description: Fruity and lightly herbaceous, this has fine textured acidity along with a pink grapefruit flavor. The wine is bright and easy, and it will be ready to drink in a few months.
title: Château de Sours 2011 La Fleur d'Amélie  (Bordeaux Blanc)

description: This wine's black cherry and plum flavors veer dangerously toward prune—no doubt a product of the exceedingly hot summer. It's creamy and supple in texture, adding just enough tobacco, vanilla and smoke for complexity. But for all the fruit and ripeness, it finishes with great elegance and precision. Drink now–2020. Imported by Acadia Imports.
title: Lassègue 2003  Saint-Émilion

description: This is a wine that has great potential—you can tell from the firm tannins, tight acidity and closed texture. Initially, black currant flavors are touched with dark, dusty notes, but they finish with more juicy character on the afterntaste. Drink from 2017.
title: Château Lafon-Rochet 2011  Saint-Estèphe

description: An intriguing blend of Sauvignon Blanc and Muscadelle, which highlights the herbaceous Sauvignon character and a more perfumed Muscadelle. The two give a fresh, citrus- and pineapple-flavored wine, lively, to be enjoyed young.
title: Château Mont-Pérat 2008 Les Amants Mont-Pérat  (Bordeaux Blanc)

description: Soft, ripe, dominated by peaches, pears and a rounded, toasty character. The spice is dominant, giving the wine an exotic edge. The more rounded style gives concentration as well as a fine, finishing velvet texture.
title: Château Tour de Mirambeau 2006  Bordeaux Blanc

description: A smooth, perfumed wine that has softened just in time for its fifth year. It has black-currant and berry fruits that are ripe while still showing fresh acidity. The tannic structure is there, well integrated into the polished structure. Drinkable now.
title: Château de Callac 2011  Graves

description: This is the first of 15 estates the Gonfrier family owns throughout Bordeaux. There are strong wood influences here, although the fruit is enough to match up. So ripe pear and apricot flavors go with those toasty characters to give a rich, full-bodied wine. It will be better from late 2016.
title: Château de Marsan 2015  Bordeaux Blanc

description: An interesting percentage of Cabernet Franc gives this wine a more perfumed character than is usual in many Pomerols. On the palate, the wine is rich and shows the aromatic character of the berry fruits and well integrated wood. It is young still, needing time. Drink from 2017.
title: Château Vray Croix de Gay 2010  Pomerol

description: Fruity and ripe, the wine also has some solid structure to give it a core of dark tannins. The black-currant fruits are developing well, bringing their crispness to the party. Drink this wine from 2018.
title: Château Bois Chantant 2015  Bordeaux Supérieur

description: This is a juicy wine with its red fruits and attractive acidity. The wood aging still shows, perhaps too strongly, but that fruit is already a major factor in the success of the wine. Drink from 2019.
title: Château de l'Aubrade 2015  Bordeaux Supérieur

description: From a Grand Cru estate, this second wine shows the same rich fruit and generous structure as the winery's first wine. It's just softer with an approachable character and generous black fruits that will enable it to mature relatively quickly. Drink from 2020.
title: Château de Pressac 2014 Les Terrasses de Pressac  (Saint-Émilion)

description: A ripe perfumed wine with fine tannins as well as dense fruit. Blackberry flavors are up there along with the acidity and crisp aftertaste. It's a wine with a good future, ready to drink from 2018.
title: Château Maison Noble Saint Martin 2015 Château Jean de Bel Air  (Bordeaux)

description: The 45% Cabernet Sauvignon in this wine gives it structure and aging potential. It is a ripe wine that is also stylish with attractive acidity and plenty of black-currant fruitiness. The wine is developing well and it should be ready to drink from 2018.
title: Bernard Magrez 2012 La Sérénité des Grands Chênes  (Médoc)

description: This is the second wine from one of the group of chateaus with Corbin in their names. It is a tight wine, firm with tannins and with a concentrated texture and flavors of over-extraction. That said, the wine will probably develop over time into something serious with a dark, dense aftertaste.
title: Château Corbin 2014 Divin de Corbin  (Saint-Émilion)

description: This is a perfumed wine, with mint flavors as well as blackberry fruits. There is still a dominant structure of tannins and the wood aging that will allow the wine to age well. The fruits give the wine weight while the aftertaste has great swathes of acidity. Drink from 2019.
title: Château Haut-Logat 2014  Haut-Médoc

description: Produced from 30-year-old vines, this 55% Cabernet Sauvignon wine is firm with tannins as well as black-currant fruit. It is balanced with the potential to become a fruity wine with a soft texture. The acidity will keep it crisp and on point. Drink from 2018.
title: Château La Branne 2014  Médoc

description: With ripe Merlot dominating this fine, blackberry flavored wine, it is fruity and rich. The acidity gives a crisper edge to the wine while the tannins come from a dry core. It is a wine in progress, full of potential and likely to be ready to drink from 2018.
title: Château Mayne Vieil 2014  Fronsac

description: This 23-acre-estate is situated in the south of the Margaux appellation, close to classed growth Château Giscours. While not classified, it still has the ability to produce a fine ripe wine that also has great structure. Acidity and firm tannins are very present along with concentrated blackberry fruits. Drink this fine wine from 2019.
title: Château Mille-Roses 2012  Margaux

description: Full-bodied wine, spiced with nutmeg and toast and give richness by sweet blackberry juice flavors. It is densely structured, rich with great fruit character as well as a powerful drive of rich tannins. Age this wine at least four years and more.
title: Château Bel-Air Ortet 2009  Saint-Estèphe

description: A solid effort, with attractive, balanced black currant fruits and ripe acidity. The wine layers fruit and integrated tannins. It feels chunky and dense, finishing dry.
title: Château Ferrière 2009  Margaux

description: The wood flavors are still prominent in this spicy wine. Heavily influenced by rich Merlot, the wine is lightly structured and more about juicy red fruits. Tannins in the back give enough shape, although it will be ready to drink from early 2017.
title: Château les Petits Arnauds 2014 Tradition  (Blaye Côtes de Bordeaux)

description: While the wine is firm and tannic at this early stage, it does have the potential to bring out a more fruity character. The red-berry fruits and acidity are there, promising a fresh wine from 2018.
title: Château Mougneaux 2014  Bordeaux Supérieur

description: Ripe fruit and balanced acidity allow this wine to make room for touches of wood aging. It has spice, a smoky character and attractive finishing freshness. Drink from 2017 when the wine will be fully balanced.
title: Château Saintongey 2014 Vieilles Vignes  (Bordeaux)

description: From a estate in the Marmet family since 1990, the wine has ripe Merlot flavors that give a generous character. Big, bold fruitiness dominates this wine whose structure is firm while smooth. Drink starting from 2019.
title: Château Ségonzac 2014 Vieilles Vignes  (Blaye Côtes de Bordeaux)

description: This is a fragrant, spicy wine that is shot through with red fruits and fine acidity. The 95% Merlot and 5% Cabernet Sauvignon blend is still firm with its tannins although the acidity and bright fruit are well in balance. Drink from 2018.
title: Château Cap Saint-Martin 2014  Blaye Côtes de Bordeaux

description: This is a ripe wine and full of fruit. It has structure as well with its firm tannins and smoky backdrop. It will broaden out well and give a rich wine from 2018.
title: Château de Bel 2014  Bordeaux Supérieur

description: From a large 177-acre estate in the southern Graves, this wine shows plenty of stalky, black currant fruits, fresh acidity and spice from wood. It has just the right characters for a food Bordeaux, dry core of tannins and vivid fruit around.
title: Château Pavillon de Boyrein 2006  Graves

description: A heavy dose of Sauvignon Blanc brings herbaceous, grassy, white currants and gooseberry flavors. It's young, and needs more time to coalesce. It is certainly fresh, fruity, right up front.
title: Château Lamothe-Vincent 2008 Sauvignon  (Bordeaux Blanc)

description: This totally fresh wine has benefited from the quality of whites in 2007 Bordeaux. It is lemony with pink grapefruit flavors giving an intense lift. There is some herbaceousness, with green herbs and juicy fruits. To drink now.
title: Yvon Mau 2007 Premius Bordeaux Sauvignon  (Bordeaux Blanc)

description: Based in the heart of the Haut-Médoc, this property has produced a wine that shows a dry character, with bitter extraction and too much wood. There are just hints of juicy fruit that will need time to come through. It could well stay dry and firm always.
title: Château du Retout 2013  Haut-Médoc

description: The producer has probably used too much wood for the fruit and density of this wine. The toastiness does not allow any fruit to show through.
title: Château la Gravette Lacombe 2013  Médoc

description: This wine is lean with acidity playing over the red-currant fruits, leaving a character that's light and tight. While the wine will soften it's not likely to show any more weight or richness.
title: Château Méric 2013  Médoc

description: This soft, jammy and fruity wine is ready to drink, with black-currant flavors that are ripe and rounded. Only the lightest tannins gives any structure to this wine that is immediately accessible.
title: Château les Joyeuses 2014  Bordeaux

description: Too enthusiastic use of wood has left this wine bereft of fruit and unbalanced.
title: Château Monfort Bellevue 2012  Médoc

description: This wine is structured and stalky without the fruit weight, reflecting the difficult vintage. A smoky character comes through the acidity to leave a dry aftertaste. Through 2016, it will soften a little, although always missing the fruit. The blend is 55% Merlot, 25% Cabernet Ssauvignon and 20% Cabernet Franc.
title: Château Vrai Caillou 2013  Bordeaux Supérieur

description: This fresh wine has plenty of acidity as well as some firm tannins. It is still young, waiting to fill out with riper fruit flavors. The aftertaste just repeats the acidity.
title: Les Vignerons Réunis de Monségur 2014 La Tour du Gouverneur  (Bordeaux)

description: Lean and tannic, this wine has chocolate and bitter coffee flavors from over-extraction. The fruit is suppressed at this stage, with a bitter aftertaste.
title: Château les Lattes 2013  Médoc

description: This smooth, rich and fine wine is maturing well. It has a good balance of ripe fruit and acidity. Bitter coffee and spice notes add complexity while not detracting from the fruit. Drink from 2020.
title: Château Tour Grand Faurie 2009  Saint-Émilion

description: A wine that aims to bring out the casual side of Bordeaux, this is friendly, accessible, without losing the essential dry tannins and fresh black currant flavors typical of the region. If only all branded Bordeaux was like this.
title: Barrière Frères 2006 Jacques Sans Souci  (Bordeaux)

description: Yes, it has 2003 ripeness, but there is also some restraint here. The tannins are still defiantly young, the fruit packed with black plum jelly flavors. It promises 2–3 years' aging.
title: Château la Grande Barthe 2003  Montagne-Saint-Émilion

description: New wood dominates this soft wine. The fruit is round and smoky, featuring notes of black cherries and red plums that fall behind a toasty caramel sweetness. It needs several months for the wood influence to integrate.
title: Château Bois Noir 2009  Bordeaux Supérieur

description: Spicy, creamy new-wood aromas introduce a wine that is heavily dominated by woody tannins. The wine is very dry, its fruit a mere whisper in the background. Give this five years and the fruit may come forward, though that's not a guarantee.
title: Château du Moulin Rouge 2010  Haut-Médoc

description: An attractively fragrant rosé, this is very crisp and clean. It has lively raspberry and red currant flavors that are lightly touched by a herb note. A bright finish completes this refreshing wine.
title: Chateau le Grand Verdus 2011 Rosé (Bordeaux Rosé)

description: Dry and firm, this is smothered with hard-edged tannins that give the wine a tough character. It will soften a little bit, but not completely.
title: Horeau-Beylot 2009 Château Grand Martinet  (Saint-Émilion)

description: Here's a solid, dark wine, with an old wood character. It has weight, a black plum flavor and dark tannins. This feels old and hard.
title: Château de Ferrand 2008  Saint-Émilion

description: Aromatic hints of new wood translate onto the smooth palate. It has smoke and black currant flavors, with tannins that are already well integrated. Attractive acidity gives this a final lift. Keep it for 5–6 years.
title: Château Blaignan 2010  Médoc

description: In the Boissonneau family since 1839, this southern Entre-Deux-Mers vineyard gives a crisp, herbal wine with light fruit and attractive acidity. It has lemon and grapefruit flavors, bright with a crisp aftertaste. Drink now.
title: Château de la Vieille Tour 2016  Bordeaux Blanc

description: The Mottet family bought this chateau in 2009 and has been in renovation mode: chateau, winery, vast vineyards and placement of a dramatic 40-foot steel rooster in the vineyard. This wine is refreshing, lively and crisp, with plenty of acidity. It reveals spice, apples and lime flavors along with a more mineral side. The wine is ready to drink.
title: Château la France 2016  Bordeaux Blanc

description: This wine has a touch of caramel as well as spice. Both work well with the red fruits that shine through this ripe wine. It is ready to drink.
title: Château Lalande Méric 2016 Rosé (Bordeaux Rosé)

description: Light and fruity, this is a crisp wine with good acidity. a tangy character and a yeasty edge. Drink now.
title: Château Lauduc 2016 Rosé (Bordeaux Rosé)

description: A massive wine for Margaux, packed with tannins and ripe fruit. It has more Cabernet Sauvignon than usual, giving intense black currant flavors with enticing acidity balanced by the sweetness of the fruit. Ripe swathes of this opulent fruit are also elegant and structured.
title: Château Margaux 2009  Margaux

description: A beautiful wine, with the firmest tannins surrounded by perfumed fruit. It is dense, of course, but this density is balanced with great elegance, blackberry fruits, sweetness and final juicy acidity. The wine is structured, a powerhouse of concentration while preserving this complete style.
title: Château Palmer 2009  Margaux

description: A very concentrated wine with such a stylish feel. It balances ripe berry fruits with chocolate and wood flavors in the richest, ripest combination. The wine has power, without losing its poised character. It's ready for long aging.
title: Château Troplong Mondot 2009  Saint-Émilion

description: Such a generous and ripe wine, with a dark core of tannins surrounded by opulent fruit. Black fruits, coffee, very concentrated flavors, a powerhouse of structure and richness. The warmth of the wine is palpable, as is the aging potential.
title: Château La Mission Haut-Brion 2009  Pessac-Léognan

description: A ripe year like 2009 is kind to the Cabernet Sauvignon of Château Figeac. The wine is perfumed with new wood and sweet fruits, delicious black currant flavors giving both ripeness and freshness. The wine has weight and impressive density. A star of the vintage.
title: Château Figeac 2009  Saint-Émilion

description: An immensely structured wine, packed with dark tannins promising aging potential. It is complex, powerful, layered with new wood and concentration, finishing with dark plum fruits and acidity.
title: Château Léoville Poyferré 2009  Saint-Julien

description: Solid, very structured, packed with dense and dry tannins. There is a core of acidity and darkness that gives the wine a brooding, powerful character. At this stage, it seems austere although it does have the weight of fruit typical of the year.
title: Château Haut-Brion 2009  Pessac-Léognan

description: Just across the road from Pétrus, la Fleur-Pétrus shares some of the same intensity. There is great fruit here, rounded and powerful with the ripest character. It is open, generous, ready to drink. The tannins lead into the purest acidity, letting the fruit sing.
title: Château la Fleur-Pétrus 2009  Pomerol

description: A dense, immense, solidly powerful wine. The ripest fruit overflows, paralleling the dark, solid tannins. As so often, Lynch-Bages is a blockbuster, dark and concentrated, with immense aging potential.
title: Château Lynch-Bages 2009  Pauillac

description: The purest Cabernet Sauvignon fruit, with dark chocolate and intense dark berry flavors. The tannins are so enveloped by the fruit and yet they promise great aging. At this stage, wood shows through the fruit, but the texture is so rich and opulent that it should easily become integrated.
title: Château Mouton Rothschild 2009  Pauillac

description: Beneath the surface tannins is great Merlot fruit, very ripe and full-bodied, a powerhouse of flavors. The depth and complexity of the wine is all there, along with a dark core of dryness. A wine for long-term aging.
title: Château Trotanoy 2009  Pomerol

description: Minty new wood aromas on a wine that shows both great tannins and sweet wood. The fruit is still to show, but promises fresh plum flavors that will be delicious and juicy. This is a ripe, concentrated wine.
title: Château Beau-Séjour Bécot 2009  Saint-Émilion

description: Very supple wine, with great richness and density. It is all so complete, a pleasure, powerful yet also with sweet opulent fruits layered with dark tannins. For long-term aging.
title: Château Branaire-Ducru 2009  Saint-Julien

description: Hugely dense, foursquare wine with great fruit and the purest tannins. Chocolate and coffee predominate at the same time as sweet tannins and acidity. A wine that combines charm with great power.
title: Château Canon 2009  Saint-Émilion

description: One of the peculiarities of St.-Émilion's classification is that Canon la Gaffelière is not classed in the top rung. Because, as this wine shows, it produces superb wines. This is ripe while so elegant, with great intensity and sweet perfumes.
title: Château Canon la Gaffelière 2009  Saint-Émilion

description: This wine enjoys the fruitiness of the vintage with its black-currant flavors and light tannic structure. The blend is 50% Merlot, 30% Cabernet Sauvignon and 20% Cabernet Franc. The Cabernets, with ripe berry flavors that dominate here, give a firm core to the wine while not losing the potential of the fruit. Drink from 2017.
title: Château Balac 2012 Cru Bourgeois  (Haut-Médoc)

description: Now managed organically, this estate has produced a light, fruity wine. Fresh red berries are sustained by a firm tannin edge that offers a solid base for the fruitiness and acidity. Drink from 2017.
title: Château des Annereaux 2011  Lalande de Pomerol

description: This fresh wine has attractive citrus and yellow fruit flavors and an orange tang. It needs more time; drink from 2017. The property includes five acres of white grapes and 65 acres of red. Sylviane Garcin-Cathiard also owns Clos L'Église in Pomerol, Château Barde-Haut in Saint-Émilion and Château Branon in Pessac-Léognan.
title: Château Haut-Bergey 2013  Pessac-Léognan

description: Herbal and fruity at this young stage, this wine is bright with acidity, citrus fruits and a tangy texture. It is still young and almost too crisp for its own good, although it will likely develop into an attractively fruity, ripe wine with a fine weight of flavor. Drink from 2017.
title: Château Larrivet Haut-Brion 2014 Les Hauts de Larrivet Haut-Brion  (Pessac-Léognan)

description: Bright and fruity, this is classic white Bordeaux with its citrus and lively acidity as well as a crisp texture. It has weight and shows some potential to fill out, so drink from 2017. Because of spring frost and summer rain, Marie-José (Perrin) Leriche reduced the (90%) Sauvignon Blanc and (10%) Sémillion harvest by a third.
title: Château le Sartre 2013  Pessac-Léognan

description: This wine is dry but rich enough with black-currant flavors to compensate. The juicy aftertaste suggests the wine will develop quickly. Drink from 2017. This wine is the latest result of renovations on the 15-generation and 400-year-old Trocard family estate.
title: Château Mancèdre 2013  Pessac-Léognan

description: This small 10-acre property has produced an attractively fruity wine with soft tannins and juicy black-fruit flavors. It is lightly structured—displaying more fruit than tannin—and has a fresh, bright aftertaste. Drink from 2017.
title: Château Peyredon Lagravette 2013  Haut-Médoc

description: This second wine of Château Potensac is soft, fruity with a hint of firmer structure. Juicy Cabernet gives the wine its shape and freshness. It is already drinkable, fruity and fresh.
title: Château Potensac 2013 Chapelle de Potensac  (Médoc)

description: This stylish Merlot-based wine has juicy red-berry flavors that are sustained by acidity and firmed up by tannins. Still dry from its dense structure, it's developing well. Drink from 2018.
title: Clos Beauregard 2013  Pomerol

description: Under the same ownership as Château de Panigon, this property (which has a heart on its cork) has produced a wine offering layers of smoky wood as well as ripe fruit. That solid structure suggests the wine will need time to develop. The aftertaste boosts a more juicy fruitiness.
title: Château Amour 2013  Médoc

description: This wine is still closed, lean and firm with its fruitiness masked by a strong mineral structure. It needs plenty of time to develop, so drink from 2018.
title: Château de Cruzeau 2013  Pessac-Léognan

description: Still lean and structured, this is a cool-feeling, young wine. It has dry tannins and a chewy texture that needs to soften. At the back, juicy black currant fruits show promise for the future. Drink from 2018.
title: Château de Paillet-Quancard 2012  Cadillac Côtes de Bordeaux

description: This is rich in spice, herbal characteristics and tangy acidity. It has a strongly mineral edge along with green fruits and tight lemon zest. Drink from 2017. André Lurton bought de Rochemorin in 1973; the estate has grown vines since the 16th century.
title: Château de Rochemorin 2013  Pessac-Léognan

description: This is a soft, ripe and fruity wine. It has gentle tannins and attractive red-berry fruits. There is just a touch of dryness that gives this easygoing wine its structure. Drink from early 2017.
title: Château Lanscade 2015  Bordeaux

description: High-toast aromas are followed on the palate by flavors that are more about wood than fruit. That gives the wine a tough, extracted character that probably will not go away.
title: Château Troupian 2014  Haut-Médoc

description: This is a crisp and fruity wine that's perfumed and full of citrus and green fruits. It has a lively character that is filled out with the ripe fruitiness of the vintage. The aftertaste, bright and fresh, suggests it will benefit from another few months. Drink from summer 2016.
title: Château Vrai Caillou 2015  Entre-Deux-Mers

description: This is a light and fruity wine that is ready to drink. It has spice and a layer of dry tannins that are acting as a support to the red fruits and acidity.
title: Château Doms 2014  Graves

description: This is a seriously wood-aged wine. Its burnt toast character doesn't chime with the light fruitiness of the vintage and so gives a wine that is bitter and extracted. Less overworking would have produced a better wine.
title: Château Pindefleurs 2013  Saint-Émilion

description: Laced with acidity, this is a complex, structured wine with great freshness as well as a dry core of botrytis. It has a rich potential, closed at the moment but holding dense texture and balance between lemon and honey. Drink from 2019.
title: Château de Malle 2011  Sauternes

description: Rounded and rich, this generous, full-bodied wine comes from a single parcel in the heart of Saint-Émilion. Black fruits are structured with dense tannins and a firm tension between ripeness and dryness. The wine is powerful, finishing with pepper and spice. Drink from 2018.
title: Le Carré 2012  Saint-Émilion

description: Meaty and spicy, this wine is in an early stage of development. It has dark tannins that have an extracted, tough character. However, the weight of ripe fruit is all there, promising a rich and concentrated wine for the future. Drink from 2020.
title: Château Bouscaut 2012  Pessac-Léognan

description: New-wood spice dominates the aroma of this wine, given weight by the rich black plum fruits and concentrated acidity. With its big structure and equally big fruits, this is an impressive wine for long aging. Drink from 2022.
title: Château Couhins 2012  Pessac-Léognan

description: This wine has yeasty aromas and a light character that brings out springy acidity before the dry botrytis. It is still forming itself around the dry core, waiting to become generous and rich. Drink from 2019.
title: Château d'Arche 2011  Sauternes

description: One of the few great values from Pauillac, this 10-acre estate has produced an attractive perfumed wine that expresses both ripe black fruit and great structure. It's not a wine for long aging with its already-fragrant acidity. It has sweet tannins, delicious fruitiness and a lengthy aftertaste. Drink from 2019.
title: Château Gaudin 2011  Pauillac

description: As is often the case with Phélan Ségur, there is an excess of wood in this wine. Sometimes it works, as here, because the big, bold fruits are powerful enough to match the toastiness. That suggests a future as a ripe, black-fruited and structured wine with room for juicy acidity. Drink from 2019.
title: Château Phélan-Ségur 2012  Saint-Estèphe

description: Forward red fruits give a good beginning to this light and fruity blend of Merlot, Cabernet Franc and Cabernet Sauvignon. It is crisp with red currant flavors and layers of acidity. Drink now.
title: Univitis 2013 Château Les Vergnes  (Bordeaux)

description: Jammy fruits conflict with a firm tannic structure. This wine is not yet balanced and needs a lighter touch. Producer is Jean Paul Barre.
title: Château Saint-Urban 2013  Blaye Côtes de Bordeaux

description: While this wine has a strong tannic structure, it also offers plenty of ripe fruit. Acidity is kept in its place, giving freshness allied to warm berries. Drink this attractive wine from 2016.
title: Producta Vignobles 2013 Mission St. Vincent  (Bordeaux)

description: This crisp, fruity wine is fresh with citrus, grapefruit and an attractive zesty texture. Aromatic and bright, it is ready to drink now, clean and fragrant.
title: Cap Royal 2014  Bordeaux Blanc

description: Too much extraction has given this wine a dry character. It does have juicy red fruits underneath and these should come out as the wine ages. It is likely, though, always to be a dry wine.
title: Château Barreyre 2013  Bordeaux Supérieur

description: This firm, smoky wine with fine tannins and ripe fruit is developing well, allowing the berry fruits to come through the structure. Give this wine until late 2016.
title: Château Laronde Désormes 2013  Bordeaux Supérieur

description: From owner Jean-Pierre Palatin's vineyards at the highest elevation in this appellation, this mostly Merlot wine is soft and fruity, ripe but with little sense of structure. It is juicy and with some acidity. Light and perfumed, it is ready to drink. The winemaker is Thomas Guibert who also handles Ferrand, Palatin's Saint-Émilion grand cru.
title: Château Roquevieille 2013  Castillon Côtes de Bordeaux

description: Ripe and jammy with attractive soft fruits and acidity, this wine has crushed strawberry and light spice flavors. Drink from late 2016. MACIF, a mutual insurance company, bought the estate in the 1980s and restored the vineyards and beautiful château. The estate manager is Fredéric Dubois and consultant is Georges Pauli.
title: Château de Belcier 2013  Castillon Côtes de Bordeaux

description: This wine is concentrated, with fruit that seems too ripe. Jammy berry flavors are mixed in with dry tannins and a firm backdrop. It's solid, although not quite balanced. The estate was founded in 1967 by Philippe Raguenot; daughters Emmanuelle and Marie-Pierre took over in 1997.
title: Château des Tourtes 2012  Blaye Côtes de Bordeaux

description: While there are firm tannins, this wine also has plenty of fresh black currant fruits. Acidity and a crisp texture give it a lift and brightness. Drink this 100% Merlot from 2016 when the tannins have softened.
title: Château Donjon de Bruignac 2013 Premium  (Bordeaux Supérieur)

description: Perfumed strawberry aromas show well. On the palate, this wine is fruity, jammy in texture with good balancing acidity. The tannins still need to soften, so drink from 2017.
title: Château Godard 2013  Francs Côtes de Bordeaux

description: Firm but with juicy fruit, this 80% Merlot and 20% Cabernet Sauvignon blend is a solid, still young, wine. The aftertaste is tough and packed with acidity.
title: Château Haut Boilon 2013  Blaye Côtes de Bordeaux

description: Hugely tannic, this formidable wine has great weight, richness and a dark and dense structure. Juicy berry fruits, sweet plum flavors and a dry, concentrated backdrop promise aging. Drink from 2018.
title: Château Haut Bertinerie 2010  Blaye Côtes de Bordeaux

description: Perfumed, ripe and packed with blackberry fruits, this wine displays a great sense of elegance. It is fresh while the solid structure provides a contrast of tannins. The end shows acidity and fruitiness.
title: Château Lalande-Borie 2011  Saint-Julien

description: A strong Merlot element has produced a ripe, juicy wine, full of fruit balanced with a subtle use of wood. It's a powerful, concentrated wine that has impressive tannins, rich berry fruits and acidity. Drink from 2018.
title: Château Preuillac 2011  Médoc

description: Smooth and rich while remaining structured, this wine performs the role of second wine very well. The tannins are already rounded and the black currant fruit remains fresh. It should be ready to drink in 2016.
title: Château Cos d'Estournel 2011 Les Pagodes de Cos  (Saint-Estèphe)

description: Solid and powerful, it has a great mix of very ripe fruit with dense tannins. Blackberry fruits, laced with licorice and dark chocolate, contrast with a juicy, lightly herbal element. This mainly Merlot wine is destined for a fine future. Drink from 2017.
title: Château de Roquebrune 2010 Cuvée Reine  (Lalande de Pomerol)

description: Fresh blackberry fruits give a smooth wine, rich and with an immediately attractive fresh acidity. It does have the density of fruit along with relatively soft tannins. At the back there is a more chocolate character.
title: Château Beausejour-Duffau-Lagarrosse 2009  Saint-Émilion

description: This wine continues the upward progression of Clerc-Milon. It has weight and density while also showing sweetness and delicious acidity. A very complete wine.
title: Château Clerc Milon 2009  Pauillac

description: There is dense, ripe fruit here, although with an austere, serious edge. The wine has firm yet juicy blackberry fruits along with concentrated tannins. It is firm, dark, with the potential for good red berry fruits.
title: Château Magdelaine 2009  Saint-Émilion

description: With layers of wood, this is a structured wine, driven as much by tannins as fruit. It will need time for the dark plum fruit flavors to come through—St.-Estèphe is always likely to be firmly textured.
title: Château de Pez 2009  Saint-Estèphe

description: Initially wood dominates, but this is a stage after bottling. Because then the ripe, smooth fruit comes in, pouring through with black fruits, very ripe and juicy. As this wine develops, this rich fruit will be its main character.
title: Château Gruaud Larose 2009  Saint-Julien

description: A wine that continues the impressive rise of du Tertre. It is becoming one of the sure values of Margaux, and this 2009 is both ripe and finely balanced. The acidity boosts the rich fruits, sweet tannins and the warm finish.
title: Château du Tertre 2009  Margaux

description: Densely rich, very sweet wine. It has some smoky tannins that give structure, along with a dark core of dry raisin and wood flavors. It has concentration and an opaque texture.
title: Château La Conseillante 2009  Pomerol

description: This solid, structured wine has black currant fruit, balanced acidity and firm tannins. The wine has a solid texture, a core of dryness and the potential to age 3–4 years.
title: Château Belrose 2011  Bordeaux

description: Under the serious amount of wood, this wine feels rich and concentrated. Wood spice, a touch burnt, along with chocolate and black currant fruit show both extraction and the need for 2–3 years' aging.
title: Château de Lestiac 2011  Cadillac Côtes de Bordeaux

description: Solid and tannic, very firm from the opening to the finish. It is based around a dark core of wood and spice as well as more juicy fruit flavors. The wine needs time to round out and bring more of the juiciness to the fore.
title: Château les Mottes Pradier 2011  Côtes de Bourg

description: Dense planting for this vineyard has resulted in a wine that has greater concentration than in the past. The wine has firm tannins, while showing already delicious black-currant fruit. For drinking over the next 2–4 years.
title: Pezat 2011  Bordeaux Supérieur

description: Fine, rich black-fruit flavors give this wine a sense of ripeness, openness and generosity. The wood and fruit balance is already fine, showing that it will be ready to drink this year.
title: Château Grand Billard 2011  Bordeaux

description: Ripe fruit, sweet tannins and soft texture mark this wine. It's full, ripe and lightly structured. An attractive wine for its black fruit and forward character. Drink in 2–4 years.
title: Château Macquin 2011  Saint-Georges-Saint-Émilion

description: A cool, very Sauvignon wine, with strong herbaceous and citrus flavors. It's crisp, showing a bright, tight, slightly mineral texture.
title: Pezat 2012  Bordeaux Blanc

description: Cherry and blackberry notes dominate this ripe, full wine. It has a smoky, toasty character that lends good balance and aging potential. The estate is planted with Merlot and Cabernet Sauvignon.
title: Château de Bordes-Quancard 2010  Bordeaux

description: Tough tannins set the scene for this firm and extracted wine, giving it a smokiness and a touch of bitter fruit. However, the wine has the weight to support the tannins, and it hints at future juicy fruit. Keep this for at least five years.
title: Château de Panigon 2010  Médoc

description: A dense and rich, jammy Merlot that is full of black fruit and has an ultra-ripe feel. It is hardly Bordeaux, but it does hold attraction with its rich, full fruits and dense tannins. A smoke and bitter chocolate aftertaste suggests some firm extraction.
title: Château Magondeau 2010  Fronsac

description: A 50/50 blend of Merlot and Cabernet Sauvignon, this shows big fruity flavors tempered with a dry core of tannins. There is a stalky element of black currant skins which adds to the sensation of dryness, but there is also a more mouthfilling character of black plum juice to give the wine a final roundness.
title: Vieux Château Gaubert 2005  Graves

description: A richly Merlot wine, soft, ripe, packed with black jelly flavors, sweet acidity and generous balanced tannins. The flavors come together in a balanced, rich way. An attractive wine, ready to drink now.
title: Château Pavillon Bel-Air 2006  Lalande de Pomerol

description: Ripe and juicy, this is packed with black currant fruit and lined with soft, open tannins. The wine has a dry core, yet this is surrounded by attractive smoky fruit and bright acidity. Ready to drink now.
title: Château Beauvillage 2009  Médoc

description: This is a very rich wine with black fruit and bitter coffee flavors and dense tannins. Its weight is almost too much for the firm structure that is underneath.
title: Château Cap Léon Veyrin 2009  Listrac-Médoc

description: Packed with superripe Merlot, this is rich and round. It has wood flavors and sweet, juicy black-plum fruits that are balanced by firm tannins. The finish shows some bitterness from over-extraction.
title: Château au Pont de Guitres 2009  Lalande de Pomerol

description: Now maturing, this retains its red fruits; its bright texture and acidity go with the firm tannins and dark structure. It is balanced and ready to drink.
title: Château Bellegrave du Poujeau 2006  Haut-Médoc

description: This is structured and firm, with its dry tannins prominent along with blackberry and black cherry acidity. The wine does have density, a dusty texture and the chance to further age.
title: Château Haut-Goujon 2008 La Rose Saint-Vincent  (Lalande de Pomerol)

description: This shows the rich density of Merlot in 2009, giving a solid structure, with dried fruit and red berry flavors and a concentrated line of tannins. Big and dense, this is ready to age.
title: Château La Fleur Plaisance 2009  Montagne-Saint-Émilion

description: Smooth and rich, this has superripe Merlot. It has soft, jammy red-fruit flavors and tannins that are enveloped by the opulent texture. The tannins should allow the wine to age over 3–6 years.
title: Horeau-Beylot 2010 Château la Fleur Poitou  (Lussac Saint-Émilion)

description: The wine is lean for the vintage, tight and with an austere structure. Its tannins and juicy red fruits are in the background. The aftertaste is dry and firm.
title: Château Kalon Nodoz 2012 Carpe Diem  (Côtes de Bourg)

description: 86-88 Barrel sample. Densely structured wine, all rich plums and berry fruit flavors. There is a strong amount of wood, but it is the juicy, just green, character of the wine which is most prominent.
title: Château la Tour de By 2008 Barrel sample  (Médoc)

description: 86-88 Barrel sample An aroma that is almost port-like in its sweetness. To taste, the structure is lost in a swathe of ripeness that covers the fruit.
title: Château Larrivet Haut-Brion 2008 Barrel sample  (Pessac-Léognan)

description: 86-88 Barrel sample. Firm, with a bitter, tight edge, this has high acidity, spice, and a tight layer of tannins. For a second wine, this is not that accessible.
title: La Chapelle de Potensac 2008 Barrel sample  (Médoc)

description: 86-88 Barrel sample. Despite its initial edge of bitterness, this develops as a dense wine, packed with dark high toast and blackberry jelly flavors. The final bite of high extract spoils the finish.
title: Château Malescasse 2008 Barrel sample  (Haut-Médoc)

description: Ripe, elegant wine, balancing fresh currant and red plum fruits against a mineral, dry structure. The acidity, the pure fruits and the solid tannins all work harmoniously together.
title: Château Dutruch Grand Poujeaux 2005  Moulis-en-Médoc

description: This wine has ripe red fruit flavors, a dry core, balanced tannins and plenty of acidity at the end. Drink now. The Maurin family's organic vineyards have all permitted grapes in Bordeaux, which is a good thing In a difficult vintage. This blend is Merlot (60%), Carmenère (15%), Petit Verdot (15%) and Malbec (10%).
title: Château la Croix de Roche 2013  Bordeaux Supérieur

description: This wine is structured although it does have plenty of ripe and full of berry fruits. Drink from 2017. The blend includes 50% Merlot, 40% Cabernet Sauvignon and 10% Cabernet Franc.
title: Château Les Hauts de Palette 2012  Côtes de Bordeaux

description: This wine is light and fruity, well balanced with plenty of red berry flavors and only light tannins. It will be fresh and ready to drink from late 2016. The 30-acre vineyard on one of the appellation's highest spots was bought in 2009 by Denis Durantou, the owner of Château l'Église Clinet in Pomerol.
title: Château Montlanderie 2013  Castillon Côtes de Bordeaux

description: With plenty of weight to support the ripe fruits, this is a balanced, perfumed wine. It has structure and tannins, along with fresh black currant flavors in the 80/20 Merlot/Cabernet Sauvignon blend. Drink from 2016.
title: Château Roc Montalon 2013  Bordeaux Supérieur

description: Fruity and lightly herbaceous, this has fine textured acidity along with a pink grapefruit flavor. The wine is bright and easy, and it will be ready to drink in a few months.
title: Château de Sours 2011 La Fleur d'Amélie  (Bordeaux Blanc)

description: From an estate in the Entre-Deux-Mers region, this wine is firm and concentrated, packed with ripe tannins and juicy blackberry fruit. Dense, with dusty tannins, it is smooth and polished in texture.
title: Château Marac 2010  Bordeaux Supérieur

description: From vines owned by Château Giscours but outside the Margaux appellation, this ripe and structured wine is a great success. Its rich berry and black currant fruits are pushed forward by the firm tannins that are so perfectly judged. It's a wine to enjoy soon, so drink from 2017.
title: Château Giscours 2012 Le Haut-Médoc de Giscours  (Haut-Médoc)

description: This very complete wine offers dark tannins, ripe berry fruits and a velvet texture. It's rich, relying on blackberry and black plum flavors and a dense structure. Mouth-filling, it delivers delicious fragrant acidity at the end. Drink from 2017.
title: Château Laforge 2012  Saint-Émilion

description: From the northern end of the Haut-Médoc region, close to Saint-Estèphe, this dark-hued wine is still very structured. Smoky wood-aging flavors give complexity that balances the ripe black currant fruitiness. It's still developing, so don't drink before 2018.
title: Château Larrivaux 2011  Haut-Médoc

description: Big structure underlies this wine, very firm and dark. It has layers of dry tannins, big fruit and concentrated structure. The dryness at the heart of the wine will allow it to age well with its powerful structure and juicy aftertaste. Drink from 2020.
title: Château Picque Caillou 2012  Pessac-Léognan

description: Big, firm tannins dominate this structured wine. New wood aging shows, giving a very dry feeling. It's also rich and full in the mouth, packed with ripe black plum and berry flavors. It's going to balance well and richly. Drink from 2018.
title: Château Rollan de By 2012  Médoc

description: New wood shows strongly in this perfumed, Merlot-dominated wine. It is structured and still very tight and tannic at this stage. The chalk soil of the vineyard has given a strongly mineral character to the wine. That, along with the tannins, gives powerful support to the black currant fruits. Drink from 2018.
title: Château Teyssier 2012  Montagne-Saint-Émilion

description: The small area of Pez is one of the top sites in Saint-Estèphe, with many highly rated chateaus. This is one. New wood aging shows strongly at this stage, although so does the fruit. That gives a structured wine, firm and also full of blackberry fruit flavors. The future is good for this wine, so drink from 2018.
title: Château Tour de Pez 2012  Saint-Estèphe

description: The gravel soil on this Lévèque family property makes a great place to grow white grapes. A 50/50 blend of Sauvignon Blanc and Sémillon, this fresh wine suggests the ability to age. It is fruity now, hinting at apricots as well as citrus. It can be drunk now for its freshness, although wait until late 2016 for it to develop greater depths.
title: Château de Chantegrive 2013  Graves

description: Spice and ripe fruit, with attractive tannins and a soft texture. This wine is open, generous, rich and packed with black currant fruitiness. Give this wine another 2–4 years, but it could well be drinkable sooner.
title: Château Mayne Vieil 2011 Cuvée Aliénor  (Fronsac)

description: Ripe, full-bodied white Graves, its flavors coming from tropical fruit, rich and complex. Good wood underscores the yellow fruit flavors and ripeness. Ready to drink, but could also age 2–3 years.
title: Château Haut-Peyrous 2009  Graves

description: Darkly tannic wine, packed with dryness. The result is firm at this stage, always likely to be full of tannins, but there is delicious fruit under this dryness.
title: Château Lafleur-Gazin 2009  Pomerol

description: Dominated by Cabernet Sauvignon, the wine is packed with dusty tannins. Mint flavors show the wood aging while black currant boosts the fruit side of the wine. It is rich, its fruit very ripe yet also elegant.
title: Château Lieujean 2009  Haut-Médoc

description: A wine that shows rich blackberry fruits, already rounded and soft. It has a tannic structure that is embedded in the fruit, along with spice, toast and a firm finish. An ageworthy wine.
title: Château Liversan 2009  Haut-Médoc

description: The wine has weight, is warm and spicy, with bold fruit flavors. A fine wine from Angludet, it is ripe, the wood judiciously balanced, finishing with tight acidity.
title: Château d'Angludet 2009  Margaux

description: Dominated by Merlot, this is a fruity and rich wine, rounded, ripe and spicy. It has density and weight, layered with dusty rich tannins. With its spice, blackberry acidity and chunky feel, it is already drinkable, but will age over several years.
title: Château Laforge 2009  Saint-Émilion

description: A wine from a château that is still finding its form . It is soft, open, with attractive juicy red fruits and black currants, ready to drink soon.
title: Château Soutard 2009  Saint-Émilion

description: Big, dense wine, with dusty tannins and ripe red plum fruits. The wine is concentrated, fruity while also structured. It is already balanced, the acidity giving freshness, the texture showing the delicious ripe character of the vintage.
title: Château Tour de Lagarde 2009  Saint-Émilion

description: This wine is tangy and textured with light tannins, a bite of citrus acidity and plenty of fruit. It's bright and has a juicy, lively aftertaste. Drink now.
title: Vignobles Bonhur 2015 Château Terres Douces Rosé (Bordeaux Rosé)

description: Almost white in color, this wine is fruity and crisp with lemon and lime flavors. A light hint of a tannic structure also suggests minerality. The aftertaste is bright and packed with acidity.
title: Château Côte Montpezat 2015 Le Canon de Côte Montpezat Rosé (Bordeaux Rosé)

description: This pale-colored wine has a light, perfumed character. A blend of Merlot and Cabernet Sauvignon, it is an attractive, bone-dry rosé, ripe with strawberry fruits, that will be best with food.
title: Château Léon 2015 Rosé (Bordeaux Rosé)

description: The caramel character of this wine is less attractive than its background of red fruits. The two sides need to come into balance for it to work completely, so wait until late 2016.
title: Producta Vignobles 2015 Cabane aux Oiseaux Rosé (Bordeaux Rosé)

description: This is a strawberry-pink-colored wine with candied flavors balanced by acidity. It is fruity, crisp and light in character.
title: Château Lamothe-Vincent 2015 Rosé (Bordeaux Rosé)

description: With only the lightest texture, this wine almost tastes like a white wine. It has plenty of citrus character, partnered with apple and green-fruit flavors. At the end, look out for the bite of tannin that gives it a more rosé character.
title: Château Laubès 2015 Rosé (Bordeaux Rosé)

description: An exceptional value for a Bordeaux, this is ripe, full and fruity. Smoky tannins and juicy black currant flavors are bright and generous. It will be ready to drink from 2016.
title: Cave du Marmandais 2014 Murets de Mez  (Bordeaux)

description: This steely, tangy wine has a strongly mineral character—tight, taut and crisp. Green fruits, citrus and a grassy character dominate. It is ready to drink. This is an unusual 75% Sémillion and 25% Sauvignon Blanc blend that tends to round out the taste.
title: Château Anniche 2014  Bordeaux Blanc

description: A property owned by Château Bel Air, Ouvrard has produced a lightly fruity wine that has fresh red berry fruits and just the right amount of acidity. Light tannins act as a backbone to the general fruitiness of this wine.
title: Château Bel Air 2012 Château Ouvrard  (Bordeaux Supérieur)

description: This wine is smooth while keeping all of its fresh wits about it. Citrus, red apple and quince flavors give both spice and ripe fruits. With its lively, tangy aftertaste, it does need to broaden out, so drink from 2016.
title: Château de l'Aubrade 2014  Bordeaux Blanc

description: With its dark pink color, this is more red than rosé. It has a tannic edge, along with red plum acidity and fruits. It's clean, allowing space for freshness while also being structured.
title: Château de Parenchère 2014  Bordeaux Clairet

description: Very crisp and fruity, this is a light, bright and refreshing wine, with a tangy edge that gives texture. Apples and a strong citrus character promise a wine that will round out over the next few months. Drink from late 2015.
title: Château Guichot 2014  Bordeaux Blanc

description: This blend of Sauvignon Blanc, Muscadelle and Sémillon is round, full and softly textured. White fruits, spice and fresh acidity are already well integrated. The end is tangy with lemon zest flavors. Drink now. The estate has been in the Forcato family since 1950.
title: Château Lary 2014  Bordeaux Blanc

description: Still toasty, this is a fruity, spicy wine. Firm tannins form the backdrop to the red berry fruits and fresh acidity. It will develop attractively over the next few years, so drink from 2017.
title: Château Maison Noble 2013  Bordeaux Supérieur

description: This ripe and spicy wine from the Dop family's 27 acres offers layers of black fruits. It has a concentrated texture and a firm structure that is juicy while dense. With this richness, the wine will develop into a smooth and generous wine. Drink from 2019.
title: Château Haut Cabut 2014  Blaye Côtes de Bordeaux

description: This Cru Bourgeois estate has produced a structured wine that is still showing strong wood-aging flavors. Toasty as well as ripely fruity, it has firm tannins and good aging potential. The aftertaste is fruity and spicy. Drink from 2019.
title: Château le Pey 2014  Médoc

description: This vineyard is at one of the highest Castillon points. Big in tannins and also fruit, this is a dense wine. It has a dry core as well as rich blackberry fruits. Concentrated and full, the wine will be seriously worth drinking from 2019.
title: Château Montlandrie 2014  Castillon Côtes de Bordeaux

description: Owner Thierry Valette has been around the Right Bank (the family owned Pavie and owns Troplong Mondot) and, as a consultant, the world. Here he offers a delicious juicy wine with fine tannins and ripe red fruits. It has mint and spice perfumes along with balanced acidity. Drink this attractive wine from 2018.
title: Clos Puy Arnaud 2014  Castillon Côtes de Bordeaux

description: This Alliance Bourg co-op wine is packed with minty new-wood aromas, this has the potential to be a smooth, polished wine. The blend is 70% Merlot, 20% Cabernet Sauvignon and 10% Cabernet Franc. Firm tannins at this stage do not mask the ripe blackberry fruits. Give this wine until 2019 before drinking.
title: Closerie du Bailli 2014 Grande Réserve  (Blaye Côtes de Bordeaux)

description: With light toast aromas, this is a wine that shows vanilla from wood aging more than its fruitiness. There is a barnyard edge to it that brings out rusticity. On the finish, acidity does bring some freshness.
designation: Le Grand Rossignol du Château Lamothe Vincent
title: Château Lamothe-Vincent 2011 Le Grand Rossignol du Château Lamothe Vincent  (Bordeaux Supérieur)

description: Structure keeps this firm, dry wine solidly closed. It is tightly wound at this stage, only hinting at a brighter, fruity future. Drink after 2015.
title: Château Pey la Tour 2011  Bordeaux

description: This wine has a lean side that takes away from the bright acidity and fruitiness. With its berry fruit flavors, it should be rich, but lacks a middle.
title: Château Haut Nadeau 2011 Réserve du Propriétaire  (Bordeaux Supérieur)

description: Light, bright and fruity, this wine is full of citrus acidity and a ripe, herbaceous character. Lively and fresh, it is a Sauvignon-dominated wine.
title: Univitis 2012 Grand Théatre  (Bordeaux Blanc)

description: This wine seems thin and rather tight. It has as much acidity as it does fruit, and a dry tannic structure. Not a wine for aging.
title: Château Gréteau Médeville 2011  Bordeaux Supérieur

description: A solid, ripe, juicy black fruited wine, delicious already with its fragrant fruits. It has structure that supports the attractive surface, giving shape to this lightly textured wine. Keep for 4–5 years, but also drink now.
title: Château de la Croix 2009  Médoc

description: Stalky wine, its black currant fruits tight and still developing. It has a juicy character that comes from the intense youthful acidity and that will blend over the next 4–5 years.
title: Château Dupeyrat Plouget 2010 Cru de Plouget  (Côtes de Bourg)

description: If only this wine wasn't extracted so much (which gives bitterness), it would be ripe and fruity. As it is, it's hard to get past the tight, dry tannins. There are hints of juiciness and black currant fruits. It might soften by 2016.
title: Maison Bouey 2012 Château Lestruelle  (Médoc)

description: This crisp, fruity wine has delicious acidity. Gray-pink in color, it is ripe with red berries that also impart attractive freshness. The wine is crisp, tangy and textured at the end.
title: Maison Bouey 2014 Le Rosé Gourmand de Lestruelle Rosé (Bordeaux Rosé)

description: Well-crafted and fruity, this has a fresh character that allows room for red berry flavors. It's a ripe wine, keeping freshness while bringing in a warmer, caramel character.
title: Quai de la Lune 2014 Rosé (Bordeaux Rosé)

description: Intense with acidity and young fruitiness, this wine needs some time. The potential of the white and citrus fruit is there, with an herbaceous character that needs to soften. Drink from late 2015.
title: Château Buisson-Redon 2014  Bordeaux Blanc

description: At first taste, the tannins dominate. Then fresher fruit shows through. The wine is firmly dry, the texture linear, the fruit showing some black currant character.
title: Château Ramafort 2008  Médoc

description: A dry, spicy wine, with some good dense tannins. There is some power here, the dark fruits hinting at sweetness, but this is followed by the high acidity typical of the vintage. It should all come together in a year to 18 months.
title: Château Couhins-Lurton 2007  Pessac-Léognan

description: There is plenty of wood, both in aromas and to taste. What is worrying is the dominance of the wood over the relatively light fruit character. There are just hints of Cabernet black currants, but then the wood closes in. It needs 3–4 years to come together.
title: Château Fonréaud 2007  Listrac-Médoc

description: Good density here, with tannins that spring from bright berry fruits. The acidity is certainly present, but it has weight behind it, giving potential richness balanced by wood.
title: Château Lieujean 2007  Haut-Médoc

description: A finely made wine, with elegant fruit and tannins, but definitely on the light side. The red berry fruits are soft and juicy, already a pleasure to drink, with only short-term aging.
title: Château Lynch-Moussas 2007  Pauillac

description: Relatively lightweight, the wine has soft, stalky tannins and flavors of hedgerow fruits to go with the well-judged layer of smoky wood. It is dry, firm and fresh.
title: Château Vray Croix de Gay 2007  Pomerol

description: Firm and bold, this is a solid wine. Its tannins and ripe berry fruit are upfront, the acidity and fresh character of the vintage in the background. Powered by a dry core, this is a wine that could do with at least five years' aging.
title: Château Lamothe-Cissac 2011 Vieilles Vignes  (Haut-Médoc)

description: Soft wine that is now maturing. It is attractive with its red fruits and light tannins. The end is easy and fresh. Not for aging.
title: Château le Pape 2007  Pessac-Léognan

description: Now reaching its maturity, this is a wine that shows tannins that have softened into spicy acidity, meaty flavors and a suggestion of wood. It is a dry wine, now ready to drink.
title: Château Tour Rozier 2007  Fronsac

description: This intensely fruity wine has richness, yellow fruit flavors and a touch of spice and citrus zest. Its soft aftertaste that makes it immediately attractive.
title: Domaines Barons de Rothschild (Lafite) 2010 Sélection Prestige  (Bordeaux Blanc)

description: Balanced, ready-to-drink wine with attractive, ripe red fruits and good acidity. It is fresh, the tannins giving an enjoyable firmness to an otherwise fruity wine.
title: La Croix de Renaud 2009  Bordeaux

description: 96-98. Barrel sample. The fruit is very pure with a great depth of flavor. This wine has weight, and intense flavors of dark plum and sweet fruit. Impressive.
title: Château Pontet-Canet 2011 Barrel Sample  (Pauillac)

description: 95-97. Barrel sample. A powerful wine with dark and dry tannins. It has a great depth of fruit flavor, with immense and concentrated weight, and a structure that is for long-term aging.
title: Château Lafite Rothschild 2011 Barrel Sample  (Pauillac)

description: 95-97. Barrel sample. Showing new wood spice, this rich and full-bodied wine also has weighty fruit, with creamy and herbaceous qualities.
title: Château Pape Clément 2011 Barrel Sample  (Pessac-Léognan)

description: Ripe, rich and generous, this has tannins that show the basic structure of the wine, with chocolate and licorice flavors highlighting the wood infuence. At the same time, it has a delicious fruitiness.
title: Château Barde Haut 2008  Saint-Émilion

description: Already deliciously fruity, this is a big, ripe, black-fruit-dominated wine. To balance the black currant flavor, there is a fine sense of structure, which offers a dry edge along with final acidity.
title: Château Belgrave 2009 Diane de Belgrave  (Haut-Médoc)

description: Sweet-tasting flavors of black plums and wild strawberries give this wine its initial charm. The tannins provide a firm structure under the attractive surface. It's rich, ripe and already a pleasure.
title: Château Haut Bessac 2009  Bordeaux Supérieur

description: With hints of mint, and a firm structure from wood as well as tannins, this is a flattering wine. The tannins are rich, layered within the jammy black berry fruits. This is a wine for aging, but is deceptively attractive now.
title: Château Cambon la Pelouse 2008  Haut-Médoc

description: Since the futures tasting in 2009, the wood element has been tamed. It is still an important factor, but the fruit has blossomed, showing a solid core of tannins, surrounded by dark plum and red fruit flavors. It will need many years, but everything is here now.
title: Château Lilian Ladouys 2008  Saint-Estèphe

description: Fruity and spicy, this is a finely wrought wine. Structured and concentrated, it will develop well, giving a solid wine with tannins as well as blackberry fruits. Drink this Sébastian and Nicolas Carreau wine from 2019.
title: Vignobles Carreau Selection 2014 Amiral  (Blaye Côtes de Bordeaux)

description: High in acidity, this Merlot, Cabernet Sauvignon and Cabernet Franc blend is a crisp, with red-fruit flavors. It is bright and fresh, with light tannins that give structure to the fruits. Drink now.
title: Château de la Bouyère 2013  Bordeaux

description: This Merlot/Cabernet Sauvignon/Malbec blend is balanced with attractive juicy acidity and red berry flavors, leaving a perfumed aftertaste. As a light wine to drink young, this Carreau family wine is attractive.
title: Château la Croix Saint-Pierre 2013  Blaye Côtes de Bordeaux

description: Aromas of wood dominate this 100% Merlot aged in oak for 12 months, which also shows on the palate. It is concentrated and firm with acidity although not much fruit yet. Give this wine until 2017. Franck Cot took over the family estate in 1996. The vineyard was certified sustainable in 2011.
title: Château Siffle Merle 2012 Cuvée Prestige  (Blaye Côtes de Bordeaux)

description: Dense, dark wine, with good black plum, fig, coffee and sweet raisin flavors. The ripe tannins fit well into this fruit mélange, with definite richness from new wood. There is good, juicy power here, as the wine finishes well with both dry tannin and fresh acidity.
title: Château Barreyres 2006  Haut-Médoc

description: Typically Nairac, this is elegant and delicate, with great freshness and acidity. While it is not hugely concentrated, it is beautifully ripe, an aperitif style rather than for dessert.
title: Château Nairac 2004  Barsac

description: There is such a surprising level of acidity in this wine that it seems unsure of where to go with its sweetness. The fruit flavors are lemon, peach and dry honey. While the wine is likely to age, it is already missing intensity.
title: Château Rabaud-Promis 2004  Sauternes

description: With an unusually high proportion (nearly 17%) of Petit Verdot in the blend, this is both darkly structured and dark in color. It is weight, intense youthful acidity and black-currant fruits. It's also rich, full of tannins and in need of several years. Drink from 2021.
title: Château du Retout 2014  Haut-Médoc

description: Owned by the Borie family, one of the grand families of Bordeaux, the vineyard forms part of Château Fourcas-Borie. The wine, with its dark tannins and dense texture, is powerful and concentrated. Layers of tannins show most strongly at this young stage, while the ripe juicy fruit will develop well. It is going to be a fine wine. Drink from 2021.
title: Château Ducluzeau 2014  Listrac-Médoc

description: From one of a group of chateaus owned by the Guyon family of Rolland de By, this is an intensely fruity wine. It has finely balanced tannins and acidity along with smoky flavors and layers of delicious black currant fruit. Drink from 2019.
title: Château La Clare 2014  Médoc

description: With signs of its wood aging that are balanced with firm tannins and concentrated black fruits, this is a solid wine, packed with tannins. There is a touch of dark chocolate as well as the ripe fruit. It is a fine wine, ready to drink from 2020.
title: Château la Vieille Cure 2014  Fronsac

description: With top consultant Stéphane Derenoncourt behind this one, the wine is fine and ripe with just the right balance between tannin and rich blackberry fruit. There is a juicy character that shines through the youthful structure. The wine will age well. Drink from 2019.
title: Château Lestruelle 2014  Médoc

description: A superripe structured wine that has serious tannins and a smoky dark character. Right now, the tannins dominate the otherwise fruity wine, but with some time it will soften and balance out. Drink this powerful wine from 2024.
title: Château Monbousquet 2014  Saint-Émilion

description: With low yields after a hail storm, the wine is concentrated and dense. It has a touch of wood aging as well as dark black fruits. The tannins are firm in a wine that will age well over the medium term. Drink from 2023.
title: Château Potensac 2014  Médoc

description: Bordeaux Claret has a darker color than a rosé, suggesting more weight. This wine, though, also has a green herbal edge that is less attractive.
title: Château de Piote 2012 Red (Bordeaux Clairet)

description: Intensely acidic wine, its red fruits and caramel hidden behind a tart, over-lemoned flavor. For lovers of mouth-shockingly dry rosé. Screwcap.
title: Château Larroque 2012 Red (Bordeaux Rosé)

description: The wine is rich and ready to drink. With red fruits and warm tannins, it is a ripe wine that has a light structure and balanced acidity. It is already an easy wine—fruity and soft at the end.
title: Les Vignerons Réunis de Monségur 2014 Château Tuilerie Pagès  (Bordeaux)

description: The Birot estate is in Cadillac, the fortress town on the banks of the Garonne. This classic Sauvignon and Sémillon blend is herbal, green and grassy. It is bright with acidity and lemon fruit and with a lightly tangy texture. Drink now.
title: Château de Birot 2015  Bordeaux Blanc

description: 88—90 Barrel sample. The man who makes Dassault aeroplanes, also owns this property. It's improving, as witnessed by this dense, dark wine, very solid, dark chocolate.
title: Château Dassault 2006 Barrel sample  (Saint-Émilion)

description: 88—90 Barrel sample. A spicy, wood laden wine, kept afloat with ripe blackberries and fresh tannins. Excellent acidity to keep the wine buoyant.
title: Château Rahoul 2006 Barrel sample  (Graves)

description: 88-90 Barrel sample. The second wine of Château Palmer is light, fresh and fruity, with accessible blackcurrant fruits. There is a light touch of wood, with delicious, easy juicy acidity.
title: Alter Ego de Palmer 2008 Barrel sample  (Margaux)

description: 88-90 Barrel sample. Perfumed, light, hinting at minerality, the wine has a smooth veneer over the dusty tannins. The final effect is rich and polished.
title: Château Fontenil 2008 Barrel sample  (Fronsac)

description: 88-90 Barrel sample. Caramel new wood aromas are followed by spice and toast flavors. The fruit seems thin by comparison, hard to feel under all that polished toast.
title: Château Kirwan 2008 Barrel sample  (Margaux)

description: 88-90 Barrel sample. A dark hued wine, with its tense tannins giving a strong backbone to the dry, firm structure. The fruit hardly shows through all this dry, extracted character.
title: Château Latour-Martillac 2008 Barrel sample  (Pessac-Léognan)

description: 88—90 Barrel sample. A wine with a high wood content, maybe too much – the question is over the fruit's ability to stand up to the blast of wood. The result is a wine that is super-spicy.
title: Château Bourgneuf-Vayron 2006 Barrel sample  (Pomerol)

description: 88—90 Barrel sample. Firm and dry, here is a wine that still offers plenty of ripe fruits. There are good blackcurrant flavors, along with the dry tannins that are as much wood as fruit driven.
title: Château Haut-Bergey 2006 Barrel sample  (Pessac-Léognan)

description: 88—90 Barrel sample. Somewhat lean, more of solid tannin than fruit. But there is also some fresh acidity.
title: Château Lafleur-Gazin 2006 Barrel sample  (Pomerol)

description: 88—90 Barrel sample. Very sweet, ripe, rounded, with almost tropical richness, layered with lychees and spice.
title: Château Bouscaut 2006 Barrel sample  (Pessac-Léognan)

description: 88—90 Barrel sample. Soft, open, the wood giving roundness to a spicy, rich wine. It will develop quickly.
title: Château de France 2006 Barrel sample  (Pessac-Léognan)

description: 88—90 Barrel sample. Spicy, rich, concentrated, with sweet vanilla flavors over the blackberry fruits. Soft and ripe, a wine that is made to charm.
title: Château Olivier 2006 Barrel sample  (Pessac-Léognan)

description: 88—90 Barrel sample. Sweet, soft, ripe, full of very soft fruit flavors. The ripeness of the year seems to have overtaken the wine.
title: Château Smith Haut Lafitte 2006 Barrel sample  (Pessac-Léognan)

description: 88-90 Barrel sample. A light style, moving into delicate citrus and crisp fruits. It shows a lively palate, with a tight, dry core of botrytis.
title: Château Bastor-Lamontagne 2008 Barrel Sample  (Sauternes)

description: 88-90 Barrel sample. A ripe, fruity wine, showing delicious fresh berries, lively acidity over solid tannins. This is a wine on the charming side, maybe lacking intensity, but a pleasure to taste.
title: Château Croizet-Bages 2008 Barrel sample  (Pauillac)

description: 88-90 Barrel sample. With its minty aroma and high proportion of new wood, this is a wine which shows polish, a smooth, wood-laden texture offering a wine that will probably age quickly.
title: Château Ferrière 2008 Barrel sample  (Margaux)

description: From an eight-acre vineyard, this is produced by the same team as Château Paloumey. Powerful and concentrated, it is also elegant, balancing its structure with good berry fruits and acidity. The tannins are still considerable, so drink from 2017.
title: Château La Garricq 2011  Moulis-en-Médoc

description: This is a delightfully perfumed wine, the second wine of Château L'Evangile. Smooth with ripe Merlot flavors, it's full and dense, conveying the sense that it will mature quickly. Drink from 2016.
title: Château l'Évangile 2011 Blason de l'Evangile  (Pomerol)

description: A firm, dense wine, it currently shows plenty of dry tannins along with potentially ripe fruits. Already showing balance, it is developing into a complex, rich wine that will be full of black fruits and smoother tannins. Drink from 2017.
title: Château Saint-Estèphe 2011  Saint-Estèphe

description: With a few years in bottle, this is maturing well. It has ripeness, the tannins beginning to soften into rich spice and damson jelly flavors. The acidity is still very present as is the dry core.
title: Chateau de Launay 2005 Les Vignes de Julia  (Bordeaux Supérieur)

description: Fresh black currant fruit gives this wine all the vivacity of the 2006 vintage. It is a beautiful, elegantly crafted wine, as you would expect from the same team as Château Ausone, and it has a lovely lightness of touch, with its final note one of delicious juiciness.
title: Château de Fonbel 2006  Saint-Émilion

description: A wood-dominated wine that shows spice and high toast characters. It has probably seen too much wood in its aging, but there is fruit there, its black currant ripeness hiding in the background. Hopefully, the wood will soften and integrate.
title: Château Fonréaud 2006  Listrac-Médoc

description: Dry, lean and structured, here is a wine that initially seems to be missing its fruit. There are hints of black cherries and plum skins, but they are always going to be surrounded by a heavy tannic presence.
title: Château Cos Labory 2006  Saint-Estèphe

description: Ripe Merlot pushes through the tight tannins that are still evident in this wine. This dark, dry core dominates initially, and needs time to open up to show the vivid black currant flavors, touched with dried fruits and fresh finishing acidity.
title: Château Teyssier 2006  Saint-Émilion

description: Very rich, this ripe and rounded wine is typical of the powerful 2010 vintage. It's dense and concentrated, packed with black plum and sweet berry fruits. It shows a dense structure along with juicy fruits. It could be over the top, but the acidity and tannins hold it back. Drink from 2018.
title: Château de Ferrand 2010  Saint-Émilion

description: A wine that is rich in both tannins and ripe fruit. The 45% Cabernet Sauvignon in the blend gives the concentration of the wine, with spice and black berry fruits that are given an extra richness by the intense dark plums. The wine needs aging, so drink from 2018.
title: Château Haut-Logat 2010  Haut-Médoc

description: Made from young vines, this is the second wine of Suduiraut. It has young, honeyed character, with a ripe, opulent texture that lays bitter orange fruits over drier noble rot flavors. It is so delicious now, but will be better from 2017.
title: Château Suduiraut 2010 Castelnau de Suduiraut  (Sauternes)

description: The wine is soft, rounded, showing light acidity and fresh fruit. Melons and pears dominate the ripe flavors, with a touch of almonds and rich aftertaste.
title: Château de la Vieille Tour 2013  Bordeaux Blanc

description: This herbaceous wine is fresh, steely and crisp. Bright acidity cuts strongly through the lively texture, giving apples, lemon and pink grapefruit. Developing fast, it is ready to drink.
title: Château Lafont Menaut 2012  Pessac-Léognan

description: It has attractive acidity and fragrant, juicy fruitiness. Underneath this fruit is a solid structure, fine tannins and fresh final acidity.
title: Château Simard 2011  Saint-Émilion

description: This wine is heavily spiced from its wood aging. Fresher fruit flavors do come through to give black currants, bright acidity as well as firmer fruit structure. The wine still needs time, so drink from 2016.
title: Etienne de Tauriac 2010  Côtes de Bourg

description: A cool, very Sauvignon wine, with strong herbaceous and citrus flavors. It's crisp, showing a bright, tight, slightly mineral texture.
title: Pezat 2012  Bordeaux Blanc

description: Mint and eucalyptus flavors show strongly in this wood-aged, polished, smoky wine. The fruit suggests black plums, damsons and berries. Give the wine 3–4 years.
title: Jean-Michel Cazes 2011 Michel Lynch Bio  (Bordeaux)

description: This is a very modern style of wine, with generous new wood and super-ripe fruit flavors, balancing with polished solid tannins. Very international in style, it is good, but could come from anywhere.
title: Château Pontet-Canet 2000  Pauillac

description: This was the last vintage at Clos Fourtet under the ownership of the Lurtons. They made fine wine, but the potential of the property was never quite realized. The wine just fails to excite: it is rich and concentrated with ripe tannins and some sweetness, but at the same time, there is a layer of acidity and structure which gives the wine a firm, solid shape.
title: Clos Fourtet 2000  Saint-Émilion

description: This is super-rich, but wears its high alcohol lightly. That gives great full fruit, blackberry flavors, a juicy ripe wine that balances the wood and acidity to give fine potential for a year's time.
title: Grands Terroirs de France 2010 Grand Cru  (Saint-Émilion)

description: While the wood is still very apparent in this wine, it does also have the rich fruit as a balance. The acidity, dark berry fruits and a fine juicy character go with the firm tannins and spicy wood character. Drink from 2017.
title: Château Lilian Ladouys 2011  Saint-Estèphe

description: The wine is all about firm structure and dense tannins. It is concentrated while hiding rich, generous fruits. It still needs to balance the structure with the fruit. For the future, it will be a rich wine full of power.
title: Clos du Marquis 2011  Saint-Julien

description: Solid and powerful, it has a great mix of very ripe fruit with dense tannins. Blackberry fruits, laced with licorice and dark chocolate, contrast with a juicy, lightly herbal element. This mainly Merlot wine is destined for a fine future. Drink from 2017.
title: Château de Roquebrune 2010 Cuvée Reine  (Lalande de Pomerol)

description: Coming from the same stable as Léoville las Cases in Saint-Julien, the wine is finely structured with firm tannins and dark fruit. Rich plum flavors are counterbalanced by solid tannins. It needs to age, so drink from 2018.
title: Château Potensac 2011  Médoc

description: An impressive wine, it already shows signs of its potential. It is elegant, with ripe fruits and layers of dark tannins. As it opens, blackberry fruits come through strongly, balancing the firm structure. Drink from 2018.
title: Château Beaumont 2011  Haut-Médoc

description: The estate is under the same ownership as Château la Dominique in Saint-Émilion. This dense wine balances acidity with intense fruitiness. The tannins are now softening, giving a rich structure plus a concentrated leather and spice character. Drink from 2016.
title: Château Clément-Pichon 2010  Haut-Médoc

description: Spicy new wood flavors dominate this otherwise strongly fruity wine. The tension between the two promises a rich, full and ripe wine for the future. There is enough weight, acidity, blackberry fruit and richness to balance out the wood aging. Give this dense wine until 2018.
title: Château Fonréaud 2011  Listrac-Médoc

description: Firm and closed this is a dark and tannic wine, although black currant flavors are also very present. It feels austere with a mineral texture and concentrated final acidity. Drink Lafite's second wine from 2017.
title: Château Lafite Rothschild 2011 Carruades de Lafite  (Pauillac)

description: Almost black in color, this is a solid, firm and ripe wine. It has a smooth wood character that is round and rich with black plum and berry fruit flavors. With its dark underlying texture, it will age, so drink from 2017.
title: Château Larose Perganson 2011  Haut-Médoc

description: This structured wine is the second wine of Château Montrose. It is balanced, the smooth, fresh fruits and plum-skin texture making it already accessible. With its juicy aftertaste, it will be ready to drink soon.
title: Château Montrose 2011 La Dame de Montrose  (Saint-Estèphe)

description: This smoky wine is full of wood and spice notes. Ripe fruit is also there, with some solid tannins to back it up. It will develop well. Drink from 2020.
title: Château Bourdieu 2015  Blaye Côtes de Bordeaux

description: This dusty wine has weight and concentration. Fruit lies behind its firm facade, giving the potential for juiciness. Drink from 2019.
title: Château de Cranne 2015 7ème Génération  (Côtes de Bordeaux)

description: This perfumed wine has firm tannins, a dry core and plenty of acidity. Its black currant fruit shows fine potential to give richness. Drink from 2020.
title: Château de Cranne 2015 Dompter la Bête  (Cadillac Côtes de Bordeaux)

description: This wood-aged wine is smooth, with berry fruit flavors, solid tannins and a touch of mint. It should age well for the next few years, so drink from 2019.
title: Château de Lagarde 2015  Bordeaux Supérieur

description: This is attractive, smooth and well balanced between spice and ripe berry fruit. With its acidity and toasty concentration, it's going to be delicious from 2020.
title: Château Godard Bellevue 2015  Francs Côtes de Bordeaux

description: Red fruit aromas show strongly in this wine. With its juicy acidity and soft tannins, it has fine fruitiness and will age quickly. Drink from 2019.
title: Château Haut-Rian 2015 Prestige  (Côtes de Bordeaux)

description: The Baylet family has produced a rich wine in this vintage. With chocolate and spice flavors accenting its black plum fruit, it's ripe and smooth. The tannins are well integrated into the generous fruit. Drink from 2018.
title: Château Landereau 2015  Bordeaux Supérieur

description: This wine has attractive black-currant fruits and fresh, light acidity. It's an early-developing wine with soft tannins and a stalky backdrop. Drink from 2018.
title: Chateau d'Angludet 2013  Margaux

description: This attractive, already smooth wine offers good acidity and dark tannins. Juicy black-currant flavors give the wine richness and the potential to age quickly and gracefully. Drink from 2018.
title: Château de Cruzeau 2013  Pessac-Léognan

description: After four years, this wine is showing ripe, smooth Merlot fruitiness with red berries and attractive acidity. It is light in texture although well balanced with acidity, a tannin underlay and silky aftertaste. Drink now.
title: Château de la Cour 2011  Saint-Émilion

description: Along with ripe fruit and structure, this wine has a core of tannins that form the base for fresh fruitiness. The acidity becomes intense as it opens, with the tannins remaining at the core. Drink from 2019.
