title: Château Fourcas-Borie 2013  Listrac-Médoc

description: This wine is toasty and spicy with black-currant fruits that are still developing. It is fresh although its firm structure needs time to soften. As it matures, it will develop a balance between fruit and tannins. Drink from 2018.
title: Château Haut Breton Larigaudière 2013  Margaux

description: Ripe, ready to drink and fruity, this is an attractive, balanced wine. Black-currant flavors are given structure by the tannins in this 94% Merlot and 6% Cabernet Franc blend from 15 acres. The fresh acidity of the vintage is still there, giving a lively juicy aftertaste. Drink now. An Alliance Bourg member.
title: Château Haut-Gelineau 2012  Côtes de Bourg

description: This dense wine comes from a 50-acre estate, large by the region's norm. It's concentrated, showing signs of extraction although not enough to hide the black fruits and fruit tannins. Dominated by ripe Merlot, it will develop relatively fast. Drink from 2017.
title: Château Lanbersac 2012  Puisseguin Saint-Émilion

description: Ripe berry fruits and gentle, dusty tannins give this wine a rich character. Acidity keeps it fresh, although a good structure lies behind that crisp surface. With its juicy fruit, it is ready to drink, but will be better from late 2016.
title: Château Lapinesse 2012 Cuvée Prestige  (Graves)

description: This is a big and juicy wine full of blackberry and dark-plum flavors. The second wine of Larrivet Haut-Brion, it is fruity with dominant Merlot and round and perfumed Cabernet. It is developing rapidly into an accessible, ripe wine. Drink from late 2016.
title: Château Larrivet Haut-Brion 2012 Les Hauts de Larrivet Haut-Brion  (Pessac-Léognan)

description: Ripe and concentrated, this is a rich blackberry-flavored wine, with a dense texture lifted by acidity and a stalky edge. The wine, like many in this vintage, still has a firm side and could age. Drink from 2017.
title: Château le Calvaire 2011  Bordeaux Supérieur

description: This wine is solid and dense with probably too much extracted tannins. There are only hints of fruitiness. It will soften although it's likely to remain stalky. This is the first vintage in which some of the vineyard was managed organically.
title: Château Marquis de Terme 2013  Margaux

description: Firmly structured, this dark and dense wine packs a punch of tannins, giving a dry core. The judicious wood-aging supports the black-currant fruitiness that is developing well. It should be ready to drink from 2017.
title: Château Saint-Corbian 2012 Cuvée Tradition  (Saint-Estèphe)

description: This wood-laden wine has light berry fruit and burnt toast flavors. The acidity cuts through, offering a glimpse of stalky black currant flavors.
title: Barton & Guestier 2008  Bordeaux

description: The wine is still very young, revealing sweetness rather than the botrytis complexity of previous vintages. Honey, peach and pineapple flavors offer fruitiness.
title: Barton & Guestier 2009 Thomas Barton Réserve  (Sauternes)

description: On the lean side for a 2009 Bordeaux, this brings out a dry, tannic character, just softened with sweet black currant juice. There is stalky acidity on the finish.
title: Château Bellevue 2009  Bordeaux

description: Soft, light fruit, packed with red cherries and fresh berries, is the star. The tannins are a mere hint, so the wine should be enjoyed soon for its attractive juiciness.
title: Château Denisiane 2009  Bordeaux

description: Attractive fragrance and a pleasureable mouthfeel characterize this medium-weight offering. A 50-50 Sémillon and Sauvignon Blanc blend, it offers  pear, lemon, and vanilla-oak flavors on the nose and mouth. The long smooth finish is unexpectedly elegant, something not often found at this price. Best Buy.
title: Calvet 1998 Reserve  (Bordeaux Blanc)

description: This wine is ripe, round, and fruity wine. It is refreshing and lively on the midpalate, with a crisp citrus note on the finish. Created by Producta Vignobles, a cooperative wine group.
title: Producta Vignobles 2014 La Cabane aux Oiseaux Rosé (Bordeaux Rosé)

description: From Lynch-Bages in Pauillac, this wine shows richness, white fruits and some herbaceousness. Currently, there is an earthy edge to the wine, slightly coarse, likely to benefit from two years' aging. It is definitely for food.
title: Château Lynch-Bages 2007 Blanc de Lynch-Bages  (Bordeaux Blanc)

description: Ripe, creamy and decidedly fruity, this has a big waft of herbaceous, citrus and green plum flavors that are all up front and delicious. The wood element gives spice, offering a base for the fruit and giving good balance, and a vibrant, clean aftertaste.
title: Château du Seuil 2007  Graves

description: Powerful and rich, from superripe grapes, this wine follows a style in Bordeaux that seems to want to make white Burgundy. It is creamy, rounded, spicy from toast, with white fruits, only a touch of citrus, and a full, intense aftertaste.
title: Château Tour de Mirambeau 2007  Bordeaux Blanc

description: With its ripe, yellow fruit flavors, this is a gentle, soft, open wine, which offers immediately pleasure. There is more: the spice from the wood and the pear skin and nutmeg element adding complexity. That suggests aging for 2–3 years, possibly more. But also enjoy now.
title: Château de Cruzeau 2007  Pessac-Léognan

description: A complex wine, exhibiting smoky tannins, rich fruit, a dark texture and concentration. Produced by the Moueix winemaking team, it feels complete with its sense of style and elegance as well as weight. Give this powerful wine many years in the cellar.
title: Château Trotanoy 2010  Pomerol

description: This is such an elegant wine that has all the structure of the vintage. Surrounding the tannins, the wine is sweet and ripe, with smokiness from the wood. It's powerful, elegant and sophisticated with a strong sense of poise. The tannins promise long-term aging.
title: Château Montrose 2010  Saint-Estèphe

description: A grand wine, it has great ripeness and richness, majestic in its structure and upright character. It is concentrated, perfumed and opulent. The style of Ducru Beaucaillou is both generous and powerful, and obviously ageworthy.
title: Château Ducru Beaucaillou 2010  Saint-Julien

description: This is a great wine with its swathes of ripe fruit allied to a very structured character. It is concentrated with complex flavors that bring in wood, tropical fruits, apricots and a dense texture. Combined, these elements give the wine great style and aging potential.
title: Domaine de Chevalier 2010  Pessac-Léognan

description: This is a perfumed wine, dominated by Cabernet Franc. Black fruits are layered with wood, dry tannins and a beautiful aromatic quality. The wine is deep and complex, built for the long term with its power, density and considerable elegance.
title: Le Dôme 2010  Saint-Émilion

description: A rich, ripe and finely balanced wine. Its acidity cuts through the full pear and apricot flavors to give a tight crispness. At this stage, it is all fruit and acidity, but it does have the potential for greatness with a more complex sense coming from the wood aging and the fine, tight texture.
title: Château Smith Haut Lafitte 2010  Pessac-Léognan

description: A smooth, dense wine, ripe and polished. It brings out a modern view of Bordeaux, dark and concentrated, hinting at the new-wood aging. At the same time, the wine has a serious edge that promises proper aging.
title: Château Pape Clément 2010  Pessac-Léognan

description: This is a complex and rich wine dominated by superripe fruit. It is a wine of extremes, of fruit, of dark tannins allied to some bitterness from the black chocolate extract. Ripe plums and sweet black fruits are given a lift at the end with bright acidity.
title: Château Cos d'Estournel 2010  Saint-Estèphe

description: A great wine, packed with black currant fruits, sweet tannins and beautiful acidity. Made by the team at Léoville las Cases, this wine reveals an elegant, restrained structure, ripe and delicious fruit and a darker, tighter texture for aging.
title: Clos du Marquis 2010  Saint-Julien

description: A big, complex wine from this continually improving property, this is now performing at its classed-growth level with concentrated ripe berry fruits and chocolate flavors. The wood aging is still showing through and needs time to integrate better, but as it does, this will be a great wine.
title: Château Bélair-Monange 2010  Saint-Émilion

description: A powerful and complex wine from an estate performing on its top form. Solid tannins, layers of wood and dark fruits combine to give a wine that offers both richness and a dense structure. This Haut-Bailly should age impressively and for many years.
title: Château Haut-Bailly 2010  Pessac-Léognan

description: A majestic wine, grand in every sense. It has weight, the firmest of tannins and an immense sense of structure. This neighbor of Château Pétrus is firmly dense, showing both the fruits and the tannins in balance. Give this wine at least 10 years in the cellar.
title: Château la Fleur-Pétrus 2010  Pomerol

description: Firm and closed, this is a wine with so much power and concentration. It also has beautiful fruit, smooth and opulent, that merges into the complex tannins and brooding, dark structure. It will take many years for this wine to open up.
title: Domaine de Chevalier 2010  Pessac-Léognan

description: This is a big and smoky wine that's very concentrated. It shows both the power and the structure of the vintage, as well as balances fresh, fragrant fruit. Dry tannins and the dusty texture are finely integrated into a wine that layers wood, intense acidity and great long-term potential.
title: Vieux Château Mazerat 2010  Saint-Émilion

description: Powerful, complex and ripe, this is a magnificent and concentrated wine. Juicy blackberry fruits, tight acidity and finely integrated tannins give a smooth, rich texture. This beautiful wine has long-term aging potential.
title: Château Canon 2010  Saint-Émilion

description: Austere and severe, this single-vineyard wine is very much a product of its limestone terroir. It has a mineral intensity that pushes through the tannins and black currant fruit, giving a powerful, dark character. Firm and structured, this is a wine for the long term.
title: Les Astéries 2010  Saint-Émilion

description: Parcels of vines on the Phélan-Ségur estate are used for this second label. The wine, with its firm tannins, is developing well. It has structure and a dense texture along with ripe blackberry fruits and acidity. As it develops, it will be generous and ripe. Drink from 2018.
title: Château Phélan-Ségur 2012 La Croix Bonis  (Saint-Estèphe)

description: At 40 acres, Saint-Pierre is small for the Médoc, but it is certainly performing well. As fine as the 2005, the 2008 is a stylish wine that also packs a firm punch of dense fruit, firm tannins and mouthwateringly juicy acidity. For medium-term aging.
title: Château Saint-Pierre 2008  Saint-Julien

description: Ripe and fruity, this smooth wine has soft tannins and a licorice edge. With weight and rich berry fruits, it's a rounded wine that shows the fine acidity of the vintage.
title: Château Andron Blanquet 2011  Saint-Estèphe

description: The initial sense of structure is rounded out by the ripe berry fruits. It's a dense wine, full of firm tannins but with fine acidity, sweet fruitiness and a sense of brooding power. It will be a rich wine, so wait until 2018.
title: Château Charmail 2011  Haut-Médoc

description: While the wine shows plenty of wood aging, dry flavors, it also has a good weight of fruit and richness. That gives both structure and weight that promise a good future. It has density, dusty tannins and good power. Drink from 2016.
title: Château Grand Bertin de Saint Clair 2011  Médoc
winery: Château Grand Bertin de Saint Clair

description: Strong, rich and extracted fruits are concentrated around a firm tannic core. The wine does have fruit, black currants and dark plums that give a more juicy side. Drink this still-young wine from 2016.
title: Château la Patache 2010  Pomerol

description: This is a dark, young-colored wine, its purple shade reflecting the dense wood and tannin-laden flavors. It has spice and some bitter extract but these are balanced by ripe blackberry fruits and a rich texture. Drink from 2017.
title: Château Lestage Simon 2011  Haut-Médoc

description: There is great fruit on this ripe, full-bodied wine. The fruit is already well integrated with the tannins, giving a juicy feel and a black currant fragrance. Rich, open and soft, finishing with an elegant structure.
title: Château Teyssier 2010  Saint-Émilion

description: This wood-laden wine, spicy and toasty, also offers plenty of fruit weight, giving richness to the palate. Fresh black currants carry through to finish the wine with a lift.
title: Château Baracan 2010  Cadillac Côtes de Bordeaux

description: Powerful, ripe fruit, now beginning to open up, is the dominant character of this wine. It's full in the mouth, packed with black plums and ripe damsons and finished with soft tannins and a slight warmth.
title: Château Carignan 2009  Cadillac Côtes de Bordeaux

description: Dark tannins are sustained by juicy blackberry fruit flavors. While the wine is very dry and firm at this stage, it has a good, if long-term, future.
title: Château Côte Montpezat 2010 Cuvée Compostelle  (Castillon Côtes de Bordeaux)

description: While it has sufficient tannin, the wine also has a feeling of generous black currant and berry fruits. It's dry with considerable concentration, but it's future looks good, so keep for 5–6 years.
title: Château la Croix Saint-Pierre 2010 Grande Réserve  (Blaye Côtes de Bordeaux)

description: A firmly structured wine, dry to the core. The tannins feel extracted, giving some bitterness, yet the fruit shows potential juiciness. While it's always going to be a severe wine, it should be a great food partner.
title: Château Suau 2010  Cadillac Côtes de Bordeaux

description: Full-bodied and rich, this is full of pineapple fruit flavors and woody spice. The ripeness is allied to an herbaceous character, with almonds giving spice. It will develop quickly into a delicious wine.
title: Château Bouscaut 2010  Pessac-Léognan

description: Classic, ripe Saint-Julien with all its richness, tempered with elegance. It is deliciously fruity, packed with blackberry fruit surrounding the structure.
title: Château Lalande-Borie 2010  Saint-Julien

description: Firm and prominent yet dusty tannins show one side of the richness of the vintage. The other is the ripe, black fruits, with acidity in fine balance. This estate, under the same ownership as Léoville las Cases, is serious Médoc, needing to age.
title: Château Potensac 2010  Médoc

description: Aromas of freshly-sawn wood set the scene on a wine that is full of new-wood toast and vanilla flavors. The fruit is also present, resulting in a wine that has balanced potential in maybe 4–5 years. A fine effort.
title: Château Suau 2010 L'Artolie  (Cadillac Côtes de Bordeaux)

description: A very structured, firm wine with excellent acidity and dark, dry tannins. The alcohol does show through, but the wine is firm and very dense, a big success from this Lurton family owned property.
title: Château Bouscaut 2010  Pessac-Léognan

description: A big, ripe and juicy wine packed with black fruit notes and laced with acidity. The tannins offer a contrast to the fruitiness, bringing balance and structure. This is an impressive wine, the smoky aftertaste bringing out the wood aging.
title: Château Manon la Lagune 2010  Blaye Côtes de Bordeaux

description: This is the first vintage under its new owner, the American Stephen Adams. It's relatively soft, with black currant fruits, given a delicious lift by some tight tannins. The acidity gives freshness, a zap to the dry, firm finish.
title: Château de Bel-Air 2005  Lalande de Pomerol

description: Dark colored wine, with ripe black plum flavors that lie over solidly textured tannins. Structured to bring out the fruit, the wine also has a core of wood, spice, dark cocoa and black currant acidity to finish. An attractive wine that is worth aging for another two years.
title: Château Franc-Cardinal 2005  Bordeaux Côtes de Francs

description: A new wood aged selection of vines from Château Haut Beyzac, a property being restored by Pennsylvanian Daren Miller and his French in-laws. It is delicious, elegant, offering classic black currant flavors of Bordeaux, but with an extra depth and richness. Fine, elegant acidity to finish.
title: Château Haut Beyzac 2005 I Second Haut Beyzac  (Haut-Médoc)

description: This wine is perfumed, ripe and soft. It shows the richness of the vintage with plenty of warm fruit. Lemon flavors lend a final lift to richer apricot and pear notes. Drink now.
title: Château Gardut Haut Cluzeau 2016  Blaye Côtes de Bordeaux

description: This blend, dominated by Sémillon and Sauvignon Gris, gives a rich, perfumed and ripe-tasting wine. Acidity balances its full apricot and pear fruit flavors. With its creamy texture, it's ready to drink.
title: Château La Fleur Ribeyrolles 2016  Entre-Deux-Mers

description: This wine is dry and likely to remain so. That's because the black currant flavors are too light for the structure, resulting in high acidity, firm tannins and a hole in the middle.
title: Château Larrivaux 2013  Haut-Médoc

description: Firm and solidly structured, this is a dense wine. It has plenty of tannins and a touch of bitter chocolate, but they are supported by the ripe fruit and fresh black currant flavors. It's a wine for aging, drink from 2017.
title: Château Lagrave 2012 Le Second  (Saint-Émilion)

description: From a Merlot-dominated, 24-acre vineyard this is a strongly mineral wine, with young, dark tannins and a powerful structure. A more juicy, fruity side brings out black currants and berries. Together the structure and the fruit promise good aging. Drink from 2017.
title: Château le Moulin d'Ulysse 2011  Haut-Médoc

description: Layered with toasty wood, this rich wine delivers blackberry fruits, a strong sense of tannins that enrich the fruit, and a concentrated aftertaste. From one of several small properties tended by owners Christophe and Marie Jo Lavau, it will age well. Drink from 2017.
title: Château Terrasson 2012 Cuvée Prevenche  (Castillon Côtes de Bordeaux)

description: Here's a solid wine full of both tannins and dark fruits. New oak barrels give a spicy character while supporting the fruitiness. A blend of 70% Merlot and 30% Cabernet Sauvignon from only 10 acres, it is developing into a rich wine that still needs time. Drink this impressive wine from 2018.
title: Château des Matards 2012 Cuvée Nathan  (Blaye Côtes de Bordeaux)

description: This is powerful, a fine expression of the richness of 2005. Dense and dusty tannins fit in the structure of ripe, black plums and currants. It has just the right amount of acidity to keep fresh among all this richness.
title: Château Coutet 2005  Saint-Émilion

description: A light touch of toastiness gives this Despagne family wine extra richness. It offers spice as well as plenty of crisp green and citrus fruits. The two elements balance and will allow this wine to age well. Drink from late 2017 or even early 2018.
title: Château Tour de Mirambeau 2016 Réserve  (Bordeaux Blanc)

description: This is a ripe and soft blend of Sauvignon Blanc and Sémillon. Well balanced, it has rich, spicy fruit lifted by lemon and apple flavors and by the final acidity. It's ready to drink now.
title: Château Vircoulon 2016  Bordeaux Blanc

description: In this still very young wine, the tannins dominate, but the fruitiness is there to come out later. With power, black fruits and touches of dark chocolate, it will be a fine, rich wine. Drink from 2017.
title: Château Bibian 2011  Haut-Médoc

description: A year's wood aging has left its mark on this wine in the form of burnt smokiness. However, the fruit is rich and full-bodied giving the promise that the wine will smooth out its rough edges. There already is a fine juiciness at the end that comes with great acidity.
title: Château Cap Léon Veyrin 2011  Listrac-Médoc

description: A wood-laden wine, it still manages to bring out its inherent fruitiness. It's a ripe wine, showing spice from the wood and juicy blackberry flavors, well packaged and finished off with acidity. Drink this attractive wine from 2016.
title: Château de Braude 2011  Haut-Médoc

description: A smooth and velvet-textured wine, where the tannins are a cushion for the ripe plum juice fruit. Herbs and wood spice contribute to this rich and full-bodied wine.
title: Château Fonguillon 2005  Montagne-Saint-Émilion

description: Saint-Croix-du-Mont is on the slopes across the Garonne river from Sauternes. In years like 2005, it can produce some fine sweet botrytis wines. This has honey, a bite of botrytis and a great lemon edge. Worth aging, but ready to drink now.
title: Château La Rame 2005  Saint-Croix-du-Mont

description: This totally fresh wine has benefited from the quality of whites in 2007 Bordeaux. It is lemony with pink grapefruit flavors giving an intense lift. There is some herbaceousness, with green herbs and juicy fruits. To drink now.
title: Yvon Mau 2007 Premius Bordeaux Sauvignon  (Bordeaux Blanc)

description: A heavy dose of Sauvignon Blanc brings herbaceous, grassy, white currants and gooseberry flavors. It's young, and needs more time to coalesce. It is certainly fresh, fruity, right up front.
title: Château Lamothe-Vincent 2008 Sauvignon  (Bordeaux Blanc)

description: The initial impression is of a jammy, almost sweet wine. Later bright berry fruits, some wood and a dense tannin core kick in. With its sweet chocolate and juicy edge, this is a wine ready to drink now. Screwcap.
title: Château Lamothe-Vincent 2007 Intense  (Bordeaux)

description: Full, rounded and creamy, this is a fine, green plum- and white berry-flavored wine that has some good depth as well as fine floral aromas. It is lively and fresh, but with some richness.
title: Château Toumilon 2005  Graves

description: This is overpowering, almost too much. The fruit is so rich it feels overextracted, superjuicy and then hit with tannins and new wood. For those who like superconcentrated wines, this will be a big hit, but not with food.
title: L'Egrégoire 2004  Bordeaux

description: This is an attractive, crisp and fruity wine. It has layers of wood that are already integrating well with the black-currant fruitiness. Tannins and a firm core are signs that the wine will age well. Drink this attractive wine from 2018.
title: Bernard Magrez 2014 Château Tour Blanche  (Médoc)

description: From vines on the plain of Saint-Émilion, close to the Dordogne river, this is a ripe fruity wine. The tannins are already well integrated into the berry fruits, leaving just a dry core that is typical of the year. Drink the wine from 2018.
title: Château Abelyce 2011  Saint-Émilion

description: On the slopes above the eastern Bordeaux town of Sainte-Foy, this vineyard produces some fine wines. Aged in new wood, the wine is rich in tannins, complex and serious. Bright red fruits and a firm structure both promise aging. Drink from 2018.
title: Château Bellevue Peycharneau 2013  Sainte-Foy Bordeaux

description: A light wood-aging flavor gives this wine its richness along with its fine ripe yellow fruits. Ripe and fruity from an excellent year for white Bordeaux, the wine is smooth and ready to drink.
title: Château Haut Bertinerie 2014 Elegance  (Blaye Côtes de Bordeaux)

description: The second wine of Château le Prieuré, made from 100% pure juicy Merlot, is ripe and concentrated. It still has plenty of firm tannins although the rich fruits will balance out shortly. It is then going to be a generous wine with great final fruitiness. Drink from 2018.
title: Château le Prieuré 2014 Délice du Prieuré  (Saint-Émilion)

description: A dense wine that is showing signs of heavy extraction, with dark chocolate and bitter flavors. In a vintage with crisp fruitiness being the defining factor, it is a bit of a shame. The dark edge needs to mellow before the wine can balance out.
title: Château Marquis de Terme 2014  Margaux

description: The wine is firm and structured, showing more structure than fruit. It is solid, tight and with vanilla and blackberry fruits that are still behind the tannins. Probably this wine will remain firm, although the tannins should soften. Drink from 2018.
title: Château Moncets 2011  Lalande de Pomerol

description: A blend that is 50-50 Merlot and Cabernet Sauvignon has produced a ripe, juicy and fruity wine, typical of the vintage. There is a crisp edge as well as firmer tannins and signs of the wood aging that will integrate as the wine matures. Drink this attractive wine from 2019.
title: Château Moulin de Blanchon 2014  Haut-Médoc

description: The 49% of Sémillon in this rich wine gives it a full, ripe character. It is backed up by the more herbal Sauvignon Blanc to add the freshness. The wine is fruity with citrus and white stone fruits, ready to drink from 2017.
title: Clarendelle 2015  Bordeaux Blanc

description: Produced with organically grown grapes, the wine is firm, still tight and with ripe black fruits. It is full, structured with enough fruitiness to balance the tannins. As it ages, this wine will come together into a rich while fruity wine. Drink from late 2017.
title: Lion des Aubrots 2014  Côtes de Bourg

description: Strong wood-aging flavors give a spice and bitter chocolate character. The result, though, is that the wood softens the potentially stalky fruit and helps accent the underlying red berry flavors with attractive acidity. Drink now.
title: Petite Sirène 2012  Bordeaux

description: The wine has some of the typical freshness of 2011 but it seems on the thin side. Black currant flavors run alongside high acidity, and the tannins show strongly. The aftertaste brings out more tight, mineral acidity.
title: Château la Petite Roque 2010  Blaye Côtes de Bordeaux

description: A soft, perfumed wine, it shows attractive light black currant flavors as well as some tannins, acidity and a young fruity character. It is ready to drink now.
title: Fleury 2012 Ilixens  (Bordeaux)

description: A very dry, firm wine, with some chocolate extract flavors and signs of wood aging, both balanced by stalky black currant fruits. It is hard at present, so give it until 2014.
title: Château le Breton 2012 Grande Réserve  (Bordeaux)

description: A light, fruity wine, dominated by salty, mineral flavors as well as black currant fruit. It is firmly structured, showing some spiciness. Keep this wine, and drink from 2016.
title: Château Siaurac 2011  Lalande de Pomerol

description: This rich, concentrated wine is velvet smooth, with tannins enveloped by ripe berry and plum fruits. Wood aging has added to the the rounded character. Despite its approachability, it will age well, so the wine is best drunk from 2018.
title: Château Haut Bertinerie 2012  Blaye Côtes de Bordeaux

description: The wine has serious tannins and firm fruit that give an austere character at this stage. But it will develop and round out into a rich wine with ripe black fruits, always with a solid tannic structure. Owner Juliette Bécot manages the technical side here with consultant Jean-Philippe Fort from the Michel Rolland lab, and manages marketing at classed-growth Château Beauséjour-Bécot in nearby Saint-Émilion.
title: Château Joanin Bécot 2012  Castillon Côtes de Bordeaux

description: Big and juicy, this is an attractive blend of 70% Merlot, 20% Cabernet Sauvignon and 10% Malbec with a promising future. It has ripe berry fruits, touches of spice and ginger. The tannins are firm, dusty and dry while allowing plenty of room for the fruit. It will develop well; drink from 2018.
title: Château la Croix Saint-Pierre 2012 Tradition  (Blaye Côtes de Bordeaux)

description: This concentrated, herbal wine has a good balance between the great fruit and the tangy, zesty texture. With its fruity character and spicy aftertaste, it's already a pleasure to drink.
title: Château le Grand Verdus 2016  Bordeaux Blanc

description: Crisp and fruity, this wine is full of apple and citrus flavors. It also features a touch of wood and spice, with a creamy aftertaste from the light wood aging. Drink now.
title: Château Mont-Pérat 2016  Bordeaux Blanc

description: This is a tight, mineral-textured wine. Crisp fruit keeps it bright, but the texture adds a more serious, structured note. Wait until late 2017 for it to come completely together.
title: Château Petit Moulin 2016 Rosé (Bordeaux Rosé)

description: Mont-Pérat is on slopes overlooking the Garonne river, offering great exposure. Maybe that's why this wine is so well balanced, its ripe fruits sliced open with acidity. The texture is smooth, given spice from judicious wood aging. This is a wine to drink this year.
title: Château Mont-Pérat 2006  Bordeaux Blanc

description: Owned by France's national agricultural research institute, this estate has been curiously underperforming until the last two vintages. This 2007, almost entirely Sauvignon Blanc, continues the improvement, a deliciously fresh, herbaceous wine, with a currant freshness on top of grapefruit and lime.
title: Château Couhins 2007  Pessac-Léognan

description: Thieuley's vineyard is on a ridge in the heart of Entre-deux-Mers. This top white cuvée, with its light wood aging, shows the wonderful freshness of the vintage while also giving some rich, full white fruits, spice and a smooth, creamy texture.
title: Château Thieuley 2007 Cuvée Francis Courselle  (Bordeaux Blanc)

description: Owned by the Cathiard family of Château Smith Haut-Lafitte since 1994, the vineyard of Cantelys neighbors both Smith Haut-Lafitte and the Lurton-owned Rochemorin. The wine is rich, smooth, the wood well integrated, allowing fine wafts of herbaceous citrus and currant flavors to come out of the glass. It's ready to drink now, but could age over 2–3 years.
title: Château Cantelys 2007  Pessac-Léognan

description: Ripe, with a touch of honey as if the botrytis for the sweet wine landed on these grapes as well. This dry white has creamy wood, spice and apricot flavors, making a delicious ripe wine, even with a touch of sweetness to the finish.
title: Château d'Yquem 2006 Ygrec  (Bordeaux Blanc)

description: In its youth, this is intensely grassy, the grapefruit and green pepper flavors adding to the general crispness of the wine. It will be an attractive wine, full of pep, with a fine edge of minerality, spice and vivid white fruits.
title: Château Ferrande 2008  Graves

description: A wine that suffers from high toast and not enough fruit weight. In time, it should settle down, but it is always going to be a wine that is on the lean side.
title: Château de Bel-Air 2007  Lalande de Pomerol

description: The spicy aroma and burnt toast character of this young wine reflects its strong wood aging. The black fruit is right behind though, likely to break through the dry surface over the next few months. Drink from 2019.
title: Château du Luc 2016  Côtes de Bourg

description: This ripe but balanced wine has ripe wood aromas and a solid tannic structure. Its black currant fruitiness is still developing, promising future juiciness. Drink from 2019.
title: Château Haut Cormier 2015  Bordeaux Supérieur

description: Produced from organic grapes, this lightly structured wine is full of black currant fruitiness. With a touch of spice from wood aging, it's soft and easy to drink now.
title: Château la Guillaumette 2015  Bordeaux

description: This wine ultrarich—perhaps too much so. With intense apricot and spice flavors, it's a dense powerhouse of bitter botrytis that lacks elegance. Although it will soften with time, the superripe character will remain.
title: Château les Roques 2013

description: This second wine of this estate is aged in tank, making it all bright, ripe berry fruit and juicy acidity. The tannins are still there as it's still aging. Give this attractive, fruity wine until late 2018 before opening.
title: Château Roc de Boissac 2014 La Millerie  (Puisseguin Saint-Émilion)

description: Made by the same team as Château Pichon Lalande, this is a tensely textured, austere wine, still young when tasted, but showing good potential to develop into elegance, with black fruit and dense tannins blending easily into fresh acidity. Age for 4–5 years.
title: Château Bernadotte 2006  Haut-Médoc

description: A finely structured and shaped wine, the Sauvignon Blanc dominating the blend, but offering more of its tropical fruit side than its herbaceous character. However, there is a good hint of balanced wood, lifting and giving extra richness.
title: Château Brown 2006  Pessac-Léognan

description: A perfumed, new wood-dominated wine, but one that does have the weight of fruit to support the wood. The tannins edge between fruit and wood, layered over rich black plums and bitter chocolate flavors. Under everything is fresh acidity to give the wine a welcome, vivid final lift.
title: Château Cambon la Pelouse 2006  Haut-Médoc

description: In the northern Margaux village of Soussans, Deyrem-Valentin produces a delicate wine, with simply structured blackberry jelly flavors, just edged with dark tannins. The flavors are sweet, ripe, open, not for aging.
title: Château Deyrem Valentin 2006  Margaux

description: Structured and austere, this is firm, dark and dry. The black currant fruit flavors are edgy, with juiciness only coming through right at the end.
title: Château la Cabanne 2006  Pomerol

description: Chocolate and bitter cherries dominate this full-on wine, packed with spice and toasty wood flavors. In mouthfeel, it is very rich, smooth, dense and velvety at the same time.
title: Château Lamothe-Vincent 2006 Merlot  (Bordeaux)

description: Immediately attractive, even if not showing much density, this wine floats by on fresh red currant and berry fruits, soft tannins and a mouthwatering, juicy close.
title: Château Marquis de Terme 2006  Margaux

description: In recent years, the Gardiniers of Phélan-Ségur seem to have become preoccupied with wood, generally too much. It's the same in 2006, and it is a shame, because everything else about this wine is balanced—the fruit is ripe and sweet and there is some freshness from a cranberry note. It just needs the wood to become less dominant.
title: Château Phélan-Ségur 2006  Saint-Estèphe

description: Showing the richness and structure of the 2010 vintage, this is an opulent wine, full of black fruits. It has a dark structure, smoky bacon flavors and powerful tannins. Ripe and generous, the fruit can cope with this structure. It does need to age, so drink from 2017.
title: Château Beauvillage 2010  Médoc

description: On the ripe side of herbaceous, this is a full and rounded wine. It has citrus flavors along with richer tropical fruits, a mineral edge and delicious, juicy acidity. The wine can be drunk now, but will be better after 2015.
title: Château Ducasse 2012  Bordeaux Blanc

description: While there are firm tannins here, the wine also has rich fruit. The two together, allied to the concentration, promise some good aging for a solidly made wine. Fine acidity cuts through in the aftertaste. Drink from 2017.
title: Château Escot 2011  Médoc

description: This wine is packed with fruit tannins and dense black currant fruits. It's rich, structured, very dry with its tannins and firm. It's a solid effort that is going to develop well. Drink from 2017.
title: Château Hourtin-Ducasse 2011  Haut-Médoc

description: This attractively balanced wine has black fruits that are well integrated into the soft tannins, the perfumed acidity and a ripe, juicy texture. Developing deliciously, the wine should be ready to drink by 2015.
title: Château Picoron 2011  Castillon Côtes de Bordeaux

description: Rich already, this wine is darkly tannic and powered by solid tannins. The weight of fruit behind the tannins also brings out acidity and black currant flavors. It will remain dry but well structured and with good fruitiness. Drink from 2017.
title: Château Reysson 2011  Haut-Médoc

description: The herbaceousness comes from both the Sauvignon and Sémillon in the blend. The Sémillon also gives a full texture as well as potential richness. With attractive citrus acidity, this is a very drinkable wine that can age.
title: Château Tanesse 2012  Bordeaux Blanc

description: Cos d'Estournel's Médoc property produces wines that are all fruit. This is typical, a medley of black and red fruits on a light bed of tannins. The downside is a rustic flavor that needs to blow away. Give the wine until 2015.
title: Goulée 2011  Médoc

description: The second wine from the biodynamic estate of Durfort-Vivens, this is a deliciously ripe fruity wine, dominated by 82% Cabernet Sauvignon. It has a crisp accessible character that will allow it to age relatively quickly. The wine has juicy acidity, red-berry fruits and final acidity. Drink from 2019.
title: Château Durfort-Vivens 2014 Viviens  (Margaux)

description: This is a very fine wine, bringing together sophisticated tannins and rich black fruits. It has structure, acidity and a juicy core that are well balanced, ripe and with great intensity. This is a serious wine from billionaire Clément Fayat and family and it is well worth aging. Drink from 2022.
title: Château la Dominique 2014  Saint-Émilion

description: Still dry and concentrated and with swathes of rich tannins, the wine is dark and dense. The undertow of ripe black fruit is impressive. It obviously has considerable aging potential, Drink this serious wine from 2025.
title: Château Giscours 2014  Margaux

description: This is a full-bodied wine, from one of the leading estates in Margaux. It is ripe with juicy blackberry and black-currant fruits. This fruit contrasts with the dark tannins and powerful structure. It is going to develop slowly and impressively to be ready to drink from 2025.
title: Château Rauzan-Ségla 2014  Margaux

description: This wine, with its massive tannins and rich fruit, is obviously set for a long life. It does have the contrast of fresh black-currant acidity to give it a lift. But with the power behind it, the wine will develop slowly. Drink from 2025.
title: Château Léoville Barton 2014  Saint-Julien

description: This is rich, while also such a stylish wine. It is ripe and full of tannins while masking that firm structure with immensely generous fruit. The two give the wine power, density and elegance. Drink this impressive wine from 2025.
title: Château Pichon Longueville 2014  Pauillac

description: With rich fruit that is balanced by tight acidity, this shows both the structure and the fragrant red berry flavor of the vintage. The acids cut through the wine to shape its freshness, highlighting its dark tannins. It needs to age for 4–5 years.
title: Château Pierre de Montignac 2010  Médoc

description: An herbaceous wine, smoothed out by spicy wood. The wine is balanced, the wood a delicious extra to pear and green plum-skin fruit flavors. Very perfumed, it demands fish with a sauce or scallops.
title: Château Haut Bertinerie 2006  Premieres Côtes de Blaye

description: Emphasizing richness rather than sweetness, here is a wine that is dominated by the dryness of botrytis. It has powerful, dark honey flavors allied to almonds and spice. The fruit, though, is less obvious.
title: Château Lamothe Guignard 2004  Sauternes

description: Rich and spicy, this 90% Merlot and 10% Cabernet Sauvignon from 10 acres generous and ripe, with warm tannins and a fruity, red berry character. This blend has attractive acidity and spicy flavors from the combination of wood and stainless-steel aging. This is only the second vintage from enologist Jean-Rémi Larrat's own property. It is worth aging, so drink from 2017.
title: Château Chatard 2012  Cadillac Côtes de Bordeaux

description: Ripe plum fruits give this big and fruity wine from the 130-acre Castéra vineyard a rich character. The structure provides a fine support with tannins that bring out the concentrated blackberry fruits. It's full of potential; drink from 2018.
title: Château Castera 2011  Médoc

description: Powerfully tannic, this dense and firm wine is dark in both color and fruit flavors. Tannins dominate the structure, giving a solid core to a wine that will certainly age. It has richness, juicy berry fruits and plums shining with acidity. Drink from 2018.
title: Château Gramond 2011  Haut-Médoc

description: Made from old vines, this complex and structured wine brings out the richness and ripe tannins of 2010. It's firm although the fruit concentration is what shows most strongly. It's an impressive, juicy, red-fruited wine that will age. Drink from 2017.
title: Château la Baronnerie 2010 Grand Vin  (Blaye Côtes de Bordeaux)

description: This complex, spicy and fruity wine is big, with attractive acidity. It is piled with berry fruits that give a rich character. The fruits are supported by well-judged wood. This full-bodied wine will develop well; drink from 2017.
title: Château la Verrière 2012  Bordeaux Supérieur

description: This is turning into an impressive wine as it finds its way between solid tannins and ripe, full black fruits. It is dark and dense at this stage with tannins that dominate. A more juicy character will develop as the wine ages. Drink from 2017.
title: Château Dutruch Grand Poujeaux 2012  Moulis-en-Médoc

description: This solid and powerful wine comes from a chateau right in the walls of Saint-Émilion. A dense texture brings out tannins and the wood-aging flavors. Spice, black currant fruitiness and a dark, dense character all promise aging. Drink from 2018.
title: Château Villemaurine 2012  Saint-Émilion

description: From what used to be known as the Premières Côtes de Bordeaux, this Merlot-dominated wine offers soft fruits laced with acidity and gentle tannins. It is not a wine for aging.
title: Château de Paillet-Quancard 2008  Côtes de Bordeaux

description: Stalky black currant fruit dominates this wood-aged wine. The black fruits are fresh, although with a stern structure of Cabernet Sauvignon. It need a year to develop.
title: Château Lacombe Noaillac 2010  Médoc

description: A structured, firm wine showing a great balance of red fruits, dry Bordeaux-style tannins and a freshly jammy texture. For a branded Bordeaux, it has both quality and elegance.
title: Domaines Barons de Rothschild (Lafite) 2005 Réserve Spéciale  (Bordeaux)

description: Owned by the Bernard family who also own one of the major Bordeaux negociants, Millésima, the wine is structured, deliciously fruity and with a series of smoky tannins that will allow it to age. It comes from a vineyard close to Pauillac and that shows in the dense Cabernet Sauvignon that gives the wine its weight. Drink from 2021.
title: Château Peyrabon 2014  Haut-Médoc

description: Produced mainly from young Cabernet Sauvignon vines on the Château Smith Haut Lafitte vineyard, this is a solid, dark and dense wine. It has rich black-currant flavors that are cut by acidity and firm tannins. Both mean the wine needs to age, so drink from 2020.
title: Château Smith Haut Lafitte 2011 Le Petit Haut Lafitte  (Pessac-Léognan)

description: With a dominance of Merlot in the blend, this Saint-Émilion-classed growth has ripe, jammy fruits and softening tannins. It is dense and concentrated with big blackberry fruits that have a touch of spice and pepper from the alcohol. The wine is rich and ready to drink now and until 2024.
title: Château de Ferrand 2012  Saint-Émilion

description: Definitely on the grassy, herbaceous side, this second white wine of Vieux Château Gaubert has freshness. But it is the intensity of its grapefruit, gooseberry and green kiwi flavors that are dominant, given an extra edge of some spice.
title: Vieux Château Gaubert 2008 Benjamin  (Graves)

description: A gold color and honey aromas set the scene for this rich, opulent wine. It has a great layer of botrytis as well as plenty of spice and delicious apricot and orange fruit flavors, finishing with a tang of crisp acidity. Drink from 2020.
title: Château Simon 2011 Cuvée Exceptionelle  (Sauternes)

description: Full, ripe and roundly fruity, this is a good example of the natural opulence of 2009. It has rich black fruits, soft tannins, a dark hint of wood and generous richness. Powered by both its acidity and its structure, it is developing well. Drink from 2014.
title: Château de Malengin 2009  Montagne-Saint-Émilion

description: This is a full-bodied, structured wine full of ripe berry fruits, delicate acidity and soft tannins. There is a juicy element that offers freshness to balance the firm texture. Wait a year to drink this wine.
title: Château de Costis 2011  Bordeaux

description: This is a solid, chunky wine, rich in dark blackberry and and red plum flavors. Maybe the tannins are too hard at this stage, but its weight and rich fruit suggest aging potential. Drink from 2016..
title: Château du Cros 2011 Clos Bourbon  (Cadillac Côtes de Bordeaux)

description: There is fine acidity here as well as the extra richness from wood aging. The wine has weight, spice and fresh apricot and quince flavors. It is a wine for aging for a couple of years, so drink from 2015.
title: Château Fonréaud 2012 Le Cygne de Fonreaud  (Bordeaux Blanc)

description: Dark and dense, here is a wine that shows just as much hard-edged dryness as it does juicy red fruits. Once the components come together, the wine will be concentrated and powerful. This wine has lots of potential. Drink from 2016.
title: Château Haut-Mongeat 2011 Cuvée Isabelle  (Bordeaux Supérieur)

description: Solid and textured, this is a firm wine with a bright future. It has weight from its tannins as well as ripe berry fruits that shine through. Delicate acidity lightens the load. It does need to age, so drink from 2016.
title: Maison Bouey 2011 Château Belrose  (Bordeaux Supérieur)

description: This wine has good spiciness, ripe fruits and firm tannins. There is a good balance between acidity from red berry fruits and a dense, tannic character. It is solid and concentrated, and needing to age longer. Drink from 2015.
title: Caves de Rauzan 2011 Château Villotte  (Bordeaux Supérieur)

description: Solidly tannic, this is a firm wine with juicy fruit that adds balance to the structure. It has a refreshing quality with black currant flavors that are full and dense in the mouth. Give this fine wine time. Drink after 2016.
title: Château Brethous 2011 The Classic  (Cadillac Côtes de Bordeaux)

description: With spice, a touch of toast and ripe fruits, this is an attractive, tangy wine. It has apricot and peach flavors as well as a full, rich texture. The wine should age a year before drinking.
title: Château Rauzan Despagne 2012 Grand Vin  (Bordeaux Blanc)

description: A serious, complex wine, its tannins and full fruit still young and headstrong. There is power here, spice wood adding to the black cherry fruit and complex acidity. For aging.
title: Château Jean-Faure 2006  Saint-Émilion

description: The small Pauillac vineyard close to some of the first growths is able to bring out all the Cabernet-dominated structure of the appellation. Look for black currant fruits, dark tannins and dense texture. Age for six years.
title: Château Béhèré Courtin 2008  Pauillac

description: From one of the properties controlled by Marie-Laure Lurton, this is a finely made wine. It revels in its structure, while around that there are ripe, soft red berry fruits, spice and an intensely juicy acidity. Full of charm, ready to age.
title: Château la Tour de Bessan 2008  Margaux

description: This big, fruity black-colored wine has ripe stone fruit flavors and firm, ripe tannins. There is structure, obvious aging potential as well as ripe, sweet juicy Merlot fruit flavors. Age for 5-6 years.
title: Vieux Château des Templiers 2008  Pomerol

description: Dark tannins provide the structured for the Cabernet Sauvignon black currant flavors. It has power—this is a big and solid wine, given tension by tannins, that will take several years to soften out.
title: Château Lafon-Rochet 2008  Saint-Estèphe

description: Big, solid, firm wine, with an edge that is a little farmyard. It has weight, though, along with smoky, fruity flavors of black plums.
title: Château Mouton Rothschild 2008 Le Petit Mouton  (Pauillac)

description: In family since 18th century, Stéphane et Paola Gabard took over in 1999. Their wine is promising plenty though it is still opening up. The apple, perfumed pear and peach flavors are all coming through to give a lively, refreshing wine that is also full bodied. Drink from late 2016. La Croix De Queynac is a French monument amidst the vines.
title: Château La Croix de Queynac 2015  Bordeaux Blanc

description: Still with its young tannins intact, the wine is firm and structured. It has spice, mint and black-currant fruits under the tight texture. It will still age so wait, if you want, for another year.
title: Château l'Espérance 2011  Blaye Côtes de Bordeaux

description: The wine, with 70% Merlot in the blend, is soft with gentle open tannins. It has an attractive perfumed edge. It's a light wine, fruity and ready to drink.
title: Château Croix de Mission 2013  Montagne-Saint-Émilion

description: On the eastern end of the Bordeaux appellation, this Gazaniol property reserves 10 of 161 acres for its white blend. This is a ripe, soft wine that is rounded with peach and red-apple fruit flavors. Crisp acidity gives it some tightness to balance the full, fruity character of the wine. Drink now.
title: Château de Parenchère 2015  Bordeaux Blanc

description: A rich, spicy wine that is full of black-currant fruits. It does have a lighter touch of acidity that is nicely integrated into the smoky texture and fine tannins. The wine is ready to drink.
title: Château du Juge 2014  Bordeaux

description: With its signature herbal aromas with tangy, grapefruit-like acidity, this wine is light, fruity and ready to drink.
title: Calvet 2016 Limited Release  (Bordeaux Blanc)

description: Jammy, overripe fruit does not help this wine. Its soft tannins and acidity provide some pleasure, but that clumsy fruit gets in the way.
title: Château de Belcier 2015 Le Pin de Belcier  (Castillon Côtes de Bordeaux)

description: New wood aromas lead this toasty wine that has spice, high toast flavors and the smallest hint of fruit. If the producer had not been so enthusiastic with the oak, this could have been a good wine.
title: Château Les Bertrands 2015 Nectar Des Bertrands  (Blaye Côtes de Bordeaux)

description: Soft, fruity and gently ripe, this is a light, easygoing wine. It has a touch of pepper as well as strawberry fruit flavors. Drink now.
title: Château Marot 2016 Collection Grande Réserve Rosé (Bordeaux Rosé)

description: Already an easy, ripe wine, this is fruity, rich and developing well. Its black currant and berry fruits give a sense of freshness, while smoky tannins suggest structure. It's not powerful, but will be very enjoyable. Drink from 2017.
title: Château Blaignan 2011  Médoc

description: This wine is maturing well, giving a firm, structure and some stalkiness. It's dry and will remain that way, showing some mineral texture as well as black currant flavors. The wine will be at its best in 2015.
title: Château de la Grenière 2008  Lussac Saint-Émilion

description: A soft, gently fruity wine, it has warm tannins, layers of smooth vanilla from wood aging and a finish that brings out the acidity of the vintage. Fresh, fruity and ready to drink.
title: Château de Sainte-Gemme 2011  Haut-Médoc

description: This is a toasty, black-currant-fruited wine. Its structural tannins give a dry character. A touch of green herb and a hard edge of toast indicate that the wine needs another year to soften.
title: Baron Philippe de Rothschild 2010 Mouton Cadet  (Bordeaux)

description: This is a soft, rather unfocused, open-textured wine that shows apple and citrus flavors. It's ready to drink now.
title: Château Briot 2011  Bordeaux Blanc

description: With a blackberry flavor and a juicy character, this is a wine that has a bright, fresh feel and soft tannins.
title: Château Chaubinet 2011  Bordeaux

description: This big, powerful and tannic wine shows a dry character that dominates the black currant and berry notes. The old wood flavors seem out of sync with the rest of the palate.
title: Château de Lugagnac 2009  Bordeaux Supérieur

description: An herbal wine, with a light in texture, this Bordeaux has smoke and tobacco aromas that make it bright and ready to drink. Screwcap.
title: Château Gabaron 2010  Bordeaux

description: Lean, soft and soapy in character, this has a dry core and soft tannins, with a lightweight red-berry note. Not for aging.
title: Château Vieux Ferrand 2011 Cuvée Legta  (Lalande de Pomerol)

description: There is a minerally texture to this structured, severe wine. It has some weight, but it shows a stalky black-currant flavor and dry tannins. The finishis lean.
title: Sirius 2009  Bordeaux

description: It is the high proportion of perfumed Sauvignon Gris in this wine that creates its ripe, smooth and rich character. It brings in a calming, rounding influence to the more herbal Sauvignon Blanc and will allow it to develop a creamy character as it develops. Drink from summer 2017.
title: La Fleur Ribeyrolles 2015  Entre-Deux-Mers

description: Grown in the far eastern edge of Bordeaux, in the Entre-deux-Mers, this is a bright and fruity wine. It has tannins that just lift the juicy red and black-currant fruits.
title: Les Vignerons Réunis de Monségur 2014 Château le Mayne Turon  (Bordeaux)

description: Produced from organically grown grapes, this is a ripe, easy and fruity wine. It has light tannins, juicy black-currant fruit and acidity. It is still young, showing off its fruitiness and will be ready to drink soon, from early 2017.
title: Château Champ du Moulin 2015  Bordeaux

description: This is a ripe wine that has a high proportion of Sémillon in the blend. That makes it rich: revealing yellow fruits as well as greener herbal characters. It is fruity, tangy and refreshing. Drink from spring 2017.
title: Château Saint-Florin 2015 Sauvignon Blanc-Sémillon  (Bordeaux Blanc)

description: This ripe Saint-Émilion is generous with its rounded perfumed Merlot. It gives the wine richness, juicy acidity and an open texture. Touches of tannin do bring in some structure, but the emphasis is on the fruitiness and fresh aftertaste. Drink from late 2017.
title: Cheval Quancard 2014 Fortin Plaisance  (Saint-Émilion)

description: Named after the fortress at Blaye on the banks of the Gironde, the wine is easygoing and approachable. It has generous black-currant fruits, shot through with acidity, and is given structure by some dense tannins. Drink this wine from 2017.
title: A. de Luze et Fils 2015 La Belle Citadelle  (Bordeaux Supérieur)

description: Situated at the highest point of the Entre-deux-Mers region, the estate is dominated by the ripe Merlot in this wine. It is fruity and soft with lively acidity and gentle tannins. There is a touch of wood from the aging, although the fruitiness is what this wine is about. Drink from 2017.
title: Château Saint-Florin 2015 Cabernet Sauvignon-Merlot  (Bordeaux)

description: While the tannins are still powerful and dense, the wine has rich berry fruits and juicy acidity that give freshness. It's ripe, well balanced, and full bodied, with a dark, concentrated character at the end. Drink from 2016.
title: Château les Reuilles 2011  Bordeaux

description: This one comes from the Mouton branch of the Rothschilds. Showing its age a bit already, with mature apple and wood varnish aromas that perk up a bit on the palate, where they pick up some attractive lemon nuances.
title: Baron Philippe de Rothschild 1998  Graves

description: A famous old brand that seems to be living off past glory, this year's edition is quite neutral in aroma and flavor; you have to work to pick out some mild herb and citrus, but it does show a nice spicy, green-peppercorn character on the finish.
title: Baron Philippe de Rothschild 1999 Mouton Cadet  (Bordeaux Blanc)

description: The nose features some plum and faint cedar aromas, but not a lot of intensity; the light black-cherry and cedar flavors incorporate some earthy nuances on the finish. Light and correct, but where's the beef?
title: Michel Lynch 1998  Bordeaux

description: A softly textured wine, this has richness coming from black and red berry fruits. Wood and juiciness combine well in this attractive wine that will be ready to drink in a few months.
title: Barton & Guestier 2010 Thomas Barton Réserve  (Margaux)

description: The wine has the richness of the vintage while retaining a more stalky black-currant character. The smoky tannins and fruit are integrated, creating a wine that will be ready to drink in the next two years.
title: Château la Tour de By 2009  Médoc

description: With its apricot and honey flavors, this is an attractive, fruity dessert wine. There is some dryness from botrytis to add complexity. At the end, the wine offers a delicious fruit salad finish.
title: Château Suau 2009  Cadillac

description: Even though it is weighty, very full and dense, the wine has a fine balance, with acidity that cuts through the richness.
title: Horeau-Beylot 2009 Château la Fleur  (Lussac Saint-Émilion)

description: This is a fine, juicy and fruity wine. It has some firm, smoky tannins that are in the background. With its fruitiness, it is likely to be a wine that is ready to drink soon, certainly by 2017.
title: Château Donjon de Bruignac 2014  Bordeaux

description: A ripe wine from Haure Jany, this is dense with wood and tannins. The black-currant fruit is masked at this stage with a powerful dry core. Let this soften before drinking, so wait until 2019.
title: Château du Seguinier 2014  Blaye Côtes de Bordeaux

description: Fresh and fruity, this is a bright wine, full of almost shocking acidity and red-currant fruits. Its tannins are there, although more of an afterthought to the fruit. Drink this light fresh wine from 2017.
title: Château Jean Faux 2014  Bordeaux Supérieur

description: The Vignobles Bourdillas brothers' wine is fruity with black currant fruits and bright acidity. Fresh with a crisp texture and light tannins, it will be ready to drink by 2017.
title: Château Jussas 2014  Blaye Côtes de Bordeaux

description: The wine, unusually 100% Cabernet Sauvignon, is ripe and juicy with some smoky tannins in support. It has a finely perfumed character although touches of extraction give it a bitter edge. That should blow by, leaving an attractive fruity wine.
title: Château la Freynelle 2014  Bordeaux

description: This is a potentially juicy wine with acidity and red fruits coming through the structure. It has the weight for the tannins and a rich background feel. Drink starting from 2018.
title: Château Labatut 2014 Grande Réserve  (Bordeaux Supérieur)

description: Closed and firm at this early stage, the wine from Jean-Michel Bergeron has good potential. It is rich with plenty of black-currant fruit as well as dry tannins. Give this wine its time and wait until 2019.
title: Château Les Martins 2014  Blaye Côtes de Bordeaux

description: Mint aromas speak of new wood as part of the aging process in this wine from Bordeaux Vineam. It has plenty of spice, while also having fine red-fruit flavors and acidity. Drink from 2018.
title: Château Rocher Bellevue 2014 Les Cerisiers  (Castillon Côtes de Bordeaux)

description: The wine is dry and structured with firm tannins that are masking the fruit. It is a concentrated wine, firm and dense. Let this wine develop and wait to drink until 2019.
title: Château Ségonzac 2014  Blaye Côtes de Bordeaux

description: Already well balanced, this firm, concentrated wine allows its fruit to show strongly. Dominated by juicy, black-currant-flavored Cabernet Sauvignon, it is solid while also fresh, layering tannins and acidity. The wine will develop quickly; drink from 2020.
title: Clos du Marquis 2013  Saint-Julien

description: This estate has produced an impressive wine for the vintage. It balances acidity, tarry wood flavors and ripe black-berry fruits. Initially it is still showing its structure more than fruit, although this will even out as it matures. Drink from 2020.
title: Château Branaire-Ducru 2013  Saint-Julien

description: Strong herbal aromas continue to the palate, with green fruits plus a tangy acidity that is fresh and hints of more tropical fruits to come. It's a rich wine that has great potential, so drink from 2019. This is one of several properties owned by Bordeaux vigneron André Lurton.
title: Château Couhins-Lurton 2013  Pessac-Léognan

description: Dense, concentrated and firm, this wine has a powerful, rich structure that promises well. Big berry fruits and dark tannins are developing well together. The wine is full of promise so drink from 2020. Fifteen-percent of the 74 acres of vines are more than 120 years old. New York banker Robert G. Wilmers bought Haut-Bailly in 1998 from the Sanders family, owners since 1955. Véronique Sanders-van Beek has run the estate since then.
title: Château Haut-Bailly 2013  Pessac-Léognan

description: This ripe wine, from young vines, has softened its Sauvignon Blanc herbal character and developed ripe apricots and a delicious richness. The wood-aging shows, although not so as to hide the fruit and the tighter, nervy texture. Still developing, it will be best from 2018.
title: Château Larrivet Haut-Brion 2013 Les Hauts de Larrivet Haut-Brion  (Pessac-Léognan)

description: This is a wine that is totally dominated by wood. So much so that there is little sign of fruit. Maybe it will integrate, but there is a question mark.
title: Maison Bouey 2011 Cuvée  (Bordeaux)

description: Hard and extracted, this is a tough number. The fruit seems lean and the bitter chocolate flavor is not promising much. It may work with food.
title: Château de Ricaud 2011  Bordeaux Supérieur

description: Thin in character, this is a pleasant wine without much style. Light and ready to be drunk immediately.
title: Château le Noble 2012  Bordeaux Blanc

description: The unfocused wine tastes soapy, with bitterness and little fruit. Not a wine to enjoy now or in the future.
title: Château Les Gravières de la Brandille 2011  Bordeaux Supérieur
winery: Château Les Gravières de la Brandille

description: This is an unfocused wine that has jammy fruit and soft tannins. It tastes overripe. Not for aging.
title: Château de Lavagnac 2011  Bordeaux

description: Full bodied and rich, this has flavors of apple and lemon, with a warm and ripe feel that is balanced by a final mineral character. It needs several months to come together.
title: Baron Philippe de Rothschild 2011 Mouton Cadet  (Bordeaux Blanc)

description: Soft and rich, this is a fruity and textured wine. It has strong pear and spice flavors that complement the edge of lemon zest. This combination results in a wine that is bright and fruity. Screwcap.
title: Château Bel Air Perponcher 2011  Bordeaux Blanc

description: Overripe, this seems like an oddly structured wine. The fruit is buried under the wood influence and tannins, which introduce a licorice character.
title: Château Clos de Sarpe 2008  Saint-Émilion

description: Dry tannins from the old wood give this wine a hard edge at first. Fresh, juicy red fruits offer an enticing character. On the finish, the tannins are tough and will need several years to soften
title: Château du Domaine de l'Eglise 2009  Pomerol

description: The wood, with its heavy toast and licorice flavors, is dominant. That element makes for a wine that has weight but loses its fruit amid the firm extraction.
title: Château Fombrauge 2009  Saint-Émilion

description: Much of the sweet-tasting fruit of 2009 is present in this wine, while it simultaneously features a firm core of tannins. The bright acidity is reminiscent of fresh black currants. Juicy, fruity and likely to age quickly.
title: Château Fonsèche 2009  Haut-Médoc

description: In this toasty, wood-dominated wine, the fruit is buried beneath dark, dry tannins. It has enough weight to promise a future when the elements fall into balance, so give it 4–5 years.
title: Château Joinin 2009  Bordeaux

description: This round wine features flavors of tropical fruit and apricot, combined with a mineral-driven texture. It is rich yet it retains a good touch of brightness. Ready to drink, but worth aging for a few months.
title: Château La Maroutine 2011  Bordeaux Blanc

description: Rich and dense, ripe and juicy, this is full of black fruits. It is smooth on the surface while solidly tannic underneath. This is an opulent wine, with a dry, wood-driven finish. Keep it for at least six years.
title: Château Lamothe-Cissac 2009  Haut-Médoc

description: This is a generous, full-bodied wine that shows the ripe fruit of the vintage. The fruit appears upfront, offering a warm mouthfeel, and the tannic structure is likely to allow it to age.
title: Château Laronde Désormes 2009  Bordeaux Supérieur

description: Initially, the acidity cuts through this structured effort. Then the ripe fruits surface, creating a wine that is both rich and firmly textured. It is full in the mouth, rich and age worthy.
title: Château Malbec 2009  Bordeaux

description: A ripe, juicy and forward wine, this is all fruit—but it's delicious fruit. The tannins are restrained behind the exuberant fruitiness. It may not be classic Bordeaux, but it is likely to be very drinkable in 2–3 years.
title: Château Mongravey 2010  Margaux

description: Here's a big, smooth, round wine, with tannins that are packed into the superripe fruit flavors. It is powerful and concentrated, and the wood influence is still prominent along with a touch of bitterness from overextraction. It needs time to fully integrate.
title: Château Reverdi 2009  Listrac-Médoc

description: This Meynard family wine is ripe and soft with a smooth, creamy texture and a perfumed backdrop. It is ready to drink, full of good acidity and with a tangy, zesty texture. The aftertaste keeps that attractive perfumed character.
title: Château Bois Malot 2016  Bordeaux Blanc

description: Produced at the classed-growth Sauternes estate, this 100% Sauvignon Blanc comes from a 17-acre parcel. It has plenty of herbal flavors while also having a riper, yellow-fruit tinge. Lightly oaked, the wine is ripe from this warm vintage and ready to drink.
title: Château de Rayne Vigneau 2015 Le Sec de Rayne Vigneau  (Bordeaux Blanc)

description: Tight acidity and grassy herbaceous character, the wine has crisp fruit, a flinty structure and a brittle apple skin texture. For fresh aperitif drinking.
title: Château La Rame 2009  Bordeaux Blanc

description: This wine has a strongly tannic, dry character from the Malbec-inspired blend of 52% Merlot, 31% Malbec and 17% Cabernet Sauvignon. However the ripe blackberry fruits are match enough, giving ripe flavors with a squeeze of acidity and richness at the end. Drink from 2016.
title: Château la France 2013 Cuvée Gallus  (Bordeaux Supérieur)

description: This 90% Sauvignon Blanc and 10% Sémillon blend is a green, herbal wine full of acidity and citrus flavors. A lemon-zest tang gives it a crisp texture and bright acidity. Drink this fruity wine from 2016.
title: Château Petit-Freylon 2014 Cuvée Izzy  (Bordeaux Blanc)

description: In this broad wine, the grapes have been harvested ripe and juicy. It has a fresh acidity typical of the vintage. The red berry and black currant fruit flavors are forward and well balanced, with a crisp aftertaste. Drink from 2016.
title: Château Pierrousselle 2013  Bordeaux

description: From an estate to the east of the town of Saint-Émilion, this rich wine shows its alcohol in the pepper edge that cuts through the fruit. It tastes firm still and has extracted bitter flavors. The acidity does give the wine a lift and lets the black currant fruit come through. Drink from 2018.
title: Château Puy Mouton 2010  Saint-Émilion

description: An austere, stalky wine, showing its dry tannins and woody black currant flavors. It has a bitter edge to it, with its lean, dry tannins.
title: Mähler-Besse 2008 Château Biré  (Bordeaux Supérieur)

description: Juicy and fruity, with red berry fruits and a strong element of acidity. This is refreshing Bordeaux, soft, supple and light in the mouth.
title: Château La Rame 2009  Bordeaux

description: Ripe and spicy, this is an attractive package of warm tannins and red berries. This wine has a solid, dry core, but it will develop fast—delicious within a year.
title: Château de Fontenille 2010  Bordeaux

description: This is a bright, fruity, rounded wine with a soft texture. It's full and ripe, with melon and green plum notes, plus a touch of bitterness on the finish.
title: Château du Taillan 2011 La Dame Blanche  (Bordeaux Blanc)

description: Ripe and juicy, this wine has good acidity that accompanies the attractive, seemingly sweet tannins. Concentrated, it needs several years to broaden out.
title: Château Lauduc 2010 Classic  (Bordeaux)

description: Fruity and rather soft, this already shows maturity. It's an attractive, red-fruited wine that's light and fragrant. Not for aging.
title: Château Pey la Tour 2010  Bordeaux

description: This is tight and closed, with bitter tannins. It takes a while for the red berry flavor to surface, offering a wine that has potential for richness in 3–4 years time. It will always have a final, mineral-driven tautness.
title: Château Roc de Ségur 2010  Bordeaux

description: An earthy, full-bodied wine, this has ripe peach and lime flavors. Sulfur unattractively makes a strong appearance; as the wine was just bottled, this feature may disappear in a few months.
title: Château Tanesse 2011  Bordeaux Blanc

description: Here's a wine that, while expressing the structure of the vintage, brings warmth and a rich blackberry flavor as well. It has a fine texture and a firm, upright feel. Ready for drinking in a year.
title: Kirkland Signature 2010  Bordeaux Supérieur

description: Warm and rounded, this is a soft, ripe rosé. The flavors of plums and red berries roll easily around the mouth, producing a wine that is full, rich and soft.
title: Château Briot 2011 Red (Bordeaux Rosé)

description: This is a structured wine, with dry tannins and notes of berry and red cherry. The fruit comes through the smoky character, bringing sweet-tasting acidity. Give this wine 3–4 years to age.
title: Château le Moulin de la Jaumarde 2009  Bordeaux
winery: Château le Moulin de la Jaumarde

description: Perfumed and fragrant, this shows wood and fruity perfumes in harmony. It's attractive, forward and ready to drink.
title: Château l'Escart 2010 Cuvée Eden  (Bordeaux Supérieur)

description: Juicy, ripe wine, perfumed with sweet fruit. Black berries and bitter chocolate mix with sweet plums and final, lively acidity.
title: Château Ducru Beaucaillou 2008 Croix de Beaucaillou  (Saint-Julien)

description: Heavy new wood influence gives a creamy, toasty palate, the fruit lying under this smooth surface. It is juicy, packed with firm tannins. It will take several years for the wine to properly integrate.
title: Château Troplong Mondot 2008  Saint-Émilion

description: Trottevieille's style, like its old style yet renewed, offers structure and dry tannins, while there is fruit to give a powerful punch. When it all comes together, this will be in a wine for long aging.
title: Château Trottevieille 2008  Saint-Émilion

description: Tight acidity characterizes this wine. It's fresh, touched by some toastiness and minerality. The dominant character is the fresh herbaceous character that brings out sliced apple and chive flavors. Attractive now, it will be even better in 2016.
title: Château Cantelys 2012  Pessac-Léognan

description: The fifth generation of the family to make wine at the estate, Oriane Mazeau has created a delicately spicy wine that is lively and fruity. A floral character gives it a lift, as does crisp acidity. Bright, with plenty of flavorsome fruitiness, the wine is already a pleasure to drink.
title: Château Toutigeac 2016  Bordeaux Blanc

description: A wine that seems to be all tannin, all wood, with only a feel of black currant fruits underneath all this dryness. These flavors suggest high extraction, giving spice, a high toast wood character, all too much for a delicate 2007.
title: Château Sansey 2007  Graves

description: This tastes lean, the fruit buried deep beneath hard, dry fruit tannins. There is an old style austerity here that demands food. The final juicy acidity does leave a welcome relief.
title: Château d'Arcins 2006  Haut-Médoc

description: Corinne Guisez scored a great success with her 2000. The wine is finely polished, shining, with its generous, deeply concentrated fruits and fine perfumes. The tannins show through the fruit, while the wood flavors hide much more discreetly in the background.
title: Château Faugères 2000  Saint-Émilion

description: The junior of the two wines produced by the Barton family, this is a subtle, classic wine. Structure and firm tannins sit alongside the perfectly formed, under-stated red and black fruits.
title: Château Langoa Barton 2000  Saint-Julien

description: If Margaux is the most delicate of the Médoc wines, then this is the epitome of Margaux. It is light, poised and attractively perfumed. The fruit is elegant and fresh with a fine streak of acidity.
title: Château Labégorce Margaux 2000  Margaux

description: Thanks to the total dedication of owner Jean-Luc Vonderheyden, Monbrison continued to perform outside its class in 2000. Fragrant, perfumed aromas with suggestions of vanilla and lavender make this wine immediately attractive. It is soft, which suggests its aging will be fast, but the liquorice fruit flavors and ripeness will give pleasure after five years.
title: Château Monbrison 2000  Margaux

description: A solid, chunky structure is the hallmark of this big wine. The fruit is black, full of dark tannins. Perhaps it lacks subtlety, but that is replaced with great power and potential.
title: Château Brane-Cantenac 2000  Margaux

description: The dominance of Sémillon in the blend gives a ripe, creamy character, hinting at honey as well as yellow fruits. The herbaceous element is there but is tamed by the richness.
title: Château le Bonnat 2008  Graves

description: Highly aromatic wine, with upfront herbaceous fruits that could give New Zealand Sauvignons a run for their money. What gives it an extra element is a creamy applesauce flavor that smooths the wine and makes it richer.
title: Dourthe 2008 La Grande Cuvée  (Bordeaux Blanc)

description: A firm but fresh wine, the black currant fruit flavors right to the fore. Tannins are solid, dry, but fit well with the fruit profile. There is final fresh acidity.
title: Mähler-Besse 2007 Château la Couronne  (Saint-Émilion)

description: Flavors of bitter extraction spoil this wine, giving an unnecessarily hard character and masking the fruit. It probably will not soften much. The blend is 79% Merlot, 20% Cabernet Sauvignon and 1% Cabernet Franc. Produced by Alliance Bourg.
title: Château Haut Peyrefaure 2012  Blaye Côtes de Bordeaux

description: Smoky flavors go with dry tannins to give this wine a solid structure. It is dry at the back, allowing room for the acidity and black currant fruits to come forward. Drink from 2016.
title: Château la Favière 2013  Bordeaux Supérieur

description: While there is plenty of wood around in this Gonfrier family wine, the Merlot, Cabernet Sauvignon and Cabernet Franc blend also has good black currant and berry fruits. At the moment it is smoky and toasty, so it needs to soften. Drink from 2017.
title: Château Tanesse 2013  Cadillac Côtes de Bordeaux

description: Firm and structured, this wine is all tannins and a tough structure. It has a smoky, tight character, a mineral texture and the merest hints of black currant fruitiness. Drink from 2017. Enologist Corinne Chevrier-Loriaud, whose family owns the estate, blended 90% Merlot and 5% each of Malbec and Cabernet Sauvignon.
designation: L'Esprit de Bel Air la Royère
title: Château Bel Air la Royère 2012 L'Esprit de Bel Air la Royère  (Blaye Côtes de Bordeaux)

description: With some attractive tannins and strawberry fruits, this wine has kept its light character. It is developing well into an attractively fruity wine that will be ready from the end of 2016. This is part of a larger estate, Château Haut Rocher, across the line from Castillon in Saint-Émilion. It has been in the family since the 17th century. Jérôme et Béatrice de Monteil took over both properties for the family in 2010.
title: Château Bréhat 2013  Castillon Côtes de Bordeaux

description: Packed with red fruits and soft tannins, this is fresh, crisp and with bright acidity. The tannins at the back offer a firm aftertaste, along with juicy red currant fruits. Thierry Lurton bought the 14th-century château in 2007.
title: Château Camarsac 2013 Cuvée Prestige  (Bordeaux Supérieur)

description: This has a firm structure and dry tannins. Behind this wall lie stirrings of black currant fruits and acidity. The extraction and the hard edge need to soften, so drink from mid-2016. This is a Boissonneau family wine.
title: Château de la Vieille Tour 2013  Bordeaux Supérieur

description: Fruity and crisp, this is an attractive lemon and pear-flavored wine from certified organic vineyards. With fresh, balanced acidity and a creamy texture, this 60% Sauvignon and 40% Sémillon blend is ready to drink.
title: Château de la Vieille Tour 2014  Bordeaux Blanc

description: A very attractive wine that has ripe yellow fruits that are cut by acidity and citrus flavors. The texture is soft, rounded and lightly creamy. It's can age a few months, so wait until the end of 2014.
title: Château Ducasse 2012  Graves

description: While the tannins are still powerful and dense, the wine has rich berry fruits and juicy acidity that give freshness. It's ripe, well balanced, and full bodied, with a dark, concentrated character at the end. Drink from 2016.
title: Château les Reuilles 2011  Bordeaux

description: Herbaceous and fruity, this has a textured character, with an orange zest note and a strong lemon juiciness. It's fresh and ready to drink, but it will likely age for a few years.
title: Château Marac 2011  Bordeaux Blanc

description: Consultant Stéphane Derenoncourt has helped this light wine to have a good balance and soft, generous fruitiness. The tannins are kind, rounded and already well integrated with the fruit. Drink from 2017.
title: Maison Bouey 2013 Château Lestruelle  (Médoc)

description: This ripe, juicy wine offers blackberry flavors and young acidity. It is developing balance, fresh fruits and supporting tannins. The structure is integrating into the fruit, which will dominate if you wait to drink until 2017. The blend is 70% Merlot and 30% Cabernet Sauvignon.
title: VIgnobles Roux 2014 Château La Fôret  (Bordeaux Supérieur)

description: The firm tannins of Saint-Estèphe are strongly in evidence in this wine that is dry, dense and only hinting at fruit. While there is some juicy acidity, it also has a bitter character that needs some time to soften. It will probably always be on the dry, structured side. Drink from 2019.
title: Château Clauzet 2013  Saint-Estèphe
