description: 87—89 Barrel sample. Even lesser Pomerol estates did well in 2006. The concentrated fruit of this wine is all about ripe Merlot, and the acidity gives a burst of life.
title: Château Bellegrave 2006 Barrel sample  (Pomerol)

description: 87—89 Barrel sample. Soft fruit, followed by high acids, and a layer of dry tannins. This is a tense, dark wine, very dry, dominated by blackcurrant and bitter cherry flavors.
title: Château Bouscaut 2006 Barrel sample  (Pessac-Léognan)

description: 87—89 Barrel sample. This is about acidity. The wine is fresh, with its sweetness layered around the fresh white pears and citrus acidity.
title: Château Bastor-Lamontagne 2006 Barrel sample  (Sauternes)

description: 87—89 Barrel sample. In the herbaceous style, this wine is all about crisp grapefruit and lime. There's a stucture there, but it is lost in the crisp fruit.
title: Château Haut-Bergey 2006 Barrel sample  (Pessac-Léognan)

description: 87-89 Barrel sample. Firm, ripe, densely structured, giving what is almost a meal in itself. The texture is dry, also rich, powerful.
title: Château d'Arche 2008 Barrel Sample  (Sauternes)

description: 87-89 Barrel sample. Ripe fruit certainly, but over a structure which is much more mineral and dark. Maybe without the power of some of the year's wines, but it will show well in a more delicate style.
title: Château Franc Mayne 2008 Barrel sample  (Saint-Émilion)

description: 87-89 Barrel sample. Initially closed, the wine is tight, mineral, with tannins that are hard and dense. The fruit is perhaps too light for all this weight of structure.
title: Château Monbrison 2008 Barrel sample  (Margaux)

description: 87-89 Barrel sample. Smooth and chocolatey, the textures are extreme velvet. The fruit is ripe, very forward, easy and soft.
title: Le Petit Mouton de Mouton-Rothschild 2008 Barrel sample  (Pauillac)

description: Crisply fruity, herbaceous and citric, with lemon zest and fine pineapple. The wine's acidity should soften in a year.
title: Château Tanesse 2010  Bordeaux Blanc

description: A black currant-dominated wine, with a stalky, herbal series of flavors along with a positive juicy, fruit-forward character. The tannins are firmly dry with some smoky spice at the end.
title: Domaines Barons de Rothschild (Lafite) 2010 Réserve Spéciale  (Bordeaux)

description: A fine, totally sweet-fruited burst of Merlot that brings together fine structure with the beginnings of mature texture. There is a layer of vanilla, a warmly polished feel with glowing berries and sweet spice. Delicious and certainly ready to drink.
title: D & R Dubois 2000 P du Roy  (Saint-Émilion)

description: A generous wine, but one with good backbone and structure. The black fruits are beginning to meld into the sweet tannins and flavors of black cherry compote and spices. It is approaching maturity, but could age another 2–3 years.
title: D & R Dubois 2005 Arthus  (Côtes de Castillon)

description: A full, liquorous wine, with ripe mango and apricot flavors set against a backdrop of honey, dry botrytis and dense texture. The wine is now ready and maturing well. Drink over the next year.
title: Barton & Guestier 2005 Thomas Barton Réserve  (Sauternes)

description: A serious, intense wine, a success for the vintage, with its dusty tannins, solid blackberry fruits and a firm core. The wine is weighty, maybe just giving a green pepper hint, but generally sitting foursquare in the mouth.
title: Château Anthonic 2007  Moulis-en-Médoc

description: A densely textured wine, but one with the weight of fruit to sustain the dry core. It is sold, chunky, pulling black berry fruits and plum skins into a good mélange of flavors. It will soften, but will always remain on the firm side. Age for 3–4 years.
title: Château Coufran 2007  Haut-Médoc

description: 91–93. Barrel sample. A dark wine with rich, fruity blackberry flavors. It's very juicy in character with an opulent, soft texture, reflecting the ripeness of the grapes this vintage.
title: Château Angélus 2012 Carillon d'Angélus Barrel Sample  (Saint-Émilion)

description: 91–93. Barrel sample. This is a very dense wine, balancing ripe fruits with dark tannins and solid structure. A powerful and ripe wine, it's still a bit firm and dense, but certainly has great aging potential.
title: Château la Gaffelière 2012 Barrel Sample  (Saint-Émilion)

description: 91–93. Barrel sample. A ripe and juicy wine that is very fruity, open and opulent. It's generous with a soft character, yet packed with jammy, Merlot-derived characteristics.
title: Château Rol Valentin 2012 Barrel Sample  (Saint-Émilion)

description: 91–93. Barrel sample. While initially tough and almost too extracted, this firm, dark wine has intense density and spice from new wood. As it opens on the palate, slowly hints of juicy black-currant fruit and acidity comes through.
title: Château Troplong Mondot 2012 Barrel Sample  (Saint-Émilion)

description: 91–93. Barrel sample. This spicy wine, aged in new wood, is rich and full with blackberry flavors. It's opulent in texture with layers of new oak that reverberate through the wine.
title: Château Grand Mayne 2012 Barrel Sample  (Saint-Émilion)

description: 91–93. Barrel sample. This is a rich, ripe wine with soft tannins and a generous texture. The dry core gives a sense of shape to all the opulence on the palate.
title: Château La Bon Pasteur 2012 Barrel Sample  (Pomerol)

description: 91–93. Barrel sample. A finely tannic wine, this is the second vintage release since Château Haut-Brion's owner took over and renamed the estate. The wine is darkly textured, very firm and concentrated with great Merlot character. The finish reveals delicious blackberry flavors.
title: Château Quintus 2012 Barrel Sample  (Saint-Émilion)

description: 90–92. Barrel sample. Powerful and fruity, this finely situated chateau on the edge of the slopes of Saint-Émilion has produced a brightly fruity wine typical of the year. It's a wine that's ripe with berries, soft tannins and great juiciness.
title: Château Berliquet 2012 Barrel Sample  (Saint-Émilion)

description: 90–92. Barrel sample. This firmly tannic wine is solid and potentially quite complex. The structure is paramount, exhibiting substantial weight, while still hinting at the juicy fruity acidity on the finish.
title: Château Clinet 2012 Barrel Sample  (Pomerol)

description: Ripe and fruity, this is a wine made for drinking soon. It has ripe black-plum fruit, structured tannins and a juicy and smoky character that is already delicious.
title: Château de Nardon 2011  Bordeaux Supérieur

description: This rich, wood-laden wine is balanced by ripe red plum and blackberry fruit. It is a solid effort, its ripe fruit laced with attractive, fresh acidity. Generous and dense.
title: Château le Piat 2011  Côtes de Bourg

description: While this wine is still dense and tannic, it also has great layers of blackberry and black plum fruits that give richness. So although it is structured, it is also full and ripe, hinting at a delicious, generous future. Drink from 2018.
title: Château de Belcier 2012 Le Pin de Belcier  (Castillon Côtes de Bordeaux)

description: This is a solid wine, with complex tannins that sit over the ripe plum and berry-fruit tones. It is balanced, yet still young showing the wood aging as well as considerable juicy acidity. This wine, with its structure, needs to age. Drink from 2018.
title: Château Lestage Simon 2012  Haut-Médoc

description: This wine is all about fresh fruit and refreshing acidity. Crisp citrus, green apples and a touch of apricot give a fruitiness contained with a steel and mineral texture. It is full of acidity while keeping a riper, fruity character. Drink from late 2015.
title: Château de Marsan 2014  Bordeaux Blanc

description: Soft and fruity, with tobacco and smoke aromas, and fresh, vibrant red fruits, topped with fruit tannins and fresh acidity. There's the possibility of aging for 2–3 years.
title: Château la Bretonnière 2005  Premieres Côtes de Blaye

description: A fresh, soft, citrus-flavored wine with freshness that comes from the green pear and lemon sharpness. Touches of wood round out a delicious, easy wine.
title: Pezat 2006  Bordeaux Blanc

description: There's good density here. This wine shows plenty of ripe Merlot fruit flavors, jammy, lifted with dried fruits and blackberries. It's a rounded, ripe wine, but shot through with a curious, unbalanced, very dry wood element.
title: Baron Philippe de Rothschild 2005 Mouton Cadet Réserve  (Saint-Émilion)

description: Juicy cherry fruit flavors with some fine tannins, pepper, spice and dry wood edges. This is a friendly, easy Bordeaux with plenty of fruit.
title: Pezat 2005  Bordeaux Supérieur

description: A big, fruity bold wine, packed with the ripest fruit, concentrated and complex, with room for tight acidity. It has citrus and green plum crispness, and needs time to fully integrate with the wood and ripe yellow fruits.
title: Château Haut-Peyrous 2008 Pêche au Carrelet  (Graves)

description: This is a dry and firm wine, with hints of sweet-tasting fruits that peep through its dense structure. It shows great power and concentration, with an obvious long-term future.
title: Château Certan 2009  Pomerol

description: Here's a rich wine that is developing slowly and surely. It holds back on the botrytis character, with a bitter orange note that gives a dry edge to the wine's sweetness. The finish shows acidity and a taut line of citrus.
title: Château de Myrat 2009  Barsac

description: Currently closed, this has the weight and the richness of its vintage. Given 5–6 years, its sweet- and soft-tasting fruit flavors with cut through the firm tannins.
title: Château des Laudes 2009  Saint-Émilion

description: There is no mistaking the firm tannins of Saint-Estèphe in this wine. At the same time, these tannins are balanced with the generous ripe flavor of black fruit and almost-sweet acidity. The property was  created by Joseph Laffitte in 1759, right in the center of the Saint-Estèphe plateau.
title: Château Laffitte Carcasset 2010  Saint-Estèphe

description: Very opulent in style, this wine is ripe, full bodied and typical of 2009. It is rich and rounded, melding new wood tones and sweet black fruits into a delicious, age-worthy selection.
title: Château Violette 2009  Pomerol

description: Strong new-wood aromas lead to a palate that is layered with firm tannins, a polished toast character and a sufficient ripe blackberry flavor to balance. This 2010 bottling shows that this is a chateau to watch.
title: Château Bernadotte 2010  Haut-Médoc

description: Château Brown continues its impressive push to quality with this fine 2010. It brings demonstrates the structure of the year with its firm, youthful tannins. But it also shows plentiful black-currant flavor, layered with acidity. Classic and serious, this is a wine for aging.
title: Château Brown 2010  Pessac-Léognan

description: A great success for this southern Médoc chateau, this is fine, elegant and perfumed. It bursts with a black fruit flavor, balanced by smooth tannins and acidity. It's a wine for medium-term aging over the next six years.
title: Château Cantemerle 2010  Haut-Médoc

description: Warm and fruity, this has the right amount of wood and sweetly ripe blackberry flavor. It is certainly structured, but the generous texture balances it, making it likely to age into a full, ripe character. Drink in 4–5 years.
title: Château Fonréaud 2010  Listrac-Médoc

description: This is ripe and dense, with great tannins; opulent, rich black fruit; and a fresh, juicy aftertaste. The structure and the solid texture both point to long-term aging.
title: Château d'Hanteillan 2010  Haut-Médoc

description: Listrac's naturally tannic character has benefited from the structure-driven 2010 vintage. Château Lestage shows this well, bearing powerful, complex tannins that are powered equally by the ripe blackberry flavor and fruity acidity. It has just the right build for medium-term aging.
title: Château Lestage 2010  Listrac-Médoc

description: The best wine from Phélan Ségur for several years, this shows less of the often-intrusive new wood and more of the fruit that had been missing in past vintages. It shows a subtle level of toast and a black currant flavor, plus great acidity and freshness on the finish.
title: Château Phélan-Ségur 2010  Saint-Estèphe

description: After a low period, Siran has come back in 2010 with this solid, tannic, firm and serious wine. There is plenty of blackberry flavor to flesh out the structure, resulting in a wine for medium-term aging.
title: Château Siran 2010  Margaux

description: Young and fruity, this is an attractive red- and black-currant-flavored wine. Its youthful stalky character will soften quickly to highlight the fruit. Drink from late 2016.
title: Les Vignerons Réunis de Monségur 2014 Château Grand Billard  (Bordeaux)

description: Produced by the Cazes family of Château Lynch-Bages and Michel Lynch, this wine delivers quite a success from a difficult vintage. It is fresh and with plenty of acidity, balanced by the rounded red fruits and soft tannins. The wine is ready to drink.
title: Kirkland Signature 2013  Médoc

description: Generously ripe and creamy, it has layers of wood giving way to a beautiful, smooth texture. It's dense and complex, although a crisper citrus element gives a fresher side to this broad, rich wine. Drink from 2016.
title: Château Haut-Bergey 2012  Pessac-Léognan

description: This bold, fruity wine is all red berries and ripe cherry flavors. It has good juiciness, soft tannins and it will be ready to drink soon. A bright wine, with great acidity at the end.
title: Château de Lisennes 2011 Cuvée Tradition  (Bordeaux Supérieur)

description: A strongly wood-aged wine, firm, spicy and with a burnt edge. Chocolate and black plum-skin fruit combine in this strongly tannic wine. There is, though, a smooth element from the ripe Merlot in the blend, giving potential richness in 2–3 years.
title: Château de Parenchère 2011 Cuvée Raphaël  (Bordeaux Supérieur)

description: Big, rich and bold, this is a finely concentrated wine that's marked by the freshness of the year. It's likely to develop quickly and be ready next year.
title: Château Haut Bages Libéral 2011 Haut-Médoc de Haut Bages Libéral  (Haut-Médoc)

description: Rich and fruity, this wine shows black currant fruit along with a firm, dry and tannic core. This youthful balance is finished with a polish of new wood and fine acidity.
title: Château Lacombe Noaillac 2011  Médoc

description: Dating to the Middle Ages, this estate has produced a Merlot-dominated wine packed with dark tannins and a dusty texture that is becoming more elegant as it ages. The wine is still young and full of its concentrated structure. Drink from 2020.
title: Château Ambe Tour Pourret 2012  Saint-Émilion

description: André Lurton bought de Rochemorin in 1973, an estate with vines since the 16th century. This is an aromatic wine, perfumed with blackberry tones. It has plenty of fresh fruit, soft tannins and ample acidity. The structure plays a supporting role—dry while also showing some richness. Drink from 2019.
title: Château de Rochemorin 2013  Pessac-Léognan

description: This wine has a juicy, fruity character that comes from the 60% of Cabernets in the blend. It is just touched by wood and, like a true Bordeaux second wine, it is showing plenty of perfumed fruitiness already. With fresh acidity and a bright character, the wine will be ready to drink from 2018.
title: Château Figeac 2013 Petit Figeac  (Saint-Émilion)

description: With its layers of wood, the wine has weight. Herbaceous characters are mixed with ripe pear flavors. There is a good, tight final texture.
title: Barton & Guestier 2010 Thomas Barton Réserve  (Graves)

description: A crisp, clean, fruity wine, tangy and lemony. This is a really attractive wine, a classic of its kind. Screwcap.
title: Château Bonnet 2008  Bordeaux Blanc

description: The second wine from the Saint-Julien estate, this is every bit as elegant as the grand vin, its black currant fruit developing to envelop the fine tannins. There is fine fruit, plenty of acidity and a rich texture. It needs time, so drink from 2020.
title: Château Beychevelle 2015 L'Amiral de Beychevelle  (Saint-Julien)

description: A mineral texture gives this ripe wine an edge while its full, red berry fruit offers some solid tannins and concentration. It's smoky and full-bodied and will be ready to drink from 2019.
title: Château Joanin Bécot 2015  Castillon Côtes de Bordeaux

description: Maturity comes slowly to a Sauternes, but this wine is almost there. Its fine sweetness is balanced by a lemon curd-like acidity while its rich botrytis is finely integrated with the opulent texture. Drink now.
title: Château Simon 2010 Cuvée Exceptionelle  (Sauternes)

description: Rich and dense, this generous wine has considerable botrytis as well as perfumed apricot and bitter orange flavors. It's ripe and full of fruit and honey. Drink from 2020.
title: Clos Haut-Peyraguey 2014 Symphonie  (Sauternes)

description: The second label of classed growth Château Chauvin, this wine is structured yet bears all the fruit that is characteristic of the vintage. Finely balanced, its acidity and black fruit flavors work together to create a wine that needs to age further. Best from 2020.
title: Château Chauvin 2014 Folie de Chauvin  (Saint-Émilion)

description: This ripe, juicy wine is already attractive and perfumed. Its tannins and wood-aging flavors give weight to its fruit. Spicy and full of black cherry and berry flavors, it's bold and will be ready to drink from 2019.
title: Château Cône-Taillasson Sabourin 2015  Blaye Côtes de Bordeaux

description: The wine has bold tannins, generous fruit and an excellent future. With its concentration and density, it needs time to soften. For now, the black fruit flavors are developing well, balanced with acidity and ripe tannins. Drink from 2021.
title: Château de Birot 2015 Vintage  (Cadillac Côtes de Bordeaux)

description: Ripe and structured, this wood-aged wine is still developing. It has a dark structure, dense blackberry fruit and powerful concentration. A peppery touch of alcohol gives it a bitter finish, which should dissipate as it ages. Drink from 2022
title: Château des Landes 2015 Cuvée Prestige  (Lussac Saint-Émilion)

description: This is a ripe, smoky wine with fine tannins and rich black fruit. Dense with black chocolate and damson flavors, it gives concentration and richness and will age well. Drink from 2020.
title: Château La Rame 2015 La Charmille  (Cadillac Côtes de Bordeaux)

description: Initially firmly tannic, this opens to reveal fine blackberry fruit and fresh acidity. It's a generous wine, the wood aging giving tannins and spice while the delicious fruit offers a rounder, smoother side. Drink from 2020.
title: Château Les Grands Maréchaux 2015  Blaye Côtes de Bordeaux

description: This juicy, fruity wine has a great backup of tannins. It has a smoky character, along with black currant fruit, lending an attractive balance. That fruit that will develop well. Drink from 2020.
title: Château L'Escadre 2015 Grande Réserve  (Blaye Côtes de Bordeaux)

description: Ripe and soft, this is a smooth, dense wine. Yes, it has plenty of tannins, but they're smothered by the concentrated black fruit that gives it its generous, rich character. It's likely to age well, so drink from 2020.
title: Château Moulin de Guiet 2015  Côtes de Bourg

description: The wine balances acidity and full fruitiness. These show in the lively, fresh character as well as the rich apple and pear flavors. The end shows more youthful texture, offering the chance to hold this wine until 2015.
title: Producta Vignobles 2013 Mission St Vincent  (Bordeaux Blanc)

description: While this shows its youthful tannins, it also bears blackberry fruit and juicy acidity. The chateau has produced a stylish wine that's rich while still keeping plenty of freshness and acidity. Age for 3–4 years.
title: Château Maison Blanche 2010  Médoc

description: This wine has a smoky character and a subtle touch of wood, along with firm tannins and red fruits. Age this for 1–2 years.
title: Les Parcelles de Stéphane Derenoncourt 2011  Blaye Côtes de Bordeaux

description: Swathes of ripe fruit dominate this full wine that verges on being too alcoholic. While the acidity gives it freshness and the perfumed Cabernet Franc in the blend lends lift, the wine seems weighed down by its own richness.
title: Château Lanbersac 2010  Puisseguin Saint-Émilion

description: Produced by the major négociant Castel, this juicy, fruity wine is proving to be drinkable already. Soft, with a black currant flavor, it has fine acids and spicy, toasty touches on the finish.
title: Château Tour Prignac 2010  Médoc

description: Big, fruity and juicy, this is a wine for drinking soon. It has lively acidity, a strong black-currant fruit character and light tannins. Already well integrated, it's a wine that accentuates freshness.
title: Château Cantinot 2011  Blaye Côtes de Bordeaux

description: Tight and herbaceous, this is a very Sauvignon-oriented wine. It has the classic, intensely grassy feel, a tangy lemon texture and green acidity. It is very intense and concentrated.
title: Château Gréteau Médeville 2012  Bordeaux Blanc

description: Ripe and full in the mouth, this is a forward, fruity wine. It has fragrant tobacco and spice notes followed by flavors of luscious blackberries. Softly tannic in structure, it will age, so drink now and until 2019.
title: Château l'Escart 2011 Cuvée Eden  (Bordeaux Supérieur)

description: Very fruity and fragrant, this is an attractive wine that shows potential. It has good acidity, firm tannins and fresh black-currant flavor. Drink this wine after two more years.
title: Château Saint-Sulpice 2011  Bordeaux

description: With great green plum, gooseberry and pink grapefruit flavors, this is a delicious fruit salad of a wine. It has lively acidity, a bright texture and an attractive tangy feel. It's ready for drinking now.
title: Maison Sichel 2012 Les Hauts de Bel-Air  (Bordeaux Blanc)

description: With 40% new wood aging, this is a polished wine. Along with its smooth texture and juicy black fruits, it has a core of dry smoky tannins. The 53% Cabernet Sauvignon in the blend gives a fine fruity, black-currant aftertaste. Drink from 2020.
title: Château Vieux Robin 2014  Médoc

description: This wine is bone dry, very crisp and fruity. It presents a bright and lively character plus orange peel tang. The acidity at the end is very fresh, with just a touch of caramel.
title: Château de l'Aubrade 2014 Rosé (Bordeaux Rosé)

description: Very fruity, this is a crisp, lemon-scented and flavored wine, with grassy, herbaceous character from the green Sauvignon Blanc in the blend. The aftertaste is tight with some bitterness.
title: Château de Parenchère 2014  Bordeaux Blanc

description: Touches of red fruits give this soft and creamy wine attractive acidity. Pepper and spice lead to a bitter aftertaste.
title: Château de Piote 2010 Perles Rosé  (Crémant de Bordeaux)

description: A bold pink color suggests the richness of this vanilla-flavored wine that misses out on a truly refreshing character. It is full and soft, with a touch of bitter acidity at the end.
title: Château des Antonins 2014 Rosé (Bordeaux Rosé)

description: Pure fruitiness, this wine is full of black currant flavors and a stalky, dusty texture. Without wood aging, it has acidity, fruitiness and some dry tannins. Drink from the end of 2015.
title: Château Haut Vieux Chêne 2014  Bordeaux

description: Still dominated by wood and toast aromas, this wine is certainly too young to drink. The wood needs to smooth out and allow room for the fruit. It will age, with its fresh fruits and acidity, so drink from 2017.
title: Château Jean de Bel Air 2014  Bordeaux

description: This caramel-flavored, lightly pink wine is soft and full in the mouth, with a light touch of tannin in the background. Drink now.
title: Château Maison Noble 2014 Rosé (Bordeaux Rosé)

description: Deep pink in color, this gently fruity wine has too much caramel flavor. It offers red currant fruit at the end and attractive acidity.
title: Château Ramage la Batisse 2014 La Rosée de Ramage Rosé (Bordeaux Rosé)

description: Light, ripe and fruity, this wine is bursting with black currant fruits supported by a firm base of dry fruit tannins. It can be drunk now in its youth, but will be better from 2016.
title: Château Grand Jean 2014  Bordeaux

description: There is a rosé here struggling to get out. This wine has strawberry fruits combined with tannins in a way that does not work. Bordeaux Clairet lies between rosé and red in color and in taste.
title: Château de Marsan 2014  Bordeaux Clairet

description: This is a soft wine, fruity without great definition. A ripe, red fruit character contrasts with a bitter acidity. It is ready to drink. The blend is 50/50 Merlot and Cabernet Sauvignon.
title: Château Taussin 2014 Rosé (Bordeaux Rosé)

description: This is a fresh but also full and rich wine with ripe pear and raspberry fruits. The wine is balanced and ready to drink.
title: Château Fonfroide 2015 Rosé (Bordeaux Rosé)

description: 93-95 Barrel sample. With an higher proportion of Merlot than is usual even at Palmer, this wine, goes for lovely fresh, soft fruits. There is a touch of spice, juicy red berries, finally getting to a depth of dusty, chewy tannins.
title: Château Palmer 2008 Barrel sample  (Margaux)

description: 93-95 Barrel sample. A small property on one of the best sites in Saint-Emilion, newly released under its own name. It is powerful, dense compact, with dark tannins, an impressive richness. It is full, firm and solid.
title: Vieux Château Mazerat 2008 Barrel sample  (Saint-Émilion)

description: 93—95 Barrel sample. A very intense, ripe wine, packed with botrytis. It has great ripe flavors, plenty of apricots and dense, full fruit. At the top.
title: Château la Tour Blanche 2006 Barrel sample  (Sauternes)

description: 93—95 Barrel sample. What a fine wine, elegant, structured, impressively balanced, full of spice, blackcurrants, vibrant acidity. A great year at Trotanoy.
title: Château Trotanoy 2006 Barrel sample  (Pomerol)

description: 92-94 Barrel sample. A solid, wood and fruit balanced wine, foursquare and chunky. It has a firm backbone of tannins, and the dark plum and fig fruits match well with final lift of acidity.
title: Château Giscours 2008 Barrel sample  (Margaux)

description: This rounded wine is dense, with firm tannins that are well molded into its sweet-tasting structure. Packed with ripe fruit, this will age relatively quickly, giving pleasure in 5–6 years.
title: Château Rouget 2009  Pomerol

description: This firmly tannic wine, characteristic of Saint-Estèphe, is very dry. Underneath the dryness, there is a delicious, opulent juiciness that brings out black currant and plum flavors. It's obviously a wine for the long haul; keep for at least six years.
title: Château Sérilhan 2010  Saint-Estèphe

description: Ripe and fruity, this has ripe tannin and rich red-berry flavors. It has a solid, firm background of dark tannins that promise good aging.
title: Clos l'Eglise 2009  Pomerol

description: This is an impressive, concentrated wine that gives pride of place to the ripe berry flavors and the balancing acidity. Underneath, the tannins are built up, showing that the wine will age. With its weight and depth, this needs to be aged the tannins to fully soften.
title: Château Hourtin-Ducasse 2010  Haut-Médoc

description: This is weighty, closed, dark and dense, and the tannins dominate. For the time being, the ripe, juicy fruits are overwhelmed by the firm structure. This needs time.
title: Château la Bienfaisance 2009  Saint-Émilion

description: Wood-driven tannins dominate at this stage, creating a wine that is structured and dense. The tannins are layered with the weight of the black currant and plum fruits. Lascombes is still finding its style, but is definitely on the upward slope.
title: Château Lascombes 2010  Margaux

description: This big, concentrated effort is currently closed, but it's already hinting at ripe black fruits, solid tannins and a long future. On the finish, acidity and a black currant note give the wine a final lift. Keep this for at least five years.
title: Château Paloumey 2010  Haut-Médoc

description: A firm, dry textured wine, with tannins that are now losing more fruity character. It needs at least an hour in a decanter to show its more balanced nature. Ready to drink.
title: Château Plaisance 2006  Bordeaux Supérieur

description: As its 14.5% indicates, this is a particularly rich wine. Maybe too rich, because it is all superripe black fruit without the balance of structure or acidity. Enjoy it as a blockbuster, probably not with food.
title: Château Cadillac 2009 Cuvée J.J. Lesgourges  (Bordeaux Supérieur)

description: A firmly tannic wine packed with both toast and blackberry fruits. It needs to soften to bring out the ripe fruitiness and jammy texture. Drink from 2015.
title: Grand Bourgeau 2012  Côtes de Bourg

description: This is tight, crisp and herbaceous, dominated by Sauvignon Blanc. A mineral character gives a firm texture. It needs to age a few months, so drink from 2015.
title: Maison Malet Roquefort 2013 Léo de la Gaffelière  (Bordeaux Blanc)

description: This Cabernet-dominated wine is elegant, structured with plenty of black currant and berry fruits that give a fresher element. With firm tannins that need to soften, it will age. Drink from 2016.
title: Monfort-Bellevue 2011  Médoc

description: Fresh and lightly fruity, it's crisp and fragrant. With great acidity and a touch of herbaceousness, it's ready to drink.
title: Château du Cros 2013  Bordeaux Blanc

description: A big, ripe and jammy wine made from old vines. There are black plum fruits but the wine is dominated by licorice, black coffee and wood. It is powerful and very solid. Drink from 2017.
title: Château des Landes 2010 Cuvée Prestige  (Lussac Saint-Émilion)

description: The earthy intensity of herbaceous Sauvignon leaps out of the glass, giving a wine that's concentrated with citrus and green herbs. It's crisp at the end, with a hint of thyme that gives a peppery aftertaste.
title: Château Timberlay 2013  Bordeaux Blanc

description: Fresh, light and fruity, it has ripe strawberry flavors, bright acidity and just a touch of caramel. It is full in the mouth, with a rounded feel and a soft texture at the end.
title: Château Tour de Guiet 2013 Rosé de Guiet Rosé (Bordeaux Rosé)

description: A continuing success story for the white from Château Margaux, this crisply herbaceous wine delivers impressive depths of flavor and texture. Lemon and apple dominate the fruitiness, with a touch of honey to contrast with the crisp acidity. Drink from 2017.
title: Château Margaux 2012 Pavillon Blanc de Château Margaux  (Bordeaux Blanc)

description: Very structured and packed with tannins, this has the weight to balance those qualities, promising layers of black fruits as it develops. There's a mineral character here, the tannins in suspension. The aftertaste brings out delicious, lightly salty acidity. Drink from 2018.
title: Les Astéries 2012  Saint-Émilion

description: The small parcel of vines that makes up Providence has proven to be a stunning piece of Pomerol. This wine is all richness and structure, with a solid density and black plum fruits cut with acidity. It's generous, full in the mouth, solid with tannins at the back and opulent with fruit at the front. Drink from 2022.
title: Château Providence 2012  Pomerol

description: One of the wines that showed great promise in 2012, this is deliciously rich, with all the elegance of Margaux and that extra firm tannic background. Blackberry and juicy red fruits balance well with the structure. Drink from 2019.
title: Château Marquis de Terme 2012  Margaux

description: A dark-colored wine, this is layered with a wood note that shows strongly along with the mint flavor. Rich, well structured and concentrated, this has black jelly fruit, and is meant for drinking in two years.
title: Château de Cornemps 2010 Cuvée Prestige  (Bordeaux Supérieur)

description: Perfumed wood and black fruit aromas lead the way in this delicious wine. It's rich but still firm, with fine juicy fruit that will come through with time. Packed with tannins, it will be ready to drink from 2021.
title: Château Picoron 2015  Castillon Côtes de Bordeaux

description: This rich wine is already smoothly textured yet still has fine tannins that give aging potential. With its black fruit and acidity, it's ripe, smoky and likely to be very drinkable from 2020.
title: Château Suau 2015  Cadillac Côtes de Bordeaux

description: Full of the bright fruit typical of the vintage, this wine is made from 90% Merlot with a touch of Cabernet Franc. It's structured with still-young tannins and is dominated by red berry fruit, needing to age until 2021.
title: Château Tour Grand Faurie 2014  Saint-Émilion

description: This attractive, juicy wine is full of red fruit. It has strawberry and crisp red currant flavors as well as fine acidity. The result is a wine with good balance, richness, spice and tannins. Drink from 2019.
title: Clos Puy Arnaud 2015 Cuvée Les Ormeaux  (Castillon Côtes de Bordeaux)

description: Soft and ripe, this is an easy, fruity wine. It has red berries, gentle tannins and attractive acidity. It is just as enjoyable as an apéritif as with food and ready to drink now.
title: Château Cru de Verdun 2009  Médoc

description: Attractively balanced wine, its apple and pear acidity giving a very fruity character. There is a burst of lemon zest for extreme freshness with some grassy herbal character right at the end.
title: Château Julian 2010  Bordeaux Blanc

description: A Bordeaux saved from its high alcohol by its acidity. There is power and superripe fruit yet parallel to these is the black currant acidity that cuts right through. Age for 1–2 years.
title: Château Saint-Michel 2010  Bordeaux Supérieur

description: A soft wine, with some light wood aging while the fruit gives black currant stalkiness, dry tannins and fresh, juicy, smoky acidity. The wine needs no aging, but could develop for 2–3 years.
title: Domaines Lapalu 2010 Famille Lapalu  (Médoc)

description: Spicy wood thrusts this wine forward. It does have enough weight of blackberry fruit to compensate.
title: Domaines Lapalu 2010 La Patache  (Médoc)

description: With 83% Sémillon in the blend, this wine has weight as well as richness. At the same time, it has a crisp edge, a smoky character from wood aging and the fine balance between citrus and more exotic fruits. It is a wine to age for many years. Drink from 2022.
title: Château La Mission Haut-Brion 2014  Pessac-Léognan

description: This is a major wine. It has enormous tension, structure and a core of dark tannins. Amid all this, the wine is also packed with fruit and concentrated blackberry and black-plum flavors. It will age slowly and steadily with its enormous structure and concentration. Drink this wine from 2027.
title: Château Lafite Rothschild 2014  Pauillac

description: Effectively half-and-half Merlot and Cabernet Franc, this is a tremendous wine. With very fine tannins, spice from a touch of wood and swathes of ripe fruits give this wine its concentration and its huge potential. The wine has weight and a dark, dense structure that will allow it to age for many years. Drink from 2027.
title: Château Angélus 2014  Saint-Émilion

description: With seriously dense tannins, this shows great structure. Rich and full of ripe fruit, it also has a fresh streak that gives it a lift. The structure will allow the wine to age over many years while the fruit and acidity will give it crispness. Drink this impressive wine from 2027.
title: Château Haut-Brion 2014  Pessac-Léognan

description: This is a great wine. It has all the elements in place to produce a wine that will last for years: powerful fruit, rich tannins and a structure that is built to last. This is elegant, impressive and concentrated. Almost entirely Cabernet Sauvignon, the grape gives the wine its fruit and its tannins. Drink from 2028.
title: Château Léoville Las Cases 2014  Saint-Julien

description: This powerful wine has a superb mix of the crispest fruit and great structure. Blackberries and black currants shine through the tannins, expressing the liveliness of the vintage. It is so well delineated with everything in its place. The wine is certainly going to age for decades. Drink from 2027.
title: Château Ducru Beaucaillou 2014  Saint-Julien

description: The label of this vintage is designed by David Hockney in memory of Philippine de Rothschild. It is a powerful wine in the rich style of Mouton with strong black-currant fruits from 81% Cabernet Sauvignon. It is dense and dark, ready to age for many years. Drink this impressive wine from 2026.
title: Château Mouton Rothschild 2014  Pauillac

description: The wine is a velvet glove in an iron fist. The smooth surface of ripe fruits and rich blackberry flavors, masks the dense tannins that will allow this very great wine to age for many, many years. The acidity and the rich fruit combine with the fine dusty tannins. The wine will surely not be ready to drink before 2027.
title: Château Pétrus 2014  Pomerol

description: This is a powerful wine, made to age for a long time, from this estate which is performing in top gear. Complex tannins and dark fruits both make their presence felt. It has weight, ripeness and a dense structure. A great success, it is unlikely to be ready to drink before 2027.
title: Château Smith Haut Lafitte 2014  Pessac-Léognan

description: With its high proportion of Cabernet Franc (45%), this is a finely perfumed rich wine. It has great tannins, a smoky character that comes from the wood. The tannins are quite marked, giving a tight firm edge to the wine that otherwise has generous fruitiness. This is a complex wine, impressive, and likely to age over many years. Drink from 2028.
title: Château Cheval Blanc 2014  Saint-Émilion

description: A tightly coiled rich wine that has great acidity as well as a lively structure. Touched by spice from wood aging as well as intense citrus, it is fruity, firm and strongly textured. Drink this impressive still-young wine from 2022.
title: Château Malartic-Lagravière 2014  Pessac-Léognan

description: This is a finely structured wine with dark tannins and intense black fruits. The estate, with its biodynamically grown fruit, has given an impressively pure wine, packed with tight serious tannins and a fine structure of black-plum skins and intense acidity. It is direct, firm and with a huge potential over many years. Drink from 2027.
title: Château Pontet-Canet 2014  Pauillac

description: With the amalgamation of Château Magdelaine into this one property, the estate is now a considerable 58 acres. The wine is now performing in top gear. Powerful tannins drive the mainly Merlot blend with 10% Cabernet Franc. It still shows signs of the wood aging and these will disappear to leave a richly endowed wine with a fine future. Drink from 2026.
title: Château Bélair-Monange 2014  Saint-Émilion

description: Here's an impressive wine that is so ripe and with great structure. It is a major wine with a dark complex texture and the finest acidity. The wine is very complete, all the elements in place from the black fruits to the tannins to the hints of wood aging. Now at the top of the tree in Saint-Emilion's classification, the wine will take years to mature. Drink from 2027.
title: Château Valandraud 2014  Saint-Émilion

description: This almost 100% Cabernet Franc single-vineyard wine is perfumed and ripe. The velvet tannins and ripe black fruits are fine, structured and with enormous potential. The wine is generous, opulent and worthy of serious aging. Drink from 2027.
title: Le Dôme 2014  Saint-Émilion

description: This second wine of Château de Belcier has a good texture, jammy ripe strawberry fruits and light tannins. A wine with acidity and a character, it will be ready to drink soon. Drink from mid-2016. MACIF, a mutual insurance company, bought the estate in the 1980s and restored the vineyards and château that was built by François de Belcier, a counter-revolutionary who was guillotined in 1794.
title: Château de Belcier 2013 Château de Monrecueil  (Castillon Côtes de Bordeaux)

description: Red currant and red berry fruits show strongly in this wine from Virginie Aubrion's biodynamic vineyards. The tannins are strong, although leaving space for the fruitiness. It needs to develop, with good acidity likely to come through. Drink from 2016.
title: Château de Piote 2013 Cuvée Prestige  (Bordeaux Supérieur)

description: Juicy black currant acidity dominates this light, bright wine that's 100% Merlot. It has a fresh feel and is structured with light tannins. Drink now.
title: Château de Seguin 2013 Cuvée Carpe Diem  (Bordeaux Supérieur)

description: There is a good balance between fruit and structure in this blend of 71% Merlot and 29% Cabernet Franc. It is not weighty, although it does offer attractive berry fruits and touches of red currants. Acidity is a powerful element in this wine that needs to soften. Drink from 2016.
title: Château Donjon de Bruignac 2013  Bordeaux

description: While the tannins here are dry, this wine has enough fruit to show its potential. Blackberry flavors are ripe, cut with acidity and a juicy texture. The wine needs time, so drink from 2017. Enologist Sebastien and vineyard manager Nicolas are the latest generation managing the Carreau family estates.
title: Château la Croix Saint-Pierre 2012 Grand Réserve  (Blaye Côtes de Bordeaux)

description: Juicy red berry fruits and bright acidity are the hallmarks of this wine, from an 80% Merlot and 20% Cabernet Franc blend. The tannic background is still there and does need to soften, so give the wine until 2017. This estate, one of six, has been in the Aubert family since before the French Revolution.
title: Château Labesse 2012  Castillon Côtes de Bordeaux

description: This wine is bright and fruity, with acidity and some fresh red berry fruits. The background tannins do have a dryness but will soften over the next few months. Drink from 2017. This property, east of Saint-Émilion, is run by Florent Dubard.
title: Château Nardou 2013 Bois Meyney du Château Nardou  (Côtes de Bordeaux)

description: This light, fruity and fragrant white has a strong herbaceous character that is recognizably Sauvignon Blanc. It is crisp, clean, fresh and ready to drink.
title: Château Nicot 2014  Entre-Deux-Mers

description: Crisp with bright fruit recalling sliced apples, this wine is fruity and fresh. Acidity cuts easily through it and lends an herbal edge. Drink now.
title: Château Barbé 2016  Blaye Côtes de Bordeaux

description: Smoky, toasty aromas set the scene for a wine that has obviously seen plenty of wood aging. At this stage, it's all spice and wood, which will probably inhibit its development. Wait until 2020.
title: Château Cailleteau Bergeron 2015 Tradition  (Blaye Côtes de Bordeaux)

description: This ripe organic wine has benefited from the fine 2016 vintage to give rich black fruit and plenty of firm tannins. At its heart are berry flavors and acidity. It will age well over the next few years. Drink from 2019.
title: Château de Lagarde 2016 Les Hauts de Lagarde  (Bordeaux)

description: This blend includes 70% Merlot and a small (2%) amount of Malbec. Ripe blackberry fruit dominates, but it also has structure. It's likely to develop quickly and be ready to drink from 2019.
title: Château Fleur de Plaisance 2015 Vieilles Vignes  (Blaye Côtes de Bordeaux)

description: This estate in the east of the Entre-deux-Mers region has produced a ripe white blend that balances its white fruit with a crisp herbal element. With acidity and a touch of spice, it's crisp and ready to drink.
title: Château Haut Peyruguet 2016  Bordeaux Blanc

description: This simple, fruity wine has both crisp, citrusy acidity and riper apricot and pear flavors. It's soft and finishes with attractive tangy acidity. Drink now.
title: Château Saint-Florian 2016  Bordeaux Blanc

description: Still very firm, this wine shows the tannic structure of the vintage. Because it's beginning to mature, it also shows it's not likely to open up much more. Big and hard to like.
title: Château Tour Grand Faurie 2011  Saint-Émilion

description: Big tannins dominate this still young wine. It has spice and a dry toast character that will need to soften. With acidity and hints of red fruits that should happen, so drink this wine from 2019 when its potential should be realized.
title: Château Les Hauts de Palette 2014  Cadillac Côtes de Bordeaux

description: A perfumed fruity wine, this has a light structure along with its forward red fruits. Acidity and juicy fruitiness complete this attractive, ready to drink wine.
title: Château l'Escadre 2014 Tradition  (Blaye Côtes de Bordeaux)

description: This is a ripe and perfumed wine from Vignobles Marcel Petit. It has good aging potential—full of tannins and also of bold black fruits. Structure and fruitiness are a good sign. Drink from 2019.
title: Château Pillebois 2014  Castillon Côtes de Bordeaux

description: This is a ripe toasty wine. With its red-berry fruits and acidity along with some dry, smoky tannins it is a wine in progress. Drink this concentrated wine from 2018.
title: Château Roc Meynard 2014  Bordeaux Supérieur

description: This is a firmly tannic wine although with ripe potential. It has a dense character that is good, allowing the fruit to develop. For now, it is dry so give that fruit plenty of time. Drink from 2019.
title: Château Tanesse 2014  Cadillac Côtes de Bordeaux

description: This is going to be a fine fruity wine once its firm tannins have calmed down. It has enough black-fruit flavors and acidity to ensure that it will be perfumed, ripe and fresh at the same time. Drink starting from 2017.
title: Château Tassin 2014  Bordeaux

description: This is a perfumed wine. Although the tannins are still firm from 14 months in new oak, it does have fine, fragrant red-fruit and acidity. The texture is dense, still young, and will be fine from 2019.
title: Château Tertre de Belves 2014  Castillon Côtes de Bordeaux

description: This is a ripe juicy wine with fine red fruits and acidity. The smoky tannins are a fine support to the berry flavors. It is developing well and should be ready to drink from 2017.
title: Légende 2014  Bordeaux

description: The Chartrons is the neighborhood of Bordeaux where the wine merchants traditionally worked. This branded Bordeaux is softly ripe, with an attractive density along with a dry core of tannins. Ready to drink now.
title: Maison Duhard 2009 Baron des Chartrons  (Bordeaux)

description: Darker in color than normal rosé, Bordeaux Clairet also has more richness. This wine is concentrated with vanilla and sweet strawberry flavors, although with a lack of freshness. Treat this as a red wine.
title: Château de Parenchère 2010 Rosé (Bordeaux Clairet)

description: 88–90. Barrel sample. Packed with dark tannins, this wine is concentrated and dry with considerable extraction, giving the palate a bitter coffee character. It could stay severe in style.
title: Château Rauzan-Gassies 2012 Barrel Sample  (Margaux)

description: 88–90. Barrel sample. Juicy and ripe, this wine has rich fruitiness without the balancing structure. It profits from ripe Merlot flavors in the blend, yielding a fruity wine that will develop fast.
title: Château Labégorce Margaux 2012 Barrel Sample  (Margaux)

description: 87–89. Barrel sample. Big, ripe and fruity, this wine has attractive acidity and a soft texture. The palate is full bodied with a lingering fruity aftertaste.
title: Château Siran 2012 Barrel Sample  (Margaux)

description: 87–89. Barrel sample. With firm tannins along with acidity and freshness, this is a lively, smoky wine, finishing with intense juicy acidity.
designation: La Chapelle de Potensac Barrel Sample
title: Château Potensac 2012 La Chapelle de Potensac Barrel Sample  (Médoc)

description: 87–89. Barrel sample. Spicy wood comes through strongly, giving this wine a bitterness that's contrasted with intense acidity and tart black-currant flavors.
title: Château Monbrison 2012 Barrel Sample  (Margaux)

description: 87–89. Barrel sample. This wine is solid and dark with bitter tannins that offer a hard edge to the riper blackberry fruits. A dense wine that has a very dry core.
title: Château Fourcas Dupré 2012 Barrel Sample  (Listrac-Médoc)

description: 86–88. Barrel sample. This is a very ripe wine, that's perhaps overripe in its soft, fruity character. It is very full in the mouth with gentle tannins.
title: Château Mongravey 2012 Barrel Sample  (Margaux)

description: 86–88. Barrel sample. A hard-edged wine, the palate is very dry, and without the fruit to support it. It has edgy wood tannins, and only a hint of juiciness.
title: Château la Tour de By 2012 Barrel Sample  (Médoc)

description: 96–98. Barrel sample. This powerful, impressive wine is comprised of 90% Cabernet Sauvignon. It's seriously structured, with loads of black currants and dark tannin, and revels on the finish with the juicy, fresh acidity of this vintage. A fine Mouton, this is the first vintage produced in the chateau's new cellar.
title: Château Mouton Rothschild 2012 Barrel Sample  (Pauillac)

description: 96–98. Barrel sample. This is a structured, ripe wine that also has a great sense of freshness—vibrant blackberry flavor and lively acidity. The finish retains the same delicious freshness and brightness of this vintage.
title: Château Pontet-Canet 2012 Barrel Sample  (Pauillac)

description: 95–97. Barrel sample. This is a very solid wine with tannins that are very firm and dense. There is power without excessive alcohol, lending a classic feel, and a pure line from fruit, acidity and tannin. The result is as much about fruit as structure.
title: Château Léoville Las Cases 2012 Barrel Sample  (Saint-Julien)

description: 95–97. Barrel sample. Full and powerfully concentrated, this wine has dense acidity, sweet black fruits and very fine tannins. The concentration is enormous but it expresses itself through the prism of smooth, velvet-textured tannins.
title: Château Lafite Rothschild 2012 Barrel Sample  (Pauillac)

description: 94–96. Barrel sample. Big and ripe, this is a powerful wine with 78% Cabernet Sauvignon, giving the wine a solid, dusty structure but also delicious fruit. Finishes with a touch of chocolate at the end.
title: Château Calon Ségur 2012 Barrel Sample  (Saint-Estèphe)

description: 94–96. Barrel sample. Big and rich with lots of chocolate and ripe black-plum fruits, this is a very structured wine, showing some extraction but also spice and sweet tannins. Powerful, but with a finish that is like a cool breeze.
title: Château Cos d'Estournel 2012 Barrel Sample  (Saint-Estèphe)

description: 94–96. Barrel sample. This is a glamorous wine with acidity and structure surrounded by a ripe fruit character. The palate is powerful, and already quite complex, with both great fruitiness and a solid feel.
title: Château Ducru Beaucaillou 2012 Barrel Sample  (Saint-Julien)

description: 94–96. Barrel sample. This is a big, powerful, fruity wine that has restraint from its dense tannins. It's foursquare, chunky in character, already balanced, the tannins merging with the acidity. There is great aging potential.
title: Château Montrose 2012 Barrel Sample  (Saint-Estèphe)

description: 94–96. Barrel sample. Firmly tannic in character, this wine is dry and extracted. There's potential for this powerful, impressive wine to bear the wine's very dry character with the weight of its fruit.
title: Château Léoville Barton 2012 Barrel Sample  (Saint-Julien)

description: 94–96. Barrel sample. Intense black currant fruitiness makes this wine unabashedly forward. The palate bears weighty tannins behind that fruit, resulting in a wine that is already quite balanced and structured.
title: Château Pichon Longueville Comtesse de Lalande 2012 Barrel Sample  (Pauillac)
winery: Château Pichon Longueville Comtesse de Lalande

description: 94–96. Barrel sample. This very ripe, full-bodied wine is powered by sweet blackberries and solid tannins. It is a full, concentrated and complex wine that has a great future.
title: Château Léoville Poyferré 2012 Barrel Sample  (Saint-Julien)

description: 93–95. Barrel sample. While fully ripe on the palate, this wine also boasts acidity and a black-currant freshness. It shows the quality of Cabernet from Pauillac in 2012.
title: Château Clerc Milon 2012 Barrel Sample  (Pauillac)

description: 93–95. Barrel sample. Concentration is the name of the game with this dark and intense wine. It has power and a structure that is finely tannic and dusty, with bright fruits suspended within. The aftertaste shows fine, bright acidity.
title: Château Haut Bages Libéral 2012 Barrel Sample  (Pauillac)

description: 93–95. Barrel sample. Already a beautiful wine, this is showing fine, sweet fruits along with a solid structure. The palate is juicy and fruity with new wood flavors showing through. The aftertaste is full of the fresh aspect of the vintage.
title: Château Lagrange 2012 Barrel Sample  (Saint-Julien)

description: 93–95. Barrel sample. Comprised of 80% Cabernet Sauvignon, this is a densely ripe wine, full of black fruits, smoky wood and generous tannins. Given its structure, the wine will obviously age well, even if it is drinkable in the medium term.
title: Château Pichon Longueville 2012 Barrel Sample  (Pauillac)

description: 93–95. Barrel sample. This is a solid effort that showcases both great blackberry fruit and sweet tannins right at the forefront. There is also fine acidity and a layer of wood that gives a dry, firm, age-worthy aftertaste.
title: Château Saint-Pierre 2012 Barrel Sample  (Saint-Julien)

description: 93–95. Barrel sample. Full of ripe Cabernet tannins, this is a structured wine that's chunky in character. It elegantly balances fruit and structure, resulting in a wine that's sure to be impressive.
title: Château Branaire-Ducru 2012 Barrel Sample  (Saint-Julien)

description: 93–95. Barrel sample. This powerful wine is dense with rich tannins and black fruits that are balanced. Full and concentrated, it's a wine with great potential.
title: Château Ormes de Pez 2012 Barrel Sample  (Saint-Estèphe)

description: 93–95. Barrel sample. This is a smooth, rich wine that's intensely concentrated and packed with great black-currant fruits. The wine has weight and a sense of structure to support the great fruitiness.
title: Château Beychevelle 2012 Barrel Sample  (Saint-Julien)

description: 93–95. Barrel sample. This finely fruity wine is packed with black fruits accented by spice and wood flavors. Solid tannins and bright layers of acidity make this wine so typical of the vintage.
title: Château Croizet-Bages 2012 Barrel Sample  (Pauillac)

description: 93–95. Barrel sample. The wine is very dry, layered tannins giving a major sense of structure. It will always have this dry, dense character, very firm, solid and powerful.
title: Château Lynch-Bages 2012 Barrel Sample  (Pauillac)

description: 92–94. Barrel sample. Fruity and spicy, this is a fine, attractively fruity wine. While it doesn't have great weight, it has a core of dry tannins and a dark structure that suggests good aging for the future.
title: Château de Pez 2012 Barrel Sample  (Saint-Estèphe)

description: Full in the mouth, this is a rich wine with its yellow fruit and buried acidity. It is laden with wood and ripe fruit, and is dense and cushioned. A nutmeg flavor shows through slowly to add to the exotic, opulent aftertaste.
title: Château Smith Haut Lafitte 2009  Pessac-Léognan

description: Rounded, but with just the right amount of herbaceousness to give a vivid fruity character. The wine is rich, sun-soaked while still retaining its sense of balance and elegance.
title: Château Olivier 2009  Pessac-Léognan

description: One of the many chateaus with vines on the wide valley floor of the Dordogne, this estate has made a lightly extracted wine that has chocolate as well as blackberry stalkiness. There's freshness as well, with fruit acidity that cuts through the mineral texture. Drink from 2018.
title: Château la Chapelle Despagnet 2011  Saint-Émilion

description: The smoky aroma and toasty wood character smothers the fruit. It is a tough wine at this stage although it does hint at some of the 2012 juicy fruit flavors. Drink this firm, solid wine from 2018.
title: Château la Haye 2012  Saint-Estèphe

description: This smoky wine has firm tannins and a tough core. The juicy fruit is taking its time to develop, although it will give the wine density and ripe berries in time. The vineyard, created in the early 1980s is now at peak maturity. Drink from 2017.
title: Château Lacombe Noaillac 2012  Médoc

description: One of Bordeaux's more memorable labels (orange nymphs supporting a picture of the chateau), Saransot-Dupré is one of a number of chateaus in Listrac with the Dupré suffix. This is a solid wine, chunky in a typical way for the appellation with plenty of black fruits and balanced tannins. Drink from 2017.
title: Château Saransot-Dupré 2012  Listrac-Médoc

description: Juicy and fruity with acidity and black currant fruits, this wine comes from a vineyard on slopes at the entrance to Saint-Émilion. It's bright and fresh with lively, easy fruits and soft tannins. Drink from 2017.
title: Château Simard 2012  Saint-Émilion

description: The 60% Cabernet in the blend gives a dark fruit character. At this young stage, the wood aging still dominates with its burnt toast and chocolate character. For the future, while the wine will be dry, it also has plenty of fresh fruit. Drink from 2018.
title: Château Taffard de Blaignan 2012  Médoc

description: This wine is all fruity, juicy Merlot. It's soft, rounded and ripe with flavors of berries and dark plums to give richness. Drink soon, from 2018.
title: Château Petit Village 2013  Pomerol

description: Anglophiles will enjoy this wine with its royal coat of arms on the label. The wine itself is less grand, although attractive with its black-currant fruits. At the moment, dry tannins are also a strong presence, and they will soften over the next few years. Drink from 2018.
title: Château Victoria 2013  Haut-Médoc

description: This structured wine has a severe aspect, with dry wood and fruit tannins. The fruit is there, smoky and with considerable acidity. It's a wine that will remain serious as it ages. Wait to drink until 2018.
title: Château Beauséjour 2013  Fronsac

description: An animal, yeasty character in this wine masks the fruit. It offers toast, spice, citrus and yellow fruits, but that earthy character needs to blow away before the wine is fully ready to drink. Wait until 2018. Lucien Lurton took over Bouscaut in 1979. Since 1992, it has been in the hands of daughter Sophie Lurton and her husband Laurent Cogombles. Improvements include vineyard renovation, the barrel cellar in 2010 and a B&B added in 2013.
title: Château Bouscaut 2013  Pessac-Léognan

description: From one of a pair of châteaux, both with Braude in the name and both owned by Château Mongravey in Margaux, this perfumed and fruity wine has ripe fruits that are now becoming mature. Soft tannins and juicy berry fruits are still fresh. Drink now and until 2020.
title: Château Braude Fellonneau 2012  Haut-Médoc

description: The almost 100-acre vineyard of Brillette is situated at one of the highest points in Moulis. Ripe and generously structured, this concentrated wine has layers of blackberry fruits and solid tannins. It will age well, with its fresh acidity and dry core. Drink from 2019.
title: Château Brillette 2013  Moulis-en-Médoc

description: Solid and firm tannins give this wine its structure. The fruits are masked by this density although the weight suggests they are there. It is concentrated and firm, and needs plenty of time. Drink from 2022. Founded in the 13th century by Benedictine monks, Château Carbonnieux is one of the oldest estates in the Bordeaux region. In 1956, Marc Perrin purchased the château and began vineyard and winery renovations, continued by son Antony. The property is now run by grandsons Eric and Philibert.
title: Château Carbonnieux 2013  Pessac-Léognan

description: This small, seven-acre property has an unusually high (20%) proportion of Petit Verdot in its wine, giving it big color and structure. Ripe black currant fruits balance the tannins. Drink from 2018.
title: Château la Garricq 2013  Moulis-en-Médoc

description: Plenty of tannins give this wine a firm and dense structure, but it also shows the potential of black-currant fruit flavors and perfumed acidity. Give this wine time and drink from 2019. Spring and fall weather in 2013 forced Marie-José (Perrin) Lerichecut to reduce production to 20% of an average year.
title: Château le Sartre 2013  Pessac-Léognan

description: Perfumed wood dominates this wine, giving it structure and tannins. Juicy red fruits are still submerged beneath this welter of dryness. The wine needs time to integrate. Drink from 2019.
title: Château Mongravey 2013  Margaux

description: Ripe and juicy, this wine is soft, generous and full of rich, while very fresh fruits. It has black-currant acidity, a touch of spice and a perfumed aftertaste. Drink from 2017.
title: Goulée 2013  Médoc

description: While the wine is structured and firm at the moment, it also has a solid character with plenty of berry fruits that are waiting to come through. It is smoky, fruity and likely to be ready to drink from 2016.
title: Le Bord'eau du Clos des Moiselles 2012  Bordeaux
winery: Le Bord'eau du Clos des Moiselles

description: Produced by the largest Bordeaux cooperative, this is a freshly fruity wine, with simple red fruit flavors and soft tannins. There is a smoky edge and pink raspberry acidity.
title: Univitis 2009 Chevalier de Saint-André  (Bordeaux)

description: Soft, lightweight wine, with gentle tannins and a thin fruit character. There is plenty of acidity to give freshness. Drink now.
title: Château Dame Jane 2010  Bordeaux

description: A thin wine that is all dry tannins and not enough fruit. It is lightweight with just a hint of juiciness.
title: Château du Vallier 2007  Premieres Côtes de Bordeaux

description: Taut, stalky wine, very structured. There is fruit but it is herbal, green, missing ripeness. The tannins have the same character.
title: Château Grand Jean 2010  Bordeaux

description: Darker in color than a rosé, this Clairet is fruity with ripe strawberry fruit. But it does seem heavily laced with caramel as well as some tannins and spice.
title: Château de Fontenille 2010 Rosé (Bordeaux Clairet)

description: Still very young, this is a Maison Bouey wine with good potential. It offers hints of the ripe yellow fruits and richness that will come as it develops. The touch of perfumed spice means it is also a wine to savor as an apéritif.
title: Château Lestruelle 2016  Bordeaux Blanc

description: Big, ripe and fruity, this wine balances its rich fruits with firm tannins. A dry core gives shape to the blackberry fruit flavors, offering aging potential. Drink from 2016.
title: Château Lamothe-Vincent 2011 Héritage  (Bordeaux Supérieur)

description: With attractive mint aromas, this polished wine balances structure and fruit. New wood shows through but it doesn't dominate the black fruits that give weight and ripeness. It shows the typical juiciness of the vintage. Drink from 2017.
title: Château Moya 2011  Castillon Côtes de Bordeaux

description: Fruity and herbal, this fresh wine suggests ripe apples and white peaches. The crisp texture brings out the perfumed character of the fruit. The wine is ready to drink.
title: Closerie du Bailli 2014 Tradition  (Côtes de Bourg)

description: With 12 months in wood, this is a firm wine, with a rustic, funky character that masks the black-currant fruit. The smoky wood contrasts with the acidity while leaving a dry aftertaste. Drink from 2017.
title: Nicolas Idiart 2012 Château Caillivet  (Graves)

description: This 90-acre vineyard has produced an attractive, light wine. Fruity with red-berry flavors, it is already soft and fresh. Acidity and touches of tannin are balanced enough for the wine to be ready to drink.
title: Vieux Château des Combes 2013  Saint-Émilion

description: Fresh and fruity, this wine is full of black currants and acidity that is structured by a core of dark tannins. While it is firm at the moment it's likely to fill out, with the fresh fruitiness emerging. Drink from 2017.
title: Château du Moulin Rouge 2013  Haut-Médoc

description: Situated outside Listrac, this estate has produced a soft, unfocused wine. It has tannins and gentle fruitiness and acidity. Drink from 2017.
title: Château la Lauzette 2013  Haut-Médoc

description: This is a stalky wine whose black-currant fruits are light and almost too fresh. Acidity and a nervy texture indicate a wine that will not have much depth although its fruits will be attractive soon. Drink from 2017.
title: Château la Roque de By 2013  Médoc

description: This very rich, wood-aged wine is dense and powerful. The power takes away from the natural balance of a Bordeaux, giving dark tannins that dominate. Spice from the wood is also a strong element. It will round out, but will remain very ripe.
title: Château Côte Montpezat 2011 Cuvée Compostelle  (Castillon Côtes de Bordeaux)

description: A firm, still young wine, wearing its tannins right up front. The berry and black plum fruits are there in the background along with considerable weight. The wine, rich and full, will develop over the next 2–3 years.
title: Château les Ancres 2010  Bordeaux

description: Fresh and herbaceous, this is a light, attractively fruity wine. It has bright acidity, green fruit and citrus flavors and is totally ready to drink.
title: Baron Philippe de Rothschild 2013 Mouton Cadet  (Bordeaux Blanc)

description: IToo much wood aging has masked the potential of the juicy black fruits of this unusual 100% Petit Verdot wine. It does have weight but that wood is overwhelming.
title: Château Mirambeau Papin 2009 Papin  (Bordeaux Supérieur)

description: Red berry fruits are right up front in this juicy, fruity wine without great sense of structure. No matter, it's attractive and fresh now, ready to drink.
title: Producta Vignobles 2012  Bordeaux

description: This aromatic wine is at the same time structured and tough. Its redeeming feature is the berry fruit layer that is waiting to show through from 2015.
title: VIgnobles Ducourt 2012 Réserve de la Famille  (Bordeaux)

description: This is a structured wine, with too many tannins from wood and fruit. The red berry fruits are likely always to remain second to the structure.
title: Ginestet 2012  Bordeaux

description: Lightly perfumed, this soft, ripe wine has attractive acidity that is balanced by ripe yellow- and white-stone fruits. The acidity at the end is just right. Drink now.
designation: Passeport Bordeaux Blanc by Laurent Prada
title: Barton & Guestier 2016 Passeport Bordeaux Blanc by Laurent Prada  (Bordeaux Blanc)

description: Aromatic and floral, this wine has crisp fruitiness and lively acidity that support the delicious spicy character. Drink now.
title: Château la Freynelle 2016  Bordeaux Blanc

description: This wine is tight, crisp with citrus flavors and intense acidity. It is developing into a refreshing, broader wine that will convey a riper character. Just wait until late 2017.
title: Château Lamothe de Haux 2016  Bordeaux Blanc

description: Offering both herbal acidity and delicious spiciness, this wine is balanced, grassy and also ripe. It is a fruity, modern style, ready to drink now.
title: Château Le Giron 2016  Bordeaux Blanc

description: Tight while fruity, this is going to be an attractive wine from the Gadras family, who have owned the property since the early 19th century. With its layers of citrus acidity and richer pear and apples, it is packed with fruit that's given added interest by spice. Drink from late 2017.
title: Château Roc de Minvielle 2016  Bordeaux Blanc

description: Always one of the most reliable and successful white Bordeaux brands, dominated by Sauvignon Blanc. The 2005 is a rich, tropical fruit and white currant-flavored wine. There is some green plum, fresh acidity and a hint of wood. Great as an apéritif, it also works well with sushi.
title: Dourthe 2006 Numéro 1  (Bordeaux Blanc)

description: Big, ripe fruit emerging from soft, dusty-textured tannins makes this a wine that is already pleasurable. Black fig and plum juice fruits roll comfortably around the mouth, balancing well, and maturing quickly.
title: Château d'Angludet 2006  Margaux

description: Very rich, almost soupy, this is an enjoyable wine, not hugely structured and therefore not likely to age long. But in 2–3 years, drink this for its plumy fruits, its dried fruit richness and its light tannins.
title: Château la Pointe 2006  Pomerol

description: Classic Barsac that goes for delicacy and elegance. The flavors are apples and cream, light honey and a wonderful floral lift. Pure lines, fresh with acidity and lively peach flavors, suggest a wine that will develop quickly but very attractively.
title: Château Nairac 2006  Barsac

description: This top cuvée from Château Cadillac has great fresh black currant fruits, dark plum skins and sweet tannins. It is also very obviously aged in wood, and this element needs to calm down. Wait another year, or decant now.
title: Château Cadillac 2006 Cuvée J.J. Lesgourgues  (Bordeaux Supérieur)

description: There is a high proportion of Merlot in this wine, and it shows in its ripe softness, with a depth of sweetness that goes all the way through. The tannins are there, but only just discernible.
title: Château Cos d'Estournel 2006 Les Pagodes de Cos  (Saint-Estèphe)

description: Three elements, already in balance, contribute to the success of this wine. First, the rich fruit, juicy blackberry and mulberry, lifted by acidity. Second, the new wood, which spices the fruit but is already smoothing out the third element, the dark firm tannic layer.
title: Château Haut-Beauséjour 2006  Saint-Estèphe

description: Rich, solid, with ripe spice and black plum flavors. The considerable richness is balanced with dark tannins, which give a sense of fine-grained texture to this solid wine.
title: Château Lamothe-Vincent 2006 Héritage  (Bordeaux Supérieur)

description: Totally herbaceous, this fruity wine has grassy aromas and gooseberry flavors. It's crisp, fresh and ready to drink.
title: Baron Philippe de Rothschild 2012 Mouton Cadet  (Bordeaux Blanc)

description: This structured wine is slow to show its fruity side although it has a layer of acidity with hints of black fruits. It is firm and dry at the moment with dense tannins and a dark aftertaste. Wait until 2017.
title: Lestonnat 2012  Bordeaux Supérieur

description: This has a curious caramel aroma from the wood aging. It's tough and extracted, a powerhouse of hard tannins without enough fruit.
title: Château Bel-Air 2012  Bordeaux Supérieur

description: The wine is developing quickly. It has all the elements, with ripe cherry flavors and acidity along some firm tannins. They are all coming together easily and generously. The attractive, ripe wine will be ready to drink from 2022.
title: Château Desmirail 2014  Margaux

description: This is a wine to watch as it develops slowly. It is all structure, concentrated and solid. Dense tannins vie with the black-currant fruits from the high proportion of Cabernet Sauvignon in the blend. Drink this wine from 2024.
title: Château Ferrière 2014  Margaux

description: This is a rich stylish wine from the Chanfreau family. It has fine tannins and signs of wood aging, both of which will meld into the juicy black-currant fruits. It has a predominance of Cabernet Sauvignon that gives the wine its structure and aging potential. The aftertaste is ripe and still crisp, still young. Drink from 2020.
title: Château Fonréaud 2014  Listrac-Médoc

description: The wine is all about fruit and balanced tannins. It is juicy, so drinkable now, although with enough structure to promise good aging. Perfumed black-currant fruits show strongly. The wine shows how this chateau continues to perform reliably. Drink from 2020.
title: Château Gruaud Larose 2014  Saint-Julien

description: Situated on one of the highest points of the Médoc, this vineyard is on deep gravel soil. It is one of a group of properties owned by the Chanfreau family of Château Fonréaud. This wine is firm and still young. However, it is already showing signs of the ripe black fruits and wood aging. Acidity and the firm structure will let the wine age. Drink from 2020.
title: Château Lestage 2014  Listrac-Médoc

description: This generous wine is on the fruity side of the 2014 spectrum. Blueberry and black-currant fruits are supported by the spice and tannins from wood aging. The wine is likely to develop easily over the medium term. Drink from 2020.
title: Château Talbot 2014  Saint-Julien

description: A négociant bottling from the ubiquitous Yvon Mau, this wine proudly boasts élevé en futs du chene on the label. You can certainly notice it in the cedary aromas and flavors, but it's adequately balanced by cassis and tobacco flavors. The fruit tastes a touch overripe, but it seems to work well here.
title: Premius 1998  Bordeaux

description: Dark earth and tobacco spice the aromas of this grand cru, followed by flavors of black cherries and herbs. The Cabernet Franc portion shines clearly through as a distinctive weediness, but it's somewhat balanced by roasted black cherries and only a hint of espresso-like oak.
title: Château Trimoulet 1996  Saint-Émilion

description: Most everyone's first Bordeaux is back for another year, with fruity black-cherry aromas spiked with just a touch of vanilla and cedar. Juicy acidity keeps this crowd-pleaser lively through the lightly tannic finish. A good introduction to the genre.
title: Baron Philippe de Rothschild 1998 Mouton Cadet  (Bordeaux)

description: A ripe and fruity wine, very typical of the vintage. There's a strong stalky black currant character, with some dry tannins and wood flavors. The aftertaste, though, comes right back to fruit and juicy acidity.
title: Château Bois de Rolland 2009  Bordeaux Supérieur

description: A delicate wine that is completely ready to drink and needs to be consumed now before it ages further. The fruit has developed a secondary, animal character, the tannins starting to dominate with their dryness.
title: Château du Grand Bos 2007  Graves

description: The second wine of Château Magnol, this is a ripe, smoke and wood flavored wine. It has spice, attractive black currant fruits and some—not too many—firm tannins. With its inherent fruitiness it will be ready to drink this year.
title: Château Magnol 2011 Les Charmes de Magnol  (Médoc)

description: Wood-laden, spicy wine with some ripe black currant fruit and soft tannins. This is a warm, open wine that is likely to age over the next year.
title: Château Allégret 2011  Bordeaux Supérieur

description: Young, herbaceous wine, very fruity and lightly perfumed. It is crisp and delicate, with its citrus and pineapple fruits already lively and fresh.
title: Château Allégret 2012  Entre-Deux-Mers

description: The aromas are of wood as much as fruit. While the palate also shows plenty of wood aging flavors, there is also a more floral, red berry fruit character that's already attractive. The acidity at the end gives intense freshness.
title: Château Laubès 2011  Bordeaux

description: One of the oldest vineyards in Bordeaux, founded by Pope Clément in the 14th century. This white is full, rich, packed with white fruits. It shows crispness, toast and spice, already well integrated.
title: Château Pape Clément 2007  Pessac-Léognan

description: A pure Sauvignon Blanc, unusual in Pessac-Léognan, which normally also includes Sémillon. This is a purely fresh wine, but with a serious aging potential side to it. For now, the white fruits, currants and pears are delicious, with fresh structure and a touch of wood spice. Screwcap.
title: Château Couhins-Lurton 2007  Pessac-Léognan

description: The top white wine from Chantegrive, this is a smoothly wood-aged wine. However it doesn't lose sight of deliciously fresh, herbaceous fruits which come through crisply. That makes the resulting balance immediately appealing, acidity and spice coming together well. Worth aging for 2–3 years.
title: Château de Chantegrive 2007 Cuvée Caroline  (Graves)

description: With smoky aromas and structured tannins, this is still young and firm. Under those tannins, the black currant fruit is developing to give a ripe wine with fine acidity and structure. Drink from 2020.
title: Château Beaumont 2015  Haut-Médoc

description: On the bank opposite the Sauternes region, Cadillac, with its fortified castle, is home to some richly liquorous wines. This 2010 is honeyed and opulent, with a smooth texture and just a bite of botrytis. Drink this peach- and bitter orange-flavored wine now.
title: Château Biac 2010 Secret de Château Biac  (Cadillac)

description: This balanced wine shows fine potential. Its structure dominates at the moment, with solid tannins, but the rich black fruit is all there. Let it develop over the next several years and drink from 2021.
title: Château d'Aiguilhe 2015  Castillon Côtes de Bordeaux

description: This Merlot-dominated wine brings out both the juicy fruit typical of the vintage and a tight, smoky character that lends perfume. Still young, it's firmly structured and will age well. Drink from 2020.
title: Château Moncets 2014  Lalande de Pomerol

description: Richly structured, this wine is dense and solid. It has swathes of ripe fruit, bold tannins and an impressive firm character. Its future is assured with its dense texture, black fruit and acidity all coming into place. Drink from 2021.
title: Château Tour Grand Mayne 2015  Castillon Côtes de Bordeaux

description: From 12-acre vineyard in Pauillac, a wine that is relatively affordable. It has fine Cabernet Sauvignon juicy black currant fruits, along with tannins that, in 2009, are so well integrated into the fruit already. The dusty texture promises good aging.
title: Château Béhèré Courtin 2009  Pauillac

description: Big, firmly tannic wine, smoky and warm, with great swathes of black currant fruit. It is firmly structured, but it is the rich sweet fruits that are the attraction.
title: Château Citran 2009  Haut-Médoc

description: It's the 100% Merlot that gives the alcohol and superripe fruit to this wine, redeemed by the acidity. Licorice and dark chocolate flavors go with the sweetest plums and spice. Age for 3–4 years.
title: Château Lyonnat 2009 Emotion  (Lussac Saint-Émilion)

description: Big and rich, powered with sweet fruits, rounded with black plums. The firm tannins are densely packed at the core of this ageworthy wine. With its swathes of ripe fruit and the edge of wood aging, it's already delicious, but keep for at least six years.
title: Château Preuillac 2009  Médoc
