description: A Cabernet Sauvignon-dominated wine, packed with tannins and flavors of new wood. The black fruits are rich from the vintage, warm and jammy. This is a wine with fine concentration, coming into balance, finishing with black currant acidity.
title: Château Ségur de Cabanac 2009  Saint-Estèphe

description: The second wine from the Saint-Julien estate, this is every bit as elegant as the grand vin, its black currant fruit developing to envelop the fine tannins. There is fine fruit, plenty of acidity and a rich texture. It needs time, so drink from 2020.
title: Château Beychevelle 2015 L'Amiral de Beychevelle  (Saint-Julien)

description: A mineral texture gives this ripe wine an edge while its full, red berry fruit offers some solid tannins and concentration. It's smoky and full-bodied and will be ready to drink from 2019.
title: Château Joanin Bécot 2015  Castillon Côtes de Bordeaux

description: Maturity comes slowly to a Sauternes, but this wine is almost there. Its fine sweetness is balanced by a lemon curd-like acidity while its rich botrytis is finely integrated with the opulent texture. Drink now.
title: Château Simon 2010 Cuvée Exceptionelle  (Sauternes)

description: Rich and dense, this generous wine has considerable botrytis as well as perfumed apricot and bitter orange flavors. It's ripe and full of fruit and honey. Drink from 2020.
title: Clos Haut-Peyraguey 2014 Symphonie  (Sauternes)

description: This perfumed wine shows a floral character. Berry fruits add juiciness, complexity and structure. Density on the finish adds interest.
title: Château Lamothe de Haux 2011  Côtes de Bordeaux

description: This is a wood-aged wine with spice and vanilla flavors, fine berry fruits and a rich texture. It is firm, while also rich and generous. The weight, the ripeness and the structure all promise aging. Drink from 2015.
title: Château Pierrail 2011  Bordeaux Supérieur

description: Ripe and toasty, this is a rich, full-bodied and juicy wine. It has ripe berry fruits, touches of black currant and balancing acidity. Wood aging supports the palate and adds considerable potential. Drink this fine wine from 2016.
title: Château Sainte Marie 2011  Bordeaux Supérieur

description: Big and bold, this is a structured wine. Although it does some have some bitter extraction at this stage, this should pass as the ripe plum and berry flavors assert themselves. The wine is complex, rich and firmly structured to the end. Drink from 2016.
title: Château Turcaud 2011 Cuvée Majeure  (Bordeaux Supérieur)

description: Dry, with dusty tannins and ripe fruit, this is a wine with considerable potential. The berry fruits have a balanced, juicy element, fine acidity and a strong texture. The wine is rich and full, while remaining fresh. Drink from 2015.
title: Domaine de l'A 2011  Castillon Côtes de Bordeaux

description: A smooth mint- and eucalyptus-flavored wine, with burnt-tannin flavors and a hugely dry core. The wine is very firm, the juicy acidity and fruit underneath just a whisper for the future. Give the wine at least 6–7 years.
title: Château Ad Francos 2010  Francs Côtes de Bordeaux

description: A solid, fruity wine supported by ripe tannins. The wine has a good sense of its rich self, a fine presence of ripe plum fruit flavors and a warm texture. There is a fine juicy aftertaste.
title: Château du Juge 2010 Cru Camille  (Cadillac Côtes de Bordeaux)

description: A wine that's straight down the line, firmly structured and with solid fruit for the future. There is weight and richness, a sense of power waiting to show in the future. With its density, anticipate aging this wine for at least 6–7 years.
title: Château Grand Moulin 2010  Blaye Côtes de Bordeaux

description: A classically structured, stalky Bordeaux, with added superripe fruit. The result is a wine with firm, young tannins that merge with the juicy sweet black currant and intense fruitiness to finish. For medium-term aging.
title: Château Léon 2010 Prestige  (Cadillac Côtes de Bordeaux)

description: A solidly based wine that offers both rich black fruits and fragrant acidity. It has weight and great concentration, with a long-term future. Keep for 4–5 years for the best effect.
title: Château Saint-Nicolas 2010  Cadillac Côtes de Bordeaux

description: Legend has it that those who listen closely to the well of Château Côte Montpezat can hear the pilgrims on the way to Compostella who drank here. Drinking the wine today offers light spice and wood aromas that give it an extra dimension. Initially, they seem to dominate the fruit, although this passes over as the herbal and green-fruit character of the wine shows through. It does mean that the wine should age a little in bottle, so wait until early 2017.
title: Château Côte Montpezat 2015  Bordeaux Blanc

description: This is a ripe, full-throttle wine. It has layers of blackberry and firm, dusty tannins. They are balanced by the juicy texture that gives the wine both freshness and the promise of some further aging. The wine is complex, rich and with good potential. Drink from 2018.
title: Château l'Espérance 2012 Les Cèdres  (Côtes de Bourg)

description: The estate belongs to the Borie family, one of the grand names of Bordeaux, with the wine making done by the team of Château Ducru-Beaucaillou in Saint-Julien. The result is an aromatic, balanced wine that is both structured and fruity. It has fine tannins, black currant fruit and a perfumed aftertaste.
title: Château Ducluzeau 2012  Listrac-Médoc

description: Full, ripe and juicy, this has a flavor of fresh black-currant juice, which is balanced by the dry, firm tannins that promise aging.
title: Château des Lattes 2010  Médoc

description: Despite the high alcohol level, this is classic Bordeaux, with style, elegance and fine balance between tannin and ripe black-currant fruit. It demonstrates the concentration and rich structure of the vintage, yet the finish has a light, bright, fruity touch.
title: Château le Manoir 2010 Cuvée Prestige  (Lalande de Pomerol)

description: Spicy and smoky, this wine is dark with tannins and dryness. Its dark chocolate and bitter coffee flavors suggest tough extraction. The fruit does not stand a chance.
title: Château Bellevue 2015 Amphorae  (Blaye Côtes de Bordeaux)

description: Minty new wood aromas are the theme in this wood-laden wine. It has a burnt character from high extraction and wood aging, making it hard to discern the fruit, although there is a juicy character at the end.
title: Château Cailleteau Bergeron 2015 Prestige  (Blaye Côtes de Bordeaux)

description: This wine's strawberry jam aromas lead to a palate dominated by tannins. It's dry and missing fruit.
title: Château de Belcier 2015  Castillon Côtes de Bordeaux

description: This is a fat wine with light, juicy acidity. Honey and spice notes add interest to its broad melon and apple flavors.
title: Château Haut Maurin 2016  Bordeaux Blanc

description: Even for the rich 2015 vintage, this is an excessive wine. Made from superripe Merlot with high extraction, it adds dark chocolate flavors to its rich, juicy blackberry jelly fruit, feeling too big and over-the-top.
title: Château Moulin Haut-Laroque 2015  Fronsac

description: Dry, firm and tough, this wine lacks the fruit fruit to come through the structure. It's a wine for those who like plenty of wood.
title: Les Vignerons de Tutiac 2015 Excellence  (Blaye Côtes de Bordeaux)

description: Firm tannins and overripe fruit dominate this wine. It will not develop well, with those tannins remaining tough.
title: Château Bourron 2015 Le Belvédère de Bourron  (Castillon Côtes de Bordeaux)

description: Heavily wood aged, this wine is tough and dry, with aggressive toast flavors. The concentration is there but is not from fruit.
title: Château Clairac 2015 Tradition  (Blaye Côtes de Bordeaux)

description: Overripe, jammy fruit aromas and flavors spoil this wine. It's oddly balanced: soft on the one hand and tough on the other.
title: Château German 2015  Castillon Côtes de Bordeaux

description: Smoky aromas from wood aging show again strongly in the tough wooden plank notes that dominate this wine. It's a shame, because the fruit is there.
title: Château les Guyonnet 2015 Cuvée Héritage  (Cadillac Côtes de Bordeaux)

description: Stalky black currant fruit aromas and a spicy, stalky character on the palate define this tight, dry wine. It's young and tough now, so give it another year and drink from 2018.
title: Closerie du Bailli 2016 Grande Réserve  (Bordeaux)

description: Balanced wine, the tight tannins fitting well into the black currant fruits, the texture coming from plum skins, damsons and some fresh, bright acidity.
title: Château Julian 2009  Bordeaux

description: A small vineyard of just over 10 acres in the north of the Margaux appellation, Bellevue de Tayac obviously received serious attention from then-owner Jean-Luc Thunevin of Château Valandraud in Saint-Émilion. You can taste that in the vanilla flavors from the wood aging and the smooth texture. It's a micro-cuvée that shows great richness and potential. Drink from 2018.
title: Château Bellevue de Tayac 2012  Margaux

description: This dense and dark wine is full of ripe, richly juicy black fruits. Solid tannins and layers of wood are softening into the rest of the wine. It's going to develop slowly, releasing the fruit into the tannic structure. Wait until 2018.
title: Château Clauzet 2012  Saint-Estèphe

description: While the nose exudes burnt-toast aromas, the palate is much better suited to fruit. It has wood flavors, certainly, but these are well balanced with the ripe berry fruits and dark, brooding structure. From just north of Saint-Estèphe, this wine will age well. Drink from 2018.
title: Château d'Aurilhac 2012  Haut-Médoc

description: This 1,000-acre estate with 140 acres of vines is close to Bordeaux and still family owned. With bitter chocolate flavor lying over the fruit, this needs some aging before it can properly integrate. Dark tannins and spice show at the end, along with juicy black-currant fruit. Drink from 2018.
title: Château de Malleret 2012  Haut-Médoc

description: Already well balanced between botrytis and fresh fruits, this structured wine could develop quickly. The acidity, pineapple and apricot flavors are up front along with a dry structure with great potential. Drink from 2019.
title: Château de Myrat 2011  Sauternes

description: Made by the Château Giscours winemaking team, this wine benefits from their expertise. Skill shows in the velvet textures, the ripe berry fruits and the hidden strength of the tannins and wood flavors. It's going to be a serious, elegant wine. Drink from 2018.
title: Château Duthil 2012  Haut-Médoc

description: Fonréaud's vineyard is on the highest point in the Médoc (all of 120 feet), at the southern end of the Listrac appellation. This wine, as often with this property, has started out rugged and solid with firm dry tannins. The fruit though is all there and will show with increasing intensity over the next few years. Drink this powerful wine from 2018.
title: Château Fonréaud 2012  Listrac-Médoc

description: While juicy Merlot dominates this wine, the structure comes from the perfumed Cabernet Sauvignon that brings out the tannins, while the fruit is packed with blackberry flavors. This ripe wine needs to develop over the next few years. Drink from 2017.
title: Château Haut-Bellevue 2012  Haut-Médoc

description: This ripe wine shows a good balance between its rich black fruits and the densely tannic structure. It is still young and for now the wine is firm and dry. The ripe fruit will blossom over the next few years to give warmth and richness. Drink from 2018.
title: Château l'Argenteyre 2012  Médoc

description: While the fruit is delicious, full of blackberry flavors, a powerful tannic core shows a firmer side to this wine. As the wine opens up, it becomes dense, concentrated, with ripe Merlot fruitiness. At the end, all is freshness and light. Drink from 2020.
title: Château Latour à Pomerol 2012  Pomerol

description: This wine is light and fresh, full of crisp and ripe black currant fruits that lie alongside gentle and open tannins. The wine has weight and a rich underlay, although it will develop well and relatively quickly with its bright fruits and acidity. Drink from 2016.
designation: Le Petit Lion du Marquis de las Cases
title: Château Léoville Las Cases 2012 Le Petit Lion du Marquis de las Cases  (Saint-Julien)

description: 85-87 Barrel sample. This is light, fresh, on the dilute side, with easy berry fruits and some juicy character. Not much depth here.
title: Château Fonréaud 2008 Barrel sample  (Listrac-Médoc)

description: The second wine of Médoc Château La Cardonne is a light, fruity wine with red berry fruits, acidity and a fresh tannin character. It is pleasingly ready to drink now.
title: Château La Cardonne 2007 Cardus de la Cardonne  (Médoc)

description: A solid, foursquare wine, flaunting its tannins but not forgetting the rich weight of fruit underneath. Mint flavors go with the chocolate and dark plums.
title: Château de la Grave 2006 Caractère  (Côtes de Bourg)

description: A powerful, dense and still youthful wine. It balances a fresh blackberry fruit character with smoky tannins and delicious, bright and juicy acidity.
title: Château Haut-Peyrous 2008 Retour des Palombières  (Graves)

description: Ripe, smooth, rich fruits, juicy strawberry flavor and fresh acidity. The texture is solid and dense, with an obvious potential for aging.
title: Château La Rame 2006 La Charmille  (Premieres Côtes de Bordeaux)

description: Finely balanced, simple Sauternes with light apricot and honey flavors. With just a touch of botrytis dryness, the aftertaste is more sweet.
title: Baron Philippe de Rothschild 2004 Mouton Cadet Réserve  (Sauternes)

description: Lightweight, with more dryness than richness, this wine is lightly sweet, hinting at botrytis, with apple and cream flavors touched by honey.
title: Chais de Méribel 2003  Sauternes

description: While this wine shows some of the softness and richness of 2003, it keeps a light touch and the acidity and black fruits remain fresh. There is an edge of astringency that leaves a hard aftertaste.
title: Château Toumilon 2003  Graves

description: This is a bright, ripe and fruity wine. With its red fruits, gentle tannins and juicy acidity, everything is in place for an early drinking and food friendly wine. Ready from late 2017.
title: Petite Sirène 2015  Bordeaux

description: The 65% of Merlot in the blend gives a wine that is soft and rounded. With its acidity and fine tannins, it is fresh and fruity. Black currants and berries dominate a wine that will be ready to drink from 2019.
title: Château Haut Beyzac 2014  Haut-Médoc

description: The top of the range wine from this estate is ripe and full of vivid black currant fruits. It does have tannins although these are subordinate to the juicy jammy fruit. The wine is almost ready to drink. Just wait until mid-2017.
title: Château Haut-Mouleyre 2014 Grand Réserve  (Bordeaux)

description: This wine with its tight black-currant character, is still also firm with tannins. It has a juicy edge that will develop well as the wine matures. With crisp acidity and structure, it should age. Drink from 2018.
title: Château Méric 2014  Médoc

description: The wine is ripe, weighty and full of fruit. Its tannins are already softening into the blackberry flavors. The sole question about this wine is the excessive wood aging that has given a burnt edge. Hopefully, this blend of 50-50 Cabernet Sauvignon and Merlot will assert its natural fruitiness. Don't drink before 2020.
title: Château Ramafort 2014  Médoc

description: Mint and eucalypt aromas set the scene for a modern, polished wine, packed with wood tannins as well as ripe black fruits. Currently, the tannins are winning giving a wine that is dark, structured and dry. So give it at least five years.
title: Château Faizeau 2010 Sélection Vieilles Vignes  (Montagne-Saint-Émilion)

description: Rich, concentrated wine, with generous fruits and soft tannins. It has super-ripe black plums, a touch of chocolate and spice from wood aging. Powerful, juicy, fruity, likely to age well over the medium-term, over the next 3–4 years.
title: Clos Larcis 2009  Saint-Émilion

description: Produced by the winemaking team of Château Giscours in Margaux, this is impressive for a simple Bordeaux. It has weight, rich blackberry fruits, structure and concentration. It could even age.
title: Petite Sirène 2010  Bordeaux

description: Produced at Château Haut-Bailly, this concentrated red show the attractive fruit of 2011. It's tannins are relatively gentle, a fine counter-point to the red berry and currant fruits. It's a wine for medium-term aging over the next 4–6 years.
title: Château le Pape 2011  Pessac-Léognan

description: Rich and smooth, this is a good example of the sumptuous 2009 vintage. It is soft, ripe with blackberry and red plum fruits. It is already developing well. It's a medium-term wine, already juicy and drinkable.
title: Château le Temple 2009  Médoc

description: Fine, fresh white Bordeaux from this Entre-deux-Mers property. A blend of Sauvignon Blanc and Sémillon, just touched by wood, with spice and melon flavors brightened by citrus.
title: Château Thieuley 2008  Bordeaux Blanc

description: A rich wine that shows plenty of berry fruits, supported by some dry but dusty tannins. This is a wine that is going to develop with its firm powerhouse of ripe fruit that is emerging from a tight period in its development.
title: Château Haut Selve 2003  Graves

description: This grassy, very herbaceous wine is all crisp green fruits. Touched by a creamy texture under a layer of freshness, it shows some good weight and structure. There is light wood that rounds it all out.
title: Château Lamothe-Vincent 2006 Héritage  (Bordeaux Blanc)

description: Still dominated by its new wood aromas, this is a fine, structured wine that is only just setting out. It has fine weight, rich blackberry fruits and dark tannins. The spicy wood still needs to integrate, so drink from 2017.
title: Château Bel-Air Ortet 2010  Saint-Estèphe

description: A ripe, soft, generous wine, laden with blackberry fruits as well as spice from wood aging. Rich and full-bodied, it has power and concentration from dark tannins as well as the ripe, opulent black fruits of the vintage. Drink from 2014.
title: Château Siaurac 2009  Lalande de Pomerol

description: Ripe and juicy, this full-bodied wine has black plum and berry fruits that are well integrated into the juicy acidity and ripe tannins. The wine will develop quickly, so drink from late 2016.
title: Les Vignerons Réunis de Monségur 2014 Château Arnaucosse  (Bordeaux)

description: This is a structured wine, displaying black currant and spice notes. Still young, with grippy tannins and a dusty texture, this will develop quickly into a round and fruity wine. Drink from late 2016.
title: Les Vignerons Réunis de Monségur 2014 Château Grand Marchand  (Bordeaux)

description: Dry and firm, this wine just escapes being too toasty. Instead there is room for the fruit to begin to show, with black-currant flavors and fresh acidity. It's not a wine for aging, so drink from 2018.
title: Château Labégorce Margaux 2013  Margaux

description: Already balanced, this is a rich wine, packed with jammy fruit and tannins. The concentration contrasts with the intense, fresh acidity. Good depth of flavor comes with a dense texture and a final shot of pure acidity. Drink from 2017.
title: Château Laforge 2013  Saint-Émilion

description: This Graves estate has vines in nearby Sauternes where it has produced this honey and orange-flavored wine. It is light and fresh while still having a wonderful sweet and dry character. The acidity at the end is delicious. Drink now for its fruit, although the wine will age at least until 2025.
title: Château Lapinesse 2013  Sauternes

description: This ripe, juicy and fruity wine has plenty of tannins, although they have easily integrated into the black fruits and fresh acidity. The wine is already surprisingly balanced, so although it will improve with age, it can be enjoyed now.
title: Château Laroque 2013  Saint-Émilion

description: All about freshness, this wine has crisp red-currant flavors and bright acidity. The tannins are just a background to the juicy, fruity front. Drink from 2018.
title: Château Latour à Pomerol 2013  Pomerol

description: What is so good about this wine is its balance. The producer has accentuated the fruit of the vintage, leaving aside any big tannic structure. The result is a black-currant wine that is juicy, fresh and developing well. Drink from 2017.
title: Château Le Boscq 2013  Saint-Estèphe

description: Rich and concentrated, this blend is mainly Merlot, with a little Cabernet Sauvignon and Malbec. The alcohol shows in the weight of the wine, but the freshness is still very present. Powerful, dark and still young, the wine will be best from 2017.
title: Château l'Espérance 2010 Cuvée Trois Frères  (Blaye Côtes de Bordeaux)

description: This well-made, ripe and fruity wine has soft tannins that are already well integrated with the red-berry fruits. Acidity keeps it all fresh and suggests the wine could age over the medium-term. Drink from 2018.
title: Château Lestage 2013  Listrac-Médoc

description: Young, fruity and with potential, this is a perfumed while also structured wine. It has plenty of black-currant flavors as well as delicious acidity. The dry core keeps the fruitiness together. Drink from 2019.
title: Château Roche-Lalande 2013  Pessac-Léognan

description: From an estate that claims to date back to Roman times and has been revived by the current owners, this attractive wine features dusty tannins and ripe, juicy blackberry-flavored Merlot. A touch of perfume and plenty of acidity at the end keep it fresh. Drink from 2017.
title: Château Saint-André Corbin 2013  Saint-Georges-Saint-Émilion

description: Tight and stalky, this wine has considerable acidity. Firm tannins in the background give some promise of aging. At this stage, the wine is more about structure than fruit and thus is very early in its development. Drink from 2019.
title: Château Brane-Cantenac 2013  Margaux

description: This is a concentrated wine, full of blackberry fruits with acidity and spice. The wood-aging character is balancing out well, giving structure without dominating the fruit. Drink from 2020. Grapes are vinified by variety and plot from the 60-acre vineyard of Cabernet Sauvignon (55%), Merlot (40%) and Petit Verdot (5%). The property was purchased by Jean-Christophe Mau in 2004.
title: Château Brown 2013  Pessac-Léognan

description: This wine is round, smooth and rich. The palate brings a tangy, herbal texture, but this is balanced by the ripe apricot and white peach flavors. The aftertaste reveals a more spicy flavor.
title: Château Gazin Rocquencourt 2013  Pessac-Léognan

description: Fresh and fruity, this wine is also lightly herbal and shows touches of wood. It is crisp, tangy with its yellow-fruit flavors mingling with the citrus acidity. The wine will be ready to drink from late 2016.
title: Le Nardian 2013  Bordeaux Blanc

description: Crisp and fruity, this is an immediately attractive win from the fourth generation of the Bonhur family. It has bright acidity, a herbal edge and perfumed apple and lemon flavors. The wine is totally ready to drink.
title: Vignobles Bonhur 2015 Château Terres Douces  (Bordeaux Blanc)

description: Bordeaux has always had Malbec in its vineyards although it is rare. This unusual wine shows how, in a fruity year, the grape can work well. The tannins are soft, giving a juicy black-fruited wine that is forward and delicious to drink now for its succulent fruit.
title: Vignobles Raymond 2014 En Mémoire du  (Bordeaux)

description: With a high proportion (60%) of Merlot, this is a ripe wine while also being structured. It has a dense character that comes from the still young, firm tannins. Behind these are the ripest black-currant fruits, crisp and juicy, packed with flavor as well as acidity. Drink this wine from 2019.
title: Château Bardins 2011  Pessac-Léognan

description: In 2001, Aliénor and Alexandre de Malet Roquefort bought this property which is 15 minutes southeast of their Château La Gaffelière. From 8.5 acres of Sauvignon Blanc, Sémillon and Muscadelle, this is a rounded, soft wine that promises well. It is going towards the tropical fruit area with its apricot and pineapple flavors. Behind, the acidity is tangy and crisp with a tight, nervy aftertaste.
title: Château Chapelle d'Aliénor 2015  Bordeaux Blanc

description: Vincent Lataste's organic wine is light, bright and immediately refreshing. This is a wine that shows a strongly herbal side. It has citrus and green apple flavors that are crisp and tight. With perfumed acidity at the end, the wine is delicious to drink now. It won 2016 Best of Wine Tourism award for B&B in giant wine barrels.
title: Château de Lardiley 2015 Sauvignon  (Bordeaux Blanc)

description: The wine is dry and firm with solid tannins as well as blackberry fruit. It is structured, balanced by juicy acidity and oak-aging flavors. The wine comes from the slopes of the Côtes de Bordeaux about the small town of Cadillac.
title: Chateau de Sadran 2012 Prestige  (Cadillac Côtes de Bordeaux)

description: From the family estate of Bordeaux wine gurus Denis and Florence Dubourdieu, this is a crisp, refreshing Sauvignon Blanc/Sémillon blend that appeals immediately. Bright acidity, freshly squeezed lemon and a herbal, green edge all make for a wine that is drinkable now as an apéritif as well as with food.
title: Château Reynon 2015  Bordeaux Blanc

description: A fully ripe wine, that has black-currant and blueberry fruit, fine acidity and balanced tannins. It is juicy, fruity although with a good structure that will allow it to age longer. Drink from 2017.
title: Clos des Justices 2012  Bordeaux

description: This is a juicy black-currant flavored wine that's ripe in tannin and in fruitiness. It has a hint of bitter extraction and an edge of dark wood aging, which need to soften and become round, so age it for at least five years.
title: Château Carcanieux 2010  Médoc

description: This is a mint- and licorice-flavored wine, with its wood aging prominent at this stage. Full bodied, rich and concentrated, it shows strong signs of extraction that give it a bitter finish. Age this tannic wine for 2–3 years or more.
title: Château Lestruelle 2010  Médoc

description: This wood-aged wine, one of the château's top white cuvées, needs to age. With its toast and ripe yellow and white fruits, it is rich and full, a reflection of good whites in a drab red Bordeaux vintage. After a bitter smoky edge from the toastiness softens, it will be a very fine wine. Drink from 2017. This Lévèque family estate is a member of the Union des Grands Crus de Bordeaux.
title: Château de Chantegrive 2013 Cuvée Caroline  (Graves)

description: Made in a firm, solid style, this wine shows considerable potential. Pure berry flavors are prominent along with the dense tannins. It is a good wine for the difficult vintage and will be ready to drink from 2020. The estate is in the process of converting to biodynamic methods.
title: Château Durfort-Vivens 2013  Margaux

description: From one of the properties owned by Bernard Magrez, this wine exhibits the opulent character he seems to like. Rich and full of black-plum flavors, it offers all the fruit of the vintage with the right amount of tannins to support it. Drink from 2018.
title: Château les Grands Chênes 2013  Médoc

description: This Cabernet Sauvignon-Merlot dominated wine is dense with tannins, although with enough fruit richness to balance. It has a dark texture and shows plenty of wood flavors at this stage. Its weight will allow it to age well, so wait until 2022. The Bonnet family has renovated vineyards and installed a gravity-fed winery. They also own a winery in Argentina and nearby Gazin Rocquencourt.
title: Château Malartic-Lagravière 2013  Pessac-Léognan

description: Spice and wood aromas show on this still-structured wine. It has fresh acidity, red berries and tight tannins that are still developing. The wine is light and fruity while also having enough structure to allow it to age. Drink from 2018.
title: Château Margaux 2013 Pavillon Rouge du Château Margaux  (Margaux)

description: One of the successes from Pessac-Léognan, this refined, structured wine is singing already with its fruitiness. Ripe and forward, it is developing into a medium-bodied, perfumed wine that will be ready to drink relatively quickly. Drink from 2019.
title: Domaine de Chevalier 2013  Pessac-Léognan

description: Very elegant, very classy, this wine shows, discreetly, its sweet juicy fruit, great ripe black currant flavor and fine tannins. Nothing is overstated; this is for lovers of stylish wines.
title: Château Lagrange 2006  Saint-Julien

description: A big, rich chocolaty wine with delicious spice and ripe tannins. The fruit is sumptuously rich, blackberry juice flavors balancing the power and concentration of the texture. In all this richness, there is just enough freshness to lift the finish.
title: Château l'Évangile 2006  Pomerol

description: At this early stage in its development, this wine shows more structure than richness. The tannins are fully developed, dark and dense. The complexity is there, but the fruit and the elegance are still to come—and that suggests good aging potential.
title: Château Pontet-Canet 2006  Pauillac

description: This is a dark wine, perhaps more elegant than powerful. The currant fruit flavors drive through with prominent acidity, trailing tight tannins and smoky wood. More weight would have been welcome.
title: Château Belair 2006  Saint-Émilion

description: A powerhouse of rich Merlot, big, ripe, with black plums, sweet figs and only light acidity. A wine for lovers of big Merlots, this rolls generously around the mouth. Because of this immediate richness, it seems likely to age quickly.
title: Château Clinet 2006  Pomerol

description: This wine continues the improvements at this classed growth chateau at the far southern end of the Margaux appellation. It is firmly structured, but the fruit is rich, showing juiciness from ripe, black fruits. The concentration and intensity offer excellent aging potential.
title: Chateau Dauzac 2006  Margaux

description: This is a great success. Youthful tannins exude power and vitality, combining with great fruit concentration, the elements coming together with sweet chocolate and cocoa as added richness. A tasty wine that is developing well.
title: Château Ferrière 2006  Margaux

description: A beautifully perfumed, dark-colored wine, bursting with black plums and violet perfumes. It is, on the surface, delicious, but taste beneath that and it becomes complex and dark, with immense but velvet tannins, suggesting considerable potential.
title: Château Léoville Las Cases 2006 Clos du Marquis  (Saint-Julien)

description: Currently a hard-edged wine that has tight structure and lacks sweetness. All the elements are there, the botrytis dryness, a racy vivid acidity, richness and balance. But they have yet to come together. Wait at least two years.
title: Château Sigalas Rabaud 2006  Sauternes

description: A wonderfully firm wine, which balances extraction with pure sweet fruit. It moves comfortably within its tannic structure, the ripe Merlot allowed plenty of play to show off its black jelly and plum flavors.
title: Château La Conseillante 2006  Pomerol

description: Jammy and ripe, from gravel soils in the valley plain of Saint-Emilion, this is already a very drinkable wine. It has intense, concentrated red and black berry fruits surrounding a core of seriously dry tannins from fruit and wood. Solid but rich, this is developing well.
title: Château Laforge 2006  Saint-Émilion

description: Mint and sage aromas give an instant herbal character. That's balanced by citrus fruits that cut through the texture to give great freshness and intense acidity. Drink from 2015.
title: Château Roquefort 2013  Bordeaux Blanc

description: A wine that is deliciously perfumed from the 25% Cabernet Franc in the blend. The wine has very ripe black fruits, with contrasting intense acidity, toast and dark chocolate. It's powerful and concentrated, with good aging potential.
title: Château Nenin 2010  Pomerol

description: A complex wine with firm acidity and ripe black currant notes. The fruit is juicy, and the palate finely structured. The small property, owned by André Lurton, is improving with every vintage.
title: Château Couhins-Lurton 2010  Pessac-Léognan

description: A firm, smoky wine, with tannins that verge on too dry. The fruit is not totally ripe, giving awkward astringency.
title: Château Beauregard 2006  Pomerol

description: A simple fruity Bordeaux, attractively layering black currants, firm and dry tannins and fresh, juicy acidity. It's light, already drinkable. Screwcap.
title: Château la Moulinière 2006  Bordeaux

description: This firm, structured wine is lean and austere. Spice and toast notes dominate, leaving little room for fruit. It's a tough wine to like.
title: Château de Cranne 2015 Château Jeandebout  (Côtes de Bordeaux)

description: Bitter chocolate aromas and woody flavors are the hallmarks of this smoky, burnt toast-inflected wine. That bitter quality probably won't go away, leaving the fruit behind.
title: Château de Fontenille 2015  Cadillac Côtes de Bordeaux

description: This young wine is full of black currant fruit and balanced tannins. It has the richness of high alcohol, which brings out a touch of pepper. But juicy fruit dominates. Drink from 2018.
title: Château Grand Meynau 2016  Bordeaux

description: An unusual find of an old vintage currently available, this is certainly a mature wine. In fact, it is beginning to dry out—focused on old tannins rather than on the wonderful secondary flavors of a well-aged Bordeaux. For lovers of older wines, this is a bargain curiosity.
title: Château Hervé-Laroque 2006  Fronsac

description: This soft and fruity wine may be young, but with its bright red fruits, it's ready to drink. Its juicy red berry flavors are filled with spice and a minty character from wood aging. It finishes with ripe fruitiness.
title: Château Lussan 2016  Bordeaux

description: It is fascinating how some wines from this vintage have gone from youth to old age without passing maturity. That's the case here: this wine is showing age, with tannins that have become dry, leaving the secondary flavors, let alone the fruit, behind.
title: Château Montlisse 2011  Saint-Émilion

description: This wine is dry and smoky, with serious tannins. It is concentrated, with bitter chocolate flavors from the wood aging.
title: Château Sainte-Marie 2015 Alios  (Côtes de Bordeaux)

description: This wine is light and fruity, poised between rich tropical and herbal-laced green fruits. It has a perfumed touch from the Sauvignon Gris in the blend and a crisp texture. Drink from early 2018.
title: Château Vrai Caillou 2016  Entre-Deux-Mers

description: Bold with tannins, this spicy wine is dense and dark. It's all structure and dryness at the moment. And, although the fruit is there, it looks as though the tannins will remain.
title: Xavier Flouret 2015 Château Haut-Meneau Quai Lumière  (Blaye Côtes de Bordeaux)

description: With an attractive pink color and soft acidity, the wine is fruity with red berry flavors and a soft, caramel texture. It's ready to drink while it is still so fresh.
title: Baron Philippe de Rothschild 2013 Le Rosé de Mouton Cadet Rosé (Bordeaux Rosé)

description: This is a hard-edged wine with a chemical character. It's tough both in tannins and extracted fruits.
title: Château Belrose 2012 Cuvée Maucaillou  (Bordeaux Supérieur)

description: The fruit is extremely extracted, making for a wine that is tough, very firm and hard without the juicy character needed to see it through.
title: Château Damase 2012  Bordeaux Supérieur

description: Bread and yeasty aromas lead to a wine that has tannins and wood aging, leaving the fruitiness behind.
title: Château Larteau 2012  Bordeaux Supérieur

description: Strong wood flavors have smothered the fruit, leaving vanilla, spice and milk chocolate as the main flavors. Gérard Laurent blends 65% Cabernet Franc and 35% Malbec from biodynamic and organic vineyards in egg-shaped Apollo flexitanks where the wine matures for a year.
title: Château l'Escart 2012 Cuvée Puits du Roy  (Cadillac Côtes de Bordeaux)

description: Herbal aromas give a crisp character. The fruit is not entirely ripe, so the wine relies on its tannins and acidity to get balance.
title: Château Briot 2012  Bordeaux

description: The wine is extracted and hard. It has a tough character along with some bitterness.
title: Château Penin 2012 Les Cailloux  (Bordeaux Supérieur)

description: A light and fruity wine that is ready to drink. From the heart of the Entre-deux-Mers region, it has red berry fruits and juicy acidity. A greener, herbal character in the background suggests grapes that weren't totally ripe at harvest.
title: Château de Crain 2012  Bordeaux

description: This is hard and tough, all tannins and extraction.
title: Château de la Vieille Tour 2012  Bordeaux Supérieur

description: This tough wine seems light on fruit. It is hard and shows considerable extraction.
title: Chateau le Grand Verdus 2012  Bordeaux Supérieur

description: This is a thin wine with way too much acidity for the fruit. The rest of the wine is dry tannin that could soften into a more juicy character. It's always going to be a light wine.
title: Léo de la Gaffelière 2012  Bordeaux

description: Full in style, this is a lemon-scented, peach-flavored wine. It has some richness to it both from the ripe fruit and the textured acidity that gives a tight tang to the aftertaste. The needs to age for a year. Screwcap.
title: Château La Rose du Pin 2012  Entre-Deux-Mers

description: Austere and firm, this is still many years from being ready to drink. For now, its potential is apparent in the juicy black fruits, dark tannins and solid structure. It has much of the structure of the vintage, well clothed in fuller fruits.
title: Château Lavergne-Dulong 2010  Bordeaux Supérieur

description: Just bottled when tasted, this is a wine that needs a few months to come together. Its ripe pear and apricot fruit and dense flavor will offer a full, rounded wine that goes more for a tropical Sauvignon Blanc character.
title: Calvet 2012 Réserve  (Bordeaux Blanc)

description: The wine shows the power typical of a Lafite but within the context of the fruity 2011 vintage. The immensely dense tannic structure gives the wine a solid feel that is lifted by so much ripe black currant and berry fruits. At the back, the wine has a more brooding, dark character that suggests great aging potential. Drink this wine from 2019.
title: Château Lafite Rothschild 2011  Pauillac

description: So smooth, this is a rich, grandiose wine. Although it is full of black currant fruits and spice flavors, the texture is most impressive. Dusty tannins are integrated with juicy fruits seamlessly. The purest fruit flavors are allied to linear tannins in a precise yet generous way. The wine is evolving beautifully, but do not drink before 2020.
title: Château Pontet-Canet 2011  Pauillac

description: Huge structure, huge potential, a wine that will bring out all the fruit and density of the vintage while remaining very fresh. Black plums are already showing strongly along with the dry core that promises aging. It's serious while alive and bright. Drink this major wine from 2022.
title: Château Léoville Las Cases 2011  Saint-Julien

description: A solidly structured wine, it is both elegant and intensely powerful. It is disclosing its fruitiness slowly, at the moment dense and concentrated. A restrained edge provides complexity and balance. It will need aging, so don't drink before 2022.
title: Château Margaux 2011  Margaux

description: This wine has so many of the structural elements of a Saint-Estèphe, but also is enveloped by ripe fruitiness. Black in color and dense in character, it has sweetness from the plum juice fruits and great acidity. But it is also firm, powerfully projecting a serious potential. Drink from 2022.
title: Château Calon Ségur 2011  Saint-Estèphe

description: There is a lightness about this vintage of Mouton Rothschild. It doesn't take away from its quality but does give the wine poise and an attractive lift. The wine is based on solid tannins, then the ripe fruit builds layers of fruitiness and freshness. It is not likely to be one of the longest-aging Moutons, but it will be delicious. Drink from 2020.
title: Château Mouton Rothschild 2011  Pauillac

description: 92-94 Dark tannins and structure go with the most powerful fruit. Full of ripe berries, this has all the structure and density. The acidity helps it on its way.
title: Château Pontac-Lynch 2010 Barrel sample  (Margaux)

description: 92-94 Very rich in character. The sweetness is there, but masked by the firm structure, the almost tannic texture. Great concentration.
title: Château Rabaud-Promis 2010 Barrel sample  (Sauternes)

description: 92-94 Concentrated tannins, very rich, very firm, very dry at this stage. There is a more juicy character underneath, offering the potential of rich berry fruits. There's a new wood, smoky aftertaste.
title: Château Haut Bages Libéral 2010 Barrel sample  (Pauillac)

description: 92-94 Ripe, juicy aromas, a wine that then offers sweet fruit, great flavors, a ripe wine with blackberry flavors and balanced tannins.
title: Château la Dominique 2010 Barrel sample  (Saint-Émilion)

description: 92-94 Big and tannic, very firm and tough. Yet all the fruit is there, offering great potential. There is a ripe, juicy aftertaste. Under the same ownership as Château Léoville-Poyferré in Saint-Julien.
title: Château Le Crock 2010 Barrel sample  (Saint-Estèphe)

description: 92-94 Sweet and juicy, a wine that has the potential to be delicious. The tannins are certainly prominent, although with good sweetness. Finally very structured.
title: Château Malescot Saint-Exupery 2010 Barrel sample  (Margaux)

description: 92-94 Powerful, very juicy in style, with toasty new wood flavors mingling with the the very ripe fruits. The wine has a bitter, extracted edge that will probably soften with further wood aging.
title: Château Beausejour-Duffau-Lagarrosse 2010 Barrel sample  (Saint-Émilion)

description: 92-94 New, polished wood aromas lead to a wine that has a smooth balance between toast, sweet fruits and a velvet-textured acidity. Delicious.
title: Château Brane-Cantenac 2010 Barrel sample  (Margaux)

description: 92-94 Juicy black fruits, very ripe berries, powered by the darkest tannins. The wine has richness, weight and immense structure.
title: Château Croizet-Bages 2010 Barrel sample  (Pauillac)

description: 92-94 Herbaceous style of wine, a Bordeaux white wine classic style, with crisp grassy Sauvignon Blanc flavors, elegant, not heavy.
title: Château de France 2010 Barrel sample  (Pessac-Léognan)

description: 92-94 A closed up wine, although all the elements are there, promising great final balance, richness and power.
title: Château Guiraud 2010 Barrel sample  (Sauternes)

description: 92-94 Smoky wine, dominated by its dry tannins, seemingly extracted. The wine certainly has weight and power, but the dryness is a major element at this stage. It will need serious aging time.
title: Château Bélair-Monange 2010 Barrel sample  (Saint-Émilion)

description: 92-94 Powerful tannins here, spiced with a considerable amount of new wood. The wine has richness, black chocolate burnt toast flavors along with intense sweet plum fruits.
designation: Barrel sample Les Pagodes de Cos
title: Château Cos d'Estournel 2010 Barrel sample Les Pagodes de Cos  (Saint-Estèphe)

description: 92-94 Packed with tannins, new wood and a dense character, this is going to be a wine for the long-term. It has all the power, although with a softer side in the final fruitiness.
title: Château d'Arsac 2010 Barrel sample  (Margaux)

description: 92-94 There is power and richness here, the wine has weight, delicious ripe fruits and a smooth texture. Under that surface is the powerful, dense texture.
title: Château Ferrière 2010 Barrel sample  (Margaux)

description: 92-94 A hugely fruity wine, very rich, concentrated and dense. It has great power and richness, the berry fruits racing with ripeness.
title: Château Fonbadet 2010 Barrel sample  (Pauillac)

description: 92-94 Big, firm, with dense tannins that underly the ripe, dark berry and plum skin fruit flavors. Very powerful, the almost shocking acidity a cutting edge of freshness. Hugely juicy aftertaste.
title: Château la Pointe 2010 Barrel sample  (Pomerol)

description: 92-94 Dark, dry wine initially with austerity. Then the bright berry fruits come from behind the severe façade to give a structured, still luscious wine.
title: Château Lagrange 2010 Barrel sample  (Saint-Julien)

description: 92-94 A rich and firm wine, packed with dark tannins, wood flavors, very concentrated and dense. The sweet, smoky character comes through to give opulent black fruits.
title: Château Lynch-Moussas 2010 Barrel sample  (Pauillac)

description: 92-94 Ripe blackcurrants, powerful fruit, with great acidity and enticing dusty tannins. The wine brings out juicy Merlot flavors, with a more concentrated element.
designation: Barrel sample Alter Ego de Château Palmer
title: Château Palmer 2010 Barrel sample Alter Ego de Château Palmer  (Margaux)

description: 92-94 Very structured wine, its fruit tannins dominant. It has power and extreme concentration. Dark and dense.
title: Château Siran 2010 Barrel sample  (Margaux)

description: 92-94 Spice, smoky fruit, with great acidity, a wine that offers richness, structure, powerful tannins and already some delicious blackberry fruits.
title: Château Smith Haut Lafitte 2010 Barrel sample  (Pessac-Léognan)

description: 92-94 A luxurious wine, acidity and sweet plum fruits rolling together into a fine, beautiful structure. It has toughness, to be sure, while it is the glamorous surface that is immediately attractive.
title: Château Talbot 2010 Barrel sample  (Saint-Julien)

description: 92-94 This is rounded, ripe, a densely tannic mineral wine, very intense. It is tense, structured, firm, promising long aging.
title: Les Astéries 2010 Barrel sample  (Saint-Émilion)

description: 92-94 With huge tannins, very dark fruits, powerful and concentrated. The wine is ripe, juicy and firmly tannic.
title: Château Certan de May de Certan 2010 Barrel sample  (Pomerol)
winery: Château Certan de May de Certan

description: 92-94 Great dusty tannins, almost too powerful, very solid in character. The wine is chunky, allowing juicy fruits to show. It is a dry wine, certainly not hard.
title: Château Cheval Blanc 2010 Barrel sample Le Petit Cheval  (Saint-Émilion)

description: 92-94 Great acidity here, the wine has freshness as well as dried apricot and peach flavors, very honeyed. Excellent acidity to finish.
title: Château de Malle 2010 Barrel sample  (Sauternes)

description: 92-94 Hugely aromatic, a wine that manages to combine freshness, lightness and density. It is deliciously fresh, then offering a fine, ripe dried fruit aftertaste.
title: Château de Myrat 2010 Barrel sample  (Barsac)

description: 92-94 Spice and mint aromas with blackberry fruit, new wood and a polished character. The acidity is delicious, refreshing.
title: Château Faugères 2010 Barrel sample  (Saint-Émilion)

description: 92-94 Sweetly juicy wine, the new wood giving high toast to the black currant flavors. It is on the elegant side, although the new wood needs to be tamed to let the fruit come through.
title: Château Giscours 2010 Barrel sample  (Margaux)

description: 90-92 Barrel sample. There is attractive spicy wood here, piled with acidity, great blackcurrant characters. The wine is balanced, fresh and fruity.
title: Château Bourgneuf 2008 Barrel sample  (Pomerol)

description: 90-92 Barrel sample. Fruity, attractively balanced wine, the spice and caramel wood flavors fitting well into the sweet, berry fruits.
title: Château Cantemerle 2008 Barrel sample  (Haut-Médoc)

description: 90-92 Barrel sample. Tight tannins set the scene for a wine that is firm, but with delicious blackcurrant fruit flavors. The tannins are dry under this freshness. Very vivid aftertaste.
title: Château Carbonnieux 2008 Barrel sample  (Pessac-Léognan)

description: 90-92 Barrel sample. Balanced, open wine, full of ripe blackcurrant fruits. It has a fine, rich density which shows well alongside the acidity of a young wine. It finishes with delicious black fruits.
title: Château d'Armailhac 2008 Barrel sample  (Pauillac)

description: 90-92 Barrel sample. Very jammy fruit, where the sweetness seems to dominate. It is accessible, the tannins open, opulent, with a ripe structure. It works though, as a rich wine.
title: Château Fonplégade 2008 Barrel sample  (Saint-Émilion)

description: 90-92 Barrel sample. Big, ripe fruits, spiced with new wood, a big-hearted blackberry wine, sweet tannins, potentially generous.
title: Château Larcis Ducasse 2008 Barrel sample  (Saint-Émilion)

description: 90—92 Barrel sample. Named after the limestone, Astéries, which dominates this small vineyard. The wine is mineral, tannic, somewhat austere at this stage, with dry tannins.
title: Les Astéries 2006 Barrel sample  (Saint-Émilion)

description: 90-92 Barrel sample. As often, Magdelaine is a wine that is on the austere side, emphasizing minerality, not showing much at this stage. The acidity is tight, opening slowly to blackcurrant flavors.
title: Château Magdelaine 2008 Barrel sample  (Saint-Émilion)

description: 90-92 Barrel sample. Along with the new wood flavors, the wine has rich fruit, spiced with dried figs, dark berries and a rounded, fruitcake character. There's a good touch of perfume to lift the finish.
title: Château Siran 2008 Barrel sample  (Margaux)

description: 90-92 Barrel sample. Great density here, this wine is big and powerful, but all held together by rich fruit. It is concentrated, the dry tannins a part of a richer whole.
title: Clos des Jacobins 2008 Barrel sample  (Saint-Émilion)

description: 90-92 Barrel sample. Austere and mineral, this is a tight wine, held by bonds of tannin. The structure is based upon dark plum skins, as well as potentially rich fruit.
title: Clos Fourtet 2008 Barrel sample  (Saint-Émilion)

description: 90—92 Barrel sample. Fresh, rich, with attractive acidity and crisp, green apple and cream flavors. Well balanced, this wine shows excellent botrytis and sweetness properly together.
title: Château de Myrat 2006 Barrel sample  (Barsac)

description: 90—92 Barrel sample. Go to this wine for freshness, crispness. It tastes like a Loire Sauvignon Blanc in its freshness, but adds to that with some toast.
title: Château Latour-Martillac 2006 Barrel sample  (Pessac-Léognan)

description: 90—92 Barrel sample. Vibrantly fruity wine that shows freshness. It has lift, fresh blackcurrants, layers of acidity, while the tannins hide in the background.
title: Château Les Carmes Haut-Brion 2006 Barrel sample  (Pessac-Léognan)

description: 90—92 Barrel sample. Dry botrytis is the theme here, with richness rather than sweetness. Somewhere under all that dryness is acidity and flavors of sweet pears, but these are a long way off.
title: Château Suau 2006 Barrel sample  (Barsac)

description: 90-92 Barrel sample. On the austere side initially, but then ripe fruit comes through, giving a wine that has potential power. There is a suspicion of super-ripe Merlot, a plump cushion. But the tannins will keep it together.
title: Château Canon 2008 Barrel sample  (Saint-Émilion)

description: A ripe, spicy wine, this balances its rich tropical fruits with tense acidity and wood toast. It's full and rounded yet finely tangy and taut. With this structure, the wine should age over many years.
title: Château Bouscaut 2009  Pessac-Léognan

description: This is full and rounded initially, then the more textured notes of green fruit skin and wood spice come through. It has an attractively ripe feel while remaining structured. At the same time, the wine is developing fast and will be ready to drink in 3–4 years.
title: Château Carbonnieux 2009  Pessac-Léognan

description: Impressive dusty tannins offer a structured counterpoint to the deliciously ripe fruits and sweet berry flavors that stand out in this wine. It has great concentration as well, a powerhouse of firm structure and gorgeous fruit.
title: Château Bouscaut 2009  Pessac-Léognan

description: A wine that is both fruity and almost approachable now, it is packed with the great structure of Pauillac Cabernet Sauvignon. It's rich and firmly tannic, layering plums and blackberries within a dark texture. This should be aged for at least five years.
title: Château Béhèré Courtin 2010  Pauillac

description: While displaying strong herbaceous Sauvignon Blanc flavors, the wine is also rich with fruitiness, offering a delicious series of green fruits followed by pineapple and tropical flavors. It's a wine that's right up front, crisp and bright at the end.
title: Château la Garde 2012  Pessac-Léognan

description: A richly smoky wine, with all its juiciness surrounded by dark tannins. Despite a dominance of Merlot, this is still intensely structured. The wine has so much richness as well as acidity.
title: Château Pibran 2009  Pauillac

description: Structured wine with a severe edge from the dry, concentrated tannins. It's serious, stalky fruit layered with a more juicy element and tight acidity. The wine does need aging to soften its austere character.
title: Château Tour de Guiet 2010 Excellence  (Côtes de Bourg)

description: The spice of this wine shows most. Add that to its good acidity and lively texture, and the wine will be delicious and rounded in a few months time. Drink from late 2017.
title: Château des Arras 2016  Bordeaux Blanc

description: This wine is soft and rounded. It does have plenty of acidity but that is only a part of a ripe, smooth whole. The lemon fruitiness and touch of spice give the aftertaste a great lift.
title: Château Lauduc 2016  Bordeaux Blanc

description: Taut and with its youthful acidity still up front, this wine has good potential. Its crisp acidity and lively, bright character all promise well. Drink from late 2017.
title: Dourthe 2016 La Grande Cuvée  (Bordeaux Blanc)

description: While this is packed with ripe fruit, it is balanced with a dense tannic underlay and judicious wood aging. With this structure, the wine should age for several years.
title: Château Ambe Tour Pourret 2009  Saint-Émilion

description: Hints of fresh mint leaves highlight the brooding black currant and dark fruit aromas. The balance of Cabernet and Merlot has been successfully achieved, as the wine is beautifully structured with a firm backbone of ample tannins and a rich, supple mouthfeel.
title: Barons Edmund Benjamin de Rothschild 2003 Kosher  (Haut-Médoc)

description: Rich blackberry and black-currant flavors give this wine its ripe character. They are already well balanced by the spicy tannins and dry core. The wine will develop well and should be ready from 2019. This is the last vintage under the Fournier-Casteja family. In December, Birot was sold to Miaolin Chen's New Century Tourism Group based in Hangzhou, China.
title: Château de Birot 2014  Cadillac Côtes de Bordeaux

description: Tight tannins dominate this highly scented wood-aged wine. It has rich blackberry flavors, spice and perfumed acidity. The juicy fruits are bright and will soften into the rich texture over the next few years. Drink from 2019.
title: Château des Arnauds 2014 Cuvée des Capucins  (Lalande de Pomerol)

description: The wine from Denis Coudroy's 10 acres of vines is perfumed from new wood, with a polished character and bright fruit flavors. Underneath the wood, there is plenty of black-currant juiciness and fresh acidity. Drink this attractive wine from 2019.
title: Château Glorit 2014  Blaye Côtes de Bordeaux

description: There is plenty of ripe fruit here. With soft tannins and a generous structure, the wine is rich, full of berry and red-plum flavors and with just enough tannins. Give this fruity wine until 2018.
title: Château le Roudier 2014  Bordeaux Supérieur

description: The Jonck family's wine is dense and still young with firm tannins. It has excellent potential because the ripe berry fruits are right there to give richness and flesh out the tannins. Spice and acidity fill the background. Drink this fine wine from 2019.
title: Château l'Espérance 2014 Espérance  (Blaye Côtes de Bordeaux)

description: This 50-50 Sauvignon Blanc and Sémillon is a rich wine that is full of lightly peppered ripe apple and pear flavors. It feels generous while being full in the mouth with good concentration and crisp acidity. Drink now.
title: Vignobles Carreau Selection 2015 Château l'Escadre  (Blaye Côtes de Bordeaux)

description: Possibly too rich, this is a full, sumptuous wine. It has great weight, density, a smooth, wood-aged character that shows through the sweet plums. For what it is, a very rich wine that shows some pepper alcohol—it offers a juicy character and ageability. Drink from 2016.
title: Château Canteloup 2010  Blaye Côtes de Bordeaux

description: A fresh and fruity wine with soft tannins and black currant fruits. The wine has the warmth of the vintage, giving some roundness the texture and stalkiness which would be more apparent in a lesser vintage. Drink now and until 2018.
title: Château Grand Picard 2009  Bordeaux

description: Firmly tannic, the wine shows the structure of the vintage well. It also brings out red berry fruits, with a herbal character that cuts the richness. The wine needs time, so drink from 2015.
title: Château Laffitte Laujac 2010 L de Laffitte Laujac  (Médoc)

description: A dense, juicy wine, with blackberry flavors right up front. The wine has weight, well-integrated tannins, firmness and structure. Drink from 2015.
title: Château Landonnet 2011  Côtes de Bordeaux

description: While the wood aging and toast do show, this wine is also rich. Black fruits give a juicy, flavorsome character, an opulence that is finished with some acidity. Drink from 2016.
title: Château Saincrit 2012 Réserve  (Bordeaux Supérieur)

description: Very herbaceous in character, this is a wine that has richness, intensity and the balance of a mineral texture and tight acidity. It's a wine that needs food with its structure and tangy aftertaste.
title: Maison Malet Roquefort 2012 Léo de la Gaffelière  (Bordeaux Blanc)

description: This Bordeaux white is heavily oaked, and it's therefore overloaded with coconut aromas, creamy custard and pear flavors, and a taste of banana on the finish. At every point along the way the wood towers over the fruit, which ultimately makes the wine duller than it could be.
title: Château de Rochemorin 2000 White  (Bordeaux Blanc)

description: This is a mature, wood-aged wine. It is rich in yellow fruits and toast flavors. It does retain a crisper, citrus side that keeps it fruity. The wines are vegan (no animal products in production). It is ready to drink.
title: Chateau Haut Rian 2013 Excellence  (Bordeaux Blanc)

description: The fact that there is 60% Cabernet Franc in this blend gives the wine a real perfumed attractiveness. It is fruity and light, with a crisp lively character. Red berries and plenty of acidity leave a fresh aftertaste. Drink now.
title: Château Landereau 2015 La Vie en Rose Rosé (Bordeaux Rosé)

description: The wine is full of bright fruit and acidity. It does still have a dry tannic core that gives it a firm character. The juicy acidity and crisp texture show it is still young. Drink from late 2017.
title: Château Tour Chapoux 2014  Bordeaux

description: Sémillon, so adept at producing botrytized grapes for sweet wines gives its richness and fine apricot flavors to this ripe wine. Sweet while kept from cloying by its acidity, it is an opulent wine, with honey and fine almond and marzipan flavors at the end. Drink from early 2017.
title: Cheval Quancard 2015  Premieres Côtes de Bordeaux

description: A Sauvignon Blanc-dominated wine that is crisp while also having some weight and fatness from the Sémillon in the blend. It is full of fruit, with lemon and crisp apple flavors. The aftertaste is tight and tangy with lemon zest.
title: Exem 2015  Bordeaux Blanc

description: The wine has simple red-berry flavors and a light layer of tannins. The acidity is probably too intense—a product of the vintage. But it is an attractive wine to drink now, finishing with its crisp aftertaste.
title: Château de Chambrun 2013  Lalande de Pomerol

description: This wine is soft and ripe, with juicy black fruit and fresh acidity over a background of firm tannins. A smoky edge adds to its attractiveness.
title: Château Berthenon 2015 Cuvée Henri  (Blaye Côtes de Bordeaux)

description: Big, bold and spicy, this wine is ripe with black fruit. Tannins and a rich texture confirm its upfront style. Likely to take its time to develop, it will be ready to drink from 2020.
title: Château Glorit 2015  Blaye Côtes de Bordeaux

description: This wine is closed at this young stage but hints at an underlying richness. That leaves acidity and fragrant lemongrass-like crispness at the fore. It needs time to fill out, so drink from 2021.
title: Château Guiraud 2014 Petit Guiraud  (Sauternes)

description: This is a powerful wood-aged wine. Spice and toast aromas give it a firm character that will need to soften. Its black plum and berry fruit is upfront, with a juicy element that will fill out. Drink from 2020.
title: Château Haut Sociondo 2015  Blaye Côtes de Bordeaux

description: This finely structured wine is ripe and full of blackberry flavors, with a soft, rich texture. That suggests it will age relatively quickly and be ready to drink from 2019.
title: Château La Roche Bazin 2015  Blaye Côtes de Bordeaux

description: Smooth with polished new wood flavors and fine black fruit, this wine has good potential. Subtle tannins back up its black currant and berry fruit. Drink from 2020.
title: Château Magdeleine Bouhou 2015 Grand Vin  (Blaye Côtes de Bordeaux)

description: This wine has intense acidity and a tight texture that will obviously need time to open up, but ripe apricot and honey flavors are present now. Drink from 2021.
title: Château Rabaud-Promis 2014 Raymond Louis  (Sauternes)

description: Ripe while also juicy, this is a fruity wine that is full of red fruits and a spicy texture from wood aging. Drink from 2019.
title: Vignobles Arno 2014 Château Godard Bellevue  (Francs Côtes de Bordeaux)

description: This is a perfumed wine with mint flavors from the wood aging. It has black-currant fruitiness that brings out acidity as well as tannins. The aftertaste is still young and fruity and the wine needs to age until 2017.
title: Château Carignan 2013  Cadillac Côtes de Bordeaux

description: This is a rich juicy wine. It has red berry fruits and jammy acidity that integrates well with the soft tannic structure. It's a wine to drink soon, so just wait until early 2017.
title: Château des Antonins 2014  Bordeaux Supérieur

description: Fresh with fine acidity, this is a crisp wine. Red-currant fruit flavors are the dominant character, supported by some firm tannins. It is juicy and perfumed. Drink this Michel Boyer wine from 2018.
title: Château du Cros 2014  Cadillac Côtes de Bordeaux

description: Moulin's gravelly four-acre Merlot plot offered up plenty of fruit for a ripe and smooth wine. It has tannins that are under the red-berry fruits. Hints of wood aging and ripe fruitiness combine to give a wine with good potential. Drink from 2018.
title: Château Grand Moulin 2014 Prélude du Grand Moulin  (Blaye Côtes de Bordeaux)

description: Jean Lissague's blend of 90% Sauvignon Blanc and 10% Muscadelle is soft and full in the mouth with just enough acidity to keep it crisp. Melon and spiced-lemon create a tangy touch that gives the wine an edginess. Drink now.
title: Château Grand Secret 2015 Petit Secret  (Blaye Côtes de Bordeaux)

description: A bright juicy wine, this has acidity, red-berry fruits and a touch of black currants. This is an attractive wine already, just needing a few months to settle down. Drink from 2017.
title: Château Lauduc 2014 Classic  (Bordeaux)

description: This wine has a dual nature, displaying both herbal and citrus characteristics. A crisp texture and some spiciness indicate its youth. It will be better with some age, so drink from 2017.
title: Château les Clauzots 2015  Graves

description: This is a wine with fine tannins and plenty of ripe fruit. It has good potential with fruit and structure working well together. Spice and a rich aftertaste suggest a wine that will be fine from 2018.
title: Château Montlau 2014  Bordeaux Supérieur

description: This is a fruity wine, full of red-berry flavors and with some smoky tannins in the background. It is balanced between the wood aging and the berry and red-cherry fruitiness. Drink from 2017.
title: Château Terres Douces 2014  Bordeaux

description: The wine has good ripe red fruits as well as layers of tannin. It has some concentration and weight behind juicy acidity. It will develop well and should be ready from 2017.
title: Domaine de Courteillac 2014  Bordeaux Supérieur

description: A wine that seems lean, even angular at first. It does, though, have a good depth of black plum skin fruits. The finish continues the tough theme, showing that it needs several years of softening up.
title: Château Croizet-Bages 2008  Pauillac

description: This is very black currant in character, with crisp fresh fruits to go with the bright acidity. There are tannins certainly, lightened by the fruity character of the wine.
title: Château d'Armailhac 2008  Pauillac

description: Foursquare, solid wine, its tannins tight and severe. There is good weight, with red berry fruits under the formidable exterior. To watch as it softens and opens.
title: Chateau Dauzac 2008  Margaux

description: A finely structured wine, well spiced with ripe berry fruits and intense but balanced acidity. This is stylish, attractive and is worth aging for 3-4 years.
title: Château Labat 2008  Haut-Médoc

description: Spicy, with wood there as well as tannins, this is a dark, extracted wine. There is stalkiness, balanced with dense berry fruits and final acidity.
title: Château Latour-Martillac 2008  Pessac-Léognan

description: For a Lalande de Pomerol this wine has a high proportion (30%) of Cabernet Franc, giving a structure that shapes the ripe Merlot. It's juicy with black plums and has a core of dry tannins. Drink from 2018.
title: Château Tournefeuille 2013  Lalande de Pomerol

description: Situated close to the city of Bordeaux, this estate has produced a Cabernet-dominated wine that has some firm tannins and a dry core. The black-currant fruit shows well, with fresh acidity giving a juicy character. It will soften quickly, so drink from 2017.
title: Château Bellegrave du Poujeau 2013  Haut-Médoc

description: With an equal blend of Merlot and Cabernet Sauvignon, this firm wine has a juicy background, nurtured by consultant Hubert de Boüard (of Château Angelus). Chocolate and spice notes mix with the dry wood-aging character, while black currant flavors develop in the background. Give this wine until 2017.
title: Château de Chantegrive 2011  Graves

description: The enthusiastic use of wood for this wine gives a dark, spicy character that masks any fruit. Less new wood would have helped highlight the natural fruitiness of the wine. Leave it until 2020 and the fruit may fill out. Winemaker Stephan Carrier returned from Napa to take over winemaking after Irish businessman Lochlann Quinn bought the property in 2001.
title: Château de Fieuzal 2013  Pessac-Léognan

description: This wine is full of bright fruit and attractive acidity. It's been made to take advantage of the fruitiness of the year and is likely to develop quickly. Drink from 2018.
title: Château Ferrière 2013  Margaux

description: While the tannins are still firm, this has the potential to be a fruity wine with attractive acidity. A juicy character will allow the wine to develop quickly. Sylviane Garcin-Cathiard also owns Clos L'Église in Pomerol, Château Barde-Haut in Saint-Émilion and Château Branon in Pessac Léognan.
title: Château Haut-Bergey 2013  Pessac-Léognan

description: While showing too much wood at the moment, this wine has potential. The red berries and black currants promise a fruity future with good tannins in support. Give the wine a few years and drink from 2019.
title: Château Larrivet Haut-Brion 2013  Pessac-Léognan

description: After the promise of the wine at its initial barrel tasting, this bottled wine is less exciting. Berry fruits are muted by the extracted tannins. It's likely the wine will develop quickly. Drink from 2018.
title: Château Lynch-Moussas 2013  Pauillac

description: While this wine has wood aromas, the palate also shows plenty of fruit. That combination gives it weight, spice and red-currant flavors along with juiciness. The wine has plenty of development ahead. Drink from 2019.
title: Château Mouton Rothschild 2013 Le Petit Mouton  (Pauillac)

description: This wine is perfumed with a high proportion of Cabernet Franc, giving structure and tannins as well as blackberry fruits. Like all the wines of the vintage, it is fruity although it balances that characteristic with the tight final texture. Drink from 2019.
title: Château Nenin 2013  Pomerol

description: This is a dense wine, full of blackberries and ripe tannins. Juiciness gives the wine the fruitiness that's typical of the best of the vintage. Acidity at the end emphasizes the freshness. Drink from 2017.
title: Château Trois Moulins 2013  Haut-Médoc

description: Bright and fruity, this wine is attractive in black currant flavors. With its juicy balance of acidity and open fruit, it is developing quickly and will be ready from 2019.
title: Château Lacaussade Saint-Martin 2015 Trois Moulins  (Blaye Côtes de Bordeaux)

description: This fine estate has produced a ripe, fruity wine in 2014. It has spice from wood aging as well as juicy black currant fruit flavors. Generously textured, it's ready to drink.
title: Château Landereau 2014  Bordeaux Supérieur

description: This ripe wine is attractively fruity. It has generous tannins that are balanced by black fruit. While not very powerful or dense, it's easy and will be ready to open from 2019.
title: Château Pillebois 2015 Vieilles Vignes  (Castillon Côtes de Bordeaux)

description: This wine is firm, dense and packed with tannins. Juicy acidity lends a crisp character to its dominant black currant fruit. It will take time to soften, so drink from 2020.
title: Château Terre Blanque 2015  Blaye Côtes de Bordeaux

description: With vines close to the Garonne river south of Bordeaux, this small vineyard has produced a light and fruity wine with red berry flavors. It's soft, just lightly tannic and ready to drink now.
title: Clos des Justices 2014  Bordeaux

description: Soft, ripe, red fruit-flavored Merlot gives a round character to this rich wine. It has plenty of spice, juicy acidity and gentle tannins that make it drinkable young.
title: Grand Bateau 2016 Sécret de Grand Bateau  (Bordeaux)

description: Firmly tannic yet with enough sense of juicy fruit to act as a balance, this is a fine, rich wine, showing power and concentration with a solid, ripe structure. Give this wine at least five years to soften and round out.
title: Château Gigault 2010  Blaye Côtes de Bordeaux

description: Big, bold and juicy, with ripe black fruits that dominate the rich tannins. The power and concentration both promise a good future for this solid, full-bodied wine, so keep for 4–5 years.
title: Château Haut la Pointe 2010  Blaye Côtes de Bordeaux

description: While there is a strong element of new wood in this wine, it also has plenty of ripe black fruits. So it makes a wine that is powerful, potentially complex in 4–5 years with richness and a solid, serious final character.
title: Château Hyot 2010  Castillon Côtes de Bordeaux

description: A fruity, structured wine, dense and dark-hued, its black currant fruits giving a sense of lighter acidity. It's just coming into balance, so it will likely age well over the medium term.
title: Château de Ricaud 2010 Réserve des Coteaux  (Cadillac Côtes de Bordeaux)

description: 89-91 Rich and spicy, the wine has ripe balanced fruit, lots of juiciness. A very Merlot, jammy character.
title: Château Siaurac 2010 Barrel sample  (Lalande de Pomerol)

description: 89-91 Tought initially, although the weight of fruit is all there. The dry core spreads outwards, giving a rich, textured feel. Very firm aftertaste.
title: Château Villegeorge 2010 Barrel sample  (Haut-Médoc)

description: 89-91 Herbaceous and fresh, the wine has a grassy character with a citrus edge, spice and grapefruit. It is lively and refreshing.
title: Le Nardian 2010 Barrel sample  (Bordeaux Blanc)

description: 89-91 Firm and structured, plenty of bitter chocolate as well as sweet fruit. The wine is very dense, wearing its tannins on the surface. Power here, dark and firm.
title: Château Belgrave 2010 Barrel sample  (Haut-Médoc)

description: 89-91 Fine tannins, with plenty of juicy fruit. The wine has wonderful sweetness to go with the acidity.
title: Château Bellegrave 2010 Barrel sample  (Pauillac)

description: 89-91 A firm wine, with tight tannins, very structured, showing a mineral edge.
title: Château La Grave à Pomerol 2010 Barrel sample  (Pomerol)

description: 89-91 Solid, chunky wine, with a fine juicy element showing through in the aftertaste. It has weight, structure, a dense texture, and balance.
title: Château Poujeaux 2010 Barrel sample  (Moulis-en-Médoc)

description: 89-91 Smooth, opulent with tannins firmly buried in the sweet acidity. Black plum juice flavors go with the ripe fruits and just a touch of spice.
title: Château Teyssier 2010 Barrel sample  (Saint-Émilion)

description: 89-91 Ripe, soft fruit, the tannin right within the sweetness. It has density without weight, an opulent, ripe wine.
title: Château Citran 2010 Barrel sample  (Haut-Médoc)

description: 89-91 Smoky, firm tannins, with black currant fruits, firmly dark, dry and tannic, with a solid structure.
title: Château de Chantegrive 2010 Barrel sample  (Graves)

description: 89-91 Attractively perfumed, with great acidity and delicious dusty tannins. It is fresh, hinting at wood, spice and blackberry flavors.
title: Château Haut-Simard 2010 Barrel sample  (Saint-Émilion)

description: 89-91 Firmly structured, while also boosted with sweet, smoky fruits and ripe tannins. The wine has style more than power, and the juicy berry fruits give it acidity and a fresh aftertaste.
title: Château Larcis Ducasse 2010 Barrel sample  (Saint-Émilion)

description: 89-91 Soft, open style of wine from one of the largest estates in the Médoc. The wine has fresh berry fruits, tingling acidity, very fresh.
title: Château Larose-Trintaudon 2010 Barrel sample  (Haut-Médoc)

description: 89-91 The wine is all tannins, very severe feeling. The toughness masks the fruit, although there is just a hint of juiciness to finish.
title: Château Phélan-Ségur 2010 Barrel sample  (Saint-Estèphe)

description: 88-90 Acidity and fresh fruit are out of balance with smoky wood. The wine will need to integrate in the coming months, although all the elements are there.
title: Château Maucaillou 2010 Barrel sample  (Moulis-en-Médoc)

description: 88-90 Big, extracted wine, with hard tannins, very firm, tough.
title: Château Peyrabon 2010 Barrel sample  (Haut-Médoc)

description: 88-90 A definite mineral character here, with a wine that boasts a taut structure, pushing beyond the metallic edge of the fruit.
title: Château Romer 2010 Barrel sample  (Sauternes)

description: 88-90 The wine seems to have over-ripe fruit, giving it an unbalanced feel. It does have weight, the tannins offering some structure, while it's the acidity that really gives the wine shape.
title: Château Berliquet 2010 Barrel sample  (Saint-Émilion)

description: 88-90 Spicy, smoky character, with ripe fruit and good acidity. Black plums, and very rich. There is a touch of pepper from the alcohol.
title: Château Bertineau Saint-Vincent 2010 Barrel sample  (Lalande de Pomerol)

description: 88-90 Great acidity runs through what is also a richly concentrated wine. It has weight, density, always with this bright acidity.
title: Château Picque Caillou 2010 Barrel sample  (Pessac-Léognan)

description: 88-90 Solid, chunky wine, firmly tannic and tough. The weight of fruit is there to give promise for the future.
title: Château Cissac 2010 Barrel sample  (Haut-Médoc)

description: 88-90 Spicy, toasty fresh citrus wine. It's light, crisp, with bright final acidity.
title: Château de Chantegrive 2010 Barrel sample  (Graves)

description: 88-90 Dense and dry, a firmly structured wine, packed with tannins and a solid texture. The acidity powers through everything.
title: Château Ferrande 2010 Barrel sample  (Graves)

description: This soft, ripe wine is a blend of 70% Merlot and 30% Cabernet Sauvignon. With black-currant fruit and bright acidity, the wine is fruity and ready to drink.
title: Schröder & Schÿler 2012 Chartron la Fleur Merlot-Cabernet  (Bordeaux)

description: This is an incredibly young wine with its spice and red-berry fruits right up there and still almost just fruit juice. That means that it has the potential to be an attractive, easy, spicy wine and will need to age. It will be best from 2017.
title: Château Grand Jean 2015  Bordeaux

description: There is a lightly toasty character in this wine that gives it a round, full texture. Spice goes along with the green and white-fruit flavors to make an intensely fruity wine that hints at a New World style. Drink now. This is one of 15 Bordeaux chateaus by Crus and Domaines de France.
title: Château Haut Mouleyre 2015  Bordeaux Blanc

description: With vineyards located in the far southeast of the Bordeaux appellation, this wine is very crisp and clean, this is a fruity wine, packed with green plum, citrus and sliced apple flavors. It is ready to drink now with its bright acidity and lightly perfumed aftertaste.
title: Château Lary 2015  Bordeaux Blanc

description: This is an attractive blend that includes a good proportion of ripe Sémillon and perfumed Muscadelle. They soften and deliciously fill out the herbal edge of the wine. That gives it a rich feel, full and fruity with a fragrant aftertaste. Drink now.
title: Château Tour le Pin 2015  Bordeaux Blanc

description: Situated in the southern Médoc village of Macau, on the edge of the deep Margaux gravels, this estate has produced an impressive and structured wine. It is concentrated with its black currants and dark tannins. It is likely to develop slowly over several years. Drink from 2021.
title: Château Belle-Vue 2014  Haut-Médoc

description: This is a tight and firm wine that will take some time to develop. The fruit, an almost equal blend of Cabernet Sauvignon and Merlot, is all present and will fill out over the next few years. It is a serious dense wine with great aging potential. Drink from 2021.
title: Château Cambon la Pelouse 2014  Haut-Médoc
