description: This is a finely perfumed wine. It has a strong sense of structure with its tight tannins. It also has lively crisp red fruits that give both acidity and richness to a wine that will develop well. Drink from 2025.
title: Château Couhins-Lurton 2014  Pessac-Léognan

description: Bold fruits dominate this ripe wine. As an estate under the guidance of Hubert de Boüard of Château Angélus, it has made enormous progress. Big tannins are enveloped in the ripe fruit to give a wine that is sumptuous and rich. Drink from 2023.
title: Château Daugay 2014  Saint-Émilion

description: Owned by Château Mongravey of Margaux, this estate is in Macau in the southern Médoc. The wine is richly fruity, firmly tannic with both wood and fruit tannin. It is dark, dense and complex, a ripe wine that has a great future. Drink from 2022.
title: Château de Braude 2014  Haut-Médoc

description: A good dash of Petit Verdot in the blend has given this fine wine its extra structure. It is still firm and tight at this young stage although the black-currant fruitiness promises much. From vines west of Pauillac, it is impressively solid and dense. Drink from 2022.
title: Château Devise d'Ardilley 2014  Haut-Médoc

description: A small part of Château Peyrabon (Haut-Médoc) is in the Pauillac appellation and is vinified and bottled separately. The wine delivers great fruit and equal richness. It is spice, packed with black plum and berry flavors. It is a powerful dense wine to age for several years. Drink from 2023.
title: Château La Fleur Peyrabon 2014  Pauillac

description: This estate is under the same management as the neighboring large vineyard of Larose Trintaudon. The wine is stylish with ripe fruit that is balanced with fine acidity. It has structure from a core of tannins that are just beginning to soften. The wine will be ready to drink from 2020.
title: Château Larose Perganson 2014  Haut-Médoc

description: With vines in the village of Lamarque close to the Gironde estuary, this estate is well placed to benefit from the warmth of the water. The wine, a blend of 55% Cabernet Sauvignon and 40% Merlot (with the remainder Petit Verdot) is richly structured and dense. It has firm tannins as well as perfumed black-currant fruit. The wine will be ready to drink from 2021.
title: Château Malescasse 2014  Haut-Médoc

description: One of several vineyards owned by the Vauthier family of Château Ausone, this is a tense wine with great structure as well as delicious ripe fruits. It has spice, a smoky edge and the acidity that is so typical of the vintage. Drink this attractive while structured wine from 2023.
title: Château Moulin Saint-Georges 2014  Saint-Émilion

description: A ripe, smooth, smoky wine, in which the fruit is dense, almost sweetly rich. Spicy wood is a strong component, going right above the berry fruit flavors. This is an immediate, fruity, ready-to-drink wine.
title: Barton & Guestier 2006 Thomas Barton Réserve  (Saint-Émilion)

description: The improvements at this property started with this wine. It does show dark, maybe bitter tannins, but at the same time there is some sweet berry fruit, new wood that is balanced and a final flavor that is soft, jellied and fresh.
title: Château de Fieuzal 2006  Pessac-Léognan

description: A light, soft wine, with attractive, ripe fruit. It is not likely to age long, but over the next 2–3 years will develop into a freshly fruity, black plum-dominated wine, which will give great drinking.
title: Château Latour-Martillac 2006  Pessac-Léognan

description: A green wine showing fruits that are underripe. While it has some soft flavors, red berries and simple tannins, that green underlay is a major downside.
title: Château Croizet-Bages 2007  Pauillac

description: Very fresh, with well-judged wood and very juicy fruit, a wine that is almost shocking in its youthful acidity. It bursts in the mouth, fruit and bright.
title: Château de Fonbel 2007  Saint-Émilion

description: This is a disappointment. The wine is tart, stalky and, at the same time, light. It has an edge of green that suggests underripe fruit. Developing fast.
title: Château Siran 2007  Margaux

description: A big, spicy wine, packed with new wood as well as ripe, soft fruit. It's smooth, polished and balanced. Fine tannins add to the structure.
title: Château Beychevelle 2008  Saint-Julien

description: The Pauillac vineyard under the same ownership as Château Peyrabon has produced an impressive 2008. It has power and intensity with the ripe, smooth fruits given muscle by the dark, chewy tannins. It's designed for aging, wait five years at least.
title: Château La Fleur Peyrabon 2008  Pauillac

description: Attractive perfumed wine, rich, soft, generous and opulent. It has powerful, ripe fruit flavors of black berry and sweet plum that gives great richness.
title: Château Nenin 2008  Pomerol

description: Olivier gets better each year, with the 2008 showing concentrated ripe tannins in a rounded structure of delicious black plum fruit. The tannins suggests that the wine could age well.
title: Château Olivier 2008  Pessac-Léognan

description: Lots of new wood here, very spicy, toasty on the nose and palate. There is a dense, firm tannic character as well and the finish offers fresh flavors, typical of 2008. For medium-term aging over 5–7 years.
title: Château Kirwan 2008  Margaux

description: A rounded wine, surprisingly soft for a Pauillac. The tannins are ripe, with chocolate and sweet black currant fruit flavors along with spice and some toast.
title: Château Pibran 2008  Pauillac

description: This is a lightly creamy, fruity wine. With touches of citrus, bitter orange and a good burst of acidity, it is balanced, ripe and ready to drink.
title: Château de Janicon 2011  Graves

description: Bold and juicy, this is a ripe, forward wine. With red berry fruits prominent, it conveys attractive fruitiness. Tannins in the background suggest medium-term aging. Drink from 2016.
title: Château Mazails 2011  Médoc

description: Owned by the Vialard family, this is a very fine wine. While it does have strong wood flavors at this young stage, they are going to be there to support the ripe jammy fruit. The wine from this 111-acre estate is generous and is going to age well. Drink from 2022.
title: Château Cissac 2014  Haut-Médoc

description: Owned by art collector Philippe Raoux, who has filled the park of the chateau with impressive sculptures, this estate produces serious and complex wines. This latest release continues in that tradition. It is rich, structured and full of swathes of black fruit. The wine will take time, so wait until 2021.
title: Château d'Arsac 2014  Margaux

description: This is the second wine of Grand Cru Classé Château la Gaffelière. It revels in ripe juicy Merlot while keeping a sense of style and elegance. Produced by the Malet-Roquefort family, owners since 1705, the wine has some firm tannins while never losing sight of the generous black fruits. Drink from 2022.
title: Château la Gaffelière 2014 Clos la Gaffelière  (Saint-Émilion)

description: This estate, dating to the 18th century and close to the Gironde estuary, has produced a rich wine. Young tannins and fine fruity acidity are both present in a wine that is serious and dense. Its weight, ripeness and the potential of the black-currant fruit will all allow it to age. Drink from 2022.
title: Château Le Boscq 2014  Saint-Estèphe

description: Under the ownership of Jacky Lorenzetti, president of one of France's top rugby clubs, this estate is now performing impressively. The wine is finely structured with dark tannins and tight acidity and a hint of minerality. It is Merlot dominated, although it is the 40% Cabernet Sauvignon that brings out the black-currant fruitiness. Drink from 2022.
title: Château Lilian Ladouys 2014  Saint-Estèphe

description: This second wine of Château Palmer is dense and structured. With ripe swathes of black fruits and juicy Merlot showing strongly, it already displays the potential of the vintage. Generous and ripe, the wine has a fine level of perfumed tannin. Drink from 2023.
title: Château Palmer 2014 Alter Ego de Château Palmer  (Margaux)

description: A forward, fruity red, coming through strongly on black currant, red fruits and soft tannins. It shows its wood aging easily, leaving an aftertaste that has light acidity. Drink now and until 2019.
title: Exem 2011  Bordeaux

description: A very herbaceous, fish-friendly wine that wins with its lemon and pink grapefruit flavors. It's aromatic and light, with the fruitiness right up front. Screwcap.
title: Barton & Guestier 2012 The Pairing Collection Salmon & Trout  (Bordeaux Blanc)

description: A fruity, strawberry-flavored wine, with crisp acidity to balance the ripe fruit. It's a clean and refreshing rosé, ready to drink now.
title: Château de Cornemps 2012 Rosé (Bordeaux Rosé)

description: The small production of white wine from this estate, owned by the Kressmann family of Latour-Martillac, comes from a deep gravel outcrop. This wine is rich and beautifully ripe. Apricot and juicy pear flavors are backed with the wood aging. It is just ready to drink.
title: Château Langlet 2014  Graves

description: A truly grassy aroma leads to a fresh, herbaceous and crisp wine. To top its crispness, it also has some weight, wood flavors and a creamy core with a white pear texture. It could benefit from aging, at least three years, to bring out the inherent richness of the wine.
title: Château Haut-Bergey 2007  Pessac-Léognan

description: Dense and dry, this is a tough, extracted wine. It has a hard edge followed by juicy acidity and will probably remain on the dry side.
title: Château Grand Bourgeau 2015  Blaye Côtes de Bordeaux

description: This ripe wine is fruity, with both citrus and tropical flavors. Light and bright, with a crisp, tangy texture, it's ready to drink.
title: Château Grand Bourgeau 2016  Bordeaux Blanc

description: The spicy wood aroma that shows strongly on the nose of this wine is confirmed on the palate, as it seems to have spent too much time in barrels. The fruit has been neglected and is dry. It will open up with time, although the dryness will probably remain.
title: Château le Piat 2015  Côtes de Bourg

description: Barrel aged for 12 months, this 95% Merlot wine (with a dash of Cabernet Franc) is very dominated by its wood. That gives it a seriously toasty character that dominates the fruit. At five years old, it should be more balanced.
title: Château Valade 2012  Saint-Émilion

description: With a few years in bottle, this is maturing well. It has ripeness, the tannins beginning to soften into rich spice and damson jelly flavors. The acidity is still very present as is the dry core.
title: Chateau de Launay 2005 Les Vignes de Julia  (Bordeaux Supérieur)

description: Packed with dry tannins and a dense structure, here is a wine that has weight and potential richness. There is some good weight of blackberry fruits. If drinking now, it needs to open out in a decanter or glass.
title: Château de Parenchère 2009  Bordeaux Supérieur

description: This is certainly a rich wine, the yellow peach flavors ripe and concentrated. But there is also a hard core where the botrytis dominates and makes for a tight character. It is missing charm.
title: Château d'Arche 2006  Sauternes

description: The fresh, soft fruit is already drinkable and the tannins are light, as is the texture of the wine. The red berry flavors are attractively integrated, leaving simple freshness.
title: Chateau Desmirail 2006  Margaux

description: This austere wine broods on its black fruits and comes up with a dry character. The structure is the main element, tied into minerality, black plum skins, only showing freshness and juicy fruits on the vivid finish.
title: Château la Gurgue 2006  Margaux

description: A structured wine that gives pleasure from its ripe blackberry fruits as well as from its firm, food-friendly, spicy tannins. It has vibrant, vivid acidity that lifts the dense structure and gives an elegant feel to the close.
title: Château Lacombe Noaillac 2006  Médoc

description: Strong aromas of new wood are confirmed by the palate, where wood flavors dominate. This is a structured wine, showing fruit acidity under the wood and sufficient weight of red berry fruits to come through in another six months.
title: Château Leboscq 2006  Médoc

description: With its high proportion of Merlot, this is a slinky, rich wine, smooth and ripe. Yes, there are tannins, but the jammy fruit softens the dark corners. It should age, but is not for the long-term.
title: La Fleur de Boüard 2005  Lalande de Pomerol

description: A beautiful, velvet-textured wine, with its dense fruit, enticing and attractive. But the wine, from the 5-acre parcel owned by actor Gérard Depardieu, is balanced, with a good layer of dry tannins, fresh acidity and subtle hints of the new wood used in the aging.
title: Ma Verité 2004  Haut-Médoc

description: This is more about elegance than power, a fresh wine with sweet fruit, and so elegant. The tannins do promise some good aging, but this is not a long-term wine. Hold for 8–10 years, but it is already a pleasure to drink.
title: Domaine de Chevalier 2005  Pessac-Léognan

description: The ancient vineyard of Tour Carnet, first planted in the 15th century, is into a renaissance. This wine, which showed too many tannins when in barrel, is now coming to life. The balance, the acidity and the seductive perfumes promise plenty. So does the structure, just hinting at bitterness, a function of its youthfulness. Keep for 5–8 years.
title: Chateau La Tour Carnet 2004  Haut-Médoc

description: Rich, full and dense, this shows considerable elegance as well as power. The fruits are black, with a strong edge of acidity, but also concentrated. There is a smooth layer of wood that adds to the complexity as well as opening the wine.
title: Château Fonréaud 2005  Listrac-Médoc

description: Soft and generously ripe, the yellow and white fruits dominate this open wine. The structure comes from green plum flavors, leaving a crisp aftertaste.
title: Château Malartic-Lagravière 2005  Pessac-Léognan

description: A delicious, smooth, ripe wine, almost lush with its opulent tannins and juicy raspberry fruits. There is just a core of firmness inside all this softness, but this remains an instantly attractive wine.
title: Château Marbuzet 2005  Saint-Estèphe

description: There is great balance among all the ripe fruit flavors, elegance among the power. For a Pomerol stuffed with ripe Merlot, this is powered as much by its fresh fruit as by its richness. A delicious wine that lingers long in the mouth.
title: Château le Bon Pasteur 2004  Pomerol

description: This 100% Merlot from the Entre-deux-Mers, made in the style of a grand cru, is rich, spicy and full of superripe blackberry flavors. From low yielding, high density vines, it is big and concentrated, with hints of wood under the weight of the fruit.
title: Girolate 2005  Bordeaux

description: This is the second wine of Vieille Cure, one of the leading Fronsac estates. It is aging well, moving from fruit to mature, secondary flavors, softening in the process. Wood aging has balanced the blackberry fruit with spice and made it ready to drink.
title: Château la Vieille Cure 2012 Sacristie de la Vieille Cure  (Fronsac)

description: From a château that has vineyards in both Blaye and Bourg, this wine is redolent of black currant, both on the nose and on the palate. The wood and tannins lend support, giving plenty of space for the ripe fruitiness and juicy acidity. Drink from 2020.
title: Château Métairie Neuve 2015  Blaye Côtes de Bordeaux

description: This second wine from the estate offers spice and mushroom aromas that indicate it's now mature. Ripe and smooth, with attractive secondary flavors, it's spicy, meaty and ready to drink.
title: Château Valade 2012 L'Etendard de Château Valade  (Saint-Émilion)

description: Bordeaux wine should not have high alcohol; it detracts from the play between fruit and tannins, as in this wine. It is powered by its extracted structure, with flavors of bitter chocolate that leave the fruit behind.
title: Château des Landes 2009 Cuvée Prestige  (Lussac Saint-Émilion)

description: Firm and structured, this wine has strong wood-aging spice and ripe tannins. The fruit is suppressed by the toasty wood flavors, but it holds hints of black currant fruitiness for the future. Drink from 2015.
title: Château Fleur la Forge 2012 Réserve  (Bordeaux)

description: Young and fruity, this wine can be enjoyed now for its fruitiness or aged over 2–3 years. The attractive black-currant flavor is pleasant now.
title: Augey 2011  Bordeaux

description: A textured wine, this has ripe fruit that still shows a green, herbal character. It has weight and a ripe black-currant flavor, plus juicy acidity and soft tannins. Ready to drink.
title: Bernard Magrez 2010 Maison Magrez  (Bordeaux)

description: Dark and structured, dense and tannic this has considerable structure, but it's unlikely to age.
title: Château Bel Air Moulard 2009  Bordeaux

description: A very herbaceous character makes this wine seem rather thin. It's soft and lightweight, and the lemon zest character is mildly attractive. Ready to drink.
title: Château de Virecourt 2011  Bordeaux Blanc

description: This exhibits stalky fruit, with some weight behind it. A black currant flavor dominates, with a ripe, jammy feel. For short-term aging.
title: Les Hauts de Lagarde 2011  Bordeaux

description: Lean, with severe tannins and fruit, dark and firm and laden with acidity. It is hard to take much pleasure from this austere wine.
title: Château la Bassonnerie 2008  Pomerol

description: Simply fruity Bordeaux. It has signs of wood and black currant fruit along with acidity and a light layer of tannin. Drink now.
title: De Mour 2008 Prince Rubis  (Bordeaux)

description: Peach aromas open a smooth wine. It has acidity certainly but also some good melon and pear ripeness. There is an herbaceous edge that cuts through the finish.
title: Château Dame Jane 2010  Bordeaux Blanc

description: Soft, fruity wine, very smooth, its pear and green plum flavors integrated into acidity along with a light touch of sweetness. Ready to drink.
title: Domaines Barons de Rothschild (Lafite) 2010 Réserve Spéciale  (Bordeaux Blanc)

description: Fresh and citrus crisp, this is a Sauvignon-dominated herbaceous wine. It has a light structure and a texture that brings out vivid lemon zest. Not for aging, drink now.
title: Château de Beauregard-Ducourt 2013  Bordeaux Blanc

description: The wine is rounded and soft with attractive berry fruits and wood aging. It's fruity with juicy acidity, black currant freshness and a dry core that will allow it to age 2017–2018.
title: Château La Rose du Pin 2011  Bordeaux

description: This is turning into an impressive wine as it finds its way between solid tannins and ripe, full black fruits. It is dark and dense at this stage with tannins that dominate. A more juicy character will develop as the wine ages. Drink from 2017.
title: Château Dutruch Grand Poujeaux 2012  Moulis-en-Médoc

description: This solid and powerful wine comes from a chateau right in the walls of Saint-Émilion. A dense texture brings out tannins and the wood-aging flavors. Spice, black currant fruitiness and a dark, dense character all promise aging. Drink from 2018.
title: Château Villemaurine 2012  Saint-Émilion

description: Initially a little rustic, the wine does open out. It is smoky, fruity with the acidity of the vintage.
title: Château Briot 2014  Bordeaux

description: Strawberry fruit flavors dominate this soft wine. It is unfocussed and misses out on clarity and shape.
title: Château la Mothe du Barry 2014 Cuvée Design  (Bordeaux Supérieur)

description: The wine is dry, firm and with too many tannins for its own good. It does have hints of fruit along with spice and acidity. Shame about the over extraction that gives it a bitter aftertaste.
title: Château le Sèpe 2014  Bordeaux

description: This is a lean wine, all tannins and missing fruit. It is dry and showing considerable hard extraction. It will soften, but not much.
title: Château les Berthets 2014  Blaye Côtes de Bordeaux

description: This is a dry wine, firm with tannins and perhaps missing the fruit element. It has a dry core along with acidity. The future will leave it still on the dry side.
title: Château Chatard 2014  Cadillac Côtes de Bordeaux

description: From a 17-acre Merlot-dominated vineyard, this is a dry wine, where the tannins dominate the fruit. The wine has a bitter edge from too much extraction. The hints of fruit are not quite enough.
title: Château des Tourtes 2014 Prestige  (Blaye Côtes de Bordeaux)

description: Structured and lean this is wine that seems to have lost its fruit. It will likely remain dry because of the tough extraction.
title: Château les Bertrands 2014 Cuvée Vieilles Vignes  (Blaye Côtes de Bordeaux)

description: There is some ripe melon fruitiness that gives the wine richness. By contrast, there is little structure or crisp acidity to give it life.
designation: Château la Croix Saint-Pierre Blanc de la Croix Saint-Pierre
title: Vignobles Carreau Selection 2015 Château la Croix Saint-Pierre Blanc de la Croix Saint-Pierre  (Blaye Côtes de Bordeaux)

description: Shooting for wine that will age for at least 15 years, this has too much wood for its own good. Dark and spicy with tough toast, it will likely remain that way. Somebody tried too hard.
title: Château Berthenon 2014 Cuvée Chloé  (Blaye Côtes de Bordeaux)

description: This is a soft wine. It is lightly fruity while tasting dilute and unfocussed. Drink now.
title: Château la Bretonnière 2015  Blaye Côtes de Bordeaux

description: The wine has very ripe fruit that leaves a jammy character. Merlot sweetness dominates and the wine seems unbalanced maybe the result of recent bottling.
title: Château Ad Francos 2014 Château le Priolat  (Francs Côtes de Bordeaux)

description: This Alliance Bourg wine is dry and firm with its concentrated tannins. Too much extraction has left a bitter character. It will remain a wine that is tough.
title: Château Haut Millet 2014  Blaye Côtes de Bordeaux

description: This Merlot/Cabernet Franc blend is a tight closed wine showing tannins rather than fruit. It will remain this way.
title: Château les Grands  Maréchaux 2014  Blaye Côtes de Bordeaux

description: From vines in the heart of the Entre-deux-Mers, the wine is fresh, fruity and light. It has red-currant flavors that are bright and crisp. It's perfumed by the Cabernet Franc that dominates the blend. Drink from 2018.
title: Château Roustaing 2015 Réserve Vieilles Vignes  (Bordeaux)

description: While the wood flavors are prominent, they don't mask the ripe berry fruits in this Merlot-dominant blend. Blaye sister-brother team of Marie-Pierre et Pierre-Charles Dartier produced a wine with a rich character. It is full of wood spice, hints of mint and acidity. Drink from 2019.
title: Château Cailleteau Bergeron 2014 Tradition  (Blaye Côtes de Bordeaux)

description: The wine shows the firm tannins of the vintage. They give a dry core that will probably remain. However, there is also a fine layer of fresh black-currant fruit that gives a fine lift to the wine at the end. It will be ready soon, drink from 2017.
title: Château de Lescours 2011  Saint-Émilion

description: All the elements are present in this young wine. It has plenty of red fruit, touches of plum and spice. The tannins are firm while leaving plenty of room for the fruit. A wine that will be comfortably drinkable from 2018.
title: Château de Parenchère 2014  Bordeaux Supérieur

description: Full of red fruits as well as spicy wood flavors, this is a rich wine that has a fine concentrated texture. It is firm at the moment, showing layers of toast and wood from a year in oak barrels. Allow the ripe fruit to come through and drink from 2019.
title: Château La Caussade 2014  Cadillac Côtes de Bordeaux

description: This is a firm wine, dry and with tight tannins. The fruit weight is still developing and the wine needs time to fully realize its potential. Given time, the fruit will become rich and full. Denis Noël and his kids run the estate, which has been in the family since 1800. Drink from 2019.
title: Château Noël Les Charmes 2014  Blaye Côtes de Bordeaux

description: Full of bright black-currant fruit, this wine shows its young fruitiness, backed by a dry core of tannins and ample acidity. With its structure and spicy wood flavors, it will develop into a complex, dense wine. Drink from 2019.
title: Château Tour Bayard 2014  Montagne-Saint-Émilion

description: This wine is concentrated with both tannins and fruit. With acidity and a fresh aftertaste the fruit is full of black-currant flavors. At the same time, the tannins assure a fine future. Drink from 2019.
title: Vignobles Carreau Selection 2014 Château Les Petits Arnauds Excellence  (Blaye Côtes de Bordeaux)

description: Smoky wood aromas are repeated on the palate. Although prominent, they do not suppress the juicy blackberry flavors and crisp acidity. Already balanced, the wine is likely to mature quickly. Drink from 2017.
title: Château Charmail 2013  Haut-Médoc

description: This wine is dry, dominated by the new-wood flavors and toasty character that hide any fruit. The lean structure will probably remain. The property is owned by the Kressmann family.
title: Château Latour-Martillac 2013  Pessac-Léognan

description: Vines on steep slopes leading down to the Gironde estuary give this estate a good exposure. This wine is structured and laced with firm tannins. It has a balanced character that will allow it to age further, although the black-currant flavors are beginning to shine. Drink from late 2016.
title: Château Moulin Eyquem 2011  Côtes de Bourg

description: This wine just avoids an excessive amount of wood. Instead the wood flavors enhance the black-plum and berry fruits. It is a dry wine, dense and firm. It does need time, so wait until 2018.
title: Château Pierre de Montignac 2013  Médoc

description: This structured wine also has attractive layers of ripe fruits. Black-currant freshness balances with a dry tannic core and a rich juicy texture. It's going to be ready to drink soon, so only wait until 2017.
title: Château Pomeys 2013  Moulis-en-Médoc

description: This is a creamy wine that has attractive fresh apple as well as citrus flavors. It has a tang of lemon zest to give a crisper edge. The aftertaste is fruity, ripe and refreshing.
title: Domaine du Claouset 2014  Bordeaux Blanc

description: Set in the southern half of the Pauillac appellation, this estate still is not expressing the quality of its vineyard location. The wine is firm, lean with tight acidity and dry tannins. It will soften, although not by much.
title: Château Croizet-Bages 2013  Pauillac

description: This structured wine is firm with tannins while also having plenty of room for ripe blackberry fruits. It will develop well, giving a rounded wine that will be ready to drink from 2018.
title: Château de Tourteyron 2013  Médoc

description: It's certainly tannic and tough at the moment, the wine also has so much fruit. That will allow it to round out, bringing out the black currant fruitiness and resulting in a full, rich and perfumed wine. Wait until 2018.
title: Château Lamothe-Bergeron 2011  Haut-Médoc

description: A ripe, smooth and fruity wine that is already delicious in its ripe berry and plum flavors. Touches of new wood show how it is still developing, a burst of vanilla followed by fruity acidity. It will be a full, ripe wine, but give it until 2016.
title: Château Peyredon Lagravette 2011  Haut-Médoc

description: Initially rough around the edges, this wine opens up to give warm red berry fruits, firm tannins and a solid structure. Underlying tannins give a dry core. A more juicy, fresh aftertaste means this wine needs some aging. Drink from 2017.
title: Château Saransot-Dupré 2011  Listrac-Médoc

description: This crisp, balanced wine has lively citrus fruits, light spiciness and some tight, mineral acidity. Drink now.
title: Les Parcelles de Stéphane Derenoncourt 2016  Bordeaux Blanc

description: This textured wine offers tangy, zesty minerality and a dry, nutty edge, making it a wine for food. With its structure and a perfumed aftertaste, it is ready to drink.
title: Maison Bouey 2016 La Vache Rosé (Bordeaux Rosé)

description: There is a touch of toastiness to this otherwise fruity wine, produced by Jean-René Matignon of Château Pichon Baron in Pauillac. It has class as well as attractive tangy acidity and a refreshing citrus backdrop. Drink now.
title: Cap Royal 2016  Bordeaux Blanc

description: Produced with advice from the late Denis Dubourdieu who was instrumental in revolutionizing Bordeaux white wines, this is impressive. The wood aging is just right, giving toast and allowing the ripe fruits to blossom and smooth out. The wine will age well, so don't drink before 2020.
title: Château Picque Caillou 2015  Pessac-Léognan

description: This wine has attractive acidity as well as ripe tannins. It is perfumed and offers structure as well as fresh black-currant fruit. It's still young, with layers of wood still very obvious. This medium-weight wine will need time to develop. Drink from 2019.
title: Château Beychevelle 2013  Saint-Julien

description: With fine, dusty tannins, this rich and juicy wine wears its fruit on its sleeve, all black plums and blackberry flavors. The acidity of the year is almost sweet with the fresh ripeness of the fruit. It is developing well, showing a medium-term future. Drink from 2018.
title: Château Capbern 2013  Saint-Estèphe

description: Fresh, fruity and fragrant, this wine has a pure line of acidity and crisp citrus alongside its tangy texture. The tightness shows its aging potential; drink from 2020. Founded in the 13th century by Benedictine monks, Château Carbonnieux is one of the oldest estates in the Bordeaux region. In 1956, Marc Perrin purchased the château and began vineyard and winery renovations that were continued by son Antony. The property is now run by grandsons Eric and Philibert.
title: Château Carbonnieux 2013  Pessac-Léognan

description: The wine from Vignobles Chatelier is ripe, smooth and well balanced. With its green fruits balanced by apricot, it is a wine that has both tangy acidity and a soft, rounded texture. It is ready to drink.
title: Château d'Arveyres 2015  Bordeaux Blanc

description: A spectacular B&B château is the backdrop for this 100% Sauvignon (Blanc and Gris). The wine has a strongly herbal character with its tense acidity and citrus flavors. It is still developing its even more fruity side, bringing out apple and green-plum flavors. Drink from late 2016. Owned by Groupe Bolian since 2013.
title: Château de la Rivière 2015  Bordeaux Blanc

description: The wine is all green fruit, crisp and with a strong citrus element. Its light tangy texture lifts it easily and gives a bright character to an attractive wine. Drink now. This is one of 15 Bordeaux chateaus by Crus and Domaines de France.
title: Château Laubès 2015  Bordeaux Blanc

description: A blend created for Schröder & Schÿler, a Bordeaux wine merchant founded in 1739, this is soft, ripe with plenty of red berry fruits. It has some firm tannins still although these are rounded out with the juicy fruits and final acidity. It's an attractive wine to drink now.
title: Schröder & Schÿler 2012 Private Réserve  (Médoc)

description: Dating back to the 16th century, this estate's 52-acre vineyard faces the Gironde estuary. The wine is dark, firm and concentrated. The tannins are firm, and hard edged. The acidity and the smoky character of the wine make a fine balance with its tough, young side. Drink from 2019.
title: Château Peyredoulle 2014  Blaye Côtes de Bordeaux

description: The wine has ripe Merlot with red-berry fruit flavors and balanced tannins. It's fresh with the acidity of the year. Here it is contrasted with spice, a smooth surface texture and a ripe cherry aftertaste. This is an attractive wine to drink from 2017.
title: Château Tour Bayard 2013  Montagne-Saint-Émilion

description: Dourthe's 100% Sauvignon Blanc is lively and crisp—a light, bright wine. With its strong citrus flavors, lemon and tangerine, touched by spice, it is balanced and fruity. The texture gives a herbal edge that is attractive and refreshing.
title: Dourthe 2015 La Grande Cuvée  (Bordeaux Blanc)

description: Citrus and apple flavors bring out freshness. A dry white, it conveys a smooth texture, lively acidity and a crisp aftertaste. Drink now.
title: Schröder & Schÿler 2012 Chartron la Fleur  (Bordeaux Blanc)

description: Here's a very rich and full-bodied wine. It does have structure, giving firm tannins to balance the ripe red berry fruits. With this solid character, the wine will age and should be drunk from 2016.
title: Château Barrail Chevrol 2011  Fronsac

description: This is a dry, structured wine, with dry tannins and stalky fruit characteristics. However, it will develop into a fruity wine without great depth but with attractive berry flavors and acidity. Drink from 2016.
title: Château Barreyres 2011  Haut-Médoc

description: Strong wood aromas lead to a wine that is still very young. The smoky wood character dominates the red berry fruits and typical acidity of the vintage. It does have the weight to develop well, so give this structured wine until 2017.
title: Château Bessan Ségur 2011  Médoc

description: A rich style of rosé that has some wood aging and a full-bodied texture. Strawberry fruit flavors dominate. Drink now.
title: Château Brown 2012 Rosé (Bordeaux Rosé)

description: With its tough tannins, this solid wine also shows dark fruits and black plum skins, finishing with fresher acidity.
title: Château Coutelin Merville 2011  Saint-Estèphe

description: Big, bold and very fruity, this is a black-currant-dominated wine. It's full of broad brush strokes of acidity and spice from wood aging. Still young, it needs to be aged. Drink from 2016.
title: Château Leboscq 2011  Médoc

description: While the wood flavors are prominent, they don't mask the ripe berry fruits in this Merlot-dominant blend. Blaye sister-brother team of Marie-Pierre et Pierre-Charles Dartier produced a wine with a rich character. It is full of wood spice, hints of mint and acidity. Drink from 2019.
title: Château Cailleteau Bergeron 2014 Tradition  (Blaye Côtes de Bordeaux)

description: The wine shows the firm tannins of the vintage. They give a dry core that will probably remain. However, there is also a fine layer of fresh black-currant fruit that gives a fine lift to the wine at the end. It will be ready soon, drink from 2017.
title: Château de Lescours 2011  Saint-Émilion

description: All the elements are present in this young wine. It has plenty of red fruit, touches of plum and spice. The tannins are firm while leaving plenty of room for the fruit. A wine that will be comfortably drinkable from 2018.
title: Château de Parenchère 2014  Bordeaux Supérieur

description: Full of red fruits as well as spicy wood flavors, this is a rich wine that has a fine concentrated texture. It is firm at the moment, showing layers of toast and wood from a year in oak barrels. Allow the ripe fruit to come through and drink from 2019.
title: Château La Caussade 2014  Cadillac Côtes de Bordeaux

description: This 24-acre estate has produced an intensely toasty wine. With burnt oak that totally killed the fruit, it has hard to see this wine becoming attractive to drink.
title: Château la Gravette Lacombe 2014  Médoc

description: This is the third wine of classed growth Château Grand-Puy-Lacoste, a charming offspring of the more serious grand vin. It shows lively black fruits, touches of wood and balanced acidity. It's a wine to drink young and fruity, so open from 2016.
title: Domaine de Saint-Guirons 2010  Pauillac

description: Ripe fruit, new wood flavors and a rounded character give this structured and textured wine a fine sense of shape. It has weight, richness and a well balanced texture. Age it for four years.
title: Château La Rame 2011 La Charrulle  (Cadillac Côtes de Bordeaux)

description: Mint aromas and new wood flavors mark this smoothly ripe, polished wine. It has a good amount of black fruit, a dry but open texture and a rich, smoky character. The tannins and generous fruit power the wine forward.
title: Château la Tonnelle 2011  Haut-Médoc

description: Dry and serious, this firm wine is classic Bordeaux. It has weight, a core of tannins and black currant fruitiness that needs time to fully integrate with the dense structure. Give this exemplary wine another five years.
title: Château Landat 2011 Vieilles Vignes  (Haut-Médoc)

description: Opulent richness combines with an aromatic delicacy, with honey, orange and acacia. The freshness and acid-sweetness balance of Castelnau are already accessible.
title: Château Suduiraut 2003 Castelnau de Suduiraut  (Sauternes)

description: Big, broad and ripe, with an opulent texture, flavors of black plums. along with soft tannins and a smooth surface. The wine is developing well, offering rich fruit that will deepen in a couple of years.
title: Château l'Enclos 2007  Pomerol

description: A smooth-textured wine that shows some ripe Merlot, firm fruit tannins and soft spice. There is an edge of wood, but the fruit is bright enough to cope. It should develop well into a rich wine.
title: Château Roylland 2007  Saint-Émilion

description: A big, fruity bold wine, packed with the ripest fruit, concentrated and complex, with room for tight acidity. It has citrus and green plum crispness, and needs time to fully integrate with the wood and ripe yellow fruits.
title: Château Haut-Peyrous 2008 Pêche au Carrelet  (Graves)

description: This rich and generous Grand Cru Classé is full of dark fruit and tannins and is ready to drink. It has weight, juicy acidity and black plum and berry flavors. Ripe, with the perfume of Cabernet Franc, it's entering maturity now and should very drinkable until at least 2025.
title: Château Destieux 2010  Saint-Émilion

description: From a Barsac-based producer who prefers to use the Sauternes appellation, this rich, intense wine has weight, opulence and layers of honey and botrytis flavors. While still young, it shows impressive apricot and liquorous flavors. Drink from 2022.
title: Château Caillou 2014  Sauternes

description: 91-93. Barrel sample. Initially this is just a seductive effort; but then its intensity and structure emerge, creating a wine of great complexity. Its botrytis character adds considerable weight.
title: Château Suau 2011 Barrel Sample  (Barsac)

description: 91-93. Barrel sample. This is big and solid wine, with firm tannins and juicy fruit. It shows spice and intense acidity followed by black-currant freshness.
title: Croix de Beaucaillou 2011 Barrel Sample  (Saint-Julien)

description: 91-93. Barrel sample. This wine's concentrated tannins match the sweet fruit and ripe acidity. It shows structure and density, with its blackberry flavor already showing well.
title: Domaine de Chevalier 2011 Barrel Sample  (Pessac-Léognan)

description: 91-93. Barrel sample. An attractive and fruity wine that offers soft, cushioned tannins, along with ripe, easy fruit.
title: Château Grand-Puy-Lacoste 2011 Barrel Sample  (Pauillac)

description: 91-93. Barrel sample. Big, bold and fruity, this shows plenty of rich blackberry-juice flavor and fine tannins. The fruit and tannins are well balanced, with a juicy character on the finish.
title: Château Lascombes 2011 Barrel Sample  (Margaux)

description: 91-93. Barrel sample. A smooth, rounded wine, this shows opulence with its rich blackberry fruit.
title: Château le Bon Pasteur 2011 Barrel Sample  (Pomerol)

description: 91-93. Barrel sample. This has an herbal character along with spice. It's juicy, with intense acidity.
title: Château Providence 2011 Barrel Sample  (Pomerol)

description: 90-92. Barrel sample. Aromas of new wood mark this wine. On the palate, the tannins are gentle, with flavors of ripe black plum, nutmeg and milk chocolate.
title: Château Beauregard 2011 Barrel Sample  (Pomerol)

description: 90-92. Barrel sample. A juicy and forward wine, with attractive spice and sweet tannins. It's soft and gentle on the palate.
title: Château Canon la Gaffelière 2011 Barrel Sample  (Saint-Émilion)

description: 90-92. Barrel sample. With all the freshness of the year, the wine is ripe and soft. It has acidity and juicy black currant fruits. The wine is spiced; well integrated with ripe tannins.
designation: Les Pagodes de Cos Barrel Sample
title: Château Cos d'Estournel 2011 Les Pagodes de Cos Barrel Sample  (Saint-Estèphe)

description: 90-92. Barrel sample. This wine is laden with tannins yet shows juicy, crisp red-berry flavors. It finishes with great structure.
title: Château Latour à Pomerol 2011 Barrel Sample  (Pomerol)

description: 90-92. Barrel sample. A herbaceous, fruity wine, with its acidity well integrated into the ripe, bright fruits. The wine is light, fresh and crisp, with an attractive lemon-curd note.
title: Château Picque Caillou 2011 Barrel Sample  (Pessac-Léognan)

description: 90-92. Barrel sample. A rounded rich wine, showing the juicy fruit of the year along with rich tannins. It is spicy, lively and impressive.
title: Château Citran 2011 Barrel Sample  (Haut-Médoc)

description: 90-92. Barrel sample. Rich and ripe, the wine has delicious Cabernet flavors. It offers ripe and rounded fruits with juiciness rather than great density.
title: Château Coufran 2011 Barrel Sample  (Haut-Médoc)

description: 90-92. Barrel sample. There are some reductive, meaty aromas on this barrel sample, but the palate still shows the fine potential of this wine. It has all the weight and richness of the vintage, with underlying crisp acidity.
title: Château Filhot 2011 Barrel Sample  (Sauternes)

description: 90-92. Barrel sample. Ripe, rich and soft, this wine has open, juicy fruit and attractive red plum flavors; it already shows its fruity character.
title: Château Giscours 2011 Barrel Sample  (Margaux)

description: 90-92. Barrel sample. A powerhouse of dark tannins, this wine is black in color and dark in taste. It has bitter chocolate flavors, with notes of new wood and intense spice.
title: Château la Couspaude 2011 Barrel Sample  (Saint-Émilion)

description: 90-92. Barrel sample. Dense and concentrated, this is a massive wine that's packed with tannins.
title: Château la Dominique 2011 Barrel Sample  (Saint-Émilion)

description: 90-92. Barrel sample. While certainly powered by tannins, this wine does have a rich, fruity character as well. The finish brings juicy flavors that cut right through the tannins.
designation: La Chapelle de la Mission Haut-Brion Barrel Sample
title: Château La Mission Haut-Brion 2011 La Chapelle de la Mission Haut-Brion Barrel Sample  (Pessac-Léognan)

description: Soft, open wine, with some attractive perfumed character as well as light acidity. It is somewhat unfocused, missing structure. Screwcap.
title: Château Suau 2010  Bordeaux Blanc

description: This is a wine with potential. It has weight and ripe berry fruits balanced with solid tannins and a dense texture. Behind the structure, the fruit and acidity promise good things. Drink from 2016.
title: Château Camelot la Chapelle 2011  Bordeaux

description: Swathes of botrytis reveal themselves seductively on this sweet wine. It is rich in flavors, but still vibrant with acidity. Fine balance and intense flavors of apricots, honey and spice give it potential to age well. Drink from 2015.
title: Château du Seuil 2012  Cérons

description: Solid and dense, this is a concentrated wine. It has black plum flavors and a feeling of ripeness and ease. Sweet acidity shows strongly on the finish. Drink from 2015.
title: Château Feret Lambert 2011  Bordeaux Supérieur

description: This is an open, juicy wine with attractive fruit framed by firm but tamed tannins. The wine has a feeling of lightness, with black currant flavors that are lifted and fresh. This is a wine for medium-term aging. Drink from 2015.
title: Château Gloria 2011  Saint-Julien

description: With a medicinal hint, this is a wine that is all potential. At the moment, it is firm, dry and darkly tannic. The weight gives the promise, offering rich fruitiness in the future. Drink this impressive, concentrated wine from 2016.
title: Château La Croix Lartigue 2011  Castillon Côtes de Bordeaux

description: This is a dense and rich wine full of black plum fruits, rich tannins and a dark structure. It has great potential. Drink from 2016.
title: Château Queyssard 2011  Bordeaux Supérieur

description: Smooth and spicy, this is an attractive, rounded and ripe wine. It has weight and richness from wood and black plum and currant fruits. The acidity is a fine counterpoint. Drink from 2016.
title: Château Roquefort 2011  Bordeaux

description: Now firmly in its new cellars, Clerc-Milon's wine is performing at the top of its form. This is a dense wine with juicy acidity as well as sweet tannins and ripe blackberry fruits. They give a ripe wine that is finely structured. The juicy aftertaste, typical of this vintage, is appealing although it does not detract from its power and longevity. Drink from 2022.
title: Château Clerc Milon 2012  Pauillac

description: This marks an impressive step forward for this wine that's so often been in the shadows of other wines in the Lafite-Rothschild stable. It's dense and structured as well as deliciously fruity. The wine is straight down the line, starting with perfumed acidity and finishing with blackberry fruit. Intense and tannic, it's likely to age. Drink from 2020.
title: Château Duhart-Milon 2012  Pauillac

description: Sumptuous, ripe and very full on the palate, this wine is dense and packed with notes of botrytis that give a strong sense of structure. This well-balanced wine shows potential to age, offering rich acacia honey and beautiful final acidity. Drink from 2020.
title: Château de Rayne Vigneau 2011  Sauternes

description: Big, ripe and juicy, this wears its rich black fruits right up front. A strong and firmly tannic structure serves as a background to the fruit. The wine is rich, complex and full of potential. Spice, ginger and nutmeg come through at the end along with the fruit. Drink from 2022.
title: Château Malartic-Lagravière 2012  Pessac-Léognan

description: A smooth wine, rich for the vintage, with black currant and bright fruits and a strong underlay of wood. The acidity, though, is quite striking, with the freshest fruit and tight tannins.
title: Château Ausone 2007 La Chapelle d'Ausone  (Saint-Émilion)

description: Powerful and complete, this shows all the juicy fruit as well as the structure of the vintage. It's big, ripe and concentrated with great fruitiness and tannins. Give this rich wine several years to age to bring out its ripe fruits and complex structure. Drink from 2022.
title: Château de Fieuzal 2012  Pessac-Léognan

description: Aromas of green-plum jelly and a touch of toast set out a wine that is spicy as well as fresh. Bitter orange marmalade flavors are laced with lime acidity, lying over a firm, tense structure with a mineral edge. It will develop well, but don't drink before 2020.
title: Château Doisy-Daëne 2011  Barsac

description: The second release since the owners of Château Haut-Brion took over the property, this is very tannic and certainly extracted with its dark chocolate flavors. It's textured, dominated by Merlot and richly lush under the tough exterior. Drink from 2020
title: Château Quintus 2012  Saint-Émilion

description: With its strong initial impression of dryness, this is obviously a structured wine. It is dense, rich and concentrated with fine tannins, spice and a strong orange-zest character. Refreshing acidity gives a lift to this ripe, full wine. Drink from 2019.
title: Clos Haut-Peyraguey 2011  Sauternes

description: Effectively a wine with its own dedicated portion of the Ducru Beaucaillou vineyard, this is structured and firm. It's concentrated with dark plum fruits and full of powerful tannins that go right through from start to finish. It certainly needs to age, so don't drink before 2022.
title: Croix de Beaucaillou 2012  Saint-Julien

description: A small portion, the flower (la Fleur) of the Peyrabon vineyard, is in the Pauillac appellation. Richly structured, this wine is full of black currant and berry fruit, with solid tannins. Dense on the palate, it shows ripe Cabernet Sauvignon juiciness. Drink from 2019.
title: Château La Fleur Peyrabon 2012  Pauillac

description: Dense and concentrated, this wine is still balancing the fruit, the structure and the sweetness. Acidity shoots through the dry core, bringing with it lemon zest and pineapple flavors. It has great potential, full in the mouth and ripe at the end. Drink from 2020.
title: Château la Tour Blanche 2011  Sauternes

description: Owned by the Cuveliers who also own Léoville Poyferré in Saint-Julien, Le Crock in 2012 is a powerhouse of ripe tannins and juicy acidity. It's a wine that demands aging with its tannins and still-youthful fruitiness. Drink from 2019.
title: Château Le Crock 2012  Saint-Estèphe

description: This second wine of Labégorce Margaux is named after the former neighboring estate Labégorce Zédé that was amalgamated after the 2009 vintage. This is a ripe wine, full of the fruit of the vintage as well as having a firm dry tannic structure that will allow it to age. With juicy blackberry fruits still so youthful, it is going to be ready drink from 2019.
title: Château Labégorce Margaux 2012 Zédé de Labégorce  (Margaux)

description: Produced from a 17-acre vineyard, dominated by Merlot, this is the top wine of Château Renard. It is structured and firm with tannins and dense concentration that will probably remain with this rich wine as it matures. Drink from 2018.
title: Château Renard Mondesir 2011  Fronsac

description: The tannins of this firm wine are softening well to give richness as well as structure. With juicy black currants, it is going to be a solid, dense wine. This is the second wine of the family-owned Grand Pontent which is managed by a member of the Bécot family of classed growth Beauséjour-Bécot. Drink from 2018.
title: Château Grand Pontet 2011 Dauphin de Grand Pontet  (Saint-Émilion)

description: The Cazes family, which owns the Michel Lynch brand (as well as Château Lynch-Bages), also has vineyards in the Graves, and this well-rounded, spice- and pear-flavored wine draws on good vineyard contacts in that region. There is toast, along with citrus acidity and a fine, fruity finish.
title: Michel Lynch 2007 Réserve  (Graves)

description: From a biodynamic vineyard, this vivid wine reveals great character. The fruit is ripe, smooth, soft, illuminated by flashes of currants, green plums, a wonderful swathe of creaminess. It feels very complete, not intense, but open and ready to drink.
title: Château Champ des Treilles 2007 Vin Passion  (Sainte-Foy Bordeaux)

description: Caramel and ripe red fruits show the weight of this wine. It has freshness from the warm plum flavors along with ripe accents of spice and pepper. The end has tangy acidity. Bordeaux Clairet lies between rosé and red in color and in taste.
title: Château Queyssard 2014  Bordeaux Clairet

description: The wine's color has already passed the young and fruity stage, hinting at the aging that's apparent on the palate. So the bright fruits have diminished, leaving a wine that is round and hinting at the wood aging. It can be drunk now.
title: Château la Baronnerie 2010 Grand Baron  (Blaye Côtes de Bordeaux)

description: This cuvée honors a sailor who, in 1919, docked his boat, La Favorite, at Blaye in the Gironde estuary and bought the property. It is still owned by the l'Amouller family. Juicy and fruity, this wine is immediately attractive and accessible. Red fruits, soft tannins and a bite of acidity all contribute to the ready-to-drink taste.
title: Château Frédignac 2012 Cuvée La Favorite  (Blaye Côtes de Bordeaux)

description: Firmly tannic, this wine is solid, firm and traditional in its dry structure. Black currant fruitiness shows briefly before the tannins and dark extract take over. It's a tough wine at this stage and could well remain hard. Try drinking from 2017.
title: Château des Landes 2011 Cuvée Tradition  (Lussac Saint-Émilion)

description: Black currant fruits dominate this ripe, stalky wine that has young tannins and a smoky cedar character that comes from light wood aging. It's dry, firm and ready to drink.
title: Château Briot 2011  Bordeaux

description: With plenty of citrus flavors, this wine is fruity while also tight and mineral textured. At this stage, it is all about acidity, so it needs to age for a few months. Drink from late 2017.
title: Château de Parenchère 2016  Bordeaux Blanc

description: A rounded and soft wine, this is already open and ready to drink. It has a full-bodied character although without great fruitiness. The aftertaste is gentle and smooth.
title: Château La Gabarre 2016  Bordeaux Blanc

description: This wine is tight and young. It will have crisp citrus acidity as it matures, giving a bright, lively wine, refreshing to drink and just right for food.
title: Château Pierrail 2016  Bordeaux Blanc

description: A pale-colored wine with crisp, tight red-currant fruit, this is light and lively. Drink this simple, attractive wine now.
title: Château Vermont 2016 Rosé (Bordeaux Rosé)

description: Showing the ripeness of the vintage, this is a smooth, lightly textured wine, with plenty of yellow and citrus fruits. The wine needs a few months, so drink from late 2017.
title: Château de Costis 2016  Bordeaux Blanc

description: Black currant fruits dominate this ripe, stalky wine that has young tannins and a smoky cedar character that comes from light wood aging. It's dry, firm and ready to drink.
title: Château Briot 2011  Bordeaux

description: Fresh and floral, this is a soft and ripe wine. With lemon and lime flavors tempered by apricots and pears, it offers a delicious fruit salad of flavors. The aftertaste is rich and juicy.
title: Château Briot 2013  Bordeaux Blanc

description: This 85% Merlot and 15% Cabernet Sauvignon wine is soft and juicy but without much character. Red fruits and acidity leave little more room for development. Aged 12 months in older oak barrels.
title: Château Clos Bourbon 2012 Cuvée La Rose Bourbon  (Cadillac Côtes de Bordeaux)

description: With too much smoky toast, this gives a hard, extracted feel with licorice rather than fruit. Tannins are dense and hints of juicy fruitiness only appear in the background.
title: Château de Monbadon 2012  Castillon Côtes de Bordeaux

description: Ripe bold Merlot creates a wine that has spice, juicy black-plum flavors and a core of tannin. It is a young wine, full of fruit, with a soft aftertaste. It was made to be drunk from early 2017.
title: Maison Givas 2015 Vin No. 03  (Bordeaux)

description: Owned by Xavier Chassagnoux, who also has vineyards in Fronsac, this estate has produced a rich wine. It has the typical fruity character of the vintage with its soft tannins and juicy acidity. Red berries are lightly supported by the open structure. Drink the wine now.
title: Château de Virecourt 2014 Cuvée Pillebourse  (Bordeaux Supérieur)

description: As with so many wines from Blaye, this is dominated by Merlot. That gives a ripe full wine that is spicy and full of black-plum fruits. Firm tannins still show through the fruits that are balanced by acidity. The wine still needs to age, so drink from 2018.
title: Château des Tourtes 2014  Blaye Côtes de Bordeaux

description: This wine is all crisp red currants and acidity. Fresh, fruity and lightly textured, it is a wine to drink young, from 2016.
title: Château Haut-Bourcier 2013  Blaye Côtes de Bordeaux

description: Crisp raspberry flavors give this Barthe family wine an attractive fruitiness and acidity. It is light on the palate, still tight and needs a few more months. Drink from 2016.
title: Château la Freynelle 2013  Bordeaux

description: This wine has attractive fruit, crisp acidity and a good balance with the light tannic structure. Bright and fresh wine, it is ready to drink. This is one of the Ducourt family properties on the Right Bank of Bordeaux.
title: Château la Rose du Pin 2013  Bordeaux

description: This is a fruity wine with red berry flavors and fresh acidity. It is crisp, light and ready to drink, with an attractive smoky aftertaste.
title: Château Lauduc 2013 Prestige  (Bordeaux Supérieur)

description: This wine is full of acidity as much as red fruits. Crisp, tight and with freshness from the red currant fruits, it is ready to drink. This is one of the Vignobles Jean Queyrens et Fils wineries.
title: Château Pilet 2013  Bordeaux

description: This wine is fruity, with only a light texture of acidity and stalky black currant fruit flavors. From the difficult 2013 vintage, it is lit with acidity and fresh fruit at the end. Drink now. The d'Arfeuille family is in its fifth century on Bordeaux's Right Bank.
title: Château Tessendey 2013  Bordeaux

description: Caramel flavor and ripe red fruits give this organic Malbec (60%) and Merlot (40%) blend some weight. Pink in color, it has ripe crushed strawberry flavors and light acidity at the end. Drink now.
title: Château de la Vieille Tour 2014 Rosé (Bordeaux Rosé)

description: This is a juicy wine with fresh acidity and red berry flavors. It is bright with fruits although also with a dry core. The juiciness should develop, so drink from 2017. Vincent and Ludivine l'Amouller, the estate's fourth generation, began converting the vineyard to certified organic in 2010.
title: Château Frédignac 2013 Cuvée Terroir  (Blaye Côtes de Bordeaux)

description: Jammy fruits conflict with a firm tannic structure. This wine is not yet balanced and needs a lighter touch. Producer is Jean Paul Barre.
title: Château Saint-Urban 2013  Blaye Côtes de Bordeaux

description: There is a farmyard quality to the aromas, but the wine itself shows a finely structured character that offers a linear, herbaceous view. The wine has considerable aging potential, bringing out an enticing citrus character.
title: Château Couhins-Lurton 2009  Pessac-Léognan

description: Located between the city of Bordeaux and Margaux, this estate regularly produces good quality. In 2013, the producers have managed to highlight good fruit and dry tannins that also sustain the juiciness. The wine is still firm and will take a while to develop, so wait until 2018.
title: Château Paloumey 2013  Haut-Médoc

description: From vines in the eastern section of Saint-Émilion, the Beaumartin family has produced a firmly structured wine that has both fruit and firm tannins. At this stage, the tannins dominate, giving the wine a dry character, but the juicy black-currant fruit is all there. Drink from 2018.
title: Château Peymouton 2013  Saint-Émilion

description: This wine is still a work in progress, but all the elements are there. Black-currant freshness underlies the firm surface structure and tight tannins. The wine has potential; wait until 2019 before drinking.
title: Château Prieuré-Lichine 2013  Margaux

description: From one of the fine estates on the Pez plateau at the heart of Saint-Estèphe, this firm and structured wine seems at this stage to have absorbed too much wood flavor, which gives toughness. However, plenty of fruit is currently being masked, so the wine should develop well. Drink from 2018.
title: Château Tour de Pez 2013  Saint-Estèphe

description: Dark colored wine, revealing wood aging both aromatically and to taste. That said, it also has great weight, a powerful and complex wine with its coffee, dried fruit and black plum flavors. It's an impressive, solid wine that deserves at least seven years' aging.
title: Château Lestage Simon 2010  Haut-Médoc

description: A powerful, firm wine, very solid and rich. With red plum and blackberry fruits, dense tannins and a touch of wood aging, the wine shows considerable potential. It is already balanced but will benefit from at least six years' aging.
title: Château Peymouton 2010  Saint-Émilion

description: Big, rich, dense wine, packed with dark tannins and blackberry fruits. The wine has concentration, layering wood aging with youthful acidity that shines through the structure. An impressive wine that needs aging for at least five years.
title: Château Tour de Guiet 2010 Grand Vin  (Côtes de Bourg)

description: A fruity, tank-aged wine that has spice, stalky black-currant fruit and some dry tannins. It is juicy and lightly perfumed with plenty of acidity to keep it crisp. It takes its name from the beehive shaped wells (puit) typical of the north of the Gironde. Drink from 2018.
title: Château du Vieux Puit 2014 Cuvée Croizet  (Blaye Côtes de Bordeaux)

description: This is a fresh and fruity wine with lively acidity and spice from wood aging. Dominated by Sauvignon Blanc, it is herbal and still young, needing time to develop. Drink this crisp wine from late 2017.
title: Château Haut Selve 2015  Graves

description: The wine is still firmly structured and dark. Tannins dominate what will become attractive red-berry fruits. With the acidity and concentration, this will be a fine wine. Drink from 2018.
title: Château la Freynelle 2015 Merlot-Cabernet Sauvignon  (Bordeaux)

description: This Sauvignon Blanc-dominated wine has light wood aging to smooth out its herbal character and bring out the richer Sémillon. Spice, toast and crisp acidity are filled out with the ripeness of the vintage. Drink this from early 2017.
title: Cheval Quancard 2015 Cuvée Clémence  (Entre-Deux-Mers)

description: Juicy red fruit dominates this wine. It has some firm tannins underneath—just enough to support the delicious raspberry and red-currant flavors. It is maturing well and will be ready to drink from 2017.
title: Château Auguste 2014  Bordeaux Supérieur

description: This is a ripe and juicy wine that has fine red fruits and some firm tannins. It is spicy, concentrated and fully fruited, with well-balanced tannins. Drink this attractive wine from 2018.
title: Château Feret Lambert 2014  Bordeaux Supérieur

description: A ripe and spicy wine, this is structured with black-currant fruits and lively acidity. It is still very young: its exuberant fruitiness likely to calm as it matures. Give this ripe wine until 2019.
title: Château Haut le Valette 2015 Cuvée Caractères  (Blaye Côtes de Bordeaux)

description: The wine has plenty of juicy red fruits as well as a firm structure. It is on the fresh fruity side, with red currant and berry flavors. The acidity is very present, needing to calm down to become really drinkable. Wait until 2018 to drink.
title: Château la Favière 2014  Bordeaux Supérieur

description: This is a spicy wine, with toasty wood flavors. Happily the fruit is also there, spreading its juicy acidity over the tannins. Let this wine fill out over the next few months and it will be ready to drink from 2017.
title: Château Lamothe-Vincent 2014 Intense  (Bordeaux)

description: This is an attractively perfumed wine. It has fine acidity, ripe wood flavors and spice. The weight of the fruit is enough to balance with the wood. It will be ready to drink from 2018.
title: Château Malbat 2014  Bordeaux Supérieur

description: This 60-40 blend of Sauvignon Blanc and Sauvignon Gris is a tightly textured wine with hints of minerality as well as citrus and grapefruit. The wine is crisp, bright in the mouth and packed with attractive final acidity. This estate is the home of Bordeaux producer Nicolas Thienpont.
title: Château Puygueraud 2015  Francs Côtes de Bordeaux

description: The wine is soft, ripe and fruity with fine tannins and plenty of red-berry fruit flavors. Structured and spicy, it will develop well into a concentrated ripe wine. Jean-Michel Baudet's Blaye estate vineyards were the first to be certified sustainable by Terra Vitis. Drink from 2018.
title: Château Ricaud 2014  Blaye Côtes de Bordeaux

description: Crisp and fresh, this is a light wine that is dominated by red-currant fruits. It has considerable acidity as well as tannins. Fruity while lightly perfumed, it will be ready from 2018.
title: Château Tour de Gilet 2014  Bordeaux Supérieur

description: This rich wine is full of berry fruits that are smoothed out by wood aging. It is still young, with a structure of tannins that gives a dry edge. That will soften to reveal the fruitiness of the Merlot/Cabernet Franc blend with its fresh aftertaste. Drink from 2017. The d'Arfeuille family is now in its fifth century on Bordeaux's Right Bank.
title: Château Tessendey 2012  Fronsac

description: A rich, sweetly fruity wine, its ripe black plum fruit balanced by fine acidity and layered with wood. It is a solid and dense wine, firm and with great juiciness. Likely to age well for 4–5 years.
title: Jean-Michel Cazes 2011 Réserve  (Médoc)

description: For Bordeaux, this is a plump, cushioned wine that brings out rich fruit, chocolate sauce and ample spice. The structure is there, with tannins and a dry core, but it's the soft, generous fruit that is more prominent.
title: Château de Parenchère 2010 Cuvée Raphaël  (Bordeaux Supérieur)

description: Initially closed, this wine just hints at its richness and perfumed character. As it opens it shows still-young tannins and intense black plums and blueberries that will develop as the wine ages. It is likely to mature well over the medium to long term, and will not be ready to drink before 2022.
title: Le Dôme 2013  Saint-Émilion

description: Sophisticated and full of fruit, this wine combines the freshness of the year with great tension and structure. The juicy underlay will develop well over the next few years. It's complex and worth aging. Drink from 2024.
title: Vieux Château Mazerat 2013  Saint-Émilion

description: This wine has a lot of class and elegance, along with firm tannins that show how well it will age. It is dark and concentrated, the black fruits still developing under the solid structure. This wine will age slowly, so wait until 2022.
title: Château Trotanoy 2013  Pomerol

description: Powered by its structure and texture, this complex wine is dense, structured and firm. Plenty of dry and taut tannins dominate at this stage, but it is also full of fruit. The wine will age over many years while not being one of those vintages that will mature forever: the fruitiness will see to that. Drink this impressive wine from 2025.
title: Château Cos d'Estournel 2013  Saint-Estèphe

description: This wine is a success for the vintage with its ripe Cabernet flavors and dark, dense tannins. It is fruity certainly, with a juicy, perfumed background. However, the structure and texture show best—firm and dry, indicating a good potential. This concentrated wine will not be ready to drink before 2024.
title: Château Figeac 2013  Saint-Émilion

description: Almost entirely Cabernet Sauvignon (98%), this structured and dense wine is packed with concentrated dark fruits that are firm, showing intense acidity and freshness under the dark tannins. It's classic Bordeaux, with fruit and tannins in equal measure and needing time. Drink from 2024.
title: Château Lafite Rothschild 2013  Pauillac

description: This wine showcases the fruit of the vintage—ripe black currants and plums with a juicy, generous character. It is full bodied and rich, with good structure plus acidity to give the right freshness. Drink from 2022.
title: Château Pichon Longueville 2013  Pauillac

description: With 60% Merlot in the blend, this wine is packed with red fruits and crisp acidity as well as richer fruitcake flavors. It has some structure as well as its red-berry flavors. It is ready to drink.
title: La Fleur Ribeyrolles 2014  Bordeaux Supérieur

description: Relatively lightweight, showing freshness rather than density, this is a fruity, red currant- and red plum-flavored wine that is lifted by a good use of wood aging, spice, and enclosed by vibrant acidity.
title: Château Roquetaillade la Grange 2007  Graves

description: A fresh, crisp wine, full of raspberry and red currant fruits, benefiting from a firm presence of acidity, a light touch of caramel and spice. A proper summer rosé.
title: Château Lamothe-Vincent 2008 Red (Bordeaux Rosé)

description: The second wine of Château du Tertre, this is produced by the winemaking team of the associated Château Giscours. It delivers the same elegance and sophistication with a more approachable fruitiness. Generous red and blackberry fruits are accompanied by concentration and some firm, smoky tannins. Drink this wine from 2017.
title: Château du Tertre 2012 Les Hauts du Tertre  (Margaux)

description: Named Espérance (hope) by the South African owner, the château has produced a firm, structured wine from this exceptional vintage. It is still young, full of black-currant fruit and fresh acidity that contrast with the dark tannins that extend throughout the wine. Drink from 2018.
title: Château l'Espérance 2010 Espérance  (Blaye Côtes de Bordeaux)

description: Rich and ripe, this wine full of blackberry fruits and balanced tannins has improved since it was reviewed from barrel. It has good concentration for the vintage, dominated by black fruit that offers good acidity at the end. Drink from 2022. Olivier is a large medieval hunting estate that has belonged to the Bethmann family since the 19th century.
title: Château Olivier 2013  Pessac-Léognan

description: A perfumed wine, this is full of black fruits that are shot through with acidity. It is bright, soft and only hinting at tannins. This second wine of Château Pichon Longueville Comtesse de Lalande will develop quickly and become an attractive, fruity wine from 2018.
title: Château Pichon Longueville Comtesse de Lalande 2013 Réserve de la Comtesse  (Pauillac)
winery: Château Pichon Longueville Comtesse de Lalande

description: Bitter tannins and heavy toast influence suggest a wine that has been heavily extracted. Rich and sweet-tasting, it has power and a solid, tannic presence.
title: Château Barde Haut 2009  Saint-Émilion

description: For such a young wine, this is surprisingly mature. Its tannins have softened and rounded, becoming well integrated with the black currant flavor and bright acidity. It's an attractive choice to drink now or over the next few years, but not for long-term aging.
title: Château Bel Enclos 2010 Cuvée Evidence  (Blaye Côtes de Bordeaux)

description: This is a dark, concentrated effort that shows its wood strongly. The tannins are firm and almost heavy, producing a wine that is intensely dry and will need many years to age.
title: Château Cissac 2010  Haut-Médoc

description: Crisp, clean and fruity, this refreshing wine has an herb note that's restrained by ripe orange and green apple flavors. Bright and ready to drink.
title: Château de Fontenille 2011  Entre-Deux-Mers

description: Powerful and rich, this wine tastes of black and red berries. The ripeness of the vintage is evident, with a dense character that lends weight and concentration, while adding fresh black-currant-like acidity.
title: Château La Maroutine 2009  Bordeaux

description: This mineral-driven and white-currant-flavored wine shows as much texture as fruitiness. In the future, it will show ripe yellow and pear notes, so age for a year.
title: Château Lamothe-Vincent 2011  Bordeaux Blanc

description: Dark and brooding, this is characterized by a plum skin note, plus firm tannins and a solid structure. It's concentrated and dense, a wine that is serious and needs to age for 4–5 years. The finish has a firm feel.
title: Château Montet 2009 Cuvée Prestige  (Bordeaux Supérieur)

description: Rich and fruity, this wine is balanced, with tannins and red fruits in harmony. It has weight and richness without being overpowerful. Ready to drink in six months.
title: Château Montlau 2010  Bordeaux Supérieur

description: In this warm and ripe effort, the flavors of red currants and plums work with the underlying tannins and acidity. This has just the right weight, making for a wine that has attractive fruitiness and light tannins.
title: Château Roquefort 2009  Bordeaux

description: With soft tannins, this wine has a full, fleshy character that's laced with acidity. Black currant fruits and only hints of dryness suggest it is ready to drink.
title: Château du Prieur 2010 Cuvée Réserve  (Bordeaux)

description: Structured and firm with balancing red berry fruit, this is a solid, chunky wine that reflects the concentration of the vintage. It has weight, solid tannins and hints of pepper and spice. Age for 2–3 years.
title: Château Tertre de Viaud 2010  Côtes de Bourg

description: A packed wine, its ripe fruits are a warm pleasure. It has all the structure of the year but in fine measure, lending density and richness to the palate. It's a wine for aging; give it at least five years.
title: Château Gauthier 2010  Blaye Côtes de Bordeaux

description: There is tough concentration here that suggests a wine that needs aging; there's also fruit that hints at richness to come. A wine that has a good future.
title: Château Monbadon 2010  Castillon Côtes de Bordeaux

description: This is a soft wine, dense and ripe. Any tannins are covered by sweet blackberry fruit flavors. This has attractive spice, final juiciness and bright acidity. A wine for early drinking.
title: Château Mouton Rothschild 2010 Le Petit Mouton  (Pauillac)

description: This is a harmonious mix of firm, extracted tannins and dense fruit. It has a dark, hard edge at this youthful stage, suggesting this is always going to be a wine that is tough. At the same time, it has weight and richness to support the structure.
title: Château Puygueraud 2010  Francs Côtes de Bordeaux

description: A very herbaceous Sauvignon aroma, crisp and fresh with pink grapefruit and lemon grass flavors on top of a bright squeeze of lime. There is a final touch of pear juice acidity.
title: Château La Rose du Pin 2009  Bordeaux Blanc

description: A wine that relishes its juicy fruit and acidity. The tannins, by contrast, are light. Close to Macau, south of Margaux, Gironville is in a fresh, black currant-fruit style, not for aging.
title: Château de Gironville 2008  Haut-Médoc

description: Pale orange-pink in color, this is fruity and light. It coveys a bright, fresh character that is both refreshing and very crisp. Drink now.
title: Château la France 2014 Rosé (Bordeaux Rosé)

description: This delicious, fruity wine is full of acidity and crisp fruit. Light, bright and dominated by green and citrus fruits, it is ready to drink now.
title: Château Vircoulon 2014  Bordeaux Blanc

description: Bright, lightly-smoked red currant and berry fruits dominate this juicy, fresh wine. A plum-skin texture leads on to some firm tannins. The aftertaste is fruity and light.
title: Cave de Rauzan 2014 Augey  (Bordeaux)

description: This soft, ripe wine by the Blaye sister-brother team of Marie-Pierre et Pierre-Charles Dartier has caramel flavors integrated into the red fruits. A crisp side comes from red currant flavors, while a smooth aftertaste keeps it rich while not losing the acidity.
title: Château Cailleteau Bergeron 2014 Villa Cailleteau Bergeron Rosé (Bordeaux Rosé)

description: This wine has some bitter extraction giving it a hard edge. The fruit is lost in the dry, tannic structure. That hard edge will be tough to shift. Try drinking from 2017.
title: Château Garreau 2011  Blaye Côtes de Bordeaux

description: Smoky and obviously wood-aged, this toasty, spicy wine has extracted black-coffee flavors that mask the black currant fruits. That leaves a wine that seems austere and with a bitter aftertaste. Drink from 2017.
title: Château la Roque de By 2011  Médoc

description: With a sense of tannic structure and a dry background, this is a firm wine. It has some weight, although the texture and the black currant fruits are light and stylish rather than dense. Drink from 2016.
title: Château les Ancres 2011  Bordeaux

description: With no oak aging, this wine offers black currants and stalky tannins. Juicy fruitiness and a ripe character reflect the vintage. The aftertaste, with acidity, is fresh and always fruity. Drink from 2016.
title: Cave du Marmandais 2014 Château Campot Lafont  (Bordeaux)

description: This is a heavily wood-aged wine with a bitter character redeemed by the ripe blackberry fruits from a blend of 65% Merlot, 30% Cabernet Sauvignon and 5% Cabernet Franc. It is structured, with firm tannins over the fresh and juicy fruitiness. Give the wine another year and the two will come into balance. Drink from 2016.
title: Château de Bordes-Quancard 2012  Bordeaux

description: Firmly tannic, this is still a young wine. It has a dry structure with a black currant-skin stalkiness. Acidity and structure are still developing, so wait until 2016.
title: Château de Piote 2010  Bordeaux

description: This is a crisp, intensely fruity wine. Full of red berries and fresh acidity, it is dry with a tangy orange-peel character, light minerality and a touch of caramel. It is ready to drink.
title: Château de Sours 2014 La Fleur d'Amélie Rosé (Bordeaux Rosé)

description: A ripe, red-fruited wine with a rich character, this offers vanilla as well as citrus and berry fruit flavors. It is just off dry, fresh and brightly fruity. It makes for a delicious, crisp summer rosé.
title: Château de Sours 2014 Rosé (Bordeaux Rosé)

description: Very fresh and crisp, this is a wine to drink soon. It has great acidity, bright and lively with green fruit flavors and some mandarin zest to give softness at the end.
title: Château du Claouset 2014  Bordeaux Blanc

description: This ripe wine is firm, with a core of dry tannins. Over this are delicious, juicy red-berry fruit flavors and acidity. The wine is still softening out, with fruit coming forward. It will be ready to drink from 2017. The property has been in the family for six generations; Robert Filliatreau is the current owner. Wine is vinified by Châteaux Solidaires co-operative.
title: Château Beaumont les Pierrières 2012  Blaye Côtes de Bordeaux

description: Dominated by Sauvignon Blanc, this wine has a still young, crisp, tight character. As it ages, the yellow fruits and ripe plum flavors will come through, balancing the acidity and giving a ripe, full and generous wine. Drink from 2016.
title: Château les Clauzots 2014  Graves

description: Honeyed, tropical fruit aromas are showing strongly in this smooth, lightly toasty dry wine. Rich and rounded, it shows both the fresh fruit of the vintage and also the concentration of the white wines. It should be aged, but can be drunk now. Drink until 2020.
title: Château de la Brède 2011 Cuvée Montesquieu  (Graves)

description: A rich and bold wine, structured and concentrated. This is packed with black plum fruits, ripe damsons and sweet tannins. There's a great juicy element, that brings in the acidity as well as some spice from wood aging.
title: Château Haut-Francarney 2010 No 2 et No 5  (Fronsac)

description: Initially austere in the mouth, this is a serious and complex wine. It has firm tannins, layers of blackberry fruits and acidity along with a strong feeling of wood aging. Powerful and with good depth, it's a wine that needs age. Drink from 2017.
title: Château les Roches de Ferrand 2010  Fronsac
