title: Château Carignan 2012 L'Orangerie de Carignan Rosé (Vin de Pays de l'Atlantique)

description: This fresh and juicy wine is marked by berry fruits and acidity. It's bright and crisp in character, while also having weight and richness. With its soft tannins, it is ready to drink now.
title: Château Hyot 2011  Castillon Côtes de Bordeaux

description: This is a lively, fruity wine that is ready to drink now. It has juicy fruitiness from black currant and strawberry notes, along with soft tannins.
title: Château la France 2011 Cuvée Gallus  (Bordeaux Supérieur)

description: On the herbaceous side, this is a full bodied but grassy wine with hints of green undergrowth and a cat-like character. It has a modern, forward fruitiness that's very new world in style. Drink now.
title: Château Roquefort 2012  Bordeaux Blanc

description: Light, fresh, raspberry-flavored wine, with a hint of spice and great lines of acidity. The wine is fruity, delicious.
title: Château Beauregard-Ducourt 2010 Rosé (Bordeaux Rosé)

description: This wine is full of juicy Merlot, ripe with sweet tannins and jammy fruit. It is soft, with the freshness of the year as well as having hints of structure. It is ripe, beautifully fruity and will be ready to drink from 2018.
title: Château Calon Ségur 2013 Le Marquis de Calon Ségur  (Saint-Estèphe)

description: Showing how Saint-Émilion came out well in 2013, this wine has ripe and juicy Merlot fruits topped with perfumed Cabernet Franc. Rich and structured, it's a wine for aging over the medium-term with its layers of tannins under the fruit. Drink from 2020.
title: Château Canon 2013  Saint-Émilion

description: Light and fruity, this wine has attractive acidity and layers of red berry fruits. The silky tannins are present, although light and dominated by the fruitiness of the wine. It's fresh, packed with acidity and likely to be ready soon. Drink from 2018.
title: Château Palmer 2013 Alter Ego de Château Palmer  (Margaux)

description: This wine shows the continuing evolution of this property even in a difficult year. Structured, balanced tannins are already integrated with the fresh black-currant fruits. With a balance between Cabernet Sauvignon and Merlot, the wine is fruity and still young. Drink from 2019.
title: Château Picque Caillou 2013  Pessac-Léognan

description: This is an impressive performance from an estate that has been improving over the past 10 years. The wine is dense with fine tannins, fresh acidity and layers of black-currant fruitiness. It will develop over the medium term, so drink from 2020.
title: Château Rauzan-Gassies 2013  Margaux

description: This impressive wine is full of potential. Powerful wood flavors are currently masking the fruitiness of the wine. However the weight of fruit and the rich texture promise good long-term aging.
title: Château Smith Haut Lafitte 2013  Pessac-Léognan

description: Mint aromas and new wood flavors mark this smoothly ripe, polished wine. It has a good amount of black fruit, a dry but open texture and a rich, smoky character. The tannins and generous fruit power the wine forward.
title: Château la Tonnelle 2011  Haut-Médoc

description: Dry and serious, this firm wine is classic Bordeaux. It has weight, a core of tannins and black currant fruitiness that needs time to fully integrate with the dense structure. Give this exemplary wine another five years.
title: Château Landat 2011 Vieilles Vignes  (Haut-Médoc)

description: This rare white wine from a vineyard in Saint-Emilion is produced by Gérard Perse of Château Pavie. Now mature, this ripe, bitter-almond and spice flavored wine shows a touch of scorched wood. As a contrast, there is a rich, almost buttery character that gives the wine a full texture. Ready to drink.
title: Château Monbousquet 2004  Bordeaux Blanc

description: This is a soft wine, fruity without great definition. A ripe, red fruit character contrasts with a bitter acidity. It is ready to drink. The blend is 50/50 Merlot and Cabernet Sauvignon.
title: Château Taussin 2014 Rosé (Bordeaux Rosé)

description: This wine is soft, watery and misses out on character. It is gentle, but with a bitter almond aftertaste.
title: Château du Cros 2014  Bordeaux Blanc

description: Juicy fruit aromas lead to a palate conveying tangy flavors and mandarin zest. This is a fruity wine that is not quite balanced, and likely to remain with fruit and texture out of kilter.
title: Château de Lardiley 2014 Prestige  (Bordeaux Blanc)

description: A soft, simple wine without great character, this is soft, gently fruity and ready to drink.
title: Château Haut Bessac 2014  Bordeaux Blanc

description: Light in color, this is a wine with flavors that seem to have been stripped away. It is crisp and only lightly fruity, with some bitter acidity at the end.
title: Château Goudichaud 2014 Rosé (Bordeaux Rosé)

description: This wine smells yeasty, a character that follows through on the palate. It is soft and round, conveying ripe red fruits without freshness. It reveals bitter acidity at the end.
title: Château Recougne 2014 Rosé (Bordeaux Rosé)

description: This wine's fruitiness comes from stalky black currant flavors that have a green edge. It shows tannins, bitter chocolate and considerable acidity.
title: Maison Bouey 2013 Château Maison Blanche  (Médoc)

description: This bright, pink-colored wine is full of caramel and vanilla flavors that give a fat, dull character to the taste. It is dry, touched by bitter almonds and with a sharp aftertaste of acidity.
title: Les Hauts de Lagarde 2014 Rosé (Bordeaux Rosé)

description: Bubblegum aromas send this wine in a candied direction. It is soft, not quite dry, with ripe strawberry flavors. It tastes confected although the acidity at the end does keep it fresh.
title: Château de Lardiley 2014 Prestige Rosé (Bordeaux Rosé)

description: The wine is neither very fruity nor fresh. It is clean with a crisp aftertaste although the character or the interest are not there.
title: Clos Floridène 2014 Le Rosé de Floridène Rosé (Bordeaux Rosé)

description: This is the second wine of Château Labégorce. It has much of the elegance of the top wine with firm tannins and generous fruits kept in stylish proportion. Black currant and berry fruits lie under the dark, dry exterior. The wine is dense, needing several years' aging. Drink from 2018.
title: Château Labégorce Margaux 2010 Zédé de Labégorce  (Margaux)

description: This wine has weight and the potential for ripe black fruits. At this stage, it is closed up, full of suggestions without realization. Wait until 2017 for the rich character to be fully revealed.
title: Château de Potiron 2012 Cuvée Privilége  (Côtes de Bordeaux)

description: Very fruity, very juicy, this wine is all about crisp, fresh fruitiness, starting with hand-picked biodynamic vineyard plots and gravity-flow into the winery. Red currants dominate, with considerable acidity right at the fore. At the back, the tannins are developing, but fruit will be the hallmark for the long future. Owner Thierry Valette's family also owns Château Troplong-Mondot in Saint-Émilion.
title: Clos Puy Arnaud 2012  Castillon Côtes de Bordeaux

description: Firm and complex, it manages both acidity and concentrated tannins and brings out really black fruits.
title: Cap Royal 2011  Bordeaux Supérieur

description: With just the right amount of wood aging, this is soft, rich and smooth. Tannins are already well integrated into the blackberry fruits, giving a wine that is fruity, juicy and good for medium-term aging. Drink from 2016.
title: Château de Terrefort Bibonne 2012  Côtes de Bordeaux

description: This is a lime- and lemon- flavored wine that is fruity and refreshing. It is delicate, bright and light, and attractive to drink now as an apéritif.
title: Château de Bellevue 2012  Bordeaux Blanc

description: This is a firm wine that will take time to show its best. When it does, it should reveals a solid texture, juicy fruitiness and attractive acidity. Wait until 2015.
title: Château de Goëlane 2011  Bordeaux Supérieur

description: Mint aromas dominate notes of new wood aging on this wine. Toast notes are there, but blend harmoniously with berry flavors and acidity. Taken as a whole, this wine has weight and potential. Drink from 2015.
title: Château de Lisennes 2011  Bordeaux Supérieur

description: Spiced with cinnamon, this is an exotic wine. The fruit takes second place to the structure, toastiness and weight of this wine. It could age well, but will always be an unusual wine, with its own, ?unique attractiveness.
title: Château de Monrecueil 2011  Castillon Côtes de Bordeaux

description: Duhart-Milon continues to get better and more sophisticated. This 2011 vintage shows that trend well with its elegant spice, black currant fruits and firm tannins. The fruitiness is well focused, with typical Cabernet acidity bringing out the fresher side of the wine. Drink from 2017.
title: Château Duhart-Milon 2011  Pauillac

description: Very firm tannins coming from ripe black fruits give this structured wine, produced by the winemaking team from Château Montrose, a solid, dense feel. The core of dryness is surrounded by rich fruits and bright acidity. The wine presents the possibility of good aging; drink from 2018.
title: Château Tronquoy-Lalande 2011  Saint-Estèphe

description: This offers black currant flavors and firm, stalky tannins. It has acidity, a good juicy character and a dry aftertaste. Drink from 2015.
title: Château Cagnas 2012  Bordeaux

description: This wine is all about fruitiness, its crisp texture merely an aid to the lively acidity and herbaceous character. Cool and fresh, it delivers a bright aftertaste of lime juiciness.
title: Château Fayau 2013  Bordeaux Blanc

description: This is a wine that's on the lean side. That gives it structure without enough fruit to balance. It is dry, tight and shows black currant acidity at the end.
title: Château La Fleur Beaumont 2011  Bordeaux Supérieur

description: The wine does have fruit, but it is masked by strong burnt tannins from the wood aging. The acidity shows the possibility of red berry fruits appearing later.
title: Château Haut-Gelineau 2011  Côtes de Bourg

description: Fruity and fresh, it's full of grapefruit, lime and green apple flavors. It is crisp and ready to drink.
title: Château Lamothe de Haux 2013  Bordeaux Blanc

description: Heavily dominated by wood aging, this wine should be showing its fruit by now, but isn't. It has bitterness, layers of spice and smoky wood. Only the aftertaste brings some freshness and acidity.
title: Château Haut-Gelineau 2010  Côtes de Bourg

description: The wine is fruity, crisp and herbaceous. Everything is in place for an attractive, ready-to-drink wine, all fruit and with only a light texture.
title: Schröder & Schÿler 2013 La Croix Barton  (Bordeaux Blanc)

description: A hard, too-toasty wine that is completely dominated by smoky wood flavors. Whatever fruit is there is swamped, only a juicy hint through the wine's weight.
title: Château Cossieu-Coutelin 2011  Saint-Estèphe

description: This is an attractive, ripe wine from the André Lurton group. It is smoothly rich, with balanced perfumed fruits and acidity. Full bodied and creamy, it is ready to drink.
title: Château Bonnet 2016 Rosé (Bordeaux Rosé)

description: This wine is already ripe and rounded. It has good balance between the rich apple and pear fruits and acidity, along with an attractive mineral texture. Drink this fruity wine now.
title: Château de la Rivière 2016  Bordeaux Blanc

description: This wine is tight and closed at this stage, although it has great potential. The fruit is lively and crisp, just waiting to burst out with citrus and sliced apple fruitiness. Wait until late 2017.
title: Château de Lussac 2016  Bordeaux Blanc

description: There is a great burst of appealing acidity in this wine, accompanied by refreshing red fruits. This balanced wine is lively, crisp and with plenty of flavor. Drink now.
title: Château Les Hauts de Palette 2016 Château Haut Mondain Rosé (Bordeaux Rosé)

description: Olivier Doujon made only 7,000 bottles of this 100% Merlot at the family estate in Fronsac. Rounded and ripe, this is a full-bodied wine with great fruitiness and attractive acidity. Well balanced, it offers red-cherry flavors with an edge of pepper. Drink the wine now.
title: Château Magondeau 2016 Rosé (Bordeaux Rosé)

description: This is a real food wine, with its tangy texture, touch of spice and attractive acidity. Light fruitiness and a dry core give a structured character. Drink now.
title: Château Reynon 2016 Le Rosé de Floridène Rosé (Bordeaux Rosé)

description: This is a crisp wine, full of acidity. It holds the potential of crisp green and citrus fruits that are developing. A nutty edge contrasts with the tense acidity. Drink from late 2017.
title: Château Terres Douces 2016  Bordeaux Blanc

description: This lively wine comes from the Clarence Dillon group (Château Haut-Brion). It offers good balance between the considerable acidity and the red-berry fruit. With its spicy background, the wine is delicious to drink now.
title: Clarendelle 2016 Rosé (Bordeaux Rosé)

description: This full-bodied wine is rounded and soft. With generous red fruits, balanced acidity and a bright aftertaste, it is ready to drink.
title: Château Goudichaud 2016 Rosé (Bordeaux Rosé)

description: Strongly herbal, this Sauvignon Blanc-dominated wine is fruity and crisp, with a good depth of flavor. Refreshing acidity adds a tight edge to this young wine. Drink from late 2017.
title: Château l' Oiseau 2016  Bordeaux Blanc

description: Véronique Barthe is the first woman to manage the estate that has been in the Barthe family since 1789. She delivered a light and bright wine, poised and stylish with its crisp fruit and tangy acidity. A delicious burst of citrus at the end continues the theme of this fruity wine.
title: Château la Freynelle 2016 La Freynelle Rosé (Bordeaux Rosé)

description: This women-owned château above Cadillac produced a crisp wine, tight and nervy. With lively acidity, it focuses on the citrus side of life, finishing with a mineral edge. It will drink best from the end of 2017.
title: Château Peneau 2016 II Sauvignons  (Bordeaux Blanc)

description: Great wafts of sweet fruit and ripe tannins show this wine well. Its fruit is balanced, the power behind it well judged alongside the fresh juicy black currant flavors and acidity. The texture is certainly dense, and the wine needs time. Give it 4–5 years.
title: Château Fonplégade 2006  Saint-Émilion

description: Big, rich and elegant, this wine has fine, lifted black fruits layered over dry new wood and fruit tannins. It is certainly firm, and needs at least 4–5 years' aging, but it will develop into a sophisticated, balanced wine.
title: Château Laroque 2005  Saint-Émilion

description: Under the watchful eye of consultant Michel Rolland, Candale has produced an intense, powerful expression of super-ripe Merlot. The tannins are dense, powering through the dark berry fruit, rounded by the wood. It could do with 4–5 years aging.
title: Château de Candale 2005  Saint-Émilion

description: With its rich chocolate and spice flavors, this rolls around the mouth like velvet, its fruit so well-integrated with the wood and the vanilla that it is seamless. A delicious wine that deserves 3–4 years aging.
title: Château l'Enclos 2005  Pomerol

description: Wonderfully aromatic, this sure-to-be legendary wine offers richness, ripeness, and pure yellow fruits, peaches and apricots, all alongside a structured strain of chalky minerality. It is a wine for long aging, the wood spice just becoming integrated, the fruit still in its first vibrancy. But even now, it fills the mouth with generous fruits, and a great finish of citrus.
title: Domaine de Chevalier 2007  Pessac-Léognan

description: The great dominance of Cabernet Sauvignon in the blend has given this wine both a fine structure and crisp swathes of black-currant fruit. It is a firm wine at this stage, although the fine fruitiness will become an important part of the taste. The estate is named after one of Napoleon's generals who became King of Sweden. Drink from 2021.
title: Château Bernadotte 2014  Haut-Médoc

description: The wine has weight, tannins and a firm structure. At the same time, its ripe black fruits are developing to fill out the structure and give an impressive wine. Hints of dark chocolate go with the juicy acidity to leave a wine that has several years to develop. Drink from 2021.
title: Château Branas Grand Poujeaux 2014  Moulis-en-Médoc

description: Owned by the Cruse family, part of the old Bordeaux elite, the estate is in the southern Médoc. The wine, with its firm character and rounded fruit, has weight and considerable richness. It will develop into a plush full-bodied wine. Drink from 2020.
title: Château du Taillan 2014  Haut-Médoc

description: This is a fine wood-aged blend of 57% Cabernet Sauvignon with Merlot and Petit Verdot. It is darkly colored, dense and with great ripe tannins. One of several Bordeaux properties owned by the Thiénot family, this estate occupies a fine, gravel outcrop in the Pessac-Léognan region, just south of Bordeaux. Drink from 2024.
title: Château la Garde 2014  Pessac-Léognan

description: Ripe tropical fruits along with intense sweet lemon give this wine its fine acidity and ripe character. It is pure, clear and clean with lively acidity and a tangy zingy aftertaste that also brings in some minerality. Drink from 2018.
title: Château Mouton Rothschild 2014 Aigle d'Argent  (Bordeaux Blanc)

description: This a finely perfumed wine with its 32% Cabernet Franc, unusual for this estate. It gives a wine with great structure and concentration as well as layers of ripe black fruits. The wine needs to age so drink from 2023.
title: Château Nenin 2014  Pomerol

description: Ripe Merlot gives this wine its richness and concentration. It is filled with black fruits, hints of the wood aging and with tannins cushioned by the fruit. Acidity shows strongly at the end, leaving a bright aftertaste. Drink from 2020.
title: Château Quintus 2014 Le Dragon de Quintus  (Saint-Émilion)

description: The home chateau of the group of properties owned by the Guyon family, this estate has produced a solid very ageworthy wine. It has dark tannins and rich juicy black fruits. With its structure and bright berry and plum flavors, it will not be ready to drink before 2020.
title: Château Rollan de By 2014  Médoc

description: A firm wine that has solid, dry tannins as well as rich fruit. It shows minerality, structure and a firm character that suggests potential for aging. The wine also has rich fruit that balances the density well, its acidity cutting through. Drink from 2016.
title: Château Myon de l'Enclos 2010  Moulis-en-Médoc

description: This wine is mostly comprised of Merlot that was sourced from 30 different parcels. It is smooth and ripe, with red berry fruits, soft tannins and attractive acids. From the hands of top consultant Stéphane Derenoncourt, this simple Bordeaux has character and style.
title: Les Parcelles de Stéphane Derenoncourt 2011  Bordeaux

description: The wood influence in this wine is almost too much for the fruit, even in the future. It has a severe, burnt character that shows an herb flavor and a tight texture.
title: Château La Grange de Bessan 2010  Médoc

description: Light and fruity, this is a fresh, rounded wine with attractive berry fruits. It is already smooth, although the tannins are in the background. It's fragrant with a medium-term potential. Drink from 2015.
title: Château d'Arcins 2011  Haut-Médoc

description: Weight and dense tannins go with the firm black fruits and acidity, producing a wine that is spicy, fruity and likely to age quickly. Drink from 2015.
title: Château Ducla 2011  Bordeaux Supérieur

description: A light and rather stalky wine from the flat plain close to the Dordogne river. It has some black currant flavors that are firmed out by dry tannins. The aftertaste is fresh and juicy.
title: Château Joly 2011  Saint-Émilion

description: With considerable spicy, smoky wood, this is a rich, while extracted, wine. It does have some juicy fruit that shows potential so it should soften and become less bitter. Drink from 2017.
title: Château l'Argenteyre 2011  Médoc

description: A full and ripe wine, it is richly layered with black fruits, soft tannins and a juicy, warm aftertaste. The acidity at the end adds a little freshness. It's made to be drunk now.
title: Kirkland Signature 2011  Médoc

description: This wine is on the austere, lean side, with firm tannins and fruit that is still only just showing and therefore lacking depth of flavor. The finish has attractive red berry fruits.
title: Château Durfort-Vivens 2008  Margaux

description: Dark in style, as is often the case here, with a hard, tough edge. It is austere, the fruit a mere hint in the background. It does have potential, although this will come slowly.
title: Château Haut Bages Libéral 2008  Pauillac

description: A wine that tries too hard. The extract is strong, giving some bitterness. And, although the berry fruits are sweet and rich, the tannins edge the fruit with hardness. On the finish, some smokiness enhances the black currant juice, but that astringency just won't go away.
title: Barton & Guestier 2006 Thomas Barton Réserve  (Margaux)

description: This structured wine has ripe black fruits followed by red berries. There is a good depth of flavor, the tannins giving the bright fruit weight and a mouthfilling character.
title: Château Sainte Barbe 2006 Merlot  (Bordeaux)

description: Sumptuous, ripe and very full on the palate, this wine is dense and packed with notes of botrytis that give a strong sense of structure. This well-balanced wine shows potential to age, offering rich acacia honey and beautiful final acidity. Drink from 2020.
title: Château de Rayne Vigneau 2011  Sauternes

description: Big, ripe and juicy, this wears its rich black fruits right up front. A strong and firmly tannic structure serves as a background to the fruit. The wine is rich, complex and full of potential. Spice, ginger and nutmeg come through at the end along with the fruit. Drink from 2022.
title: Château Malartic-Lagravière 2012  Pessac-Léognan

description: This structured wine with big, bold red fruits offers ripe acidity, a dense texture and considerable concentration. It also has the hallmark freshness of the vintage that balances the strong aging potential. Drink from 2022.
title: Domaine de Chevalier 2012  Pessac-Léognan

description: This is a perfumed and generous wine with great tannins and a strong minerality. This is the first year that wines from the former Château Magdelaine were also included in Bélair as the two estates were amalgamated. It's dense, complex, balanced in character yet still with fruitiness of the vintage. Drink from 2024.
title: Château Bélair-Monange 2012  Saint-Émilion

description: Very firm and closed up, this wine is a tough proposition at the moment. It has the weight to develop well along with richness. Acidity, sweet fruits and concentrated tannins will all come through strongly as the wine matures. Drink from 2020.
title: Château Haut-Bailly 2012  Pessac-Léognan

description: This dark and dense wine is closed, with its tannins very dominant. It's a solid, dark wine intense with juicy acidity, firm dry structure and a rich core. This is a magnificent wine for serious aging, with all the elements coming strongly into play. Drink from 2022.
title: Château Smith Haut Lafitte 2012  Pessac-Léognan

description: This wine is already balanced, rich and structured. Acidity, honey and yellow fruits are well integrated. At the same time, aging potential is there with the dry core, firm texture and the strong final acidity. Drink from 2020.
title: Château Filhot 2011  Sauternes

description: An equal blend of Merlot and Cabernet Sauvignon with a dash of Cabernet Franc, this wine is structured, serious and also approachable. Ripe, juicy fruit is in evidence under the firm structure and dusty tannins. The combination is a rich and supple wine that will be ready from 2018.
title: Château Haut-Brion 2012 Le Clarence de Haut-Brion  (Pessac-Léognan)

description: Lafite's second wine is much closer to a balance of Cabernet Sauvignon and Merlot that the first wine. It's also a properly rich, satisfying wine that is as much fruit as structure. Packed with blackberry fruits, it has a fresh character that dominates the firmer tannins and touch of bitter chocolate. Drink from 2020.
title: Château Lafite Rothschild 2012 Les Carruades de Lafite  (Pauillac)

description: Concentrated and rich, this has fine tannins that are integrated into the big plum fruits. It's a black-fruited wine that has both the fruit and the structure to allow it to age well. Drink from 2020
title: Château Pape Clément 2012  Pessac-Léognan

description: Very fresh and strongly fruity, with just the right amount of dry botrytis, this is already approachable. However that botrytis does promise aging, with peach and ripe orange flavors pushing forward. Drink this attractive wine from 2019.
title: Château Suduiraut 2011  Sauternes

description: Ripe and fruity, this wine brings out apricot and pear flavors. It is rounded, full of fruit as well as balanced acidity. It is ready to drink but will be better from late 2015. The vineyard, about two-thirds old-vine Sémillon and one-third Sauvignon Blanc, tends to be harvested during cool mornings.
title: Chateau Haut Rian 2014  Bordeaux Blanc

description: This is a soft wine, ripe with lime and grapefruit flavors that are sweetened with juicy red apple. It's tangy as well, laced with orange zest and filled with steely acidity. It should age a few months, so drink from late 2015.
title: Château la France 2014  Bordeaux Blanc

description: Structured and still dry with young tannins, this concentrated wine has the potential of fresh black currant fruits. For the moment, it is dark, showing some bitter chocolate flavors that need to soften. Drink from 2017.
title: Château les Aubiers 2012  Blaye Côtes de Bordeaux

description: Tight and tangy, this is the epitome of an herbaceous wine. Packed with fruit, it is just emerging into a rounder, fuller future, conveying great acidity along with hints of richer yellow and white fruits. Drink from early 2016.
title: Chateau les Tuilleries 2014  Bordeaux Blanc

description: Produced by the same team as Château Cambon la Pelouse, this wine is already drinkable. With attractive black currant fruits and acidity, it is gently tannic with a dry core. The aftertaste is juicy and full of fruit.
title: Château Trois Moulins 2012  Haut-Médoc

description: This rich, impressive wine is full of ripe fruit and balanced acidity. It has intensity, sweetness and botrytis rich enough to lend a dry core. Drink from 2022.
title: Château Rieussec 2014 Carmes  (Sauternes)

description: This is the first vintage of this new purchase by Sylvie Cazes, a leading figure in the Bordeaux wine scene. A classed growth, it's richly fruity yet structured and firm, with dense tannins and layers of delicious black fruit. With its tannins still well at the fore, it will need to age further, so drink from 2022.
title: Château Chauvin 2014  Saint-Émilion

description: The power of the 2010 vintage is very apparent in this superripe wine. Dominated by rich, perfumed Cabernet Franc, it's concentrated, dark and dense. Its juicy black fruit is still in the background, moving slowly forward as it matures. Drink from 2020.
title: Château la Clide 2010 Primo du Château la Clide  (Saint-Émilion)

description: This bold, ripe wine is full of smoky tannins from the wood aging, plus blackberry jam flavors that are nicely cut by the acidity. The dry core and dark chocolate flavors are balanced by the fresher, richer fruit. Drink now.
title: Cheval Quancard 2012 1844 Réserve  (Bordeaux)

description: This wood-aged wine conveys mint aromas and new-wood flavors. It is rich, full in the mouth and developing quickly. The black currant fruitiness is fresh, giving a delicious, juicy wine to drink from 2016.
title: Les Hauts de Tousquiron 2012 Cuvée Lucie  (Médoc)

description: New wood aromas and flavors make this selection seem dominated by toast, giving it a dry, tannic character. The ripe plum fruit is submerged and is likely to surface only after 3–4 years of aging when a powerful, upfront wine will emerge.
title: Château l'Argenteyre 2010  Médoc

description: With the delicious black-currant aroma of Cabernet Sauvignon, this is a stylish, fruity wine that also has a firmly tannic side. One of a range of wines produced by consultant Stéphane Derenoncourt, this wine exudes the attractive acidity and the forward fruitiness of the vintage.
title: Les Parcelles de Stéphane Derenoncourt 2011  Haut-Médoc

description: Smooth and unctuous in texture, this has dense black fruits that edge toward dryness from the tannins. Dark chocolate and licorice notes lend a bitter edge. Rich and modern in style, this should age over the next 5–6 years.
title: Bernard Magrez 2010 Château les Grands Chênes  (Médoc)

description: This has ripe and polished fruit, with hints of mint and new wood. A ripe blackberry flavor pushes through the firm tannins, and it should become more rich over the next 5–6 years. The vineyard is situated in the northern part of the Médoc appellation.
title: Château Poitevin 2010  Médoc

description: Smooth and rich, this has fine black and red cherry flavors, along with structured, dry tannins. There is a spice note from the wood aging, which is balanced by the acidity. The finish has a fine, generous texture. Give this wine at least four years.
title: Château Tour Haut-Caussan 2010  Médoc

description: This is the blended Bordeaux from Calvet, one of the oldest wine names in the city. It's full and ripe, a rounded wine that has good berry fruits as well as a drier, firmer core. At the end, a more smoky character appears.
title: Calvet 2010 Réserve  (Bordeaux)

description: One of the labels from the Bonnet vineyard of André Lurton, this red follows the approachable, fruity style of these wines. Red berry fruits and soft tannins make it already drinkable.
title: Château Tour de Bonnet 2010  Bordeaux

description: Mushroom aromas indicate a wine that is now mature. It's light, textured with hints of green herbs as well as tannins that are now dry. Not for aging, drink now.
title: Château du Grand Bos 2005  Graves

description: Firm, closed wine that exhibits a strong tannin character. The wine is powerful and dense, its black plum fruits lying under the dry structure. There is a touch of alcohol burn—a shame in an otherwise well-made wine.
title: Château Laroche Joubert 2010  Côtes de Bourg

description: Produced by the Domaine de Chevalier team, this is a bright and crisp wine with red currant and tight red-berry flavors. These are lifted and given a refreshing character by the acidity. The wine is clean, bright and fruity. Drink now.
title: Domaine de la Solitude 2015 Rosé de la Solitude Rosé (Bordeaux Rosé)

description: This is a balanced wine with fine young tannins and plenty of blackberry and black-plum fruits. It is ripe while keeping plenty of acidity. The wine is going to develop well and should be ready from 2019.
title: Château Bel Orme Martial 2015  Bordeaux

description: This ripe smoky wine has fine tannins and plenty of red-berry fruits. With its acidity, dusty texture and crisp aftertaste, it is not made for long aging. Drink from 2018.
title: Château Croix Mouton 2015  Bordeaux Supérieur

description: A fruity, perfumed wine that has attractive acidity as well as spice. The black currant fruit gives the wine a crisp edge as well as an easy approachability. Drink now.
title: Château Haut Pougnan 2015  Bordeaux

description: Ripe and structured, this is a concentrated wine. Its blackberry fruits are powerful and dense with tannins as well as acidity. It will take some time for the juiciness to really show, so wait until late 2018.
title: Château Lauzanet 2015  Bordeaux

description: Structured and at the same time fruity, this is a wine with good potential. Its tannins and its acidity are balanced to give a warm wine that will be fine to drink from 2019.
title: Château Timberlay 2015  Bordeaux Supérieur

description: This densely structured wine has firm tannins and concentration. The juicy black fruits are still developing to fill out the wine even further. Drink from 2018.
title: Château Jamin 2015  Bordeaux

description: Smooth and rich, a delicious black berry juice-flavored wine, its tannins embraced by ripe fruit and sweetness. The wine does have a dry core, along with acidity, although it will be ready to drink in the next 2–3 years.
title: Château Fontis 2008  Médoc

description: Black currant fruit lends the nose a fruity aroma. The flavors are reflected in the soft, dry tannins, stalky fruit, black fruit acidity and smoky finish.
title: Les Caves Joseph 2010  Bordeaux

description: Initially austere, this wine is driven by notes of bitter chocolate and lean fruit. The fruit weight promises some attractive aging, but for the present, it is firm, dry and solidly tannic.
title: Château Bois Redon 2010  Bordeaux Supérieur

description: This has a light herbaceous character followed by notes of warm yellow fruit, kiwi and bright acidity. It's crisp, fresh and ready to drink.
title: Château de Seguin 2010 Sauvignon de Seguin  (Bordeaux Blanc)

description: This is smooth and lush, with its tannins softened by ripe berry fruit and a strong presence of spicy wood. It has weight, density and, on the finish, fruitiness.
title: Château Bois de Rolland 2009  Bordeaux Supérieur

description: Solid, chunky and dense, this shows a rich character based around dark tannins. It has a ripe black-plum flavor and juicy acidity on the finish.
title: Duval & Blanchet 2009 Les Notes Fruitées  (Bordeaux)

description: Firmly structured, this has a dry core that's solidly based on smoky tannins. The fruit is holding back, although in a few months the blackberry flavor should surface. The finish retains the dry, firm character of the wine.
title: Duval & Blanchet 2010 Les Notes Fruitées  (Bordeaux)

description: This is a wine that brings out a soft, tropical character allied to a citrus and a herbaceous element. It's open, attractive and soft, and it's ready to drink.
title: Augey 2010  Bordeaux Blanc

description: Light and fruity, this wine's berry flavor dominates the gentle tannins, while the bright acidity adds lift. Drink this in the next two years.
title: Cave du Marmandais 2011 Château Campot Lafont  (Bordeaux)

description: The wine seems lean, austere and minerally in character. It has stalky black-currant fruits, firm tannins and forward acids. It should age over 2–3 years, but it will always be on the severe side.
title: Château de Janicon 2010  Graves

description: Fruity and juicy, this has soft tannins and an open, gentle texture. It has red currant fruit that gives acidity, with only a touch of dry tannins on the finish.
title: Château la Valade 2008  Premieres Côtes de Blaye

description: This wine's green, herbal character suggests underripe fruit. All bell pepper and spice flavors, the fruit seems left behind.
title: Château Cantinot 2015  Blaye Côtes de Bordeaux

description: This lean wine is high on acidity and structure. The fruit seems to be missing, needing more flesh to feel complete.
title: Château Haut-Rian 2015 Tradition  (Côtes de Bordeaux)

description: This wine is marked by dry tannins and is smoky and toasty, with little sign of fruit. While it will soften, it will stay somewhat tough.
title: Domaine de l'Aurage 2015  Castillon Côtes de Bordeaux

description: This wine has meaty aromas that lead into a bacon flavors. It has ample tannins but hardly any fruit.
title: Château Berthenon 2015 Cuvée Chloé  (Blaye Côtes de Bordeaux)

description: Full-bodied herbaceousness is the hallmark of this ripe wine. It offers great acidity while also having rich yellow and grapefruit fruits. Dense with fruits and acidity while also structured, this is a wine to age for a few years. Drink from 2017.
title: Château de Rochemorin 2012  Pessac-Léognan

description: The estate belongs to the Borie family, one of the grand names of Bordeaux, with the wine making done by the team of Château Ducru-Beaucaillou in Saint-Julien. The result is an aromatic, balanced wine that is both structured and fruity. It has fine tannins, black currant fruit and a perfumed aftertaste.
title: Château Ducluzeau 2012  Listrac-Médoc

description: Ripe and fruity, this is an attractive wine. It has a rich, spicy character from wood aging. It has a friendly, open character, making it ready to drink now.
title: Château Bois de Favereau 2011 Cuvée Jean-Jules  (Bordeaux Supérieur)

description: This wine is quite closed at this stage with dark tannins and a firm texture. The dry edge obscures attractive fruitiness, finishing with acidity and freshness.
title: Château la Tourbeille 2011  Bordeaux Supérieur

description: Crisp and fruity, this is a wine that hides nothing. It is all upfront, fresh fruit backed with lively acidity. It's a wine that sings brightly and effortlessly.
title: Château Lauduc 2012  Bordeaux Blanc

description: This is an attractively fruity wine that has just the right tannic structure, solid berry fruits and good acidity. It's a wine that is developing well and is ready to drink now.
title: Chateau le Grand Verdus 2011  Bordeaux Supérieur

description: This wine is very juicy with fruit, but also exhibits a strong mineral element that adds texture and tightness. With acidity prominent, it seems to be a wine that will always be taut and firm.
title: Château Réaut 2011  Côtes de Bordeaux

description: This wine is firm, solid and strongly tannic in nature. Juiciness is there, along with wood aging, spice and some concentration. The acidity is very present and needs to soften over the next year. Drink from 2015.
title: Château Valentin 2011  Côtes de Bordeaux

description: This is a ripe, fruity wine with rich strawberry flavor. Light tannins and just the right amount of acidity make it fresh, juicy and already attractive.
title: Jean-Michel Cazes 2011 Michel Lynch  (Bordeaux)

description: This wine is crisp with acidity but rounded on the palate with concentrated pink-grapefruit flavors. It has a rich, fruity, juicy aftertaste.
title: Château Ballan-Larquette 2012  Bordeaux Blanc

description: Leaving Bordeaux for the Médoc, this is the first estate along the road. The wine is structured and firm, with some solid tannins as well as generous blackberry fruit. The wood aging and spice balance the blueberry and blackberry fruits. The wine should age well; drink from 2021.
title: Château du Taillan 2015  Haut-Médoc

description: The Bordeaux outpost of the Jackson family winery has produced a rich wine in this vintage. It is structured with swathes of ripe black fruits. The tannins promise some serious aging for this complex ripe wine with its solid texture. Drink from 2023.
title: Château Lassègue 2014  Saint-Émilion

description: Made in a traditional, gravity-operated cellar with 100% Merlot from a densely planted vineyard, this is an impressive wine that manages to tread a fine line between considerable richness and a more restrained, dry tannin and fresh fruit character. Although it does quickly fall apart with decanting or air, it is worth aging, for at least 3–4 years.
title: Girolate 2006  Bordeaux

description: This is a structured wine, with solid tannins and ample woody flavors. But it has the fruit weight to sustain the structure, offering a wine that promises good aging as well as short-term attractive fruitiness.
title: Château Barreyre 2011  Bordeaux Supérieur

description: A soft, creamy wine, with bright yellow fruits and just the right amount of acidity. Green apple skins give texture to go with a citrus aftertaste. Screw cap.
title: Château Suau 2009  Bordeaux Blanc

description: A very structured, firm wine with excellent acidity and dark, dry tannins. The alcohol does show through, but the wine is firm and very dense, a big success from this Lurton family owned property.
title: Château Bouscaut 2010  Pessac-Léognan

description: A big, ripe and juicy wine packed with black fruit notes and laced with acidity. The tannins offer a contrast to the fruitiness, bringing balance and structure. This is an impressive wine, the smoky aftertaste bringing out the wood aging.
title: Château Manon la Lagune 2010  Blaye Côtes de Bordeaux

description: This ripe, fruity wine is full of red fruit flavors. It has spice, attractive tannic structure and ample acidity. With its balance coming together, the wine will be ready to drink from 2017.
title: Barton & Guestier 2014 Passeport  (Bordeaux)

description: Christian Veyry (formerly with Michel Rolland) oversees the fifth-generation family estate's winemaking at the Châteaux Solidaires cooperative. Ripe black fruit dominate this generous wine. It has structure as well, giving a dense texture. Berry flavors and acidity are well to the front. Drink from 2018.
title: Château Beaumont Les Pierrières 2014  Blaye Côtes de Bordeaux

description: Red fruits and soft tannins give this rounded wine a generous feel. It has spice and rich berry fruits that are lifted with a touch of acidity. Drink this attractive wine from 2018.
title: Château de Seguin 2014 Cuvée Carpe Diem  (Bordeaux Supérieur)

description: This is a smooth wine whose tannins have been already integrated into the blackberry fruits. It is ripe, still young of course, and with a stalky texture in the background. With acidity and fruitiness, the wine needs to age. Drink from late 2017.
title: Château la Barotte 2015 Cuvée Prestige  (Bordeaux)

description: This fresh, crisp wine has a light salmon-pink color. It bursts with attractive red and citrus fruits to give a bright character plus tight acidity. Drink now.
title: Vignobles Bonhur 2015 Château Merlet Rosé (Bordeaux Rosé)

description: This wine is textured and fruity. Crisp citrus and red-currant fruits are layered with bright acidity and a refreshing aftertaste. The wine could do with a few more months before drinking, so wait until late 2016.
title: Château Cazeau 2015 Rosé (Bordeaux Rosé)

description: From the home estate of wine academic and guru Denis Dubourdieu, this tight, nervy wine has a mineral character rounded by wild-strawberry flavors. An attractive citrus tang gives it good bite at the end. Drink now.
title: Clos Floridène 2015 Le Rosé de Floridène Rosé (Bordeaux Rosé)

description: The producer obviously likes wood aging, because this is a strongly toasty wine. It has dark coffee and licorice flavors as well as a strong tannic character. It will need time to soften. Drink from 2020.
title: Château du Vallier 2015  Cadillac Côtes de Bordeaux

description: This soft and fruity wine was produced from vines between Bourg and Blaye. A perfumed, floral aroma makes it bright and fruity. Its black currant flavors are twisted by tannins and acidity. Drink from 2018.
title: Château Fleur la Forge 2015  Bordeaux

description: This fruity wine, with its blackberry fruit, is ripe, generous and developing fast. A fine juicy character bursts through its firm structure to give a crisp aftertaste. Drink from 2018.
title: Château Haut Canteloup 2015  Blaye Côtes de Bordeaux

description: This is a strongly herbal wine. Its acidity and crisp texture give it great lift, bringing out lively fruitiness and a green fruit aftertaste. Drink now.
title: Les Vignerons de Tutiac 2016 Château les Jouberts Prestige  (Blaye Côtes de Bordeaux)

description: With its big, ripe chocolate, raising and dark plums flavors, this is a deliciously perfumed wine, its tannins a firm motif around the rich fruit. At the end, it exhibits the freshness of the year.
title: Château La Tour Figeac 2008  Saint-Émilion

description: An elegant wine, smooth and rounded, bringing out smoky fruits over tannins that smooth out as the fruit unfolds. Less opulent than some previous vintages, the wine shows restraint and aging potential.
title: Château Smith Haut Lafitte 2008  Pessac-Léognan

description: Very intense wine, packed with dark tannins, solid and powerful. It is leavened with great perfumes, while the overall effect is dark, brooding and concentrated.
title: Vieux Château Mazerat 2008  Saint-Émilion

description: Solid wine, dark, firm and powerful. The black currant fruits shear through the tannic texture, giving a wine that is juicy, fresh, structured and definitely for aging.
title: Château Brane-Cantenac 2008  Margaux

description: Austere wine, its tannins pushing forward to give power and structure. It is dense, concentrated, with layer upon layer of bitter coffee and dark fruit flavors, acidity and sweet tannins.
title: Château Hosanna 2008  Pomerol

description: This is an impressive wine, packed with toast, yellow fruits, spice and richness. There is structure as well, the fruit layered with wood. Great balance and great potential.
title: Château Pape Clément 2008  Pessac-Léognan

description: Big, rich, almost velvet in texture, this is a powerful wine. It has spice, black berry fruits, layers of wood and black plum skins. Powerful wine for long-term aging and medium-term accessibility.
title: Château Rauzan-Ségla 2008  Margaux

description: The wine is crisp and lightly herbal. It has a good citrus edge that is filled out with warmer peach and currant flavors. There is a good tangy texture as well that gives an attractive bite. The wine is ready to drink.
title: Vignerons de Tutiac 2015 Château Lalande Bellevue  (Bordeaux Blanc)

description: From one of the oldest estates in Blaye, this smooth wine is rich and packed with blackberry fruits. It has a mint character as well as spice. It is a juicy, powerful wine that will need to age. Drink from 2019.
title: Château Bourdieu 2014 No. 1  (Blaye Côtes de Bordeaux)

description: A vineyard on the river plain of Saint-Émilion, Haut-Pezat has produced a wine whose full black fruits handle strong wood-aging flavors with ease. The result is a ripe wine packed with blackberry flavors and acidity that is filled out with the wood spice. The wine should age well, drink from 2020.
title: Château Haut-Pezat 2014  Saint-Émilion

description: With a well-balanced but firm tannic structure, this is a wine that reflects the freshness of the vintage and also gives a feeling of richness. Berry fruits dominate, supported by a dry core that promises aging. Drink from 2014.
title: Château La Barotte 2011 Réserve  (Bordeaux)

description: Very soft and rich, this wine offers dusty tannins now well integrated into the ripe fruits, It is full of red fruit and some herbal flavors, along with a light level of acidity. Drink now and until 2019.
title: Château la Favière 2009  Bordeaux Supérieur

description: Showing the rustic edge that sometimes characterizes wines from Listrac, this still offers smooth new wood and tight blackberry fruit flavors. It is still developing, with the wood probably too prominent.
title: Château Fourcas Hosten 2006  Listrac-Médoc

description: While this young wine is dry now, it has good potential with rich fruits developing well. Dark and firm at the moment, it will become a generous rounded wine as it ages. The 30-acre Etienne Barre and Christophe Reboul Salze estate is managed by the Stephane Derenoncourt team. Drink from 2019.
title: Château Belle Coline 2014  Blaye Côtes de Bordeaux

description: There is a fine balance between the firm tannins and the ripe fruit in this wine. It has juicy acidity, spice and layers of delicious black-currant flavors. The fourth generation, Nathalie Boyer and Alain Tourenne, converted vines to Ecocert-certified organic beginning in 2008. Drink from 2019.
title: Château Beynat 2014  Castillon Côtes de Bordeaux

description: With the vineyards in the family since the 18th century, it was Jérôme and Béatrice de Monteil's turn in 2010. The wine is dry and firm with powerful tannins. It is still young and there is plenty of rich fruitiness there as well. That makes its future good, balanced and ripe. Drink from 2019.
title: Château Bréhat 2014  Castillon Côtes de Bordeaux

description: This wine from Blaye sister-brother team of Marie-Pierre et Pierre-Charles Dartier is perfumed, ripe with black fruits and with a generous smooth texture. With the hint of tannin from the wood aging and the black-plum fruits, it will be a rich, generous wine. Drink from 2018.
title: Château Cailleteau Bergeron 2014 Fut de Chêne  (Blaye Côtes de Bordeaux)

description: The wine is ripe and smooth with a fine balance between acidity and the red fruits. It is light on tannins, concentrating on the fruitiness. The aftertaste with its spice is dense and ripe. Drink from 2017.
title: Château Donjon de Bruignac 2014 Premium  (Bordeaux Supérieur)

description: Produced by the winemaking team from Château la Gaffelière in Saint-Emilion, this is a fine, smooth and ripe wine. It has black fruits and a structure that is well integrated into the rich wood and acidity. Drink this fine wine from 2018.
title: Château la Gaffelière 2014 Château Chapelle d'Aliénor  (Bordeaux Supérieur)

description: This is named for Arnaud Puyanché, who moved to Francs to make wine but put the project on hold due to the Great War of 1914. Five generations later, the family has revived his dream of producing estate wines. Ripe and full of red fruits, this 80% Merlot and 20% Cabernet Franc is concentrated and rich. The tannins are fine and already integrated into the fruits. With the acidity at the end, this is a well-balanced wine with a good future. Drink from 2020.
title: Château Puyanché 2014  Francs Côtes de Bordeaux

description: As with many Margaux in 2007, this wine is all fruit, very little tannin. That brings out the attractive black currant flavors, but does mean that it is likely to be mature in the short term.
title: Chateau Desmirail 2007  Margaux

description: A lightweight wine, with smoky fruits, soft tannins and bright, vibrant juicy black currants. This is not a wine for aging, but will be delicious in a year or two.
title: Château Franc Mayne 2007  Saint-Émilion

description: There is lovely richness here, with fresh acidity and red berry fruit flavors. The texture is round, lightly chewy, with some wood and final stalky fruit.
title: Château la Bassonnerie 2007  Pomerol

description: Perfumed with new wood aromas and violets, this is a full-bodied wine, its tannins blending into sweet plum and cranberry juice flavors. The wood is finely judged, giving a rounded feel to the finish, along with the acidity.
title: Château Labat 2007  Haut-Médoc

description: Very structured wine that shows its wood aging as well as textured black plum fruits. It has spice, toast and a smoky character. Underneath are blackberry fruits and a strong layer of acidity. Age for 3–4 years.
title: Château Bertinerie 2008 Cru Réserve  (Blaye Côtes de Bordeaux)

description: Dark colored wine, its fruit structured with building blocks of dense tannins, acidity and a plum skin texture. The wine has a fine balance, rich but also restrained and elegant. For aging over 3–4 years.
title: Château Haut-Bellevue 2009  Moulis-en-Médoc

description: Ripe, fruity, full flavored wine. It shows its wood aging in the toasty character that lies over the herbaceous fruit. Rounded, smooth with a burst of citrus. Drink next year, but also age.
title: Château Haut Bertinerie 2010  Blaye Côtes de Bordeaux

description: With considerable new wood flavors, this is a ripely opulent wine. It has weight, rich tannins, a smooth surface as its skims over the black fruits. The acidity, sweet black plum jelly, both give a warm, ripe character to the wine.
title: Château Tour Baladoz 2009  Saint-Émilion

description: Produced close to Fronsac, this Merlot-based wine has rich fruits and a warm, rounded character. A touch of bitterness and dark chocolate from extraction mar this otherwise ripe and fruity wine. Drink from 2016.
title: Château Saint-Michel 2012  Bordeaux Supérieur

description: Very Merlot dominated, this is a ripe and soft wine. It has some dryness that forms the core, but the rich fruit with its balanced acidity dominates. Smooth now, it will age quickly and easily and should be drunk from 2015.
title: Cheval Quancard 2012 Chai de Bordes  (Bordeaux)

description: There is plenty of acidity in Sylvaine and Yannick Fournier's wine as well as ripe red-currant and spice flavors. The streak of crispness goes right through, lively and tight with a tangy, almost New World aftertaste. Drink from late 2016.
title: Château de Bonhoste 2015  Bordeaux Blanc

description: The Lobre family created a herbal wine that is crisp with green fruits, green herbs and tangy acidity. It is fresh, lightly perfumed and with touches of more tropical flavors. The wine could do with a few more months, so drink from late 2016.
title: Château de l'Aubrade 2015  Bordeaux Blanc

description: This is a crisp wine, dominated by rounded Sémillon and perfumed with Muscadelle. It has the bright freshness of the 2013 vintage with citrus and red apple flavors. There is a light mineral aftertaste. Drink now.
title: Château Ducasse 2013  Bordeaux Blanc

description: This is a young, structured wine that needs some time to develop. It has stalky tannins over black-currant fruits that give the wine both structure and freshness. With its dusty texture and spice flavors from the wood aging, it will be best drunk from 2018.
title: Château la Fleur 2014  Montagne-Saint-Émilion

description: From its origin in 1789, the Barthe family vineyards were in the hands of sons. In 1991, Véronique Barthe took over and is now developing sustainable vineyards. This vintage is perfumed with touches of fruit candies that will probably integrate better as the wine settles down. Behind this confected front, there is good fruit, crisp acidity and a lively, bright aftertaste. Wait until late 2016 to drink.
title: Château la Freynelle 2015  Bordeaux Blanc

description: The Courselle sisters, Marie and Sylvie, continue to boost their white style with the lovely blend of 50% Sémillon, 35% Sauvignon Blanc and 15% Sauvignon Gris. The wine is still developing, although it is already giving hints of its spice and ripe apple future. It is a full-bodied wine, only lightly textured. As it develops, it will add to its rich character.
title: Château Thieuley 2015  Bordeaux Blanc

description: From a small portion of the Fonréaud vineyard, this blend of 65% Sauvignon Blanc with Sémillon and Muscadelle is delicately wood aged to give a ripe fruity wine with added spice. It is perfumed and aromatic with a smooth creamy texture. With its intense acidity, it is a delicious and refreshing wine. Drink now.
title: Château Fonréaud 2014 Le Cygne  (Bordeaux Blanc)

description: Produced from Michel and Isabelle Dietrich's oldest vines on the plateau above the Cadillac fortress, the wine is rich. There's plenty of black-currant fruit and acidity to balance while still showing its wood aging. The wines are vegan (no animal products in production). Drink this wine from 2018.
title: Chateau Haut Rian 2014 Cuvée Prestige  (Côtes de Bordeaux)

description: The second wine from this estate, which is currently performing very well, is a rich and opulent wine, typical of the vintage. It has generous black fruits, concentrated tannins and a firm core. All of this points to a wine that will be delicious to drink. Wait until 2018.
title: Château Lafon-Rochet 2009 Les Pélerins de Lafon-Rochet  (Saint-Estèphe)

description: This is the second wine of Laroze, a property situated on the plateau to the west of Saint-Émilion. This is a softly ripe and perfumed wine with 40% Cabernet Franc in the blend. It is rich, smooth and dense with black fruits and balanced acidity. Drink from 2018.
title: Château Laroze 2012 Lady Laroze  (Saint-Émilion)

description: Although the wood aging shows strongly at this stage, this is a wine that will develop well. Already its blackberry fruits show ripe juicy character that blends well with the generous tannins and acidity. It should be ready to drink from 2018.
title: Château Rousset-Caillau 2015  Bordeaux Supérieur

description: This is a ripe and structured wine with great fruit and still some firm tannins. It has layers of black-currant acidity along with the dry core that signal the potential to age further. The blend of 50-50 Merlot and Cabernet Sauvignon gives the wine firmness while allowing plenty of expression for the exuberant fruit. Drink from 2019.
title: Bernard Magrez 2011 Château du Galan  (Haut-Médoc)

description: All tangy fruit, this simple wine is light, with citrus and crisp pear flavors. A touch of honey adds a soft side while keeping its zesty fruit right in place. Drink now.
title: Château l'Orangerie 2016  Bordeaux Blanc

description: Soft and bright with red berry fruit, this is a warm, open and easy wine. It has a gentle texture and just enough tannins to give it shape. Drink now.
title: Château Saint-Florian 2016  Bordeaux

description: Fruity, and crisp, it has citrus flavors balanced by an intense herbal character. It's fresh and juicy; the acidity gives a bright, lively aftertaste.
title: Château de Parenchère 2013  Bordeaux Blanc

description: Still young and dry, it has an austere, lean side that is still a way from being mature. Some juiciness gives a fresher potential. Drink from 2016.
title: Château Métairie Neuve 2011  Côtes de Bourg

description: For the vintage, this is a surprisingly lean wine. Some juicy fruit is still struggling out of the very dry tannic shell. Acidity is a dominant character of this firm, dry wine.
title: Château Blanchereau 2010  Côtes de Bourg

description: The wine is attractively fruity, its crispness balanced by round apple and pear flavors that give richness. It has a creamy texture, concentrated acidity and a finish that brings out lemon and lime.
title: Château Buisson-Redon 2013  Bordeaux Blanc

description: This young, fruity wine is almost ready to drink. Attractive black currant acidity and light tannins t bring a bite to the natural smoothness of the wine. Drink from 2015.
title: Château Chai Neuf 2012  Bordeaux

description: This fruity wine is full of juicy red berries that are laced with acidity. Hints of wood aging stay in the background of this essentially fresh and bright wine.
title: Château les Mottes Pradier 2011  Côtes de Bourg

description: The wine shows both rich density and structure. It gives weight while remaining stylish. The delicious black berry fruits on the finish characterize a wine that is classic, balancing fruit and tannins.
title: Château Canon la Gaffelière 2008  Saint-Émilion

description: While at this young stage there may be toasty aromas, there is also intense, perfumed fruit. This complex, distinguished wine is polished, with plenty of bright fruits and acidity.
title: Château Haut-Bailly 2008  Pessac-Léognan

description: Treated now as a separate wine, rather than a second wine, with its own vineyard, Clos du Marquis has developed a dense, concentrated style. It is firm, chewy, the tannins in suspension in the rich fruit. Good aging potential.
title: Château Léoville Las Cases 2008 Clos du Marquis  (Saint-Julien)

description: This formal, upright wine has solid, dense tannins and is well structured: with acidity and firm fruit, it shows its more opulent side slowly, leading to a smoky finish.
title: Château Beau-Séjour Bécot 2008  Saint-Émilion

description: A powerful, chocolate- and berry fruit-flavored wine, powered by ripe tannins and juicy acidity. It has a solid foundation of tannins, on which is built a rich edifice of fruit.
title: Château la Fleur-Pétrus 2008  Pomerol

description: With its classic mineral edge, dusty tannins and firm, dry structure, the wine has a core that weighs well with the severe texture. As a contrast, the fruit underneath is ripe and juicy. A wine for several years' aging.
title: Les Astéries 2008  Saint-Émilion

description: The production is tiny, yet the potential of this wine is enormous, with its tight, textured structure that is still so young. It is opulent and generous while still keeping a tight rein on its emotions. A steely core is surrounded by fruit that has hints of apricots as well as citrus. This will be a very fine wine but it needs many years, so wait until 2022.
title: Château Haut-Brion 2013  Pessac-Léognan

description: This is an impressive wine that transcends the problems of the vintage. It has rich fruit that is sustained by the tannic structure that rests on a bed of fresh blackberry fruits cut with fresh acidity. The wine will certainly age well. Don't think about drinking it before 2024.
title: Château Calon Ségur 2013  Saint-Estèphe

description: This is finely structured, a tense wine with great fruits and an intense texture. It's tight while bursting with fruit. The structure is complex, dense and very mineral in character. It is a wine that will need many years, so drink from 2022. The production is tiny, and what is not fit for this wine goes into the Dillon Clarté wine.
title: Château La Mission Haut-Brion 2013  Pessac-Léognan

description: This generous, almost opulent wine has both concentration and rounded fruits. It's open already, hinting at wood-aging while concentrating much more on the ripe fruits. Packed with fruit and tannins, it's densely textured. It will age, of course; don't start to drink before 2025.
title: Château Mouton Rothschild 2013  Pauillac

description: Freshness dominates this bright, fruity wine. There are apple, pear and apricot flavors with just the lightest touch of vanilla. At the end, the wine shows a great tangy character, full of lemon and grapefruit zest.
title: Château La Rame 2012  Bordeaux Blanc

description: This is an intense wine that is full of fresh fruits, rich green plum and apricot flavors, as well as a creamed apple character. It is weighty and generous, while at the end, the wine offers a more tangy, tight aftertaste.
title: Château Les Combes 2012  Bordeaux Blanc

description: This is a dense wine that has plenty of fresh fruit to support its weight. It's quite tannic though, so enjoy with food. It could also do with time, so wait two years.
title: Château Rivensan 2011  Bordeaux

description: Herbaceous in character, this is a tight and tangy wine with crisp, grassy fruitiness. It has a rich palate, but maintains a tight and nervy feel to it. Best kept for a year before drinking.
title: Château Talbot 2012 Caillou Blanc  (Bordeaux Blanc)

description: This is a ripe wine with tropical fruit flavors that are cut with fine green acidity. There is a good texture with some nerviness as well as lively acidity on the finish. It's a style of wine that needs food.
title: Château Tour d'Auron 2012  Bordeaux Blanc

description: Still very herbaceous, this Sauvignon Blanc-dominated wine is ripe, full of melon and peach flavors, with an attractive zesty character. There's enough structure for 2–3 years' aging.
title: Château Bertinerie 2008 Cru Réserve  (Côtes de Bordeaux)

description: A little rough around the edges, this wine still has some attractive black berry and damson flavors and shows acidity and a texture of dry tannins. For medium-term aging.
title: Château Fourcas Dupré 2007  Listrac-Médoc

description: With good density, this is a success for the vintage. It has ripe, smooth fruit, flavors of black berry, the tannins well integrated. Age for a year.
title: Barton & Guestier 2007 Thomas Barton Réserve  (Saint-Émilion)

description: From a tiny, seven-acre property in Saint-Estèphe, this is a Cabernet Sauvignon-dominated wine with black currant fruit and good, firm fruit tannins. There is a smoky wood element to balance the lively, youthful acidity.
title: Château Graves de Pez 2009  Saint-Estèphe

description: A full, spicy wine, with weight from wood and attractive fruits. There is a touch of stalkiness here, a sign of the vintage, but the wine is maturing well in a food-friendly way.
title: Château Haut Ballet 2007  Fronsac

description: Bel-Air is owned by the Cazes family of Château Lynch-Bages in Pauillac, and the pedigree of the winemaking shows. A rich, almost opulent wine, tempered with tannins. Flavors of dark black figs, herbs and wood come together harmoniously. It has a tense edge of tannin that promises aging.
title: Château Villa Bel Air 2003  Graves

description: 85-87 Barrel sample. Ripe, unfocussed fruit, simple blackberry jelly flavor, lacking the structure and the acidity.
title: Château Berliquet 2008 Barrel sample  (Saint-Émilion)

description: 85-87 Barrel sample. High wood here, with spicy toast. The fruit is lean by comparison, hinting at freshness, but not giving much through the wood and tannin.
title: Château Lilian Ladouys 2008 Barrel sample  (Saint-Estèphe)

description: The tannins are very fine, with rich fruitcake and smoky flavors. Red berry and black plums give a fruity character, along with delicious acidity. The wine is structured while still remaining very approachable.
title: Château Tronquoy-Lalande 2009  Saint-Estèphe

description: This is a tangy wine, packed with fruit, orange and lemon zest and a background hint of herbaceousness. A tight, steely texture gives both acidity and the promise of aging. Drink from early 2016.
title: Château la Verrière 2014  Bordeaux Blanc

description: A touch of spice comes from the wood aging. This has plenty of fruit as well, promising a good future. Ripe and rich, this should age well, so drink from 2016. The Maurice Robert family winery, in the heart of Entre-Deux-Mers, is now in its third generation. The Sauve Majeure Benedictine abbey in the village is on the UNESCO World Heritage pilgrim route.
title: Château Turcaud 2014 Cuvée Majeure  (Bordeaux Blanc)

description: An elegant wine that is given weight by its rich black fruits and style by the balance between tannins and acidity. There is a fresh character to this bright and fruity wine at this stage. Give it 4–5 years and it will begin to develop secondary aromas. Drink from 2016.
title: Château Chantelune 2011  Margaux

description: French philosopher and writer Charles-Louis de Montesquieu once lived at the moated Château de la Brède, hence the name of this wine. It is a ripe, finely perfumed wine, with new wood and eucalyptus aromas, rich red fruits and a soft, open series of tannins. It is almost ready to drink, but the chocolate edge suggests it should be kept until 2017.
title: Château de la Brède 2011 Cuvée Montesquieu  (Graves)

description: Very ripe, powerful and extracted, the wine has a bitter edge, a dark and tannic structure and a dense texture. With its edge of cocoa and layers of wood over the blackberry fruits, it's a wine that will need a while before drinking. Drink from 2016.
title: Château Franc Pipeau 2010 Descombes  (Saint-Émilion)

description: With strong new wood aromas, this concentrated wine shows vanilla as well as black-fruit flavors. Acidity cuts the richness, giving shape to wine and focusing on the balance. With firm tannins in the background, it needs several years. Drink from 2016.
title: Château Haut Selve 2010  Graves

description: Showing the freshness of the year as much as the structure, this is a ripe wine that's full of fragrant black currants and some tight acidity. It is smooth and soft, the tannins are already integrating, so drink from 2015.
title: Château le Prieuré 2011  Saint-Émilion

description: Baked apple aromas and crisp green fruit flavors set up this bright, fruity wine. With its lively character and juicy citrus notes, it could age a few more months. Save it for summer 2018.
title: Château des Tourtes 2016 Cuvée Classique  (Blaye Côtes de Bordeaux)

description: Rich and fruity, this wine is packed with blackberry and damson flavors. The firm tannins at the back are balanced, giving an attractive character that will be ready to drink from 2020.
title: Château Gigault 2015 Cuvée Viva  (Blaye Côtes de Bordeaux)

description: With its strong aromatic character, this wine layers firm tannins and intense acidity. Underneath all this, there is some fine fruit potential, evoking ripe blackberries. Drink from 2020.
title: Château le Doyenne 2015  Côtes de Bordeaux

description: Produced from organically grown grapes, this Merlot-dominated wine is bright with red fruit and lined with tight tannins. It has the crisp edge of youth that will fill out with time. Drink from 2019.
title: Château les Aubiers 2015  Blaye Côtes de Bordeaux

description: This wine is dry and extracted, with firm, almost bitter tannins. Licorice and black chocolate flavors dominate. It will take several years for the fruit potential to show. Drink from 2021.
title: Château les Conseillans 2015  Cadillac Côtes de Bordeaux

description: This juicy, fruity wine has red berry fruit and gentle tannins. Although ripe, it's not rich but attractive and likely to age quickly. Drink from 2019.
title: Château Pilet 2015 Alt. 120 Metres  (Côtes de Bordeaux)

description: Spice and damson flavors give this wine a fruity character. Add its smoky tannins and toasty layers, and it is a wine that needs to age. Drink from 2020.
title: Château Tour Saint Germain 2015 Cuvée Moulin  (Blaye Côtes de Bordeaux)

description: Tight, crisp and mineral driven, this wine has citrus fruits and a steely texture, demonstrating that it needs to age for a year.
title: Château de Bonhoste 2011  Bordeaux Blanc

description: This is a fruity wine, and its black currant flavor emerging right away. Next comes the bright acidity, while the tannins form a solid, dark and dry contrast. The wine needs at least two years to soften into something rich.
title: Château de la Bouyère 2010  Bordeaux

description: Both the aromas and the flavors show considerable wood-aging notes that need time to integrate. The wine will begin to show its fruity black-currant and red plum flavors in a year. It has the richness and ripeness for aging over several years.
title: Château de Macard 2010  Bordeaux Supérieur

description: Ripe red fruits give this wine a juicy feel. The fruit is balanced, with new wood and caramel flavors offering a smooth contrast to each other. The smoky aftertaste is warm and ripe.
title: Château Haut-Mongeat 2009 Cuvée Isabelle  (Bordeaux Supérieur)

description: Very herbaceous and fruity, this has gooseberry, lime and pink grapefruit flavors. It's a light, bright and attractive, and it will be ready to drink in a few months.
title: Château La Mothe du Barry 2011  Entre-Deux-Mers

description: With its forward acidity, this shows its fresh side before revealing its ripe red-berry flavors. Tannins form a firm, solid base that dominates the finish.
title: Château Moulin de Mallet 2010  Bordeaux

description: Smoky, ripe and juicy, this wine's weight and tannins are secondary to the plum note and balancing acidity. The wine is open, generous and delicious already.
title: Château Pey la Tour 2009 Réserve du Château  (Bordeaux Supérieur)

description: This is a fruity effort, with a blackberry note that is laced with attractive tannins and acids. With its smooth, ripe texture and full mouthfeel, this is already approachable.
title: Cheval Quancard 2009 Chai de Bordes  (Bordeaux)

description: This lightly structured wine is all fruit. Its red berry flavors are already well integrated with the smoky tannins that form its core. It will, however, age quickly. Drink from 2019.
title: Château Côte Montpezat 2014  Castillon Côtes de Bordeaux

description: This is a ripe wine that also has a light touch. That gives black-currant fruit and tannins along with a poised structure and attractive crisp acidity. The Cabernet Sauvignon fruit dominates while also giving the wine a dry core. Drink this stylish wine from 2019.
title: Château Escot 2012  Médoc

description: This is the second wine of Listrac's Chateau Fonréaud. A blend of half-and-half Merlot and Cabernet Sauvignon, it is rich and juicy. Blackberry fruits are shot through with acidity and balanced with generous tannins that are softening well. With its juicy acidity and fruity aftertaste, it will be ready to drink from late 2017.
title: Château Fonréaud 2014 La Légende  (Haut-Médoc)

description: The wine is dry and firm with a serious amount of new wood and spice. That seems to have swamped the fruit at this stage. There is enough fruit weight there to develop as the wine matures. Drink from 2022.
title: Château Monbrison 2014  Margaux

description: A juicy, fruity wine with attractive, bright red-berry fruit flavors. The wine is fresh, touched nicely by some wood and tannins.
title: Pezat 2010  Bordeaux

description: Firm and structured, this is a textured wine, its tannins currently showing strongly. The blueberry fruit flavors offer a juicy, friendly contrast, resulting in a balanced wine that will benefit from a year or two of aging.
title: Château Arnaud Jouan 2010 Cuvée Prestige  (Côtes de Bordeaux)

description: A rich but structured wine, this shows dark fruits and a strong tannic core. There is fine acidity and a taut, mineral texture.
title: Château Franc-Cardinal 2010  Francs Côtes de Bordeaux

description: Dense and tannic, a firmly wood- and stalky-fruit based wine. Black currant fruits and dry tannins are the prominent characteristics. On the finish, the fruit shows a juicier feel.
title: Château Lamothe 2010 Première Cuvée  (Côtes de Bordeaux)

description: With polished, new-wood aromas and flavors, this is a smooth wine. Hints of mint go with the black plum notes and the firmer, bitter chocolate flavors. In a modern style, this is likely to age quickly.
title: Château Reynon 2010  Cadillac Côtes de Bordeaux

description: Earthy in character, this is powerful and rich, yet somewhat rustic. It has concentrated ripe fruit, dark and dense, best at the end with its juiciness.
title: Goulée 2010  Médoc

description: This is a spicy ripe wine. Its berry flavors are shot through with acidity and generous tannins. It is still dry and still young although its future is assured. This estate is Bordeaux producer and négociant Nicolas Thienpont's family home. Drink this fine wine from 2019.
title: Château Puygueraud 2014  Francs Côtes de Bordeaux

description: This 16th century chateau with towers is in the northern Médoc. The wine is spicy with the wood aging still showing. At the same time, the ripe black-currant fruit is developing well and as it ages further, the wine will become finely balanced. With 60% Cabernet in the blend, this is a wine for the long term. Drink from 2019.
title: Château Tour Prignac 2014  Médoc

description: Juicy red fruit dominates this wine. It has some firm tannins underneath—just enough to support the delicious raspberry and red-currant flavors. It is maturing well and will be ready to drink from 2017.
title: Château Auguste 2014  Bordeaux Supérieur

description: This is a ripe and juicy wine that has fine red fruits and some firm tannins. It is spicy, concentrated and fully fruited, with well-balanced tannins. Drink this attractive wine from 2018.
title: Château Feret Lambert 2014  Bordeaux Supérieur

description: A ripe and spicy wine, this is structured with black-currant fruits and lively acidity. It is still very young: its exuberant fruitiness likely to calm as it matures. Give this ripe wine until 2019.
title: Château Haut le Valette 2015 Cuvée Caractères  (Blaye Côtes de Bordeaux)

description: The wine has plenty of juicy red fruits as well as a firm structure. It is on the fresh fruity side, with red currant and berry flavors. The acidity is very present, needing to calm down to become really drinkable. Wait until 2018 to drink.
title: Château la Favière 2014  Bordeaux Supérieur

description: This is a spicy wine, with toasty wood flavors. Happily the fruit is also there, spreading its juicy acidity over the tannins. Let this wine fill out over the next few months and it will be ready to drink from 2017.
title: Château Lamothe-Vincent 2014 Intense  (Bordeaux)

description: This is an attractively perfumed wine. It has fine acidity, ripe wood flavors and spice. The weight of the fruit is enough to balance with the wood. It will be ready to drink from 2018.
title: Château Malbat 2014  Bordeaux Supérieur

description: This 60-40 blend of Sauvignon Blanc and Sauvignon Gris is a tightly textured wine with hints of minerality as well as citrus and grapefruit. The wine is crisp, bright in the mouth and packed with attractive final acidity. This estate is the home of Bordeaux producer Nicolas Thienpont.
title: Château Puygueraud 2015  Francs Côtes de Bordeaux

description: The wine is soft, ripe and fruity with fine tannins and plenty of red-berry fruit flavors. Structured and spicy, it will develop well into a concentrated ripe wine. Jean-Michel Baudet's Blaye estate vineyards were the first to be certified sustainable by Terra Vitis. Drink from 2018.
title: Château Ricaud 2014  Blaye Côtes de Bordeaux

description: Crisp and fresh, this is a light wine that is dominated by red-currant fruits. It has considerable acidity as well as tannins. Fruity while lightly perfumed, it will be ready from 2018.
title: Château Tour de Gilet 2014  Bordeaux Supérieur

description: Sweet fruit dominates this attractive, spicy wine. It has ample acidity, giving a fine, fresh black-currant character and tannins that are already melding into the wine. For medium-term aging of 3–5 years.
title: Château Lamothe-Cissac 2011  Haut-Médoc

description: Dense and concentrated and still very young, the wine has ripe blackberry flavors, a sense of ripeness and a dry wood-and-tannin core. Give the wine at least 4–5 years.
title: Château Tanesse 2011  Cadillac Côtes de Bordeaux

description: This wine, from selected vineyards owned by the Carrille family, is rich and now mature. Its tannins are merging with the secondary flavors of the fruit as it softens and develops a spice and tobacco character. Drink this wine now.
title: Poupille 2011  Castillon Côtes de Bordeaux

description: This 240-acre property has produced a ripe, smooth and fruity wine. With layers of tannins under the juicy blackberry flavors, it is already balanced and likely to be approachable soon. There is a lively edge of acidity to keep everything crisp. Drink from 2019.
title: Château Blaignan 2014  Médoc

description: This is the first vintage of this property under the ownership of Château Ausone. The wine has a solid structure and firm tannins that offer rich fruit. It is balanced, full of tannins and with fine acidity as well as bold red fruits. Drink from 2023.
title: Château la Clotte 2014  Saint-Émilion

description: Bell peppers and green herbs as well as dark tannins are the main characters of this very dry, bitter wine.
title: Château des Tourtes 2010  Blaye Côtes de Bordeaux

description: A diffuse wine without focus. The tannins and the fruit are some way apart, while the final flavor is dry and tough.
title: Château la Petite Roque 2010  Blaye Côtes de Bordeaux

description: Aromas and flavors of rhubarb and red pepper dominate, resulting in a wine that is sharp and unbalanced.
title: Château Dubraud 2010  Blaye Côtes de Bordeaux

description: 94–96. Barrel sample. A surprisingly fresh Margaux considering that it's dominated by 87% Cabernet Sauvignon. Dense tannins, black fruits and tight acidity combine to present a wine that shows, for a Château Margaux, medium-term potential.
title: Château Margaux 2012 Barrel Sample  (Margaux)
