title: Clos des Jacobins 2009 Barrel sample  (Saint-Émilion)

description: 90-92 Barrel sample. Dense, smoky tannins over ripe fruit with layers of powerful structure. It is extracted but also well-made.
title: Clos Magdelaine 2009 Barrel sample  (Margaux)

description: 90-92 Barrel sample. Soft, fleshy and fruity, with tannins that are very ripe. The fruit has blackberry juice, sweet with an edge of licorice.
title: Goulée 2009 Barrel sample  (Médoc)

description: 90-92 Barrel sample. It takes a while for this wine to show. Then it has solid tannins, topped by ripe berry flavors, rich plums and an edge of juiciness.
title: Château Bouscaut 2009 Barrel sample  (Pessac-Léognan)

description: 90-92 Barrel sample. A bright, shiny wine, spiced with blackcurrants and sweet plums, very fruity, dancing with liveliness.
title: Château Brillette 2009 Barrel sample  (Moulis-en-Médoc)

description: 90-92 Barrel sample. Firm tannins, but also ripe, sweet fruits, with a fine balance. While the wine is on the light, fresh side, it does have a good, final structure.
title: Château Coufran 2009 Barrel sample  (Haut-Médoc)

description: 90-92 Barrel sample. From a vineyard right on the edge of the city of Saint-Emilion, this is a rounded wine, packed with ripe and generous fruit, black cherries and velvet tannins. The finish is very juicy.
title: Le Carré 2009 Barrel sample  (Saint-Émilion)

description: 90-92 Barrel sample. Tough tannins over juicy fruit. The wine has great ripeness as well as freshness. The intensity of the blackcurrant is considerable.
title: Château Cos Labory 2009 Barrel sample  (Saint-Estèphe)

description: 90-92 Barrel sample. The juicy blackcurrant flavors of the year show through here, the wine a firm balance between juicy fruit and the driest of tannins.
title: Château les Ormes de Pez 2009 Barrel sample  (Saint-Estèphe)

description: 90-92 Barrel sample. A finely structured wine, its tannins firm but generous. It has some dark characters, black plums and a solid texture, but it is also fired with super-rich fruit.
title: Château Moulin de la Rose 2009 Barrel sample  (Saint-Julien)

description: 90-92 Barrel sample. Under new ownership after the sale by Alain Raynaud, this is now a lighter style of wine. But it does have great acidity, really fresh, with smoky tannins.
title: Château Quinault L'Enclos 2009 Barrel sample  (Saint-Émilion)

description: 90-92 Barrel sample. Packed with ripe fruits, caramel flavors, lots of wood, solid and well balanced. Good final acidity.
title: Château Rahoul 2009 Barrel sample  (Graves)

description: 89-91 Barrel sample. A rounded wine, packed with rich fruits, feeling generous. The plum and damson juice flavors are dominant, ripe and powerful.
title: Château d'Angludet 2009 Barrel sample  (Margaux)

description: 89-91 Barrel sample. Juicy, the fruit showing some awkward super-maturity. Power, but the structure is missing.
title: Château Grand-Puy Ducasse 2009 Barrel sample  (Pauillac)

description: 89-91 Barrel sample. A big wine, with intense dark tannins and great concentration. This is a wine of power, somewhat rough around the edges. To finish, great juiciness.
title: Château Lafleur-Gazin 2009 Barrel sample  (Pomerol)

description: 89-91 Barrel sample. Caramel aromas, a wine that seems over-extracted, tough. The fruit has a juicy element, but misses out on elegance.
title: Château Phélan-Ségur 2009 Barrel sample  (Saint-Estèphe)

description: 89-91 Barrel sample. Surprisingly lightweight wine, its freshness the dominant character. It shows bright black fruits and some toast, the tannins a sweet element.
title: Château Tour de Pez 2009 Barrel sample  (Saint-Estèphe)

description: 89-91 Barrel sample. Solidly packed tannins, very firm and structured, a feeling of considerable extract as well as a high toast content.
title: Château de Chantegrive 2009 Barrel sample  (Graves)

description: 89-91 Barrel sample. Spice and sweet fruits, a delicious wine, already soft and approachable. Only a hint of tough tannin suggests aging.
title: Château Dutruch Grand Poujeaux 2009 Barrel sample  (Moulis-en-Médoc)

description: Rich Bordeaux, with concentrated blackberry fruits and dry tannins. There is a dry core and intense acidity. The wine is ready to drink, but could mature for 1–2 years.
title: Abbaye de Saint-Ferme 2006 Les Vignes du Soir  (Bordeaux Supérieur)

description: The wine relies entirely on its ripe fruit without any oak aging. That gives a fresh and fruity character, typical of the vintage, with red-fruit flavors and a fine line of acidity cutting through the gentle tannins. Drink now.
title: Cheval Quancard 2014 Chai de Bordes  (Bordeaux)

description: The classic Bordeaux white blend of Sauvignon Blanc and Sémillon has produced a light and fruity wine. It has some attractive green plum and currant flavors that are lined with clean, pure acidity. Drink the wine now.
title: Clos des Menuts 2014 Menuts Fruité  (Bordeaux Blanc)

description: A light and fruity wine that has bright black fruits and an edge of tannins. The black currant and acidity give the wine its fruity character, typical of the vintage. Drink now.
title: Château Bellevue 2014  Bordeaux

description: A soft, ripe and rounded wine that is full of fruit. It has a generous feel to it that is balanced by a more tangy citrus edge. Apricots show as the wine opens up to reveal its ripe side. Drink now.
title: Château de la Vieille Tour 2015  Bordeaux Blanc

description: There are ripe yellow fruits here in this generous, full wine. Touches of spice add to the general feeling of richness. There is enough concentration to give a wine that is dense and with a pepper aftertaste.
title: Château Gantonnet 2015  Bordeaux Blanc

description: Small production from five acres with biodynamic techniques, the wine is perfumed, full of candied flavors. It has acidity and a zesty texture with a juicy, green plum character. The aftertaste is ripe and full-bodied. Stéphane Derenoncourt consults for owner Pascal Collotte.
title: Château Jean Faux 2015  Bordeaux Blanc

description: Dominated by its 86% Merlot, this is a fruity wine that is surprisingly light for the vintage. It comes from the plain between Saint-Émilion and the Dordogne River, giving a soft style with just a touch of tannin. Drink from 2017.
title: Château Joly 2014  Saint-Émilion

description: Pierre Lurton runs Cheval Blanc and d'Yquem and this winery, his home château. This is a smooth wine, full-bodied and with a soft texture. It is ripe with apricot and pear flavors, cut with sliced apple. A touch of spice adds interest. With its ripe, full aftertaste the wine shows the plumper side of the vintage. It is ready to drink.
title: Château Marjosse 2015  Bordeaux Blanc

description: It's the smoky flavors and acidity that dominate this fresh wine. It has hints of black-currant flavors that may develop although the wine is light and shows more dry tannins than fruit at this stage. Think about waiting until 2018.
title: Château Recougne 2013  Bordeaux Supérieur

description: Bruno Mottet's 2013 purchase of Right Bank Château Seguin now delivers a ripe, smooth and soft wine. There is plenty of fruitiness, citrus, green plum and apple, all integrated into the rich texture and final acidity. Drink now.
title: Château Seguin 2015 Sauvignon de Seguin  (Bordeaux Blanc)

description: A finely balanced wine, its tannins showing the influence of Cabernet Sauvignon along with its signature black currant flavors. There is also weight and an attractive plumper character that broadens the wine, surrounding the tannins with sweet berry fruits.
title: Mähler-Besse 2008 Château d'Arche  (Haut-Médoc)

description: Initially mineral and austere, but after a moment, the richer sweet berry fruits come through. The wine has spice from new wood as well as a solid core of dry tannins. The aftertaste reveals the dense texture, and the aging potential.
title: Château Belle-Vue 2008  Haut-Médoc

description: A chunky wine, this has flavors of dark plum skin and blackberry that merge with the firm tannic core. It has a bell pepper character and a juicy, fruity aftertaste.
title: Kirkland Signature 2009  Bordeaux Supérieur

description: With red berry fruitiness, this is an attractive wine. It has a light texture, some juicy acidity and it's ready to drink.
title: Château Bellegrave du Poujeau 2007  Haut-Médoc

description: Herbaceous and aromatic, this is a crisp, green-fruit- and citrus-flavored wine. Grapefruit and green apple dominate the texture with its zesty character. Not for aging.
title: Château du Barrailh 2010 Cuvée Collection Prestige  (Graves)

description: With some structure to go with the blackberry fruit, this is fruity and still light-bodied. With soft tannins and acidity, it is ready to drink.
title: Barton & Guestier 2010 Thomas Barton Réserve  (Bordeaux)

description: Initially austere, this wine is driven by notes of bitter chocolate and lean fruit. The fruit weight promises some attractive aging, but for the present, it is firm, dry and solidly tannic.
title: Château Bois Redon 2010  Bordeaux Supérieur

description: 88-90 Barrel sample. Good, with dense tannins, a powerful wine that shows a rich structure. It has obvious acidity, but that fits into a fresh profile.
title: Château de Chantegrive 2008 Barrel sample  (Graves)

description: 88-90 Barrel sample. Dry firm tannins with a lively sweet layer of blackcurrant fruits. Both tannins and fruit are ripe.
title: Château de Pez 2008 Barrel sample  (Saint-Estèphe)

description: 88-90 Barrel sample. Very sweet fruit, deliciously approachable. Chocolate and ripe black fruit. The layer of tannin is important to keep all this opulence together.
title: Château la Pointe 2008 Barrel sample  (Pomerol)

description: 88-90 Barrel sample. An intensely spicy wine, full of exotic flavors, dried prunes, figs and a powerful layer of cinammon. The wine certainly has character.
title: Château Lynch-Moussas 2008 Barrel sample  (Pauillac)

description: 88—90 Barrel sample. The second wine of Valandraud, a wine that goes more for tannins than its big brother. The fruit is less obvious, less attractive.
title: Clos Badon 2006 Barrel sample  (Saint-Émilion)

description: 88-90 Barrel sample. Ripe, but firm wine, its blackcurrant freshness tucked into stark tannins. Black plum juice gives both acidity and sweetness. The final is a balanced wine, lifted by spice.
title: Château Batailley 2008 Barrel sample  (Pauillac)

description: 88-90 Barrel sample. A spicy new wood flavored wine, offering attractive jammy fruits. The wine is fresh, fruity, not particularly dense, but balancing well.
title: Château d'Agassac 2008 Barrel sample  (Haut-Médoc)

description: Fruit and more mature flavors are coming together, giving a structured wine with black-currant flavors balanced with mint, spice and a rounded texture. This stylish wine is almost ready to drink; just wait until summer 2016.
title: Château de l'Annonciation 2012  Saint-Émilion

description: This is the dry white wine made from the Sauternes estate of Rayne Vigneau. Grapefruit and other citrus flavors are prominent, cutting through the taut texture, along with with a light touch of honey that gives richness. The wine needs to age a little longer, so drink from late 2016.
title: Château de Rayne Vigneau 2013 Le Sec de Rayne Vigneau  (Bordeaux Blanc)

description: The skill of Michel Rolland's wine-consulting team shows in this sophisticated, rich wine. The 90% Merlot dominates, but the ripeness is tempered by solid tannins, stylish black-currant flavors and a firm, ageworthy aftertaste. Drink from 2018.
title: Château du Courlat 2011  Lussac Saint-Émilion

description: From a small parcel of chalky soil in the Fourcas Dupré estate, this ripe, wood-aged wine offers toast and herbal flavors along with ripe apricot and quince fruitiness. The acidity and the mineral edge of the wine promise aging, so drink from 2018.
title: Château Fourcas Dupré 2014 Grand Vin Blanc Sec  (Bordeaux Blanc)

description: This is a ripe, spicy wine with attractive acidity and pear and crisp apple flavors. It is all fruit, fresh while also having a riper side to it. Drink from 2018.
title: Château Haut Nouchet 2013  Pessac-Léognan

description: This structured wine has acidity and a broad base of black fruits. It is concentrated and firm, but with the fruitiness of the vintage. Drink this already-attractive wine from 2018.
title: Château Lalande-Borie 2013  Saint-Julien

description: Black-currant fruit and attractive acidity are layered with ripe, dark tannins and concentration. The potential is there, although it is likely be over the short term. Drink from 2018.
title: Château Gruaud Larose 2013  Saint-Julien

description: This full and structured wine offers good acidity, firm tannins and layers of black-currant flavors. It has good potential with richness, weight and balance. Drink from 2019.
title: Château Haut-Vigneau 2013  Pessac-Léognan

description: With 70% Cabernet Sauvignon, this is a structured wine, firm with tannins that contrast with the black-currant fruits. Still full of young tannins, it will develop well over the next few years. Wait to drink until 2019.
title: Château Laffitte Carcasset 2013  Saint-Estèphe

description: This second wine of Lafite Rothschild is packed with acidity, nervy black currant fruits and extreme freshness. It's a light wine, all fruit and only hints of tannin and structure.
title: Château Lafite Rothschild 2013 Les Carruades de Lafite  (Pauillac)

description: For a Lalande de Pomerol this wine has a high proportion (30%) of Cabernet Franc, giving a structure that shapes the ripe Merlot. It's juicy with black plums and has a core of dry tannins. Drink from 2018.
title: Château Tournefeuille 2013  Lalande de Pomerol

description: Full bodied, structured and tannic while also fruity, this is fine example of the 2010 vintage. It's all structure at this stage, but it's going to be a full and ripe wine, although the alcohol does show through at the end in a pepper-driven moment.
title: Château la Brande 2010  Castillon Côtes de Bordeaux

description: Dusty tannins push to the front, resulting in a firm, wood-aged wine that shows smokiness, ripe blackberry flavors and a firm core. This should be at its best in 2–3 years.
title: Château Maison Neuve 2010 Clotilde  (Blaye Côtes de Bordeaux)

description: This is a delicious wine already, not powerful, but charming and elegant. The acidity and fruit are easy and bright, the tannins light but properly in balance. That suggests this is not for aging. It's already a pleasure to drink now.
title: Château Branaire-Ducru 2007  Saint-Julien

description: The wood that dominated during the futures tastings in 2008 has calmed down, merging more easily into the rich fruits. There is an attractive smoky character, focused berry flavors and delicious spice. It should age well over 3–5 years.
title: Château du Tertre 2007  Margaux

description: A great success, with its concentration, solid tannins and black, bitter cherry fruit flavors. The wine has spice, licorice and some layers of wood. Certainly, this would be worth aging for 4–5 years.
title: Domaine de Chevalier 2007  Pessac-Léognan

description: With a high proportion of Cabernet Sauvignon, this is a structured wine, the freshness coming from intense blackberries. Spice and bitter coffee flavors mingle with the tannins, promising some good aging for the vintage.
title: Château Gruaud Larose 2007  Saint-Julien

description: Definite tannins here, a wine that shows ripe fruits, richness and a solid core. It is not huge, but does have structure, bitter chocolate, sweetness. It's worth aging this wine 3–4 years.
title: Château Léoville Las Cases 2007 Clos du Marquis  (Saint-Julien)

description: A dense wine, very much in the line of powerful wines from Haut-Bailly. Flavors of bitter chocolate, sweet berry fruits and richness are dominant, the acidity a fine balancing act to give a burst of freshness.
title: Château Haut-Bailly 2007  Pessac-Léognan

description: Rounded and rich, this single-vineyard wine is concentrated without losing a touch of its beautiful fruit. It has a fine balance between fruit and acidity as well as a tense line of minerality and tight texture. Drink this impressive wine from 2024.
title: Le Carré 2014  Saint-Émilion

description: Ripe and fruity, the wine is a great success. It has juicy berry fruits that are underpinned by the firm tannins and mineral structure. It is full while also crisp: a wine that is deliciously perfumed. Drink from 2024.
title: Château de Fieuzal 2014  Pessac-Léognan

description: Produced from biodynamically grown grapes, this is a fine, smooth and rich wine. Great tannins are cushioned within the ripe blackberry fruits and generous texture. It is already a delicious wine, although certain to age as well. The estate is close to Château Figeac. Drink from 2022.
title: Château la Marzelle 2014  Saint-Émilion

description: The tannins and density of this wine are impressive. With its strong structure and concentrated fruit, the wine is ripe and likely to age well. Blackberry and red-cherry flavors dominate a wine that is going to be ready to drink from 2022.
title: Château Latour à Pomerol 2014  Pomerol

description: With swathes of delicious herbal and green Sauvignon Blanc fruit just delicately underpinned by the wood aging, this is a wine that is rich while remaining so crisp. It is the tangy grapefruit and crisp texture that will allow this wine to age. Drink from 2020.
title: Château Margaux 2014 Pavillon Blanc du Château Margaux  (Bordeaux Blanc)

description: The small parcel of vines that makes up Providence has proven to be a stunning piece of Pomerol. This wine is all richness and structure, with a solid density and black plum fruits cut with acidity. It's generous, full in the mouth, solid with tannins at the back and opulent with fruit at the front. Drink from 2022.
title: Château Providence 2012  Pomerol

description: Dating back at least to the 17th century, Duplessis was one a hunting lodge. Today, owned by the Lurton family, it has produced a dark and dense wine that has a dry structure at the moment, with a strong extraction character. However, the potential black fruits promise future richness. Drink from 2018.
title: Château Duplessis 2012  Moulis-en-Médoc

description: This second wine of Château Montrose is ripe and structured. In 2012, it formed 29% of total production at Montrose. It opens with severe tannins that transform into ripe blackberry as the wine opens out. Solidly structured and darkly tannic, it needs to age. Drink from 2018.
title: Château Montrose 2012 La Dame de Montrose  (Saint-Estèphe)

description: Initially densely tannic, this wine quickly reveals a more velvet character that is enhanced by the blackberry fruits. Over half the production at Palmer in 2012 was of this second wine, which is already finely integrated and developing well. Drink from 2020.
title: Château Palmer 2012 Alter Ego de Château Palmer  (Margaux)

description: This tastes jammy and very fruity, with tannins that are totally enveloped by the rich texture. Plummy and comfortable, it's all about ripe berries and currants. Smoky flavors come from the wood aging, and contrast with the Port-like lusciousness of the wine.
title: Château Pontet-Canet 2012  Pauillac

description: While this wine does have firm tannins, it also offers a ripe, fruity backdrop that will develop. At the moment, the wine is dry and dense. Give it a few months for the red fruits to broaden out. Drink from mid-2016.
title: Château Bois Pertuis 2013  Bordeaux

description: This wine has potential, with ripe berry fruits and soft tannins that are already well integrated. It is dense, showing a structure that will broaden out as the wine ages. Drink this juicy, fruity wine from Vignobles Dulon from 2016.
title: Château Grand Jean 2013  Bordeaux Supérieur

description: The aroma is all green herbs, with crisp acidity following on the palate. Fragrant with acidity, lemon zest and gooseberry flavors, this 100% Sauvignon Blanc is bright and lively at the end. Drink from 2016 for the texture to calm down a little. The estate is transferred from mother to daughter; Alexia Eymas took over in 2001.
title: Château Maison Neuve 2014  Blaye Côtes de Bordeaux

description: Rich and fruity, this is a balanced, mainly Merlot wine with some good tannins and a dark berry fruitiness. It is still young and full of dryness, although this will fill out. Drink from 2017. George Thienpont bought the property in 1946 and started a family legacy in this appellation. Son Nicolas is the enologist and oversees this and other Francs properties.
title: Château Puygueraud 2013  Francs Côtes de Bordeaux

description: Still young, this rich wine has a stalky character that contrasts with the ripe black currant flavors and good acidity. With a few months aging, this will fill out and be an attractive and fruity. Drink from 2016.
title: Château Roc de Ségur 2014  Bordeaux

description: This Merlot/Cabernet Sauvignon/Petit Verdot blend has a tannic character, smoky flavors and a solid structure. It is also perfumed with ripe berry fruits and a juicy taste that is developing behind the firm tannins. It's made by the same team as the Médoc Cru Bourgeois Haut Breton Larigaudière. Drink from 2016.
title: Château Tayet 2013 Cuvée Prestige  (Bordeaux Supérieur)

description: Rich and structured wine, this is full of opulent black fruits, sweet tannins and an immediately attractive smooth and juicy character. The wine has obvious weight and concentration. Ready to drink in the next 3–4 years.
title: Vieux Château Chauvin 2009  Saint-Émilion

description: A densely tannic wine that is showing fine aging potential. It is well endowed with weight, acidity and ripe black currant fruits. With the rich fruit that opens slowly in the mouth, it has a fine combination of sweetness and structure. Age for 5–6 years.
title: Château Haut Breton Larigaudière 2009  Margaux

description: Soft and juicy wine, all blackberry fruit and attractive acidity. There is a smoky wood edge just to add extra interest, while tannins are light and sweet.
title: Château Lynch-Moussas 2009  Pauillac

description: It is easy to be seduced by the opulence of this wine. But underneath the ripe surface, there is a complex wine, full of tight, structured yellow fruits, spice from wood and acidity bursting to get out. It needs at least another four years for its real grandeur to be apparent.
title: Château Malartic-Lagravière 2007  Pessac-Léognan

description: Slowly the potential of this impressive wine is coming out. It is rich, the new wood flavors blending with the ripe blackberry sweetness and tight tannins. Chocolate flavor power through this concentrated wine.
title: Château Pontet-Canet 2007  Pauillac

description: A serious wine, filled with firm tannins, spiced with wood, and layered with bitter coffee as well as fruit. It certainly has power, the structure ready for long aging, firmly anchored in the dense character of this wine. It is a medium aging wine, 5–10 years.
title: Château Haut-Brion 2007  Pessac-Léognan

description: This is a wine for aging. The tannins are dense, very dry with a feel of extraction. It takes a while for the black currant fruit to show through, with acidity and freshness dominant. The wine is still settling, and time will bring the fruit into line with the tannins.
title: Château Lafite Rothschild 2007  Pauillac

description: With plenty of new wood, the wine has a velvet character, smooth and round. Only gradually does a plum skin, bitter chocolate element come in, giving structure and weight. This is a wine that should age well.
title: Château Beau-Séjour Bécot 2007  Saint-Émilion

description: A powerful, extracted wine, very concentrated. The tannins are dense, giving a sense of tight texture, while underneath the ripe fruits are pulsing with fresh acidity as well as sweet berry flavors.
title: Château Léoville Poyferré 2007  Saint-Julien

description: Silky wine, fresh and light, balanced with high acidity cutting through black berry fruits. The structure has some substance, but this is a light, aromatic wine, developing fast, already delicious, and only for medium-term aging.
title: Château Margaux 2007  Margaux

description: A ripe wine, with a delicious citrus and pear character, sweet fruits and an edge of spice. Pineapple acidity gives both richness and freshness. The wine has both balance and final acidity.
title: Château Laville Haut-Brion 2007  Pessac-Léognan

description: A dark charactered wine, with solid tannins and firm, extracted fruit flavors. The berry fruits are juicy and sweet, with the dusty tannins coming from the Cabernet in the blend. The finish is softer, more black jelly in texture.
title: Château Pichon Longueville 2007  Pauillac

description: On the slopes above the river Garonne, this vineyard has produced a fresh and fruity wine. Firm tannins are balanced by the intensely young and juicy berry fruit. Wood aging rounds the corners of this wine that will be drinkable from 2015.
title: Château de Paillet-Quancard 2011  Cadillac Côtes de Bordeaux

description: Dense and structured, this ripe and fruity wine features attractive dense tannins that are balanced by rich black-currant fruit flavors. The acidity and the dry core of the wine both promise good aging, so drink from 2020. The property has been in the Ballande family since early 19th century. Red-wine production from the 50 acres is overseen by consultant Denis Dubourdieu.
title: Château Baret 2013  Pessac-Léognan

description: While this wine is dark and packed with tannins, it has the fruit weight potential to compensate. It is a firm wine, solid with ripe tannins and blackberry flavors. The acidity at the end promises a good future, so drink from 2022. Lucien Lurton took over Bouscaut in 1979. Since 1992, has been in the hands of daughter Sophie Lurton and her husband Laurent Cogombles. Investments include vineyard renovation, a barrel cellar in 2010 and a B&B in 2013.
title: Château Bouscaut 2013  Pessac-Léognan

description: This wine has concentration, dark tannins and powerful fruits. A smoky character is balanced by the black-plum flavors. The wine will develop slowly, so wait until 2022.
title: Château Couhins 2013  Pessac-Léognan

description: Vines surround a garden full of contemporary sculpture in the grounds of the château. This wine, produced at the western end of the Margaux appellation, is well structured with firm tannins that are balanced by juicy berry fruits and acidity. It is well integrated, on the way to aging well. Drink from 2018.
title: Château d'Arsac 2013  Margaux

description: Continuing the impressive improvements at this château even in a tough year, this wine is ripe, full of structured tannins and blackberry fruits. It is fresh, a sign of the vintage, but it has concentration as well. The wine will age well over the medium term, so drink from 2019.
title: Château Duhart Milon 2013  Pauillac

description: The positive influence of consultant Michel Rolland lives on at this estate. This bold, ripe wine brings out layers of black-plum fruits that are attractive and supported by some firm tannins. It will develop quickly; drink from 2019.
title: Château Kirwan 2013  Margaux

description: Owned by a branch of the family that also owns nearby Château Pontet-Canet, this estate is really improving. The 2013 is attractive with ripe fruit and delicious acidity, supported by a firm, dry backdrop of solid tannins. Drink from 2020.
title: Château Lafon Rochet 2013  Saint-Estèphe

description: Lascombes seems to have got into its stride even in a difficult vintage such as this. Ripe black-berry fruits are there along with firm, balanced wood and spice flavors that give promise of some aging. The wood still has to calm down as the fruit develops, so don't drink until 2019.
title: Château Lascombes 2013  Margaux

description: Straight down the line, this wine shows fruit and acidity. The tannins are relatively soft while the fruit is forward. Blackberries, coffee and licorice notes all come together.
title: Château la Gaffelière 2009  Saint-Émilion

description: Very fruity aromas hint that this is a bright wine, its tannins shaded by the red and black berry flavors. The structure is integrated, showing ripe as well as fresh fruit with final flavors of chocolate.
title: Château Pavie Macquin 2009  Saint-Émilion

description: A tropical- fruited wine, full of toast and apricot and melon fruits. It is deliciously ripe and soft with the acidity lost in the richness. It is opulent and already a pleasure to drink.
title: Château Haut-Brion 2009  Pessac-Léognan

description: This is the first vintage of a wine that used to be called Laville Haut-Brion. It is ripe and opulent with exotic fruits and generosity, very open, very rich. Pineapple, yellow fruits and toast are all present.
title: Château La Mission Haut-Brion 2009  Pessac-Léognan

description: Warm and rounded, this spicy wine has wood flavors just showing through the ripe fruit. It is already delicious, with rich blackberry flavors right up front, although its aging potential is evident with the concentrated, deep structure.
title: Château Brane-Cantenac 2009  Margaux

description: A ripe wine, very open and smooth. The tannins are dark, but it is the fruit—blackberry and red plums—that comes right through. Look beneath this charm, and there is also a wine with more structure, perfumed and ageworthy.
title: Château Grand Mayne 2009  Saint-Émilion

description: Ripe wine, with soft tannins allied to great density. Weight and lovely, juicy, final fruit flavors meld together easily. This is solid, dense, impressive and for long-term aging.
title: Château Lagrange 2009  Saint-Julien

description: A smooth and fruity wine, it has plenty of attractive red berry fruits, some firm tannins and youthful juicy character. It is obviously still new. Although it can be drunk now, it will be better from 2015.
title: Château Fondarzac 2012  Bordeaux Supérieur

description: This wine has fruit but it is overwhelmed by the darkly tannic structure. It is concentrated and dense, with signs of extraction giving a hard edge. The Aubert family has been on the Bordeaux Right Bank for two centuries and currently owns six estates. Consulting oenologist is Michel Rolland.
title: Château Lagrave Aubert 2012  Castillon Côtes de Bordeaux

description: A wine that is finely balanced, poised between an herbaceous character and riper fruits and lively acidity. This is a wine to drink young and fresh.
title: Château Roc de Minvielle 2014  Bordeaux Blanc

description: Heavy wood aromas from new French oak barrels show equally strongly as dark chocolate flavors on the palate from this 50/50 Merlot/Malbec blend. The wine, tiny production from 2.5 acres, is all wood, very firm and tough. Only the acidity suggests a potential fruitiness. This estate has been in the Noël family since 1800.
title: Château Tour Saint-Germain 2012 Excellence  (Blaye Côtes de Bordeaux)

description: This wine has fresh acidity and attractive black currant fruit flavors. They are given a hard ride by the dark and bitter tannins and dry texture. This is a Carreau family wine.
title: Château Les Petits Arnaud 2013  Blaye Côtes de Bordeaux

description: This wine is heavy with tannins as well as raspberry-flavored fruit, with an edge of bitterness at the back. The blend is 50/50 Merlot and Cabernet Sauvignon. Drink now.
title: Château Maison Noble 2014  Bordeaux Clairet

description: With soft tannins and fresh fruits, this light, crisp wine has a red fruit-flavored character that is intense in its acidity. Drink now.
title: Producta Vignobles 2013 Roc des Chevaliers  (Bordeaux Supérieur)

description: This wine is tough, extracted and still very bitter. The fruit is there, well behind the tannic front in this Merlot/Malbec blend. Give the wine until 2017 and decant although it is likely to remain tough. A Châteaux Solidaires wine.
title: Château Haut Prieur 2013  Blaye Côtes de Bordeaux

description: This is a light 100% Merlot wine, with tangy red berry fruits. Tight and mineral with high levels of acidity, it is not for aging, so drink now.
title: Château Lamothe-Vincent 2013 Intense  (Bordeaux)

description: This 60% Merlot and 40% Cabernet Franc blend is very fruity and fresh, balancing dry tannins and attractive red fruit flavors. It is light, still tight with its structure. Drink from 2016.
title: Château Buisson-Redon 2013  Bordeaux

description: Soft red fruits, with tannins that give a firm core. The wine is pierced through with acidity, touched with strawberry jam. In keeping with the vintage, the wine is light, acidity surging on the finish.
title: Château Franc-Cardinal 2007  Bordeaux Côtes de Francs

description: Dominated by grapefruit and pineapple flavors, this is very fresh and herbaceous. The wine is crisp and clean, with acidity at the end. Drink over the next year.
title: Château Lauretan 2010  Bordeaux Blanc

description: An attractively fruity wine—fragrant, fresh and with a touch of tannin. Raspberry flavors give the wine a good lift. Drink it this year.
title: Bernard Magrez 2012 Château Pérenne Rosé (Bordeaux Rosé)

description: Ripe fruit suggests a wine that is soft, juicy and unlikely to age for long. It has red berry flavors, attractive tannins and fine finishing acidity.
title: Château Gamage 2011 Selection Exceptionelle  (Bordeaux Supérieur)

description: A solid and fully tannic wine that also has a bright, fruity side. The combination, with its ripe fruit, is already a pleasure to drink fresh, textured and juicy. The wine also has a future with a smoky character that will allow it to age. So drink until 2021.
title: Château de Sadran 2010 Prestige  (Cadillac Côtes de Bordeaux)

description: Dark in color, this wine from the Entre-deux-Mers shows structure, firm black fruits and rich tannins. Berry fruits, black currants, smokiness and fresh acidity are well integrated and balanced with the firmer texture. It will certainly age, so drink from 2015.
title: Château Fourchou 2010  Bordeaux Supérieur

description: Packed with dark tannins, this complex wine shows a powerful structure allied with very fresh acidity and red berry fruits. It is still feeling its way, heavy on the texture and still waiting for the fruit. Drink from 2014.
title: Château le Bonnat 2010  Graves

description: This seven-acre Petit family estate is dominated by Merlot that gives the wine its rich generous character. In this vintage it was balanced by crisp acidity and a lively aftertaste. The tannins promise further aging. Drink from 2020.
title: Château Lécuyer 2014  Pomerol

description: The improvements at this estate continue with this bright and fruity wine. It is structured with some firm tannins under the attractive blackberry flavors. Crisp and likely to develop well over the medium term, the wine will be ready from 2020.
title: Château Rauzan-Gassies 2014  Margaux

description: This comes from one of the small Margaux vineyards that are dotted amongst the big-name estates. René Renon's wine is ripe and juicy—still young and exuberant. It balances Merlot and Cabernets Sauvignon and Franc in almost equal proportions, giving a wine that has structure and plenty of berry fruits. Drink this wine from 2020.
title: VIgnobles René Renon 2014 Château Charmant  (Margaux)

description: Beychevelle's style is for elegance, and this wine epitomizes that character. It is sweet, soft, with light tannins, achieving a balance of black fruits and acidity, light in structure and depth.
title: Château Beychevelle 2006  Saint-Julien

description: Rounded, relatively soft wine, but one that shows balance. Sweet fruit plays with black currant acidity, giving density, even if the tannins are lightweight. Clerc-Milon, made by the team that also produces Mouton-Rothschild, has become a delicious Pauillac.
title: Château Clerc Milon 2006  Pauillac

description: This is already developing fast, its balance right in place. While that does not suggest much aging potential, the dry tannins, sweet fruit and smoky wood give it richness and concentration. To drink in five years.
title: Château Lascombes 2006  Margaux

description: A light, balanced wine, with floating lemon acidity, freshness and intense orange and honey flavors. With its vibrant character, this is poised, likely to develop quickly, but be delicious all the way.
title: Château Suau 2006  Barsac

description: A dense, rich wine, showing layers of black plum and berry fruits, topped with dry tannins and ripe acidity. This is a firm wine that shows good richness and balance, the wood element present but already well integrated.
title: Château Bertinerie 2006 Cru Réserve  (Côtes de Bordeaux)

description: A 50/50 blend of wood-aged Merlot and Cabernet Sauvignon from selected wines. It is wood-dominated at present, but the fruit feels rich enough to come through shortly, and then it will be an impressively ripe, structured wine. However, it's always going to be a dry, dark and firmly tannic.
title: Château Liversan 2006 Cuvée Sophie  (Haut-Médoc)

description: The Moulin Saint-Georges vineyard is next to that of Ausone and run by the same team. That makes this deliciously structured wine a great buy. It has fine ripe fruit, flavors of smoke and luscious black berries and impressive fruit intensity. The wine's opulence is held together by dark, firm tannins.
title: Château Moulin Saint-Georges 2006  Saint-Émilion

description: A wine that has taken the fruity route, with peach, sweet apple and honey flavors dominating. It is ripe and lush, although not hugely concentrated. It is already ready to drink, easy and friendly.
title: Château Rabaud-Promis 2006  Sauternes

description: Very juicy, smoky, smooth and velvety. It has great acidity as well as sweet fruit. An opulent, open wine, yet with a great final structure; big and sweet.
title: Château Petit-Village 2009  Pomerol

description: Ripe and spicy tannins and red-berry flavors, this is a generous organic wine that will develop quickly. It has new wood as well as red-berry fruit flavors, under the direction of consultant Michel Rolland. Let the wine come together and drink from 2019. Suau is part of an international group of family wineries.
title: Château Suau 2014 Cuvée Cadillac  (Cadillac Côtes de Bordeaux)

description: Vincent and Ludivine l'Amouller, the estate's fourth generation, named this wine after the sailboat of the ancestor who moored in Blaye and bought the vineyard. The 2014 vintage, certified organic, is firm while also rich with fruit. The wine is going to generous, ripe and full of concentration. Drink this attractive wine with its good potential from 2019.
title: Château Frédignac 2014 Favorite  (Blaye Côtes de Bordeaux)

description: This certified organic wine from Damien Lorteau is juicy with attractive blackberry fruit. Spice and warm tannins (aged 12 months in barrel) give it a rich structure. It will have a fine future—a ripe wine with plenty of fruitiness. Drink from 2019.
title: Château les Vieux Moulins 2014 Cuvée les Hélices  (Blaye Côtes de Bordeaux)

description: This is a tough wine, packed more with tannins than fruit. A bitter chocolate character comes from over-extraction of the tannins. The fruit is slow in coming, although there are hints of juiciness. Give it until 2017.
title: Château Fonsèche 2012  Haut-Médoc

description: This wine is lean and austere, with extracted tannins that have left no sense of fruit. It will remain hard, although it will be less dry from 2018.
title: Château d'Hanteillan 2012  Haut-Médoc

description: This lean wine lacks fruit to support the dry tannins. That probably comes from the extraction that has also caused some bitterness. It's a hard wine that needs time to soften.
title: Château Leboscq 2012  Médoc

description: From one of two properties in Listrac owned by the Thomas family (the other is Reverdi), this is seriously dark and tannic, with flavors of bitter chocolate extract and wood. It doesn't feel as if it will really soften enough.
title: Château L'Ermitage 2012  Listrac-Médoc

description: This is attractively fruity, crisp and perfumed. With red currant fruits and refreshing acidity, it's fresh and light in character. Drink now.
title: Producta Vignobles 2013 La Cabanne aux Oiseaux Rosé (Bordeaux Rosé)

description: This is a firm wine with ripe Merlot fruits that are still sheathed in tannins. Densely textured, it is rich with berries and a stalky character that needs to soften. Wait for this solid, concentrated and ageworthy wine until 2017.
title: Château de l'Annonciation 2011  Saint-Émilion

description: A well constructed, solid wine, this has a fine layer of firm tannins that melds well with the rich black plums and acidity. Even this young, the wine is showing a balanced character, warm and ripe. It will age, so drink from 2018.
title: Château Franc Pipeau 2012  Saint-Émilion

description: Ripe and fruity, this rounded, open wine reveals its fruit quickly. Red berries and soft tannins complete the character to give a bright wine that will be ready to drink mid-2015.
title: Château Julian 2012 Alter Ego  (Bordeaux Supérieur)

description: Still young and fruity, this is a bright, crisp wine packed with red berry fruit flavors. A smoky character underlies the fruit, allowing some toast and spice to come through. Drink from 2016.
title: Château Mazetier 2012 Tradition  (Bordeaux)

description: Soft and rounded, this wine is finely tuned with acidity and blackberry fruits. It has some firm tannins, although these are well-integrated with the fruit and acidity. This is a wine for medium-term aging, so drink from 2016.
title: Château Tournefeuille 2011  Lalande de Pomerol

description: A seriously rich and spicy wine, heavily structured and dense. It has gone from generous to over the top, giving a powerhouse of fruit and tannins that stretches the boundaries of its structure. It's for those who like super-rich Bordeaux.
title: Cru Lagaillarde 2010  Bordeaux Supérieur

description: Made by Domaine de Chevalier for an order of nuns, this ripe and rich wine keeps a beautiful sense of proportion. Already delicious, it has touches of wood as well as quince and green plum fruits. Drink from 2016.
title: Domaine de la Solitude 2012  Pessac-Léognan

description: Some wood aging has given this wine its smooth texture and light eucalyptus character. It has also give the fruit extra richness and depth. The black-currant flavors are rich, lifted by balanced acidity. This is going to be a delicious wine from early 2017.
title: Château Meillier 2015  Bordeaux Supérieur

description: The vineyards of this estate take their name from their hillside (Puy) position. The wine is still very young with its generous black fruits and acidity still bubbling with energy. With tannins in the background, it will be a wine that develops relatively quickly, certainly ready to drink by 2019.
title: Château Puy Rigaud 2015  Montagne-Saint-Émilion

description: This is a bold and ripe wine from the gravel soil of Lalande de Pomerol. It is now reaching maturity. It has rich blackberry fruits, layered with acidity. The tannic core is still firm giving the wine the chance to age further. Drink until 2022.
title: Château Roc de Boissac 2012 Château la Croix  (Lalande de Pomerol)

description: This ripe blackberry-flavored wine is deliciously ready to drink. It has soft tannins and a smooth texture that is now just right. The acidity and the jammy aftertaste make the wine attractive.
title: Château Vrai Caillou 2014  Bordeaux Supérieur

description: This wine is softly fruity, not matched with the dry tannic structure. It is juicy, perfumed and with tight acidity. A hint of sweetness throws the fruit off balance.
title: Château Chantemerle 2013  Médoc

description: This wine has way too much wood, like drinking planks. It shows little signs of fruit.
title: Château d'Eyran 2013  Pessac-Léognan

description: From vines in the far east of the Entre-deux-Mers region, this is a wine that is just red fruits, lightly tannic and with plenty of fresh acidity. The wine is surprisingly ready to drink.
title: Cave du Marmandais 2015 Murets de Mez  (Bordeaux)

description: The wine has mango aromas that set the scene for a tropical, richly fruity wine. Spice gives an extra frisson to this ripe wine. It has an exotic character that is unusual in this style of wine although it doesn't seem out of place or context. Drink now.
title: Château des Tourtes 2015 Duo Blanc  (Bordeaux Blanc)

description: The wine is tight and mineral in character. It is textured, steely with the citrus fruits giving the wine a bite as well as intense acidity. Think of this wine with seafood.
title: Château du Seuil 2015 Domaine du Seuil  (Bordeaux Blanc)

description: A simple, rounded and soft wine that has light acidity and more in the way of ripe fruit. It is lightly textured, bright with fruitiness with a squeeze of lemon at the end. Drink now.
title: Château Gandoy Perrinat 2015  Bordeaux Blanc

description: Produced from 52 acres of vines close to Cadillac, the wine is ripe, just hinting at a herbal character. Fresh lemon and apple fruit is crisp and light. It is a fruity wine that is ready to drink.
title: Château Haut Maurin 2015  Bordeaux Blanc

description: Red-plum and strawberry fruits are combined with a firm structure in this ripe wine. It has attractive acidity to give enough freshness. Drink from late 2016.
title: Château La Mothe du Barry 2015 French Kiss Red (Bordeaux Clairet)

description: With its soft texture and rounded character, this is a generous wine. Acidity and crispness are some way behind the ripe green and white-stone fruits. The wine, though, is certainly balanced and ready to drink.
title: Château des Antonins 2015  Bordeaux Blanc

description: Christophe and Fabien Vincent are focused on picking the right soils for their grapes. It takes a while. In this vintage, initially this wine is not showing much. It then opens with a tight, herbal character. It is refreshing, tangy and textured with its green plum and green-herb flavors. The wine is ready to drink.
title: Château Lamothe-Vincent 2015 Intense  (Bordeaux Blanc)

description: This is a light, fruity wine that is likely to be drinkable very soon. It does have a rustic edge although that is likely to blow away in the coming months. For the rest, the red fruits, spice and acidity give the wine a soft, rounded aftertaste. Drink from the end of 2016.
title: Château les Verriers 2014  Bordeaux

description: The wine has red fruits and spice from wood aging. It suffers from the lean character of the vintage, giving a wine that shows tannins while not having enough fruitiness. Drink from 2017.
title: Château Montaiguillon 2013  Montagne-Saint-Émilion

description: With its 10% Muscadelle, the wine has an attractive perfumed edge that lifts the citrus fruit. The wine is floral, fruity and crisply ready to drink.
title: Château Naudeau 2015  Entre-Deux-Mers

description: Produced by the Barton family of Château Léoville-Barton, this is a soft and smooth. It has blackberry fruits and gentle tannins, both now at their best. The aftertaste has a lift from acidity. Drink now.
title: Schröder & Schÿler 2012 La Croix Barton Merlot-Cabernet Sauvignon  (Bordeaux)

description: The 30-year-old vines of this estate surround a 16th-century castle. The wine is ripe although with intense acidity at the end. Wood aging has added spice and has smoothed out the bright acidity and red-berry fruits. Drink from 2019.
title: Château Cruzeau 2014  Saint-Émilion

description: Mint aromas and spice give this wine a good start. It is full in the mouth with spice, toast as well as black-currant fruits. The acidity and the crisper aftertaste give the wine a fine lift. Drink this wine from 2018.
title: Château de la Cour d'Argent 2014  Bordeaux Supérieur

description: Crisp fruit dominates this second wine from Durfort Vivens. It has tannins, tight acidity as well as the potential for further aging. Spice and wood flavors finish the wine on a firm note. Drink from 2018.
title: Château Durfort-Vivens 2011 Vivens  (Margaux)

description: The wine is ripe with juicy black-currant fruits and balanced acidity. It has some spice from the wood aging, just enough to smooth out the bright fruitiness. Drink this attractive wine from 2017.
title: Domaine de Valmengaux 2014  Bordeaux

description: Initially, this seems soft and superripe. But the acidity that shows through balances the black cherry jam flavors, and the touch of mint gives a delicious edge. The aftertaste brings back juicy, ripe fruit.
title: Château la Fleur-Pétrus 2005  Pomerol

description: Extravagantly rich, this is dense and supersweet initially, just balanced with acidity. The botrytis dryness is really not here at this stage, but with its elegant creamy texture, wood flavors still very present. This is still at the very beginning of its development.
title: Château la Tour Blanche 2005  Sauternes

description: Hugely concentrated and packed with tannins, this wine shows considerable amounts of dark, extracted fruit. It wins out on impressive power, driving the fruit through the tannins, giving great richness.
title: Château Léoville Poyferré 2005  Saint-Julien

description: Despite its core of strength and power and obvious aging ability, this is already a delicious wine, with mint aromas, ripe fruit masking the solid tannins. This estate has been on a roll for several years, and this 2005 shows why.
title: Château Pontet-Canet 2005  Pauillac

description: You get both apricots and honeyed botrytis aromas that are followed through by a dry core, very full-bodied with richness, the sweetness of the yellow jam fruits, apricots and mangoes gliding over the palate. Delicious, and certainly ageworthy.
title: Château Rieussec 2005  Sauternes

description: Surprisingly dry, this has richness rather than sweetness, and intense, powerful botrytis. The honey is intensely perfumed, along with baked apples and spice. Certainly a long-aging wine.
title: Château Coutet 2005  Barsac

description: This tastes of great Cabernet Sauvignon, with its black currant, cedar and herbs and fresh, juicy acidity. It is as fresh as it is rich, but it has a structure of dense tannins that balances the wine. This is one of the best wines from Gruaud-Larose for several years.
title: Château Gruaud Larose 2005  Saint-Julien

description: Very straight, firm, a wine that seems to be developing slowly. The blackberry fruits are impressive, rich and pure, and the tannins form a dense core of darkness. The wood is currently showing too strongly, but the fruit will certainly open out in a year or so. An impressive wine, but it needs time.
title: Château La Tour Figeac 2005  Saint-Émilion

description: Perhaps not the most open and generous of wines, but in a style that has become typical of Magdelaine, this wears its austerity, tannins and dry core proudly. But, because it is 2005, the wine is deliciously perfumed, and the bright cherry flavors are enticing. For aging over 10 years at least.
title: Château Magdelaine 2005  Saint-Émilion

description: Superrich, but it works because of its mouthwatering acidity. The white fruit flavors are verging on tropical, the spice and new wood are here, but finely judged. And then there is a delicious green, herbaceous finish, which makes the wine both rich and lively.
title: Château Pape Clément 2004  Pessac-Léognan

description: This sleeping beauty of a chateau is showing signs of awakening. With its great terroir, it deserves to make wine like this 2005, dense, perfumed, very ripe, powered with sweet, purple fruit and juicy flavors. It will develop relatively quickly, but then should age over many years.
title: Château Trottevieille 2005  Saint-Émilion

description: The predominance of Cabernet Sauvignon in Figeac has won out in 2005. It shows in the delicious black currant fruits and very fresh, vibrant acidity. The tannins, curiously, are less apparent—maybe all that fruit overwhelms them. Only on the finish is there some austerity and firmness.
title: Château Figeac 2005  Saint-Émilion

description: Classic Sauternes, treading the fine line between sweetness and elegance. Initially, it seems to be dominated by the botrytis, but then sweet fruits also show, with ripe yellow fruits, honey and almonds, touched with citrus. As it develops, the wine will become richer and more intense.
title: Château Lafaurie-Peyraguey 2005  Sauternes

description: Big wood, big fruit—there are no half measures here. The wine is spicy from the tannins and wood, the fruit is densely black with red berry tinges, and the power is evident throughout. This wine has weight.
title: Château Grand Mayne 2005  Saint-Émilion

description: Ripe and fruity, with delicious red berry flavors, this wine is attractive now. It also has some firm tannins built for aging, giving structure to the juicy fruit. Drink from 2019.
title: Château Crusquet Sabourin 2015  Blaye Côtes de Bordeaux

description: Minty aromas reflect the new wood that was used to age this wine. Its red berry fruitiness recalls the vintage while its firm tannins will allow it to age for several years. It comes from the western end of the Entre-deux-Mers region. Drink from 2019.
title: Château de Bel 2014  Bordeaux Supérieur

description: Although this seems initially austere, it has some fruit weight. Its tannins are dry and firm but will soften with time, showing potential for long, slow aging. Drink from 2020.
title: Château des Mille Anges 2015  Cadillac Côtes de Bordeaux

description: Structured and firm, with dense, dry tannins, this wine also has plenty of fruit. Black cherry flavors envelop its dry core, feeling rich and ready to drink from 2021.
title: Château du Cros 2015  Cadillac Côtes de Bordeaux

description: This opens with crisp and attractive spice and almond flavors. They go with the acidity, lemon and apple notes to give a balanced, complex wine. Drink from mid-2018.
title: Château Dubraud 2016  Blaye Côtes de Bordeaux

description: The wine is ripe and smooth, with rich if still dry tannins. Its juicy black fruit and acidity are balanced with a structure that will allow it to age further. Drink from 2019.
title: Château Ducros 2015 Clos Bourbon  (Cadillac Côtes de Bordeaux)

description: This wine is firm with powerful surface tannins. Underneath, its blackberry-like fruit is developing, bringing out spice, acidity and plenty of weight. Drink from 2020.
title: Château Haut Bertinerie 2015 Grand Vin  (Blaye Côtes de Bordeaux)

description: This wine is aromatic, spicy and likely to develop quickly. That shows in the fragrant black currant fruit and generous tannins. Its acidity should be fully integrated with the fruit and the wine ready to drink from 2019.
title: Château Haut Grelot 2015 Coteaux du Methez  (Blaye Côtes de Bordeaux)

description: Richly structured, this is a wine with style and balance. It has plenty of firm tannins to contrasted with its juicy blackberry fruit. It needs some time to fill out. Drink from 2019.
title: Château Haut la Pointe 2015  Côtes de Bourg

description: Ripe berry aromas set the scene for this balanced, juicy wine. Full of black currant and berry flavors, it's already delicious with its fruitiness. The tannins, though, need to calm down somewhat, and the wine will be better from 2019.
title: Château Haut Peyrefaure 2016  Blaye Côtes de Bordeaux

description: This wine is packed with crisp red currant fruit and plenty of acidity. Firm with tannins now, it will bring out more fruitiness as it develops. Ready to drink from 2019.
title: Château la Brande 2015  Castillon Côtes de Bordeaux

description: One of the finest wines to come from Cantenac Brown for many years, this is powerful and dense, dominated by Cabernet Franc tannins and fruits. The structure has a smooth, polished character that locates it firmly in Margaux, giving elegance and discreet fruitiness. Age this fine wine for many years.
title: Château Cantenac Brown 2010  Margaux

description: This is rich, exuding delicious sweetness, with a core of dense botrytis. An opulent, ripe apricot flavor accompanies the bittersweet orange and mirabelle fruit notes. The acidity, sweetness and concentration promise a great future for this wine.
title: Château la Tour Blanche 2009  Sauternes

description: Closed at this stage, this promises a huge, ripe future. Toast and spice notes are balanced around a black plum flavor. The dense, dark tannins create a brooding character, which is balanced by freshness on the finish. Give this wine at least 10 years.
title: Château Angélus 2009  Saint-Émilion

description: A lemon zest flavor cuts through this delicate wine. It has lively sweetness and flavors of lemon curd and bitter orange that lace the note of honey. There is much more concentration to come in the future.
title: Château de Rayne Vigneau 2009  Sauternes

description: It was powerful and dense at en primeur, and it hasn't changed since. This is firm, concentrated and very structured, perhaps extracted, showing the full force of blackberry and sweet wood flavors and dark tannins.  Long-term aging needed.
title: Château Labégorce Margaux 2010  Margaux

description: One of the Lurton properties in Margaux, Brane Cantenac is showing the richness of its finely placed vineyard in this 2010. Smoky wood and ripe blackberry are among the flavors of a wine that is complex, complete and concentrated. It will certainly age well.
title: Château Brane-Cantenac 2010  Margaux

description: This full, fruity wine is packed with acidity as well as ripeness. It has a fresh black-currant character, and the structure underneath is strong. It will develop relatively quickly, but then could hold at its peak for many years.
title: Château Kirwan 2010  Margaux

description: Obviously wood-aged, with a smoky toast flavor, this is a wine that shows the power of Saint-Estèphe tannins in full force. At the same time, there is a blackberry character that adds richness and juiciness, which cuts through the dry core. Age for at least 7–8 years.
title: Château Lilian Ladouys 2010  Saint-Estèphe

description: In this concentrated wine, an opulent botrytis character dominates. Notes of yellow and citrus fruits combine with a lemon-flavored honey accent to produce a wine that has both richness and intense acidity. It needs to age.
title: Château Nairac 2009  Barsac

description: With advice from consultant and Bordeaux University professor Denis Dubourdieu, Batailley has improved immensely in the past few years. This 2010 reinforces that trend, revealing a wine that is structured with Cabernet Sauvignon and is attractive with black currant fruitiness. Age for the medium-term.
title: Château Batailley 2010  Pauillac

description: Dense and rich, this wine has concentrated flavors of botrytis and floral honey. The wine gives the impression of sweetness, with balancing acidity and a core of dryness. Weighty and dense, it's likely to age.
title: Château Coutet 2009  Barsac

description: Superbly ripe, this wine shows upfront botrytis and honey flavors. At its core, it bears opulence, with depth and concentration. The open character of the wine is shot through with lemon and orange zest flavors.
title: Château de Malle 2009  Sauternes

description: This is a smoky, rich wine that shows evident wood aging. This feature adds weight, though the sweetness is currently muted. It is a wine with potential intensity; the fruit and acidity will emerge in several years.
title: Château Guiraud 2009  Sauternes

description: This powerful, rich wine is densely packed with sweetness and citrus flavors. Honey and lemon notes combine with a dry core of botrytis, offering intensity and a complex sweet-and-sour finish.
title: Château Lafaurie-Peyraguey 2009  Sauternes

description: Big, floral, ripe and juicy, this epitomizes the richness of the 2009 vintage. It offers firm tannins and generous, forward fruits.
title: Château Valandraud 2009  Saint-Émilion

description: Beychevelle's style privileges elegance over weight, and such is the case with the 2010. It's a pure-fruited, ripe and lightly tannic wine, emphasizing a blackberry note. This will evolve relatively quickly, reaching a peak in approximately eight years.
title: Château Beychevelle 2010  Saint-Julien

description: The 20% Malbec in the blend helps to produce the spicy tannins and dark color of this wine. The other grapes in the blend add richness and firm structure, plus a blackberry-driven juiciness. With its bright acidity added to the mix, this is a serious wine with good aging potential.
title: Bernard Magrez 2010 Château Guerry  (Côtes de Bourg)

description: Rich and fruity initially, this shows spice and new wood flavors as well as black plum and red berry touches. It has weight without being too concentrated. For medium-term aging.
title: Château Altimar 2009  Pomerol

description: Ripe, juicy and fragrant, this has a delicious red berry flavor that is ready to give pleasure. Maybe it's not a wine for long-term aging, but keep it for at least for 4–5 years.
title: Château de Pressac 2009  Saint-Émilion

description: A solid and dense wine, this is full of firm tannins, plus black currant and berry flavors. It is well structured and concentrated, a benefit from using fruit sourced from low-yield old vines. With its dark, dense texture, it will age for several years.
title: Château La Mothe du Barry 2010 Vieilles Vignes  (Bordeaux Supérieur)

description: One of the largest Médoc properties, this chateau always produces a reliable wine that is ready to drink soon. Soft and already approachable, the 2010 is no exception. Ripe tannins and a blackberry flavor meld into a round finish
title: Château Larose-Trintaudon 2010  Haut-Médoc

description: This is a ripe, fruity wine, with a black currant flavor, layered tannins and refreshing acidity. It's a wine of power yet also of pleasure for drinking now.
title: Château Lynsolence 2009  Saint-Émilion

description: This wine is rich and smooth, and the power of its tannins are already integrated into the complex plum and blackberry flavors. It has a solid structure, with weight and an open feel.
title: Château Pey la Tour 2009  Bordeaux

description: New-wood flavors abound in this firmly structured, dry wine. With its tannins at the fore, plus its heavy toast and sweet-tasting black-fruit flavors, it has weight and density. This is likely to age well over 3–4 years.
title: Château Tanesse 2010  Cadillac Côtes de Bordeaux

description: By Médoc standards, this 7-acre vineyard is small, with a production of 1,150 cases. The powerful blackberry flavor is sweetened by dark plum and licorice notes, structured with new wood influence and firm tannins. There is a juicy finish, and the tannins promise long-term aging.
title: Clos la Bohème 2010  Haut-Médoc

description: A solid, structured Bordeaux. It shows black berry fruit flavors, lifted by acidity and rounded with dark plum, dry spice and firm tannins. There's a fine, juicy richness to the finish, which leaves fruit and dry tannins firmly in place.
title: Barton & Guestier 2006 Thomas Barton Réserve  (Bordeaux)

description: Aromas of smoky new wood and blackberries set the scene for a wine that brings out a soft, supple texture, followed by fresh black fruits and light structure. The second wine of Château Corbin Michotte is attractively fresh, smoky and ready to drink.
title: Château Corbin Michotte 2006 Les Abeilles  (Saint-Émilion)

description: Dry, certainly not softened by the rich 2003 vintage, but showing fresh fruit, black currants and dry tannins. It's restrained, finely balanced, drinkable now, leaving a soft final impression.
title: Château Guillotin 2003  Puisseguin Saint-Émilion

description: Light, lean wine that has some firm structure. The fruit, though, is really not there, just hints of black currant floating past.
title: Château Lynch-Moussas 2006  Pauillac

description: A light wine that shows extreme freshness, rather than any depth. The acidity comes from red currant fruits, showing the freshness that is the wine's dominant character. The finish is short and fruity, a wine to be drunk within two years.
title: Château Potensac 2006 Chapelle de Potensac  (Médoc)

description: This fruity wine is full of cherry and blackberry flavors. It has a soft texture, lightly spiced and with an attractive balance of acidity and firmer tannins. Drink from 2018.
title: Château Barreyre 2015  Bordeaux Supérieur

description: This ripe fruity wine has soft tannins and generous berry fruit flavors. It is perfumed with mint and spice aromas that fill the glass. It's an attractive wine, juicy at the end and ready to drink.
title: Château de Bel 2015 Echappée Bel  (Bordeaux)

description: The wine is crisp with black currants and plenty of acidity. There is a smoky character to this wine that is still young and stalky. Drink from 2018.
title: Château de Garros 2015 L'Excellium de Château de Garros  (Bordeaux Supérieur)

description: Ripe fruit, firm tannins and acidity are showing the potential of this wine. With its blackberry flavors and attractive light tannins, this one should be ready to drink soon, certainly by early 2018.
title: Château de Lisennes 2015  Bordeaux

description: A ripe, balanced and structured wine, this is dense and full of blackberry and damson fruits. It has spice from the wood aging, along with a dry core of tannins. With its potential, it will be ready to drink from 2018.
title: Château d'Haurets 2015  Bordeaux

description: A strong wood component at the moment doesn't mask the juicy ripe fruits. They give the wine its ripe character and potential. As it matures, it will be an attractive, ripe wine. Drink from 2019.
title: Château Floreal Laguens 2015  Bordeaux Supérieur

description: This Dulon wine is full of wood flavors that are currently dominating the fruit. That will change as the blackberry fruitiness emerges from the background. So give this wine until 2019 to bring out its inherent juiciness.
title: Château Grand Jean 2015  Bordeaux Supérieur

description: Produced from biodynamically grown grapes, the wine is structured with firm tannins and an austere character. The sixth generation of the Hubert family at the estate has made a wine that will need time for the acidity and the structure to soften. From 2019, it will have richness and a more full-bodied character.
title: Château la Grolet 2014 Tête de Cuvée  (Côtes de Bourg)

description: This is a fruity wine, full of both red-berry and cherry flavors and some dry tannins that will certainly soften and integrate. It has the potential to be balanced, full and deliciously fruity. Wait until 2019.
title: Château Tayet 2015 Cuvée Prestige  (Bordeaux Supérieur)

description: The wine is spicy with strong wood flavors. That contrasts with the blackberry fruitiness and fine acidity. It should be well integrated and ready to drink from early 2018.
title: Château Tour de Bigorre 2015  Bordeaux

description: Solidly structured, this is a dense wine. Its black fruits add to the density, giving a concentrated, fruity wine. Drink this starting from mid-2018.
title: Château de l'Aubrade 2015  Bordeaux

description: This wine has an attractive salmon-pink color followed by ripe caramel and spice flavors. The fruit and acidity don't feature as strongly, so the end result is a wine that is fat.
title: Château de Cornemps 2015 Rosé (Bordeaux Rosé)

description: Herbal and spicy, this wine has bitter vegetal flavors that don't accord with the acidity or texture.
title: Château Gandoy Perrinat 2015 Rosé (Bordeaux Rosé)

description: This wine has a herbal character that doesn't mesh with the lightly tannic and tangy structure. The effect is of a wine that comes from grapes that were too green.
title: VIgnobles Ducourt 2015 Château Larroque Rosé (Bordeaux Rosé)

description: A strong caramel aroma and flavor spoils the suggestions of fruit. They give a ripe, almost sweet character that doesn't match with the red-currant fruit flavors.
title: Château de la Vieille Tour 2015 Rosé (Bordeaux Rosé)

description: Montrose's second wine has something of the same gravity as the top wine from the estate. It shows firm tannins as well as black currant fruits. These flavors are followed by spice, leather and drying tannins. It does have a sense of elegance that promises well for its mid-term aging,
title: Château Montrose 2010 La Dame de Montrose  (Saint-Estèphe)

description: No longer a second wine of Ducru-Beaucaillou, but a wine from its own separate vineyard, Croix de Beaucaillou is impressive. Firm while also rich, it is firmly tannic, superripe and packed with great dark plum and berry fruits. Fruit and structure well balanced together.
title: Croix de Beaucaillou 2010  Saint-Julien

description: 92–94. Barrel sample. An austere wine that has distinct acidity and a black-currant character. The texture is tannic and dry, but it's fragrant with a light green note that comes through at the end.
designation: Pavillon Rouge de Château Margaux Barrel Sample
title: Château Margaux 2012 Pavillon Rouge de Château Margaux Barrel Sample  (Margaux)

description: 92–94. Barrel sample. With marked acidity as well as black fruits, this is a wine with weight and richness. It has a dark core of firm tannins, although the aftertaste maintains the juiciness.
title: Château Brane-Cantenac 2012 Barrel Sample  (Margaux)

description: 92–94. Barrel sample. This is a spicy, fruity wine that has excellent acidity and a rounded, fruity character. It has some extraction, giving a bitter edge, while the final effect is a rich, juicy Merlot.
title: Marojallia 2012 Barrel Sample  (Margaux)

description: 91–93. Barrel sample. This wine is rich, with delicious fruitiness, as well as ripe black fruits. With all this opulence, however, there is also great freshness and crispness that comes from the Cabernet in the blend.
designation: Alter Ego de Château Palmer Barrel Sample
title: Château Palmer 2012 Alter Ego de Château Palmer Barrel Sample  (Margaux)

description: 91–93. Barrel sample. This is a dense, complex wine that's full of dark tannins piled atop ripe black-plum fruits. The wine has richness as well as lively acidity.
title: Château du Tertre 2012 Barrel Sample  (Margaux)

description: 91–93. Barrel sample. This is a full-bodied wine that shows signs of bitter extraction. It has weight, certainly, along with signs of dark-plum fruits to go with the firm tannins. A complex aftertaste promises well.
title: Château Lascombes 2012 Barrel Sample  (Margaux)

description: 91–93. Barrel sample. Rich and soft, this wine has fine acidity and sweet black fruits. It has a good depth of rich flavor, and a palate that's rounded and smooth. The tannins show a velvet character.
title: Château Marquis de Terme 2012 Barrel Sample  (Margaux)

description: 91–93. Barrel sample. Very structured with enough ripe fruit to yield a wine that is firm and balanced. This is a fine, complex wine with good aging character.
title: Château Chasse-Spleen 2012 Barrel Sample  (Moulis-en-Médoc)

description: 91–93. Barrel sample. This is a big and fruity wine with solid tannins and dense structure. It's ripe and rich—packed with black plum—and yet modern and polished.
title: Château d'Arsac 2012 Barrel Sample  (Margaux)

description: 91–93. Barrel sample. This is a complex wine that's dry at the heart and powered with dark tannins. Slowly the juicy fruit shows through on the mid palate, yielding a wine that offers the potential of solid fruits and excellent acidity.
title: Château Poujeaux 2012 Barrel Sample  (Moulis-en-Médoc)

description: 91–93. Barrel sample. A ripe and fruity wine with some chocolate extract as well as black-currant fruitiness. This is a soft wine with attractive final acidity.
title: Château d'Issan 2012 Barrel Sample  (Margaux)

description: 90–92. Barrel sample. Firm and tannic, this is a structured wine that also supports delicious black fruits. It brings together both fruitiness and ripeness.
title: Château Dutruch Grand Poujeaux 2012 Barrel Sample  (Moulis-en-Médoc)

description: 90–92. Barrel sample. There's a big amount of acidity that flows from the black-currant flavors on this wine. Brisk fruitiness contrasts with a dry, dense structure, while a richer center is missing.
title: Chateau Dauzac 2012 Barrel Sample  (Margaux)

description: 90–92. Barrel sample. This wine has very dark, extracted tannins. It is densely structured, and at present tasting tough, although with plenty of wonderful ripe fruit, there's a refreshing acidity on the finish.
title: Château Ferrière 2012 Barrel Sample  (Margaux)

description: 90–92. Barrel sample. This is a solid and dense wine with hints of bitter chocolate along with super-ripe blackberry fruits. The wine has concentration, richness and a fine ageing potential.
title: Château Pontac-Lynch 2012 Barrel Sample  (Margaux)

description: 90–92. Barrel sample. This rich, opulent wine is packed with ripe black fruits and red berries. It's a warm wine with a generous character that's balanced with a firm core of tannins.
title: Château Branas Grand Poujeaux 2012 Barrel Sample  (Moulis-en-Médoc)

description: 90–92. Barrel sample. This is a solid and dense wine with hints of bitter chocolate along with super-ripe blackberry fruits. The wine has concentration, richness and a fine ageing potential.
title: Château Maucaillou 2012 Barrel Sample  (Moulis-en-Médoc)

description: 90–92. Barrel sample. This concentrated wine brings out all the qualities of 2012 vintage—fruitiness, juicy black fruit and great swathes of fresh acidity. It's a finely balanced wine.
title: Château Malescot Saint-Exupery 2012 Barrel Sample  (Margaux)

description: 89–90. Barrel sample. This is a polished, new-wood flavored wine that has hints of mint as well as an herbal character. It's juicy and soft with black currant fruits lending an attractive aftertaste.
title: Chateau Desmirail 2012 Barrel Sample  (Margaux)

description: 89–91. Barrel sample. This juicy wine is attractively perfumed. It's a wine that will develop relatively quickly with lively acidity and balanced tannins.
title: Château Paveil de Luze 2012 Barrel Sample  (Margaux)

description: 89–91. Barrel sample. Firmly tannic and dry, the wine has density, a dry core and complex structure. With a firm character, not yet hinting at fruit.
title: Château Prieuré-Lichine 2012 Barrel Sample  (Margaux)

description: 89–91. Barrel sample. In its ninth harvest as the Médoc bottling from Château Cos d'Estournel, Goulée is coming into its own as the vineyard matures. The palate is nicely concentrated with chocolate and black-currant fruits, followed by an herbal hint on the finish.
title: Goulée 2012 Barrel Sample  (Médoc)

description: 89–91. Barrel sample. This wine is attractive with light tannins, black-currant fruits and lively acidity. It has a rustic edge, allowing the dominant Merlot flavors to shine through.
title: Château Fourcas-Borie 2012 Barrel Sample  (Listrac-Médoc)

description: 89–91. Barrel sample. There is a severe character to this wine, with its bold acidity and firm tannins. At the same time, the fruitiness is attractive, as is the final perfume.
title: Château Potensac 2012 Barrel Sample  (Médoc)

description: 89–91. Barrel sample. Structured and firm, this solid, dense wine is lightened by fresh acidity that is already well integrated into the tannins. A big and fruity finish gives the wine added attraction.
title: Château Fonréaud 2012 Barrel Sample  (Listrac-Médoc)

description: 89–91. Barrel sample. This is a perfumed wine with new-wood aromas that lend a strongly woody character. The wood buries much of the fruit at the moment, resulting in a hard and dry aftertaste.
title: Château Fourcas Hosten 2012 Barrel Sample  (Listrac-Médoc)

description: 89–91. Barrel sample. This chateau has been newly acquired by the Barton family of Léoville Barton. It's an attractive, fruity wine with warm tannins. The palate is fine and juicy, and finishes softly at the end.
title: Château Mauvesin Barton 2012 Barrel Sample  (Moulis-en-Médoc)

description: 89–91. Barrel sample. Very open, ripe and soft, this wine has spice, fruity plum-juice flavors and just a touch of warm tannin.
title: Château d'Angludet 2012 Barrel Sample  (Margaux)

description: 88–90. Barrel sample. Juicy and fruity, this wine has brisk acidity and fresh fruit flavors, along with a bitter edge of dark chocolate.
title: Château Clarke 2012 Barrel Sample  (Listrac-Médoc)

description: Soft and somewhat dilute, this wine is attractively crisp but does not show great character. It's a fine apéritif wine, light and gently fruity.
title: Château de Parenchère 2011  Bordeaux Blanc

description: This lightweight wine is dominated by juicy red fruit. Fresh in character, it has bright acids and soft tannins. Not a wine for aging.
title: Château des Combes 2010  Bordeaux

description: This wine veers between firm tannins from old wood and red fruit acidity, without finding balance. It's very dry, with a hard edge.
title: Château Toumilon 2009  Graves

description: This is all fruit and no structure. The fruit shows a superripe character, which suggests this is a wine for short-term aging.
title: Château Cluzan 2009  Bordeaux Supérieur

description: The year is a fine one for white Bordeaux, and this vintage of white Mouton-Cadet takes good advantage of the fresh, herbaceous character, with an added citrus tang, and spiced up with some aromatic Muscadelle.
title: Mouton-Cadet 2007  Bordeaux Blanc

description: This is a bold and rich wine, a blend totally dominated by 90% Merlot. It is fruity, structured and with fine juicy black fruits and acidity. The 12 months of wood aging have given the wine an edge of spice that is attractive now. Final tannins will allow it to age. Drink from 2021
title: Château Reysson 2014  Haut-Médoc

description: Packed with ripe Merlot fruit, this is a dense wine. It has impressive structure and great acidity to cut through the dark fruit. Rich and full in the mouth, this will be a solid fine wine from 2020.
title: Domaine des Sabines 2014  Lalande de Pomerol

description: This is a new wine in this ever-expanding series. It reflects the structure and solid tannins of the appellation. It also brings out the juicy black-currant fruit of the vintage that will allow it to mature relatively quickly. Drink this attractive wine from 2019.
title: Kirkland Signature 2014  Pauillac

description: Ripe, round, soft and juicy, this is already attractive and drinkable. It has firm tannins, yet these are cushioned by the sweet black fruits and the lift from the acids. Drink now, or hold this for another year.
title: Abbaye de Saint-Ferme 2009 Vieilles Vignes  (Bordeaux Supérieur)

description: While the aromas speak of wood aging, the fruit comes through on the palate. It is firm, full and dry, and the fruity acidity and fresh black currant flavor backs up the structure.
title: Barton & Guestier 2008 Thomas Barton Réserve Privé  (Médoc)

description: The wine is soft and ripe. Generous blackberry fruits and a smooth texture from wood aging give this wine its richness and open character. Hints of vanilla and spice add to the perfumed aftertaste. Drink from 2019.
title: Château Amour 2014  Médoc

description: Under the same family ownership as Château Lamothe-Cissac, this estate has produced a broa rich wine, dominated by its 60% Cabernet Sauvignon. It is rounded already with juicy blackberry fruits and dark tannins. Drink this already fruity wine from 2019.
