description: This wine has weight and concentration, heavy on the tannins at this stage. Wild strawberry and dark plum fruits are taking their time to show through the structure. Dark tannins from firm wood aging and extracted fruit can also be found here. Drink from 2015.
title: Château la Favière 2010 Muse  (Bordeaux Supérieur)

description: This hugely ripe Merlot has created a monster of a wine, heavily laden with bitter coffee extraction as well as very ripe black plum fruits. Big and concentrated, this is a wine to be enjoyed for its profusion and excess.
title: Château Siaurac 2010  Lalande de Pomerol

description: Ripe botrytis, honey and peaches make for an attractive, open, ready-to-drink sweet wine. The acidity keeps the richness in check.
title: Barton & Guestier 2008  Sauternes

description: A wine that is firmly tannic, solid, chunky and dry with red fruits buried behind the foursquare facade. Fruit flavors and acidity come through more strongly at the end.
title: Château Bertinerie 2008 Merlot-Cabernet  (Côtes de Bordeaux)

description: A dry, firm wine, with light fruits and a perfumed smoky character. It is developing in a dry, black currant, stalky style.
title: Château Grand-Maison 2008  Côtes de Bourg

description: An attractive, ripe wine with acidity and black currant fruits. This is a medium-bodied Bordeaux, the dry core ripened with a rounded, soft texture.
title: Château les Reuilles 2005  Bordeaux

description: 93-95. Barrel sample. Dense and ripe, this wine boasts sweet tannins and flavors of ripe plums. With the vintage's tight, taut acidity, the aging potential is there.
title: Château Kirwan 2011 Barrel Sample  (Margaux)

description: 93-95. Barrel sample. This is a crisp-textured wine, with a complex structure of rich, dense fruits, spice and wood. The wine is only just coming together, promising many years of aging ahead.
title: Château la Tour Blanche 2011 Barrel Sample  (Sauternes)

description: 93-95. Barrel sample. Ripe, fruity and powerful, this wine has intense Cabernet black-currant flavors, with plenty of richness and concentration. It shows the acidity and the bright fruit of the year.
title: Château Léoville Poyferré 2011 Barrel Sample  (Saint-Julien)

description: 93-95. Barrel sample. The wine shows depth and richness while also being very structured, almost severe. Weight and density is followed by extreme juiciness and blackberry fruits.
title: Clos du Marquis 2011 Barrel Sample  (Saint-Julien)

description: 93-95. Barrel sample. A ripe, balanced wine, with a structure that's well-integrated into its rich, sweet fruit. It has an edge of spice and bitter-orange flavors to go with the opulent front texture.
title: Château Caillou 2011 Barrel Sample  (Barsac)

description: 93-95. Barrel sample. A finely balanced wine, with a ripe mix of mango, apricot and pink grapefruit flavors. It has a fresh edge along with a rich, full character.
title: Château de France 2011 Barrel Sample  (Pessac-Léognan)

description: 93-95. Barrel sample. A wine that shows rounded, opulent fruit. Its structure has a dark side that's melded into its rich fruits. Weight and juiciness combine on the finish.
title: Château Grand-Puy Ducasse 2011 Barrel Sample  (Pauillac)

description: 93-95. Barrel sample. Very rich in botrytis, this is a dense, opulent wine that's charged and hugely ripe. The acidity is there in the background.
title: Château Lamothe Guignard 2011 Barrel Sample  (Sauternes)

description: 93-95. Barrel sample. This wine has an intense herbaceous quality, with fruit and nutmeg flavors. It feels and tastes powerful, with alcoholic warmth and a taut and nervy character.
title: Château Haut-Brion 2011 Barrel Sample  (Pessac-Léognan)

description: 93-95. Barrel sample. This is powered by tannins while also keeping its fresh fruit intact. There is a mineral texture that's layered with a juicy fruit character on the finish.
title: Château Pichon Longueville Comtesse de Lalande 2011 Comtesse de Lalande Barrel Sample  (Pauillac)
winery: Château Pichon Longueville Comtesse de Lalande

description: 93-95. Barrel sample. A powerful wine—its concentrated tannins contrast its underlying juicy fruit. This is a flavorful medley of prunes, dark plums and blackberries; the finish is marked with juiciness.
title: Château Gloria 2011 Barrel Sample  (Saint-Julien)

description: 93-95. Barrel sample. This wine is powerful and concentrated, with its tannins showing. It is perfumed, ripe and offers density that's impressive for the year.
title: Château Langoa Barton 2011 Barrel Sample  (Saint-Julien)

description: 93-95. Barrel sample. Spice and green apple flavors dominate the palate of this crisp yet creamy wine. It has a fine, dense texture, and the fruit comes through with great intensity. The wood is neatly in support.
designation: Pavillon Blanc de Margaux Barrel Sample
title: Château Margaux 2011 Pavillon Blanc de Margaux Barrel Sample  (Bordeaux Blanc)

description: 93-95. Barrel sample. Spice from new wood and the superripe, botrytized fruit show strongly in this powerful, impressive wine. It has weight, structure and intensity. It will surely age for many years.
title: Château Clos Haut-Peyraguey 2011 Barrel Sample  (Sauternes)

description: 93-95. Barrel sample. Big tannins, smoky wood notes and prominent fruit mark this wine, along with acidity and freshness. It's powerful, with the most gentle structure of concentrated dusty tannins and intensely-fresh blackberry-juice flavors.
title: Château Pichon Longueville 2011 Barrel Sample  (Pauillac)

description: 92-94. Barrel sample. A very firm and closed wine. It has intense tannins, with the fruit following slowly behind. The structure is impressive, while the black-currant flavors are still to show.
title: Château de Pez 2011 Barrel Sample  (Saint-Estèphe)

description: 92-94. Barrel sample. DA dark, dry wine that shows its strong, firm tannins. The wine is well structured, with flavors of mint, new wood and a layer of blackberry fruit.
title: Château Magdelaine 2011 Barrel Sample  (Saint-Émilion)

description: There is plenty of Merlot in this ripe wine which is produced in the Listrac cooperative. Spice and attractive tannins give the wine structure and perfume. They contrast with the juicy blackberry fruits and fine crisp acidity. The wine will be ready to drink from 2021.
title: Château Capdet 2014  Listrac-Médoc

description: This is a soft ripe wine. It has already delicious red fruits and gentle tannins. With a generous rich palate, it is full bodied and packed with jammy Merlot flavors. The wine will be ready to drink soon, certainly by late 2017.
title: Château de Tourteyron 2014  Médoc

description: The wine is fruity and also textured. The acidity and dry tannin and wood flavors reveal a wine that will need to develop. It has weight and potential richness that will come out over the next couple of years. Drink this wine from 2018.
title: Château du Bois Chantant 2014 Cuvée Laurence H.  (Bordeaux Supérieur)

description: The dryness and tannins of this wine are on the outside. Inside it has plenty of juicy fruit, sweet acidity and black plum flavors. Put the two together and this ripe wine offers plenty of potential. Drink from 2019.
title: Château Luchey-Halde 2012  Pessac-Léognan

description: Fresh and juicy, this full-bodied while structured wine comes from the heart of the Entre-deux-Mers region, which gives the fruitiness and blackberry fruit flavors. It will develop quickly and can be drunk from 2016.
title: Château Peyfaures 2010  Bordeaux Supérieur

description: This concentrated, structured wine has an earthy quality, typical of some Listracs, along with a more juicy, fruity character that's boosted by acidity. Balanced, it will age over the medium-term. Drink from 2017.
title: Château Vieux Moulin 2012  Listrac-Médoc

description: This smoky wine has firm tannins and a tough core. The juicy fruit is taking its time develop, although it will provide density and ripe berry fruits in time. The vineyard, created in the early 1980s, is now at peak maturity. Drink from 2017.
title: Château Laffitte Carcasset 2012  Saint-Estèphe

description: Powerful and structured, this has dense tannins that will always be an important part of the wine. The juicy, fresh fruit gives a perfumed character to the wine and brings out acidity as well as the dry texture. It needs to age, so drink from 2018.
title: Château Lalaudey 2012  Moulis-en-Médoc

description: Ripe and perfumed, this is packed with the richness of 2010 along with its structure. It has weight, juicy black and red berry fruits and a tense structure that still needs time. Acidity at the end provides a fresh lift to the essentially firm wine.
title: Château Maine d'Arman 2010  Côtes de Bourg

description: This is a deep-colored, ripe wine, with touches of wood well embedded in the spicy, rich blackberry fruits. The wine is juicy, with dry, dusty tannins promising some aging. Drink from 2016.
title: Clos Monicord 2011  Bordeaux Supérieur

description: This is well-balanced and ripe, with plenty of room for both the attractive black fruits and the firm tannic structure. Wood aging shows, although it will integrate well. The wine is fruity, likely to be ready to drink from 2016.
title: Producta Vignobles 2011 Château Courbian  (Médoc)

description: A soft juicy wine, with mid-weight. The berry fruits, the black currant juice and the fresh acidity are enjoyable. It's developing fast, and not likely to age.
title: Château Ferrière 2007  Margaux

description: Dusty tannins gives the wine some weight and richness. Juicy blackberry flavors combine with the fresh acidity of the vintage, but with an extra burst of power. There is a fine, crisply acidic aftertaste.
title: Château Malaire 2007  Médoc

description: While this wine has pleasant fruit, there are also some dark edges of black berries and rough tannins. The focus is shaded, still developing.
title: Château Haut Bages Libéral 2007  Pauillac

description: Very toasty wood aromas, the wine itself packed with new wood, fresh spice, the fruit lost somewhere at this stage. But it does have some weight and underlying hints of concentration.
title: Château Moulin Saint-Georges 2007  Saint-Émilion

description: This smoky wine has firm tannins and a tough core. The juicy fruit is taking its time develop, although it will provide density and ripe berry fruits in time. The vineyard, created in the early 1980s, is now at peak maturity. Drink from 2017.
title: Château Laffitte Carcasset 2012  Saint-Estèphe

description: Powerful and structured, this has dense tannins that will always be an important part of the wine. The juicy, fresh fruit gives a perfumed character to the wine and brings out acidity as well as the dry texture. It needs to age, so drink from 2018.
title: Château Lalaudey 2012  Moulis-en-Médoc

description: Ripe and perfumed, this is packed with the richness of 2010 along with its structure. It has weight, juicy black and red berry fruits and a tense structure that still needs time. Acidity at the end provides a fresh lift to the essentially firm wine.
title: Château Maine d'Arman 2010  Côtes de Bourg

description: This is a deep-colored, ripe wine, with touches of wood well embedded in the spicy, rich blackberry fruits. The wine is juicy, with dry, dusty tannins promising some aging. Drink from 2016.
title: Clos Monicord 2011  Bordeaux Supérieur

description: Strongly woody at this stage, this wine does have the potential to reveal ripe fruits and a generous structure. Smoky flavors are beginning to balance with broad red fruits and acidity. Drink from 2018.
title: Union de Producteurs de Lugon 2012 Château Jeanrousse  (Fronsac)

description: Calling a wine romantic is perhaps a new approach for Bordeaux. The wine itself is ripe and jammy, with wood tannins that will be softer in a year. Drink from 2016.
title: Les Vignerons Réunis de Monségur 2012 Romantique  (Bordeaux)

description: Tannins and acidity hint to fine aging potential for this well-made, balanced wine. Acidity and freshness are dominant. Give this wine till 2016 to develop.
title: Domaine Virginie Thunevin 2011  Bordeaux

description: Attractive and fruity, this wine is full of fresh red fruits as well as balanced wood flavors. The tannins are soft, already integrated, and have a warm feel to them. The wine will age, intensifying in fruitiness over the next two years.
title: Maison Malet Roquefort 2011 Léo de la Gaffelière  (Bordeaux)

description: The wine comes from a small, seven-acre property. This 2010 is structured with a mineral character and chewy tannins. It is well balanced; the blackberry fruit synchronizes well with the dry texture and fresh acidity. Age for 4–5 years.
title: Château Graves de Pez 2010  Saint-Estèphe

description: The dusty tannins dominate this firm and dry wine. With its new wood aging and its concentration, it is complex and dense. The ripe black fruit offers power and sweetness. The wine is likely to age well over five years or more.
title: Château Lanbersac 2009 Cuvée Vieilles Vignes  (Puisseguin Saint-Émilion)

description: Touched by spice from wood aging, this is a balanced wine. Its toastiness supports the ripe peach and apricot fruits, lifted by acidity. It will be a good wine; drink from 2018.
title: Maison Bouey 2016 Maison Blanche  (Bordeaux Blanc)

description: This is a ripe, fruity wine. The herbal side of the blend is filled out with more tropical, apricot and mango flavors that give the wine a perfumed character. It is ripe and crisp, while rounded. Drink from late 2017.
title: Cheval Quancard 2016 Réserve Sauvignon-Sémillon  (Bordeaux Blanc)

description: This wine is ripe and full of the fruitiness of the vintage, the citrus and the gooseberry flavors spiced by the fresher acidity. It will mature further, so wait to drink until late 2017.
title: Clarendelle 2016  Bordeaux Blanc

description: The wine has plenty of black-currant fruit. At the moment, the fruit is developing while still dominated by lean dry tannins. The two will balance out, giving a structured wine that will need to age. Drink from 2018.
title: Château Chatard 2014  Cadillac Côtes de Bordeaux

description: Now fully integrated, this is a firm black-fruit flavored wine. It has dark tannins that are dry and solid, contrasted with blackberry fruit flavors and fresh acidity. There is a touch of spice giving a peppery edge to the wine. It will age further, so drink from 2017.
title: Château de Belcier 2011 Château de Monrecueil  (Castillon Côtes de Bordeaux)

description: This is a bold, fruity wine with ripe tannins and a touch of toast. This toastiness needs to soften to fill out the palate with the red-berry fruits and acidity. The tannic core is dry, firm and solid, offering aging potential. Drink from 2018.
title: Château de Monbadon 2014  Castillon Côtes de Bordeaux

description: Hugely dense and dark, the wine is over the top in all respects. From the heavy bottle to the much too concentrated fruit and wood flavors, it is a statement wine. Its saving grace is the quality of the vintage that inevitably has produced a wine that will balance out the tannins as it matures. Drink from 2019.
title: Château du Vieux-Guinot 2010 Osage  (Saint-Émilion)

description: Produced from 40-year-old vines with Merlot dominant in the blend, this is a dark wine showing tight black-currant fruits and crisp acidity. With its texture and dry tannins still prominent in its youth, the wine needs to age so drink from 2018.
title: Château Hourbanon 2012  Médoc

description: There are attractive, herbal flavors in this wine. It has a fresh, fruity character that is bright and crisp. Lemon zest flavors cut through the warmer apricot and apple. It is an attractive wine that is ready to drink.
title: Château la Verrière 2015  Bordeaux Blanc

description: This wine, produced by négociant Rivière in Saint-Émilion, is a fruity, red-berry and black-currant flavored wine. It has tannins as well as a good structure that points up the fruitiness. The wine is ripe, smooth and ready to drink.
title: Clos des Menuts 2012 Menuts  (Bordeaux)

description: Lightly perfumed, this white Bordeaux shows the fresh character of the 2006 vintage. The acidity is poised, lifted and goes well with the pink grapefruit flavors. Drink this summer.
title: Mouton-Cadet 2006  Bordeaux Blanc

description: The second wine of Angélus is almost as structured as the first wine. It has serious tannins and dark acidity. At the same time, the fruit is rich with black-currant flavors. It is solid with plenty of potential. Drink this very fine wine from 2023.
title: Château Angélus 2014 Le Carillon d'Angélus  (Saint-Émilion)

description: The wine from this estate perched high above Château Angélus is tight and mineral. While the dark dense tannins are to the fore, it also has great fruits. The acidity and the crisp texture give the wine both its intensity and its potential. Drink from 2025.
title: Château Bellevue 2014  Saint-Émilion

description: In the village of Soussans, and in the north of the Margaux appellation, this estate has a fine reputation for its wines. This vintage, with its great balance between fruit and tannins, shows why. It is a ripe wine full of black fruit and with the bright acidity of the vintage. Drink the wine from 2021.
title: Château la Tour de Mons 2014  Margaux

description: Owned by the Cuvelier family of Léoville Poyferré in Saint-Julien and with Michel Rolland as consultant, this is a fine estate with an equally fine chateau. It is dense and richly endowed with black fruits and spice. At the same time, it has style and a way with its fruit and acidity that give it a lift. Drink this very ageworthy wine from 2023.
title: Château Le Crock 2014  Saint-Estèphe

description: Rich and dense, a second wine that is right at the level of a grand cru classé. The fruit is polished by wood, with additional chocolate and spice character. The wine has power, extraction and tannins that envelop the juicy fruit.
title: Château Ausone 2008 Chapelle d'Ausone  (Saint-Émilion)

description: A tight wine, showing racy fruit and an herbal character. Its acidity shoots through the orange zest and grapefruit flavors, leaving a wine that is bright, tangy and ready to drink.
title: Château Couhins-Lurton 2008  Pessac-Léognan

description: A little severe at first, not letting the fruit show through the tannins. However, the black currant fruit is there, and it's possible to discern that it will become delicious and for medium-term aging.
title: Château Lagrange 2008  Saint-Julien

description: This wine is concentrated and shows hints of bitter extraction as well as ripe fruit. There is a tough dryness that will soften given time, yielding a palate that's rich and fulfilling. Wait until 2016.
title: Château Croix Mouton 2011  Bordeaux Supérieur

description: Very Sauvignon in style with marked acidity and a grassy character, this wine has flavors of pure green and crisp white fruits. Apples and quince are balanced by the light texture and fine acidity.
title: Château Fonfroide 2012  Bordeaux Blanc

description: This wine is bready and yeasty with notes of vanilla and spice from wood. Big and bold on the palate, it could intensify in fruitiness in the future.
title: Château Mirefleurs 2011  Bordeaux Supérieur

description: This gentle, fruity wine is softly textured and already drinkable. Ripe berry fruits show well, with a juicy acidity that adds to the richness of this open, friendly wine.
title: Clos Puy Arnaud 2011  Castillon Côtes de Bordeaux

description: Full in the mouth, this is a ripe, currant- and gooseberry-flavored wine. It has a bright, forward, fruity feel that makes it delicious to drink. Very refreshing in character. Screwcap.
title: Baron Philippe de Rothschild 2012 Mouton Cadet  (Bordeaux Blanc)

description: This wine is quite closed at this stage with dark tannins and a firm texture. The dry edge obscures attractive fruitiness, finishing with acidity and freshness.
title: Château la Tourbeille 2011  Bordeaux Supérieur

description: Crisp and fruity, this is a wine that hides nothing. It is all upfront, fresh fruit backed with lively acidity. It's a wine that sings brightly and effortlessly.
title: Château Lauduc 2012  Bordeaux Blanc

description: This is an attractively fruity wine that has just the right tannic structure, solid berry fruits and good acidity. It's a wine that is developing well and is ready to drink now.
title: Chateau le Grand Verdus 2011  Bordeaux Supérieur

description: This wine is very juicy with fruit, but also exhibits a strong mineral element that adds texture and tightness. With acidity prominent, it seems to be a wine that will always be taut and firm.
title: Château Réaut 2011  Côtes de Bordeaux

description: This wine is firm, solid and strongly tannic in nature. Juiciness is there, along with wood aging, spice and some concentration. The acidity is very present and needs to soften over the next year. Drink from 2015.
title: Château Valentin 2011  Côtes de Bordeaux

description: With fine tannins, ripe berry fruits and a good cut of acidity, this is an attractive wine that deserves some aging. It has weight along with its strawberry and red currant flavors. Drink from 2016. Made by UNIVITIS Producers.
title: Château Bellevue 2013  Bordeaux Supérieur

description: There is a ripe and smoky character to this wine aged 12 months in French oak. A rich background of plums and berry fruits steadies the tannins. The wine is balanced and will be ready to drink from 2017. The Gonfrier brothers' 94 acres are certified “Haute Valeur Environmentale” (High Environmental Value).
title: Château de Marsan 2013  Cadillac Côtes de Bordeaux

description: There is a mineral texture to this wine with its blend of almost equal Sauvignon Blanc and Sémillon. It is tight, structured and needs to age with its crisp acidity and warmer tropical fruits. Drink from 2016.
title: Château Galès 2014  Graves

description: The wood aging shows in this wine, giving a smoky, spicy character. It has softened the crisp fruits and allowed the wine to broaden out with ripe berry fruits. Solid and dense, it will need to age so drink from 2017.
title: Château Peuy Saincrit 2013  Bordeaux Supérieur

description: With ripe berry fruits, this smooth wine has a layer of balanced tannins. It is structured, jammy in character, full of black currant flavors and final acidity. Drink from 2016. The château's history goes back to the 14th century and became a ruin after the 1789 Revolution. It was completely restored after World War II.
title: Château Timberlay 2013  Bordeaux Supérieur

description: This is a structured wine that shows class and finesse. It has rich juicy blackberry flavors that are supported by some firm tannins and a dense texture. The wine is ready to drink for its fruitiness, although it will be better from 2019.
title: Maison Malet Roquefort 2012 Les Hauts de la Gaffelière  (Saint-Émilion)

description: This is the second wine of Clerc Milon from an exceptional year. With the soft richness of the vintage, its tannins are velvety and ripe. Blackberry fruits and mint shine through the smoky edge of tannins to give a wine that has both generous fruits and a tight end that brings in bright acidity. It is just ready to drink, although it will be better from 2017.
title: Château Clerc Milon 2009 Pastourelle de Clerc Milon  (Pauillac)

description: This wine shows extraction, new wood and firm tannins. What it also has is the fruit weight to sustain all this. Given 4–5 years, the wine's richness and smoky flavors will come together with the black currant fruit.
title: Château Darzac 2011 Heritage  (Bordeaux Supérieur)

description: Mint flavors reflect the new wood aging in this smooth, ripe wine. It has a fine structure, ample acidity and blackberry fruit. This textured, structured wine is ready for 4–6 years of aging.
title: Château la Croix de Roche 2011  Bordeaux Supérieur

description: Finesse is a wine created to exhibit elegance, showing restrained fruits, poised tannins and plenty of the trademark 2004 fresh acidity.
title: Château de Portets 2004 Finesse de Portets  (Graves)

description: A freshly herbaceous wine, a reminder of how crisp, grassy and refreshing white Bordeaux can be. This has a lively green and white fruit character, all vibrant acidity. Drink now.
title: Château Bel Air Perponcher 2006  Bordeaux Blanc

description: Finely balanced, this has plenty of weight, which shines with the fresh lemon, pear and sweet grapefruit flavors. There is some wood there, but just a hint to give texture. A big success from a fine white wine vintage, and worth aging for 3–4 years.
title: Château Larrivet Haut-Brion 2007  Pessac-Léognan

description: This is rich, but the balance of the wine is excellent, the wood very much underneath the smooth, opulent apricot and pear fruits. There is spice, which adds a fine piquancy to the texture. The finish is vivid, still young, needing at least five years to age.
title: Château Smith Haut Lafitte 2007  Pessac-Léognan

description: Rich and creamy, this wine has weight as well as the hallmark freshness of 2007. The yellow fruits and spicy pear flavors are smoothed out with spice, with some herbaceous elements and a fine waft of apple skin structure. Worth aging for 3–4 years. Screwcap.
title: Château la Louvière 2007  Pessac-Léognan

description: Soft and balanced, this seems to have missed the potential when tasted as a barrel sample. It is maturing quickly, the tannins are soft, delicate. It is turning into an easy wine for drinking soon.
title: Château Monbrison 2006  Margaux

description: Made by the winemaking team at Cos d'Estournel, this is a very soft, generous wine that burst with fruit in the mouth. The structure is easy, gently tannic but not more. The pleasure is from the sweet fruit.
title: Goulée 2006  Médoc

description: Still with its youthful structure and tannins, this is going to be a classically ripe Médoc, all black currant fruits and dry tannins. But to give it weight, there is a rich streak of black plum skin, followed by a tight, dark finish.
title: Château les Ormes Sorbet 2006  Médoc

description: Produced on a small family-run estate that is surrounded by Bordeaux first growths, this wine is structured and firm. It has dark tannins and black currant fruit, together giving a ripe, smoky wine. The 40-year-old vines add to the concentration of this wine. Drink from 2019.
title: Château Gaudin 2012  Pauillac

description: Produced from 40-year-old vines on a 15-acre vineyard, the wine is almost entirely Merlot. It has dense, dark tannins and signs of wood aging that will integrate with time. It is a very fine, rich wine with black-plum fruit flavors. The aftertaste brings out the acidity and black currant fruits.
title: Clos Beauregard 2014  Pomerol

description: This wine has ripe red fruits, a touch of caramel and some spice. A definite mineral and tannic structure gives the wine a textured character. It needs food to show at its best.
title: Château Cantelaudette 2015 Rosé (Bordeaux Rosé)

description: 84-86 Barrel sample. Definitely in the earthy style of Listrac, very tannin dominated, the fruit way behind that dry structure. It seems to have been over-extracted.
title: Château Fourcas Hosten 2008 Barrel sample  (Listrac-Médoc)

description: 84-86 Barrel sample. With its gentle tannins and juicy fruit, this is on the fresh side, the jelly and blackcurrant flavors a hint.
title: Château Puy-Blanquet 2008 Barrel sample  (Saint-Émilion)

description: Still showing its tannins, this wine is developing well. It is relatively light in texture, the sweet berry fruits balanced with a layer of acidity.
title: Château Grand Corbin Manuel 2004  Saint-Émilion

description: With some weight behind the firm tannins, this is beginning to develop into a dense and powerful wine. It has black plum and berry fruits and a layer of fresher strawberry juice. Throughout there are dry tannins to hold the structure together.
title: Château Tour Coutelin 2007  Saint-Estèphe

description: Eighteen months in wood have dried out the fruit, and now the wine needs time to come together. The black plum weight is here, with a rich potential to bring out the sweet, juicy flavors.
title: Château Cabredon 2007 Tradition  (Premieres Côtes de Bordeaux)

description: A tight, stalky wine, showing black currant and dark plum fruits, intense acidity and a dry, tannic character. It feels light, without great density, very up front and fruity.
title: Château de Cornemps 2011  Bordeaux Supérieur

description: From the far east of the Bordeaux vineyards, this is a soft wine that is already drinkable. It has red berry fruits, fresh acidity and a lightly tannic structure. Drink now and until 2016.
title: Château La Barotte 2011  Bordeaux

description: There seems to be too much wood here which is smothering the fruit. Given that, the wine does have weight and as the wood softens, the juicy fruit flavors should come through. Wait to drink until 2016. But it will always be austere.
title: Château la Croix Margautot 2010  Haut-Médoc

description: An impeccable wine, this is so finely balanced between its rich fruits and structure. With its seamless character, it offers both fine acidity, green and white fruit and an undertow of wood aging. This is a wine for long-term aging.
title: Domaine de Chevalier 2009  Pessac-Léognan

description: This is a finely balanced wine, combining an herbaceous flavor with apricot and sweet pear. The whole is a delicious wine that brings together notes of toast and fresh fruit, with a firm, dry structure. For long-term aging.
title: Château Pape Clément 2009  Pessac-Léognan

description: While the bulk of this estate's wines are in prestigious Saint-Julien, this comes from a parcel in the Haut-Médoc. It's a rich and structured wine, full of black fruit and acidity. Although developing well, it still needs time. Drink from 2019.
title: Château Beychevelle 2015 Le Haut-Médoc de Beychevelle  (Haut-Médoc)

description: Generous tannins and blackberry fruit, along with a smooth texture all contribute to the richness of this broad, ripe wine. The 79% Merlot in the blend lends a generous character and the likelihood it will age quickly. Drink from 2018.
title: Château Chantemerle 2015  Blaye Côtes de Bordeaux

description: With Merlot and Cabernet Franc dominating the blend, this wine is as perfumed as it is structured. It shows elegance through its rich blackberry fruit and firm tannins. Concentrated and ready to drink from 2021.
title: Château de Brousse 2014  Castillon Côtes de Bordeaux

description: Château de Cérons, which also produces sweet wines, uses the same grape varieties for this dry white. It has an almost honeyed character that fills out its crisp acidity and citrusy orange flavors. Drink from late 2018.
title: Château de Cérons 2015  Graves

description: This generously structured wine is rich in tannins and fine, ripe black fruit. Its structure and juicy acidity will allow it to age well. Drink from 2020.
title: Château de Ricaud 2015  Cadillac Côtes de Bordeaux

description: This serious, solid wine has plenty of smoky flavors, juicy black fruit and a firm background of tannins. Ripe, full of fruit and with fine acidity at the end, it will be ready from 2019.
title: Château la Bastidette 2012  Montagne-Saint-Émilion

description: This smooth and ripe wine is full of dark berry fruit and layered with tannins that will allow it to age. Although rich with black plum flavors, it's balanced with acidity. Fine and ageworthy, it will be ready to drink from 2021.
title: Château la Fleur 2015  Montagne-Saint-Émilion

description: Wood aging gives this wine's aroma its eucalyptus character. That perfume follows through to the finely structured palate, where oak flavors balance its delicious black plum fruit. It's warm, ripe and stylish. Drink from 2020.
title: Château le Grand Moulin 2015 Collection Grande Réserve  (Blaye Côtes de Bordeaux)

description: This ripe, smoky wine is structured, full of new oak flavors and dense with both fruit and tannins. Its concentrated, bold blackberry flavors and firm tannins mix with smoky wood notes and acidity. Drink from 2020.
title: Château Roque le Mayne 2015  Castillon Côtes de Bordeaux

description: A dense, wood-aged wine, it brings richness, intense fruit and acidity together. It's complex and concentrated, powerfully structured and full of yellow fruits as well as lemon juice, edged with toast. It's a wine for aging, so drink from 2018.
title: Château Malartic-Lagravière 2012  Pessac-Léognan

description: A richly rounded wine, impressively dense and powerful. Its ripe tropical and green fruits are integrating well with the toast from wood aging to give great swathes of complex fruit and structure. This is a wine for the long haul. Drink from 2017.
title: Château Smith Haut Lafitte 2012  Pessac-Léognan

description: This sophisticated wood-aged wine comes from a fine year for whites in Pessac-Léognan. Subtle wood supports the rich tropical and yellow fruits as well as the crisper acidity. The texture, with its minerality, is still developing, with good potential. Drink from 2017.
title: Château Brown 2013  Pessac-Léognan

description: There is considerable freshness here, along with black currant, bright berries and a smoky edge. It does have a strong tannic element that gives an austere structure.
title: Château Grand Rolland 2008 Grande Cuvée  (Bordeaux)

description: Solid tannins mark this out as a wine that will need to age. Its structure dominates its black fruit, hiding it beneath a smoky, spicy character. Give it until 2020 before opening.
title: Château Castegens 2015  Castillon Côtes de Bordeaux

description: This soft, fruity wine delivers honey and apricot aromas. With touches of botrytis, it has a dry, spicy edge. At the same time, it's full of bitter orange and yellow fruit. Drink from 2018.
title: Château Dauphiné Rondillon 2011

description: Malbec is on the list of allowed grapes in Bordeaux but is rarely found now because it used to be difficult to ripen. This rich, structured wine shows that the situation has changed. It's ripe, full of black fruit and likely to mature well. Drink from 2018.
title: Château de Lagarde 2016 En Mémoire du  (Bordeaux)

description: This wine is still tannic and firm, with a dry core of ripe fruit. The tannins will always be present, typical of this vintage. Drink now, but decant first.
title: Château la Clide 2011  Saint-Émilion

description: This perfumed wine is ripe with exuberant black fruit and hints of wood aging. It's juicy with spice and pepper notes as well as bold red fruit. Drink from 2020.
title: Château la Croix Saint-Pierre 2015 Tradition  (Blaye Côtes de Bordeaux)

description: This is a soft and juicy wine with black currant fruitiness. Its wood aging is nicely judged, allowing its ripe character, acidity and black fruit to show through. The wine will be ready to drink from 2019.
title: Château les Aubastons 2015  Côtes de Bourg

description: This wine is firm, with dry, smoky tannins that underscore its rich black fruit, promising good aging potential. It will develop slowly and be ready to drink from 2021.
title: Château Mayne Mazerolles 2015  Blaye Côtes de Bordeaux

description: This fine, perfumed wine is richly endowed with tannins and black fruit. It has good concentration as well: ripe and juicy, with its acidity and crisp texture in place. Drink from 2019.
title: Château Picoron 2015 Petit Picoron  (Castillon Côtes de Bordeaux)

description: This soft wine is full of red fruit. It has a fine balance of acidity and gentle tannins. From the fruity 2012 vintage, it's now ready to drink.
title: Château Tour Grand Mayne 2012  Castillon Côtes de Bordeaux

description: The wine is ripe and perfumed. Mint and sweet eucalyptus aromas are followed on the palate by ripe tannins and strawberry fruits. This is an attractive wine that will be ready to drink from 2018.
title: Château Auguste 2014 L'Audacieux  (Bordeaux Supérieur)

description: A dark-colored wine, this is full of tannins as well as ripe blackberry fruits. The acidity and fruitiness give it a very fresh character, while the underlying tannins will let it age. Drink from 2018.
title: Château d'Agassac 2013  Haut-Médoc

description: Old Merlot vines from a five-acre parcel have given this powerful and dense wine. Solid with dark-plum fruits and still-dry tannins, it also has a fine texture and freshness to balance. It is juicy while also young. Drink from 2018.
title: Château Lanbersac 2012 Cuvée Vieilles Vignes  (Puisseguin Saint-Émilion)

description: Very young, fruity wine. The tannins are already soft and there is stalky black currant acidity that gives the wine a bright freshness. It has no wood and will develop fast.
title: Château Allégret 2012  Bordeaux

description: Pink in color, this is a full wine that misses out on freshness. It is clean with ripe strawberry fruits, but it feels fat and heavy. Screwcap.
title: Château de Beauregard-Ducourt 2012 Red (Bordeaux Rosé)

description: Big, dusty tannins dominate this rich and opulent wine. With black plum and juicy red berries, it is well balanced, the acidity cutting through to point up the richness. Very ready to drink, but it will age. Drink now and until 2020.
title: Château Haut Selve 2009 Réserve  (Graves)

description: This wine shows mint aromas and big black-fruit flavors. With high toast wood aging, it feels extracted, with bitter chocolate paralleling the blackberry fruits. It has considerable power and density and needs aging. Drink from 2017.
title: Château Vray Croix de Gay 2011  Pomerol

description: Beautifully poised, this wine strikes a balance between crisp lemon-curd acidity and intense honey and botrytis. Along with its nutmeg and marmalade flavors, it has the potential to be a powerful, wine. Drink from 2024.
title: Château Rabaud-Promis 2014  Sauternes

description: This floral wine shows geranium and white fruit notes. These are in relief against a background of great acidity and generous honey flavors. All these elements need time to come together but show great potential. Drink from 2025.
title: Château de Myrat 2014  Barsac

description: Already beautifully balanced, this wine is intense, rich and full of layered acidity and concentrated honey flavors. It's ripe, opulent and dense, with spice notes and acidity highlighting its rich core. Drink from 2024.
title: Château Guiraud 2014  Sauternes

description: This is ripe and floral, with intense acidity under the sweet, honeyed surface. Its dry core of botrytis is controlled by acidity and citrus flavors. Still developing and still young, it needs to age for many years. Drink from 2024.
title: Château de Malle 2014  Sauternes

description: Initially all lightness and crisp fruit, this wine slowly builds in richness as its botrytis and intense honey flavors develop. It shows huge potential: concentrated and opulent yet always balanced with acidity. Drink from 2024.
title: Château Romer du Hayot 2014  Sauternes

description: The wine, from one of the five Aubert family properties, is rich and full of great fruit. With ripe tannins and blackberry generosity over the wood aging, this is still structured yet ready to drink.
title: Château de Ribebon 2015  Bordeaux Supérieur

description: This is a smooth and soft wine that will develop quickly. It has a light tannin structure behind the easy blackberry fruit. The chateau is owned by Castel, the largest drinks producer in France. Drink this attractive wine from 2018.
title: Château Barreyres 2014  Haut-Médoc

description: Equal proportions of Cabernet Sauvignon and Merlot give this wine a ripe character. The wood aging shows in the smoky flavors that underline the juicy black-currant fruits. The wine is attractive and will soon show its fruitiness. Drink from 2019.
title: Château Laujac 2014  Médoc

description: This is a ripe wood-aged wine. It has tannins and layers of spice and toast from the wood aging. Happily, the fruit is also there, giving well-balanced black currants and acidity. The wine will be ready to drink from 2020.
title: Château Les Trois Manoirs 2014  Médoc

description: A rich, Merlot-dominated wine, this is opulent and packed with blackberry fruits. It has a great structure of tannins and ripe fruitiness. Bitter chocolate and coffee flavors give an extra complexity. The wine is still young, still full of juicy fruit. Drink from 2019.
title: Château Lafleur du Roy 2014  Pomerol

description: Too much wood aging yields a wine that is lean and lacks fruitiness. It has intense dark, burnt wood flavors and doesn't have the weight to round out.
title: Château Moulin de Canhaut 2011  Médoc

description: A blend of Sémillon and Cabernet Franc, this is a smooth, soft wine. It has soft fruitiness, some fresh acidity and a light but clean aftertaste.
title: Jaillance NV Brut  (Crémant de Bordeaux)

description: With barnyard aromas, this is a rustic wine. It does have some red fruit flavors and acidity but these are compromised by the earthy texture.
title: Château Bonnin 2011 La Fleur Blanchon  (Lussac Saint-Émilion)

description: This wine is all structure and dark, dry tannins. The fruit is very subdued, giving a hard wine that could well remain tough.
title: Château du Cartillon 2011  Haut-Médoc

description: A rather soapy, wine, it does not have enough fruitiness to sustain its tannins. It's hard edged and likely to remain that way.
title: Château La Clare 2011  Médoc

description: A wine that is hard right through, missing out on the fruit. It has a bitter extracted taste that brings out dark chocolate flavors. It's unlikely to soften much.
title: Château L'Argilus du Roi 2011  Saint-Estèphe

description: The wine has bold fruit and ripe tannins. There is still a strong flavor from the wood aging although this should integrate. The fruit is the dominant character of this red-berry flavored wine. Drink from 2021.
title: Château Plince 2014  Pomerol

description: This wine has some richness, with ripe black currants and balanced acidity. The wood-aging just shows but, again, is balanced. With its fresh fruitiness, the wine will age quickly, so drink from 2017.
title: Château Balac 2013  Haut-Médoc

description: This ripe wine has light tannins to go with its red currant and blackberry fruits. The blend is 70% Merlot, 27% Cabernet Sauvignon and 3% Cabernet Franc. It is developing fast. With its acidity and gentle tannins it will be ready from 2017.
title: Château Chantemerle 2014  Blaye Côtes de Bordeaux

description: A full, fruity and textured wine, this is ripe with quince and apple flavors that are freshened by the citrus acidity. The ripe and fruity character, with a light toastiness, allow the wine to be drunk now.
title: Château d'Alix 2013  Pessac-Léognan

description: There is a good structure here, plenty to support the fresh fruits and red-berry flavors. This wine is full of fresh acidity with fruit and tannins in balance. It's going to develop well, always full of fruit and attractive acidity. Drink from 2018.
title: Château du Domaine de l'Eglise 2013  Pomerol

description: With Sauvignon Gris and Muscadelle as part of the blend, this is an attractively perfumed wine. Apricot, pear and quince flavors are already well integrated. The texture is light, with just a touch of orange zest. Drink now.
title: Château Landereau 2014  Entre-Deux-Mers

description: This Fontana family wine is concentrated and ripe. Blackberry and red fruits go with balanced acidity to give a wine that's already drinkable. Tannins support the ripe, full foreground. Drink now, or, better, from late 2016.
title: Château Le Clou du Pin 2014  Bordeaux

description: This five-acre property has produced a ripe wine that is more about fruit than structure. Although there are tannins, the bold, black fruits and fresh acidity show best. The aftertaste is fruit with a generous texture. Drink from 2018.
title: Château les Hautes Graves 2012  Montagne-Saint-Émilion

description: This wine is well balanced between its juicy black-currant fruits and dry tannins. The high percentage of Petit Verdot (20%) gives both the color and the firmer tannic background. It is beginning to age well, so drink from 2017.
title: Château Reverdi 2013  Listrac-Médoc

description: This wine is structured, packed with tannins and acidity. Blackberry flavors come from behind to give some flesh to the structure. For a difficult vintage, this is attractive and will be drinkable after 2016.
title: Château Rousset-Caillau 2013  Bordeaux Supérieur

description: An obviously wood-aged wine, this shows a bitter toast character. The fruit is lean, struggling to show through the dark chocolate flavor. It has an austere finish, which is mitigated by its final acidity.
title: Château Le Bourdieu 2010  Médoc

description: This firmly tannic wine has all the structure of 2010 without the fruit. It's a skeleton without flesh, and it will be unlikely to soften in the coming years.
title: Château la Gorre 2010  Médoc

description: Light, light and light. This is such a soft, easy wine, already drinkable, the fruit fresh but missing concentration. The hint of smoke and wood are the only suggestion of complexity.
title: Chateau Dauzac 2007  Margaux

description: With some weight behind it, this is a rounded wine, lightly flavored with apricot and lemon and a tang of bitter orange zest. The acidity is soft, an easy element in the texture.
title: Château Guirauton 2007  Graves

description: A wine that shows firm tannins, fruit and wood acidity. It is now ready to drink, a wine that will remain firm and dry.
title: Château Bellerose Figeac 2007 Prestige  (Saint-Émilion)

description: With its rich texture from aging on the lees, this is a Sauvignon Blanc that goes more to the tropical and pineapple fruit direction. It has refreshing acidity along with weight and concentration. The lemon acidity kicks in in the aftertaste.
title: Château Bertinerie 2010  Blaye Côtes de Bordeaux

description: Wood-dominated wine, very structured. It is spicy, firmly dry, with juicy black currant fruit behind the wood. Give a year or two for the wood to soften out and the fruit to come forward.
title: Château Lacombe Noaillac 2009 Les Traverses la Franque  (Médoc)

description: With stalky fruit and black currant acidity, the wine starts out lean. Then a richer, smoky wood character gives weight and sweeter flavors. Give the wine a year.
title: Château le Gardera 2009  Bordeaux Supérieur

description: A field blend of the Enclos vineyard has given a superrich wine, densely packed with juicy black plum fruits and sweet tannins. Ripe, full-bodied with a slight alcohol burn.
title: Château l'Enclos 2009 Triple A  (Sainte-Foy Bordeaux)

description: This branded wine produced by the Cazes family of Château Lynch-Bages is ripe and rounded with dense tannins and sweet fruit. It has weight, spice from wood and a fine ready-to-drink balance.
title: Jean-Michel Cazes 2009 Michel Lynch  (Bordeaux)

description: From a vintage known for its readily-approachable wines, this grand cru Saint-Emilion shows surprising structure. Some toasty oak frames delicate black-cherry fruit. Black tea notes on the finish carry more tannins than the fruit can handle in the long run, so catch this one soon before it heads south.
title: Château Lapelletrie 1997  Saint-Émilion

description: With a nose of spicy green herbs—notably tarragon—and flavors of lemon and pink grapefruit, this no-nonsense blend of 50% Sauvignon Blanc and 50% Sémillon goes down easy and clean. The crisp finish is a good palate-cleanser.
title: Marquis de Chasse 1999 Reserve  (Bordeaux Blanc)

description: Shows its Right Bank roots in Merlot and Cab Franc-derived red fruit and herb flavors: strawberry, tomato and rhubarb. Turns leathery and earthy, with some hints of toast on the finish.
title: Vieux Château Négrit 1997  Montagne-Saint-Émilion

description: I know Bordeaux isn't known for being fruit-driven, but this paucity of fruit in a wine that's 50% Merlot (from a vintage that favored this variety's development) is hard to fathom. Leather and old wood combine with earth and mushrooms. There's decent weight and intensity here, so if these are flavors you look for this is an example to seek out.
title: Château Ducla 1998  Bordeaux

description: A Merlot-dominated wine, structured with stalky black currant fruits, solid tannins and attractive spiciness. With its firm, serious character, it does need to age a few years. Drink from 2015.
title: Château de Terrefort-Quancard 2010  Bordeaux Supérieur

description: Less successful than the red Jacques Sans Souci, this nevertheless has some attractive fresh citrus and green plum flavors and bright fresh acidity. Simple fruits and a light green apple structure give it a good, crisp finish.
title: Barrière Frères 2006 Jacques Sans Souci  (Bordeaux Blanc)

description: A tough, dark wine, needing considerable aging to bring out its balanced fruits. It has the feel of a serious, impressive wine, dominated by powerful tannins. Underneath, the fruit is dark, brooding and firm. Give this wine at least five years.
title: Domaine de l'A 2010  Castillon Côtes de Bordeaux

description: Densely tannic while also fruity, this is a product of ripe fruits that give a black currant flavor as well as a solid structure. The acidity gives great lift to the end of this finely made wine.
title: Château Chantemerle 2010  Blaye Côtes de Bordeaux

description: Since this is 100% Sauvignon Blanc, it is intensely crisp, with grapefruit flavors and bright acidity that lead into a lemongrass aftertaste. It's clean and fresh, and is likely to mature quickly.
title: Château Couhins-Lurton 2010  Pessac-Léognan

description: This is a very complete wine, with all the fruit and tannin elements in place. There's a fine and rich character here as well as a more austere, mineral side. The combination results in supporting tannins, dark fruits and good aging potential.
title: Château Haut Dina 2010  Castillon Côtes de Bordeaux

description: Firm and solid tannins with a dry core offers a dark character and density. Along with this, the wine has a ripe, fruity character that's packed with acidity and layered with wood.
title: Château Haut-Simard 2010  Saint-Émilion

description: Sweet pear perfumes announce a ripe style of white wine. It is on the soft side, its acidity well under the pear and melon flavors, aided by nutmeg and tangerines. The finish is juicy, ripe, always soft.
title: Château le Bonnat 2006  Graves

description: There is way too much acidity here, and it's exagerrated by the wine's soft, unfocused texture. Notes of bitter toast and dark tannins are rather unbalanced.
title: Château Ballan-Larquette 2011  Bordeaux

description: This wine seems rather unfocused with indistinct tannins and fruit. There is a soapy texture, and the red berry fruits seem awash with acidity.
title: Château Bernés 2011  Bordeaux

description: Dry, firmly structured and tough, this is an austere wine that doesn't hold out much hope for improvement. Drink it soon with rich food to balance out its dense tannins and wood flavors.
title: Château du Cros 2011  Bordeaux

description: Juicy and fruity, this wine has strong layers of acidity and extracted tannins. It has a hard, austere character that doesn't promise for the future.
title: Château du Lort 2011  Bordeaux Supérieur

description: This is a very feline wine with tight citrus and gooseberry fruits that are almost too intense for its own good.
title: Château des Gravières 2012  Bordeaux Blanc

description: A fresh wine with juicy red fruits, but weighed down by harsh tannins. The mouthfeel is dry, just bitter. It's only in the finish that good fruit acidity shows through.
title: Château d'Arnaussan 2004  Bordeaux

description: This small production wine is the equivalent of a second wine for Count Leo de Malet-Roquefort's Premier Grand Cru Classé estate. The wine is smooth, elegant and ripe. Black plums and perfumed acidity are accompanied by some wood aging flavors and fresher black-currant fruitiness. It is a sophisticated wine that still needs to age. Drink from 2019.
title: Château la Gaffelière 2012 Clos Gaffelière  (Saint-Émilion)

description: A high toast wine, the fruit and fresh acidity submerged beneath the wood. At the present, it is hard to enjoy, but in 2–3 years the fruit will kick in. It would be good if the producer had been less enthusiastic about the wood.
title: Château de Candale 2007  Saint-Émilion

description: A richly textured wine, showing some attractive fresh fruits and soft berries mingling with a layer of firmer tannins. The wine has weight, an attractive edge of spice and a final sweet juicy character.
title: Château Plaisance 2006  Montagne-Saint-Émilion

description: The rustic aromas are off-putting in this wine. It has a proper density but seems to have a musty character. This could blow off over time, because the fruit is here.
title: Château Bellegrave 2008  Pauillac

description: A touch of wood helps the wine's light fruit to deepen and become richer. The wine is well balanced, with fresh acidity giving a good lift.
title: Château Grand Jean 2009 Elevé en Fûts de Chêne  (Bordeaux Supérieur)

description: The second wine of Château Glana in the prestigious Saint-Julien appellation is properly tannic with fruit in the background. The wine will develop well, but will still require some time. Its juicy black-currant fruitiness and acidity have power and concentration—enough to produce a ripe, while still elegant wine from 2020.
title: Château du Glana 2014 Terre du Lion  (Saint-Julien)

description: Here's a new wood-aged young wine, with ripe fruit and mint aromas. The wine does have a bitter edge of extraction that detracts from the generous black fruitiness. It is certainly firm at this stage—a full-bodied wine with a dark-fruit character at the end. Drink from 2020.
title: Château Gaby 2014  Canon-Fronsac

description: The wine comes from a tiny seven-acre estate to the east of the town of Saint-Emilion. Owned by the same family since 1847, it estate is making serious wine. This is a rich wine, perfumed by Cabernet Franc although firmly based in Merlot. Black plum and berries are strengthened by the firm tannins that will allow further aging. Drink from 2018.
title: Château Rochebelle 2012  Saint-Émilion

description: This is a warm and ripe Merlot-dominated wine. The chateau's position on the hill of Fronsac gives the wine structure and a mineral texture that does promise aging. With blackberry fruitiness developing well, drink from 2016.
title: Château Tessendey 2010  Fronsac

description: An austere, tannic wine that will need a few years to develop. It has solid tannins that are layered over the fresh berry and currant fruits. A smoky hint gives the wine extra character.
title: Château Lagrave Paran 2008 Cuvée Géraldine  (Bordeaux Supérieur)

description: Ripe, fruity wine, it has sweet tannins, blackberry fruit, laced with acidity. The wine is all fruit, with only the lightest hint of wood.
title: Château Roc Meynard 2009  Bordeaux Supérieur

description: Densely tannic, this has edgy black currant flavor emerging between a firmly dry structure  packed with dark berry fruits and fresh acidity. This is light in fruit and heavy on tannins.
title: Château le Bonnat 2003  Graves

description: An attractive pale, salmon-pink-colored wine, this is soft and ripe with strawberries and a smooth texture. Drink now.
title: Château La Gabarre 2016 Rosé (Bordeaux Rosé)

description: This attractive pink-colored wine has plenty of red-fruit flavor and acidity. It is a warm, rich wine, full of fruit with a touch of spice. Drink now.
title: Château Laville 2016 Rosé de Laville Rosé (Bordeaux Rosé)

description: This wine is fruity, packed with red-berry flavors. It has plenty of the acidity that marks this vintage in rosés while keeping a riper backdrop. Drink now.
title: Château Smith Haut Lafitte 2016 Les Hauts de Smith Rosé (Bordeaux Rosé)

description: With 20% Sémillon in the blend, this wine has some richness as well as plenty of herbal character. It is light, refreshing and crisp, with plenty of acidity and gooseberry flavors. The wine is ready to drink.
title: Cheval Quancard 2016 Chai de Bordes  (Bordeaux Blanc)

description: Here's a very rich and full-bodied wine. It does have structure, giving firm tannins to balance the ripe red berry fruits. With this solid character, the wine will age and should be drunk from 2016.
title: Château Barrail Chevrol 2011  Fronsac

description: This is a dry, structured wine, with dry tannins and stalky fruit characteristics. However, it will develop into a fruity wine without great depth but with attractive berry flavors and acidity. Drink from 2016.
title: Château Barreyres 2011  Haut-Médoc

description: Strong wood aromas lead to a wine that is still very young. The smoky wood character dominates the red berry fruits and typical acidity of the vintage. It does have the weight to develop well, so give this structured wine until 2017.
title: Château Bessan Ségur 2011  Médoc

description: A rich style of rosé that has some wood aging and a full-bodied texture. Strawberry fruit flavors dominate. Drink now.
title: Château Brown 2012 Rosé (Bordeaux Rosé)

description: With its tough tannins, this solid wine also shows dark fruits and black plum skins, finishing with fresher acidity.
title: Château Coutelin Merville 2011  Saint-Estèphe

description: Very classic in style, it has firm tannins that come before black currant fruits. Its structure is dry, lightly smoky from wood aging and with a crisper fruit character underneath. The tannins need to soften before the wine can be drunk with pleasure, so wait until 2017.
title: Château Belle-Vue 2011  Haut-Médoc

description: Showing considerable wood flavor, this wine has some tough tannins to overcome before it really shows its best. The fruit is ripe, full and packed with blackberry flavors. Once fully integrated, the wine should reveal more of a luscious side. Drink from 2017.
title: Château Greysac 2011  Médoc

description: With a majority of Merlot in the blend, this is a smooth and ripely rich wine. It has sweet berry fruits, soft tannins and good juicy acidity. At this stage, the wood shows strongly, but the fruit will soon develop. Drink from 2016.
title: Château Haut-Bellevue 2011  Haut-Médoc

description: A fruity and juicy wine, it also has a stalky, herbal element. That gives a fresh character to the wine while also showing lightness. The black currant fruits are strong and forward, with a hint of maturity that suggests this is for medium-term aging.
title: Château les Anguilleys 2011  Médoc

description: A gently perfumed wine, it has ripe, juicy black-fruit flavors and a backing of tannins. It's balanced with the dry core surrounded by rich fruitiness and a burst of final acidity. It could be drunk now, but will be better from 2016.
title: Château Pierre de Montignac 2011  Médoc

description: This is a bold, ripe and fruity wine. It has rich black currant fruits, solid tannins and a dense texture. Very aromatic, it is powered by its dry core that is showing signs of softening and rounding out. Drink from 2017.
title: Château Poitevin 2011  Médoc

description: Fruity and perfumed, this is already an attractive wine. Dusty tannins are working with the black-currant fruitiness to produce a fresh, lightly structured wine. Like many wines of the vintage, it will develop quickly, so drink from 2018.
title: Château Paveil de Luze 2013  Margaux

description: This wine is full of black-currant freshness. It is already delicious, crisp while just lit up by tannins. It is developing quickly, with a refreshing character that will make it drinkable from 2017.
title: Château Teyssier 2013  Saint-Émilion

description: This attractive, fruity wine features soft blackberry fruits that are backed up by still-young, dry tannins. A juicy character comes from the acidity typical of the vintage. Drink from 2017.
title: Château Tour St Bonnet 2013  Médoc

description: From a property owned by Château Mongravey in Margaux, this firmly structured wine is solid with dark tannins and blackberry fruits. It has the stalky texture typical of the vintage, although this will soften to leave a firm while ripe wine. Drink from 2018.
title: Château de Braude 2013  Haut-Médoc

description: Half and half Merlot and Cabernet Sauvignon, this wine is firm and tannic. It has a ripe character, benefiting from the good climatic conditions in Saint-Estèphe. Blackberry and damson flavors are lifted by youthful acidity that will calm down. Drink this from 2019.
title: Château de Côme 2013  Saint-Estèphe

description: This is rich with black fruits and layers of wood. It is structured and dense while also having the attractive fruitiness of the vintage. The wine will be ready to drink by summer 2016.
title: Château Fontana 2014  Bordeaux

description: Big and fruity, this is a ripe, full wine that shows good structure and dark berry fruits. It has a fine juicy potential, fine acidity and a perfumed aftertaste. Drink from 2019.
title: Château Gazin Rocquencourt 2013  Pessac-Léognan

description: This wine is tough and structured, while still having plenty of weight and fruit for the future. As it integrates, ripe berry flavors will balance those tannins, giving a classic, structured Bordeaux. Drink from 2018.
title: Château d'Hanteillan 2013  Haut-Médoc

description: Named after King Henri IV, this is a powerful, ripe and still-structured wine. Big, rich tannins push the structure forward and boost the full black-plum flavors. It is complex, dense and still needing time. Drink from 2018.
title: Château Henry de France 2010  Côtes de Bordeaux

description: This rich, smoky wine has an appealing streak of ripe black-plum flavors. What it is missing in all this richness is enough acidity, although the tannins will certainly allow it to age. Drink this powerful, ripe Merlot from 2017.
title: Château La Croix Chantecaille 2012  Saint-Émilion

description: This easy, early-developing wine has balanced tannins that lift the black-currant fruitiness and the fresh acidity. It is developing fast, with its fruit right to the front and the tannins in the background. Drink from 2017.
title: Château Lamothe-Bergeron 2013  Haut-Médoc

description: All spice, acidity and tangy herbal flavors, this rich wine is also very fresh. It's full of green fruits and lively acidity. The aftertaste is crisp but ripe. The property has been owned since 1999 by Sophie Lurton of neighbor Château Bouscaut.
title: Château Lamothe Bouscaut 2013  Pessac-Léognan

description: From the same ownership as Larose Trintaudon, this wine is firm while also having juicy red-currant fruit and intense acidity. The two characteristics are still working it out in this young wine. Wait to drink until 2018.
title: Château Larose Perganson 2013  Haut-Médoc

description: Firm and solid, this wine is more tannin than fruit at this stage. It does have some weight and acidity to it, showing potential for blackberry fruitiness with age.
title: Château Bois Pertuis 2011  Bordeaux

description: Full in the mouth, this is a ripe, currant- and gooseberry-flavored wine. It has a bright, forward, fruity feel that makes it delicious to drink. Very refreshing in character. Screwcap.
title: Baron Philippe de Rothschild 2012 Mouton Cadet  (Bordeaux Blanc)

description: This is a delicious ripe wine, full of black fruits and with generous tannins. Mint flavors come from the new wood aging and enhance the ripe berry flavors and acidity. Drink this structured wine from 2018.
title: Château Beauséjour 2014 Cuvée Spéciale  (Puisseguin Saint-Émilion)

description: The wine is ripe and full of blackberry fruits. It has serious tannins still although these are well balanced by the fruitiness. The firm structure and wood aging flavor will soften over the next few years. Drink from 2020.
title: Château Fourcas Dupré 2014  Listrac-Médoc

description: The wine has the firm tannins of the appellation, moderated by the black-currant fruitiness of the vintage. Spice and the dry structure will allow it to age well. With the same winemaking team as Château Lynch-Bages in Pauillac, it will age well. Drink from 2022
title: Château les Ormes de Pez 2014  Saint-Estèphe

description: The ample fruitiness of this 80% Merlot wine is right up front. It comes from a large 116-acre estate on the extension of the Pomerol plateau. Firm tannins as well as generous black plum and berry fruits are well balanced, just needing time to soften and fill out. Drink this full, rich wine from 2018.
title: Château Siaurac 2014  Lalande de Pomerol

description: This is a ripe soft wine full of warm fruits and gentle tannins. The second wine of the always-impressive Château Smith Haut Lafitte, it is a rich wine its own right. With black currant and dark plum flavors, it has some solid tannins from 60% Cabernet Sauvignon in the blend. Drink from 2018.
title: Château Smith Haut Lafitte 2013 Le Petit Haut Lafitte  (Pessac-Léognan)

description: A southern yet herbal-feeling wine, this is ripe—maybe overripe—and missing real structure or fruitiness.
title: Château Bellevue Favereau 2011  Bordeaux Supérieur

description: This is a finely balanced wine, combining an herbaceous flavor with apricot and sweet pear. The whole is a delicious wine that brings together notes of toast and fresh fruit, with a firm, dry structure. For long-term aging.
title: Château Pape Clément 2009  Pessac-Léognan

description: Very dense and firm, this has powerful tannins as well as a blackberry jam flavor. The wine is complex, full of both dark tannins and the richest fruits, layered with notes of herb, spice and a concentrated structure.
title: Château Smith Haut Lafitte 2009  Pessac-Léognan

description: Big, ripe and delicious, this is packed with spice and sweet apricot fruits. It's full and opulent, very much a wine of 2009, yet it retains its sense of balance and structure.
title: Château Malartic-Lagravière 2009  Pessac-Léognan

description: Full of tropical fruit flavors, this is rounded, ripe and very accessible. At the same time, its structure shows through in the tang of green apple skin, judicious wood aging and taut aftertaste.
title: Château de Fieuzal 2009  Pessac-Léognan

description: Already delicious, this wine shows its wood aging with such finesse, while letting its elegant white-fruit flavor come through. It has an herbaceous edge, rounded out with a more ripe fruit character. This is meant for aging.
title: Château Latour-Martillac 2009  Pessac-Léognan

description: This has smooth, rich fruit, with sweet berries, ripe tannins and strong layers of wood. The wine is powerful; the stalky and bitter chocolate edge contrasts the sweet, ripe fruit. This is meant for long-term aging.
title: Château Olivier 2009  Pessac-Léognan

description: Fruity and with fine tannins, this wine is already tasting good. It has juicy acidity, lots of ripe tannins and black-currant fruitiness. Drink this wine from 2018.
title: Château Haut Pingat 2015  Bordeaux

description: This juicy, wood-aged Pierre Lurton wine has very ripe fruit. That gives it richness with black-plum fruits and a dense texture. A bitter coffee flavor shows through the fruit. It needs time, so drink from 2018.
title: Château Marjosse 2015  Bordeaux

description: A romantic name for an easy fruity wine. Spice from wood gives the black-currant fruit richness and some complexity. With its acidity and dry core, this is a wine to keep for another year. Drink from 2018.
title: Château Venus 2014  Graves

description: This is a ripe wine with generous black fruits and crisp acidity. It is balanced—fruity with a core of tannins. Drink from 2018.
title: Château Vircoulon 2015  Bordeaux

description: While this wine is firm at the moment, it does have fine black fruits. The acidity from the blackberry fruitiness is going to balance with the tannins shortly to give a ripe and fruity wine. Drink from 2018.
title: Château Briot 2015  Bordeaux

description: This attractive fruity wine is full of young black-currant and red-berry fruits. The tannins mingle with spice to give a contrast to the aura of fruitiness surrounding the wine. Drink from 2019.
title: Château Haut Pasquet 2015  Bordeaux

description: Lightly stalky because it is still young, this wine otherwise promises rich black-currant fruitiness as it matures. It is balanced, ripe and with a gentle set of tannins in the background. Drink from 2018.
title: Château la Tour Chapoux 2015  Bordeaux

description: Attractive grapefruit and herb aromas and flavors mark the bouquet and palate of this French sparkler. There’s a touch of anise or licorice in the mouth, and a dry spice note on the foamy finish. The soft feel gives it great appeal, while the solid flavors set it apart from the sweet set.
title: Veuve du Vernay NV Blanc de Blancs Brut  (Bordeaux)

description: Rich new wood and fruit combine well in this concentrated wine. Flavors go right through to give mint, blackberry and dark plum fruits. The tannins are already integrated to give a wine that will be ready to drink in two years.
title: Château Grand-Maison 2009  Côtes de Bourg

description: A smooth, wood-aged wine that has a rich texture, layers of toast and nutmeg from the wood and peach fruits. The wood needs time to integrate, but already shows that this is going to be a rich wine.
title: Château Bertinerie 2009 Cru Réserve  (Blaye Côtes de Bordeaux)

description: With the few years of bottle age, the wine is showing ripe fruits, the tannins well integrated. The combination of juicy acidity and ripe fruit, with the dry core, are bringing the development of the wine on well.
title: Château Franc-Cardinal 2006  Bordeaux Côtes de Francs

description: Soft apple- and honey-flavored wine that has dry botrytis and a spiced texture. With flavors of lemon curd and peach, it is more in a light Barsac style, fruity as well as sweet.
title: Château Hallet 2009  Sauternes

description: A solid effort, all tannins and dark texture at this stage. The acidity and dry tannins are firmly edged with black currant fruits. It will age and soften, but will always be on the dry, firm side.
title: Château le Paradis 2009  Côtes de Bourg

description: Very herbal Sauvignon Blanc, crisp and tangy, with flavors of lime and green apple skins. Fresh as well as structured, with a final zest of acidity.
title: Château les Arromans 2010  Bordeaux Blanc

description: Wood aging has given this wine some roundness and softness without taking away from the intense grassy, grapefruit flavors of Sauvignon Blanc. It has good richness as well as taut fruitiness.
title: Château Lamothe-Vincent 2007 Héritage  (Bordeaux Blanc)

description: Cérons, next door to Sauternes, produces a lighter version of those dessert wines. This wine, with its characteristic honey sweetness, is edging toward toffee, the baked apple flavors already tamed by a few years aging. The core of botrytis dryness is now well integrated, suggesting the wine is ready to drink.
title: Grand Enclos du Château de Cérons 2005  Cérons
winery: Grand Enclos du Château de Cérons

description: This concentrated wine is solid with tannins. The fruit is evident from the fine acidity and hints of black plum that push through the wall of tannin. Give it time and drink from 2021.
title: Château de Birot 2015  Cadillac Côtes de Bordeaux

description: This is a beautiful, ripe, soft, perfumed wine. Its intense berry fruit is well to the fore, backed by firm tannins. Packed with fruit and smokiness from wood aging, it has strong aging potential. Drink from 2020.
title: Château de Ricaud 2015 Grand Vin  (Cadillac Côtes de Bordeaux)

description: This ripe, juicy and smoky wine is rich in black fruit. It's structured and full, the fruit layered with wood. Perfumed now, it promises a good future ahead. Drink from 2021.
title: Château du Roc 2015 Libelula by Roc  (Castillon Côtes de Bordeaux)

description: While this dense wine has plenty of firm tannins, it also has fine, ripe fruit. Rich blackberry flavors and smoky aromas dominate. Drink from 2020.
title: Château Haut Dina 2015  Castillon Côtes de Bordeaux

description: Black cherry aromas are followed by rich black fruit, plum and damson flavors in this wine. There is plenty of juicy acidity here as well, with tannins to support the richness. Drink from 2020.
title: Château Haut Peyrefaure 2015 Réserve  (Blaye Côtes de Bordeaux)

description: An unusual blend of 95% Cabernet Franc and only 5% Merlot comprises this richly perfumed and structured wine. It's generous, with dark chocolate and spice flavors as well as acidity at the end. It could still age further, so drink from 2019.
title: Château la Clide 2009 Primo du Château la Clide  (Saint-Émilion)

description: This bold, ripe wine is full of tannins as well as great fruit. Juicy with black currant flavors, smoky from wood aging and rich with tannins, it's finely structured and ready to mature gently. Drink from 2021.
title: Château la Croix Saint-Pierre 2015 Grande Réserve  (Blaye Côtes de Bordeaux)

description: Although full of fruit, this no-sulfur-added wine is structured and concentrated. Big tannins back up the ripe character and generous fruit flavors. It's likely to be ready to drink from 2021.
title: Château les Petits Arnauds 2015 Cuvée Non-Sulfité  (Blaye Côtes de Bordeaux)

description: Balanced and ripe, this is a rich wine. Its tannins and dark chocolate and wood flavors are deliciously balanced by ripe black fruit. It's concentrated and dense and will age well. Drink from 2021.
title: Château Tanesse 2015  Cadillac Côtes de Bordeaux

description: While the wine has plenty of tannins, it also has juicy black fruits that more than balance the structure. It's a well-made, ripe wine that has a sweep of fruitiness. From 2018, the tannins will be fully integrated.
title: Château de la Cour d'Argent 2012  Bordeaux Supérieur

description: This wine has dark tannins and considerable wood flavor at this stage. The structure and the weight are all there, allowing the fruit and rich texture to develop. Drink from 2017.
title: Château Bel Air Perponcher 2012 Réserve  (Bordeaux)

description: Rich and round, this attractive wine has generous tannins and equally generous fruit. Black currants shine with their acidity while the texture is firm and solid. This is a wine with a future; drink from 2016.
title: Château Roquefort 2012  Bordeaux

description: Lalande de Pomerol is the northern extension of Pomerol, so it's no surprise to find this wine dominated by Merlot. It is soft, rounded and rich. Black plums give the fruitiness while black fruit skins provide the texture. It's a full wine that needs a little aging. Drink from 2016.
title: Château Vieille Dynastie 2012  Lalande de Pomerol

description: This ripe, juicy wine will develop quickly. Its tannins are there but already well integrated with the red cherry fruit and acidity. It's bright and ready to drink from 2019.
title: Château Le Cap 2015 Tradition  (Blaye Côtes de Bordeaux)

description: Reflecting the ripe vintage, this is a warm wine. Its black currant fruit is still dominated by spice from wood aging, although this will dissipate to leave a smooth, ripe and fruity wine. Drink from 2018.
title: Château l'Orangerie 2015  Bordeaux Supérieur

description: Red fruit aromas dominate this youthful wine. On the palate, it's still tight, with fine red berry fruit flavors interlaced with tannins. The structure and acidity suggest it will age, so drink from 2019.
title: Château Noblet 2016  Côtes de Bourg

description: From vines on the plateau to the west of the village of Saint-Émilion, this is a light, fruity wine. Its acidity and tannic structure lend a crisp texture to its black currant fruit. It will probably broaden as it matures, so drink from 2019.
title: Château Truquet 2016  Saint-Émilion

description: The 100% new oak used in the aging of this wine was not a good idea. It has given too much woodiness and not enough fruit. Still young, it may soften enough to allow the generous blackberry flavors to come through.
title: Château Valade 2014  Saint-Émilion

description: This finely balanced wine is poised between spicy wood notes and black currant fruit. It's lightly structured with fine tannins and plenty of juicy acidity. Although young, it has been made to drink now.
title: Ignatus 2016  Bordeaux

description: This attractive wine has smoothed out the sometimes rough edges of Listrac and given a ripe, purple hue to the berry fruits. Showing much of the acidity of the vintage, it's about fruit and freshness.
title: Château Fourcas-Borie 2012  Listrac-Médoc

description: This dense and solid wine comes from the eastern ends of the Entre-deux-Mers. It is full of black fruits that balance the firm, dry tannins. Juicy acidity bursts in at the end for a wine that's already delicious and will age well. Best to drink from 2017.
title: Château Grand Marchand 2012  Bordeaux

description: While this is a firm wine, full of dry tannins and smoky wood-aging flavors, it also has plenty of ripe and juicy fruit. Red berry and black currant show strongly, filling the wine out and promising roundness as it ages. Drink from 2017.
title: Château Greysac 2012  Médoc

description: Produced from vines on the plain of Saint-Émilion near the Dordogne river, this is a Merlot-dominated wine. It has big tannins, bold ripe fruit and a dark core of dryness. As with so many wines in this vintage, the fruitiness makes it work so well, ripe and bold black fruits that are finished off with acidity. Drink from 2018.
title: Château Haut-Pezat 2012  Saint-Émilion

description: Cadillac faces Barsac and Sauternes across the Garonne river and shares the same autumn conditions that give the noble rot in the sweet wines. This wine offsets sweetness with a fresh, lemon marmalade crispness to give a well-balanced, ready-to-drink wine.
title: Château Lamothe de Haux 2009 Château Manos Réserve du Château  (Cadillac)

description: The 54-acre Landat vineyard, dominated by Cabernet Sauvignon, has produced a powerful, wood-aged wine. The wood shows in the firm and dense tannic structure and gives the wine a dry perspective. Black currant and acidity provided a more juicy aspect to this concentrated wine.
title: Château Landat 2012  Haut-Médoc

description: While the tannins are very present in this wine, it also has good acidity and blackberry fruits. It's firm and structured in the front, still young, although allowing plenty of room for the fruit to show strongly over the next few years. Drink from 2019.
title: Château le Sartre 2012  Pessac-Léognan

description: This wine is firmly structured while also supporting swathes of berry fruits. Tannins come from the Cabernet in the blend and from the wood aging that gives a toasty character. Black fruits and acidity shine at the end. Drink from 2018.
title: Château Lestage Simon 2012  Haut-Médoc

description: A ripe, juicy and fruity wine, this is already softening. Plenty of rounded Merlot flavors are stiffened by the wood-aging spices and the stalky black currant character of Cabernet. Drink this structured wine from 2018.
title: Château Moulin de Canhaut 2012  Médoc

description: Old vines from a 10-acre vineyard are the backbone of this wine. Ripe and concentrated, it offers aromas and flavors of mint from the wood aging along with a dominant Cabernet black currant and berry fruitiness. This is going to develop well, so drink from 2018.
title: Château Peyredon Lagravette 2012  Haut-Médoc
