description: 88-90 Barrel sample. Very soft, rounded wine, the tannins a mere hint as the fruit rolls forward. Fine, juicy spice.
title: Château Anthonic 2009 Barrel sample  (Moulis-en-Médoc)

description: 88-90 Barrel sample. Very apply wine, with light botrytis character, some spice and very fresh fruit. It is bright and almost crisp.
title: Château Bastor-Lamontagne 2009 Barrel sample  (Sauternes)

description: 88-90 Barrel sample. There is a high level of new wood, toast that dominates both the aroma and the flavors. It gives the wine a hard-edged feel at this stage.
title: Château de Lamarque 2009 Barrel sample  (Haut-Médoc)

description: 88-90 Barrel sample. Sweet vanilla aroma, fruit that is ripe, soft, fleshy. This seems to have suffered from super-mature, fruit, although a final juiciness does help.
title: Château Lafon-Rochet 2009 Barrel sample  (Saint-Estèphe)

description: 88-90 Barrel sample. Dark bitter chocolate coated wine, soft in texture, but with a good stalky chewy edge. Final flavors are of cedar, new wood and spice.
title: Château Teyssier 2009 Barrel sample  (Saint-Émilion)

description: 88-90 Barrel sample. A hugely extracted wine, very dark and tannic, solid, spicy wood.
title: Marojallia 2009 Barrel sample  (Margaux)

description: 88-90 Barrel sample. Lots of spiced wood, with sweet blackberry fruits. The wine is initially soft, but the tannins do kick in. The fruit finally has great freshness
title: Château Beaumont 2009 Barrel sample  (Haut-Médoc)

description: Soft, warm and smoky wine, this has a finely layered wood flavor to go with the black currant and red berry fruits. It's dry, yet warm and ripe, finishing with freshness.
title: Château Moulin de Clotte 2009  Castillon Côtes de Bordeaux

description: There is a strongly caramel element to this wine. A tannic edge gives structure, though its fruit is less obvious.
title: Domaine du Claouset 2015 Rosé (Bordeaux Rosé)

description: This wine is tightly textured, firm and with a strongly tannic element. It will be better with food.
title: Château Toutigeac 2015 Rosé (Bordeaux Rosé)

description: The caramel character of this wine is less attractive than its background of red fruits. The two sides need to come into balance for it to work completely, so wait until late 2016.
title: Producta Vignobles 2015 Cabane aux Oiseaux Rosé (Bordeaux Rosé)

description: Lightly salmon-pink in color, this wine is ripe, caramel-flavored and full of red-berry fruits. A zesty orange edge gives the freshness this otherwise full, ripe wine needs.
title: Les Hauts de Lagarde 2015 Rosé (Bordeaux Rosé)

description: Dense and dark in color, this wine has a black currant flavor. The tannins are ripe and soft, and the texture has a fresh lilt to it from the acidity and fruitiness. Only on the finish do the youthful tannins show, promising medium-term aging.
title: Château Bessan Ségur 2010  Médoc

description: A classically structured wine, this has a smoky wood flavor that's balanced by a fresh black-currant note. It has a juicy edge, a dark chocolate note and a slight bitterness that should fade. This needs to age for 4–5 years. Château Loudenne is situated by the Gironde estuary.
title: Château Loudenne 2010  Médoc

description: Using fruit sourced from a 20-acre vineyard in Castillon, this is dominated by Merlot, with a touch of perfumed Cabernet Franc. It has an age-worthy structure, showing good balance, firm tannins and ripe fruit.
title: Château Moulin de Clotte 2010  Castillon Côtes de Bordeaux

description: This has intense black-currant fruit, with stalky tannins and a bone dry, firm core. It's a finely structured wine, packed with tight fruit and acidity. Drink now.
title: Calvet 2009 Réserve de l'Estey  (Médoc)

description: This is a fruity wine with a black currant flavor. As a contrast, the tannins offer a denser side, creating a food-friendly wine with fine dryness and a smoky flavor.
title: Château Lande de Bertin 2009  Bordeaux

description: This is a soft wine, with attractive red-currant fruit and open, smoky tannins. It's well balanced between the fruit, tannins and acidity, which lends a crisp aftertaste.
title: Château Piron 2009  Montagne-Saint-Émilion

description: This is a wine that brings out a soft, tropical character allied to a citrus and a herbaceous element. It's open, attractive and soft, and it's ready to drink.
title: Augey 2010  Bordeaux Blanc

description: Light and fruity, this wine's berry flavor dominates the gentle tannins, while the bright acidity adds lift. Drink this in the next two years.
title: Cave du Marmandais 2011 Château Campot Lafont  (Bordeaux)

description: The wine seems lean, austere and minerally in character. It has stalky black-currant fruits, firm tannins and forward acids. It should age over 2–3 years, but it will always be on the severe side.
title: Château de Janicon 2010  Graves

description: Fruity and juicy, this has soft tannins and an open, gentle texture. It has red currant fruit that gives acidity, with only a touch of dry tannins on the finish.
title: Château la Valade 2008  Premieres Côtes de Blaye

description: 92—94 Barrel sample. Well balanced wine, with its rich dark fruits well in harmony with its freshness and its dry tannins. Very juicy aftertaste.
title: Château Hosanna 2006 Barrel sample  (Pomerol)

description: 92—94 Barrel sample. Owned by the Bécot family of Beauséjour-Bécot, this is a single vineyard parcel, producing a rich wine, powered by blackberry fruits.
title: Château la Gomerie 2006 Barrel sample  (Saint-Émilion)

description: 92—94 Barrel sample. A fat, full wine, this is rich, intense, concentrated. Great layers of botrytis and apricot flavors give it attraction and power.—R.V.
title: Château Rieussec 2006 Barrel sample  (Sauternes)

description: 92-94 Barrel sample. Like many of the Sauternes in 2008, this is dominated by huge, concentrated botrytis. The fruits are dried, with orange peel coming through as a final, fresh lift.
title: Château Clos Haut-Peyraguey 2008 Barrel sample  (Sauternes)

description: 92-94 Barrel sample. With its gold color, this announces richness. The texture is rich, a wine that rounds in the mouth, giving sweetness, tropical flavors and big, ripe fruit. Only to finish, does the acidity arrive.
title: Château de Myrat 2008 Barrel sample  (Barsac)

description: 92-94 Barrel sample. An impressive wine. It shows just the right balance of dry botrytis and sweet fruit, bringing a firm structure as well as ripe bitter orange marmalade flavors.
title: Château Filhot 2008 Barrel sample  (Sauternes)

description: 92-94 Barrel sample. With its big, almost dry core of botrytis, this is going to be an intense wine - many years from now. For the present, the acidity gives it some freshness, while it remains concentrated.
title: Château Suau 2008 Barrel sample  (Barsac)

description: 92—94 Barrel sample. A dark, meaty wine, very new world in its richness and opulence. It is concentrated, packed with black fruit.—R.V.
title: Château Faugères 2006 Barrel sample  (Saint-Émilion)

description: 92—94 Barrel sample. There is big, and serious botrytis here. With its powerful structure, its dry botrytis, here's a wine that will certainly need aging. Very powerful, intense.
title: Château Lamothe Guignard 2006 Barrel sample  (Sauternes)

description: This crisp, lemon-flavored wine has a ripe, full character. It is rich with apples, apricots and delicious acidity at the end.
title: Les Hauts de Lagarde 2014  Bordeaux Blanc

description: This is a soft and ripe wine. Red fruits and caramel flavors add weight to the wine and a rich character, without forgetting the crisp, fresh acidity in the aftertaste.
designation: Le Rosé Gourmand de Maison Blanche
title: Maison Bouey 2014 Le Rosé Gourmand de Maison Blanche Rosé (Bordeaux Rosé)

description: This stalky, firmly tannic wine is still developing. Dominated by Merlot, it has black currant fruits in the background with acidity and crispness. Give this structured wine another few years and drink from 2016.
title: Château Andron 2010  Médoc

description: This fragrant, spicy wine is soft and rounded. It is still developing to give a wine that will be warm and full. It misses something of the essential fruitiness.
title: Château Au Grand Paris 2014  Bordeaux Blanc

description: Fruity and juicy, this is an attractive blend of Sémillon and Sauvignon Blanc, giving a tight, mineral-driven wine. With its pink grapefruit and crisp green apple fruits, it is young and can age, although not for long. Drink from 2016.
title: Château Grand Jean 2014  Entre-Deux-Mers

description: While there are certainly tannins here, this wine is essentially about fruit. Stalky black currants and berries dominate this perfumed wine with its fresh acidity and crisp, clean aftertaste. Drink now.
title: Château Haut-Sorillon 2012  Bordeaux Supérieur

description: Pale orange-pink in color, this is fruity and light. It coveys a bright, fresh character that is both refreshing and very crisp. Drink now.
title: Château la France 2014 Rosé (Bordeaux Rosé)

description: This delicious, fruity wine is full of acidity and crisp fruit. Light, bright and dominated by green and citrus fruits, it is ready to drink now.
title: Château Vircoulon 2014  Bordeaux Blanc

description: Full of acidity and red-currant flavors, this is a wine that is light and fruity. It is crisp along with touches of wood. This is one of several Nicolas Thienpont properties, run by son Cyrille. Drink from 2018.
title: Château La Prade 2014  Francs Côtes de Bordeaux

description: The wine is firm and structured although with enough fruit weight to give the wine a good potential for aging. Still full of young energy, it is going to develop balance.
title: Château Lajarre 2014 Cuvée Eléonore  (Bordeaux Supérieur)

description: The wine is all fruit with just the lightest tannins. It has great acidity, a lively red -ruit character and intense freshness. Drink this wine now.
title: Château les Arromans 2014  Bordeaux

description: Spice and some firm tannins mark this wine. It has a red-fruit character as well as a more earthy backdrop. With its structure it will need to sit until 2017.
title: Château Malbat 2014 Optimus  (Bordeaux)

description: This is a fresh wine that has been aged in tanks, retaining its bright red fruits and lively acidity. It is still young although it will develop quickly to give a soft fruit-driven wine.
title: Château Roc de Ségur 2015  Bordeaux

description: The organic wine has tight tannins and acidity. The structure is balanced by red-currant fruit flavors. The wine is vinified under the direction of Michel Rolland and one of several family wineries under Bacchus Investments. Drink from 2018.
title: Château Suau 2014  Cadillac Côtes de Bordeaux

description: This wine is ripe and potentially rich, but is firm at this stage. With its dark tannins and dense structure, it will age well. Drink from 2019.
title: Vignobles Carreau Selection 2014 Château Crusquet Sabourin  (Blaye Côtes de Bordeaux)

description: This is a crisp and herbal wine that is both fruity and finely textured. With layers of acidity and green fruit flavors, it is bright, fresh and ready to drink.
title: Château Barbé 2015  Blaye Côtes de Bordeaux

description: This is a dry wine, firm with tense tannins and structured. It needs time to bring out the ripe fruits that are there. Big and concentrated, this wine inaugurated a new gravity-fed winery. Wait until 2019 to drink.
title: Château Bourron 2014 Belvedere de Château Bourron  (Castillon Côtes de Bordeaux)

description: The wine is full of juicy acidity along with some attractive spice and light wood flavors. It is still developing and the fruit is too young, so give it until 2018.
title: Château Feret Lambert 2014 Costes du Château Feret Lambert  (Bordeaux Supérieur)

description: This is a structured wine from 96% Merlot and 4% Cabernet Sauvignon that has plenty of fruit. With some firm tannins as well as concentrated blackberry fruit, it is going to be a fine wine. It was created under the direction of consultant Stéphane Derenoncourt's team. Start drinking from 2019.
title: Château Gigault 2014 Cuvée Viva  (Blaye Côtes de Bordeaux)

description: The wine is structured with concentrated tannins and dense fruit. It has spice, wood-aging flavors and a firm aftertaste. That means the wine needs time, so wait until 2019.
title: Château Haut Peyrefaure 2014  Blaye Côtes de Bordeaux

description: This is a lively crisp wine with a creamy texture and a perfumed character. It is ripe and full with just enough acidity to give freshness.
title: Château Jeanguillon 2015  Entre-Deux-Mers

description: The hot, overweight 2003 vintage has not been kind to this licorice- and dark chocolate-flavored wine. It is dry, firm, while still garishly rich. If you have it, drink it now.
title: Château Fourcas Hosten 2003  Listrac-Médoc

description: Very herbaceous, dominated by Sauvignon Blanc, this wine is powered by green fruits, citrus and layers of wood. Ripe, crisp, with a tangy finish.
title: Château Couhins 2008  Pessac-Léognan

description: This is a woody, toasty wine, which seems to be the style here for the last several years. It has weight, but does need time for the wood to subside and bring out the elegant fruits.
title: Château Phélan-Ségur 2008  Saint-Estèphe

description: Soft, very round, already approachable, the wine is flavored with spice, black berry flavors and sweet tannins. Juicy, ripe Merlot for medium-term aging.
title: Château Couhins-Lurton 2008  Pessac-Léognan

description: A soft, ripe wine, its fruit rounded by an oily Sémillon texture. There is weight here, wih spice, wood and a creamy aftertaste. For medium-term aging.
title: Château Olivier 2008  Pessac-Léognan

description: An impressive wine, it already shows signs of its potential. It is elegant, with ripe fruits and layers of dark tannins. As it opens, blackberry fruits come through strongly, balancing the firm structure. Drink from 2018.
title: Château Beaumont 2011  Haut-Médoc

description: The estate is under the same ownership as Château la Dominique in Saint-Émilion. This dense wine balances acidity with intense fruitiness. The tannins are now softening, giving a rich structure plus a concentrated leather and spice character. Drink from 2016.
title: Château Clément-Pichon 2010  Haut-Médoc

description: Spicy new wood flavors dominate this otherwise strongly fruity wine. The tension between the two promises a rich, full and ripe wine for the future. There is enough weight, acidity, blackberry fruit and richness to balance out the wood aging. Give this dense wine until 2018.
title: Château Fonréaud 2011  Listrac-Médoc

description: A very dry wine, it shows the traditional Saint- Estèphe hard tannins. That suggests it will develop slowly, gradually bringing out the potential of the red berry fruits and acidity as it develops into a fine, complex wine. Drink from 2017.
title: Château Cos Labory 2011  Saint-Estèphe

description: This is a ripe wine with spice, juicy red fruits and a feeling of opulence. Full, fruity and rich, it's a wine for medium-term aging. Drink from 2017.
title: Château d'Armailhac 2011  Pauillac

description: This is a perfumed, new wood-flavored wine. It has soft tannins and attractive acidity along with a drier core. Showing a rich potential, it will round out over the next four to five years. Drink from 2018.
title: Château Meyney 2011  Saint-Estèphe

description: This is a rich, full-bodied and complex wine. It shows dense tannins and equally dense fruits that are powered by the ripe black currant fruit flavors. There is a fresher component at the end, attractive and bright. Drink from 2017.
title: Château Ormes de Pez 2011  Saint-Estèphe

description: A 50-50 blend of Cabernet Sauvignon and Merlot, this smoky wine has a flavor of black currant juice and a lean, firmly tannic texture. It needs several years to mature.
title: Château la Roque de By 2010  Médoc

description: Smoky and structured, this is a wine that has both firm tannins and balanced, juicy fruits. It's a fine wine to drink now, especially with rich meats, and it can age for a year or two.
title: Cheval Quancard 2010 Réserve  (Bordeaux)

description: Named after the stagecoaches that used to travel through the Médoc, this château has produced an attractive, fruity wine in 2011. It has some tannins and firm wood-aging flavors, while the fruit is light and fresh. Drink from 2016.
title: Château Patache d'Aux 2011  Médoc

description: This is a stalky, black currant and spice flavored wine. It has relatively soft tannins while showing a meaty, juicy character. The wine is for medium-term aging, so drink from 2016.
title: Château d'Escurac 2011  Médoc

description: An attractive, if lightweight, wine that has good acidity and red berry fruits. It is a medium-term wine, fresh and developing quickly.
title: Château Léo de Prades 2011  Saint-Estèphe

description: This is an enormous wine, maybe too much. With its layers of rich black fruits and dark tannins, it is a powerful, juicy, jammy and super-ripe wine. It all seems excessive and out of balance. It's fun for a moment, but not for drinking with food.
title: Château Roullet 2010  Canon-Fronsac

description: With layers of new wood and spice flavors, this wine is highly structured without much fruit to balance. It will develop into a dry, firm wine, showing light black fruit flavors surrounded by textured tannins.
title: Château Tour Prignac 2011  Médoc

description: Confusingly, the wine has no connection with Château Magnol, also owned by Barton & Guestier. It's a soft Médoc wine, light and gentle in character, the tannins soft, merging with the red berry fruits.
title: Barton & Guestier 2008 Les Charmes de Magnol  (Médoc)

description: Tight wine, its black currant flavors layered with dry tannins. It's finely structured, although the stalky element tends to dominate. Not for aging.
title: Barton & Guestier 2008  Médoc

description: A curious, dirty nose doesn't help this wine. The palate is certainly better, its fruit now mature, smooth, the acidity blending with attractive smoky flavors.
title: Château Pimpine 2005  Bordeaux Côtes de Francs

description: Close to Fronsac, this is a Merlot-dominated wine that has soft, ripe fruit. It shows sweetness and open berry flavors touched by chocolate and licorice. To be   opened over the next 2–3 years.
title: Château Saint-Michel 2008  Bordeaux Supérieur

description: A wine that offers plenty of the charm of Margaux, with its soft tannins, layers of chocolate, smooth texture and juicy fruit. The wood at this stage is prominent, and needs to settle down.
title: Barton & Guestier 2007 Thomas Barton Réserve  (Margaux)

description: A soft, open wine, kept together by its dry tannins. Good black fruits, fresh acidity and an attractive smoky character.
title: Château Monroze 2008  Bordeaux Supérieur

description: There's earthy, fleshy aromas on this wine that has acidity, red fruits and soft tannins. The rough edge of rusticity is not far away, though, spoiling the fresh fruits.
title: Château Saint-Sulpice 2005  Bordeaux

description: Rustic, barnyard aromas with flavors of hedgerow red berries and light acidity. The style is fruity; the sweet fruits are shot through with some licorice and beetroot flavors.
title: Château du Bousquet 2005  Côtes de Bourg

description: Still very young, this is a Maison Bouey wine with good potential. It offers hints of the ripe yellow fruits and richness that will come as it develops. The touch of perfumed spice means it is also a wine to savor as an apéritif.
title: Château Lestruelle 2016  Bordeaux Blanc

description: While there are plenty of wood flavors here, the wine also has fine ripe blackberries. That gives potential balance and density. This fine wine will be ready to drink from 2018.
title: Château de Lionne 2015 L'Envolée de Lionne  (Bordeaux)

description: The wine has firm tannins and a dense texture that promises a good aging potential. Its ripe blackberry and black-plum fruits also show a solid wine with its richness and fine fruit. Drink from 2019.
title: Château de Rouquette 2016  Bordeaux

description: Produced in the hills above the small town of Castillon, the wine is fruity with a stalky texture and some firm tannins. It is balanced, though, with its acidity and black-currant flavors and should mature well over the next few years. Drink from 2018.
title: Château du Roc 2014  Castillon Côtes de Bordeaux

description: Rich and with good fruit, this is a structured wine that has the density to age well. The dark-chocolate flavors mingle with the black-plum fruits, finishing with just a light lift of acidity.
title: Château la Verrière 2015  Bordeaux Supérieur

description: This is a bold fruity wine that just allows its tannins to build a supporting structure. The black fruits are right up front, full of acidity and with a delicious potential. Drink from 2019.
title: Château le Grand Verdus 2015  Bordeaux Supérieur

description: There is a caramel edge to this wine showing the wood-aging flavors. Luckily the fruit is all there as well, giving a balanced future to this structured wine. With plenty of tannins and juicy acidity combined, it will be a fine wine from 2019.
title: Château Saint Seurin 2015  Bordeaux Supérieur

description: Big tannins mask the fruit in this potentially ripe and fruity wine. It is structured and dark with a dry core of tannins. It means the wine needs time. Drink from 2019.
title: Château Vircoulon 2015  Bordeaux Supérieur

description: Ripe and fruity, this is a pale pink-colored wine from Raymond family organic vineyards. In the winery, the wine is full of red berry flavors and with a crisp final texture. Refreshing and lively, it's ready to drink now.
title: Les Hauts de Lagarde 2016 Rosé (Bordeaux Rosé)

description: Warm, voluptuous, rich and generous, this wine has the right weight, along with firm, dark tannins and a bitter coffee flavor. The finish is warm and delicious.
title: Château de Candale 2009  Saint-Émilion

description: This firmly tannic wine boasts solid structure and density. It has powerful concentration, due to very low yields. The fruit is ripe, driven by notes of black plum and berry. This is a wine with a long-term future.
title: Château de Pez 2010  Saint-Estèphe

description: Ripe, dense and smooth from wood aging, this is a modern view of Margaux. At the same time, it shows a beautiful black-currant flavor from the Cabernet Sauvignon, and the Petit Verdot adds great color.
title: Château du Tertre 2010  Margaux

description: Rich and juicy, this features a ripe plum flavor and acidity, resulting in a wine that is fragrant, fresh and structured. It has power, and its dark concentration is at the heart of this solid effort.
title: Château Fombrauge 2008 Magrez Fombrauge  (Saint-Émilion)

description: Tough at the moment, this is a wine with impressive concentration. It's solid and chunky, with massive structure. The fragrant finish is a sign of the pleasure to come.
title: Château Grand-Puy Ducasse 2010  Pauillac

description: This has enough rich fruit to meld with the abundance of toasty wood. It is opulent and ripe, a powerful wine, typical of the vintage with its sweet red-berry flavor and refreshing acidity on the finish.
title: Château la Croix Saint-Georges 2009  Pomerol

description: Tense and firmly tannic, this wine is still very young. Berry and black currant fruit are still dominated by a dry character. The wine will take time toward its slow maturity.
title: Château Bourgneuf 2010  Pomerol

description: A full, rich wine, showing red fruits at their best. It has structure and layers of bright acidity. It's not a wine for long aging, likely to be at its best in three years time.
title: Château de Laville 2010  Cadillac Côtes de Bordeaux

description: Rich and spicy, this is a smooth, wood-aged wine. It has ripe tannins and some concentrated fruits. With its acidity and dry aftertaste, it will certainly age.
title: Château La Grange Clinet 2010  Côtes de Bordeaux

description: A creamy, wood-aged white that simultaneously emphasizes crisp Sauvignon Blanc fruit and minerality. Hints of pineapple and lemon go with a tight texture. A rich yet fresh wine that could age for a few years but can also be enjoyed now.
title: Le Nardian 2010  Bordeaux Blanc

description: A rich, oak-laden wine that shows fine ripe fruits. There are juicy blackberry and dried fruit flavors allied to a light structure that results in a rich, open and generous wine.
title: Château de Fonbel 2010  Saint-Émilion

description: This firm wine has black-currant and red-plum fruit, nicely integrated with the dry core. Ready to drink, although capable of aging a year or two.
title: Château Grand Marchand 2011  Bordeaux

description: This is a wine with light spice and perfumed red fruits. It is juicy, fresh, lightly tannic and likely to develop quickly. Drink from 2017.
title: Château Maréchaux 2014  Bordeaux Supérieur

description: The wine has plenty of ripe fruit, raspberry flavors and light spice. With a crisp streak of acidity, it is beginning to show a good balance. Drink from 2017.
title: Château Queyssard 2014  Bordeaux Supérieur

description: This wine from Bruno Martin's 3.3-acre vineyard is going to be a fresh and fruity. Already it has a fine juicy character and plenty of red fruits. Crisp acidity at the end confirms this bright character.
title: Château Sainte-Luce Bellevue 2014 Tradition  (Blaye Côtes de Bordeaux)

description: The spicy wood is prominent here. It balances the red-berry fruits and bright acidity. That makes for a perfumed, juicy wine that will finish fresh and crisp.
title: Château du Grand Pierre 2014  Blaye Côtes de Bordeaux

description: This is a dry wine although the fruit does show potential. It is concentrated and firm, tannins foremost. Drink from 2019.
title: Maison Hebrard 2014 Premium  (Cadillac Côtes de Bordeaux)

description: This is a structured, firm wine that has tense tannins and acidity. It is smoky with a dry core. The fruit is just not there.
title: Château de Beauregard-Ducourt 2014  Bordeaux

description: The wine is spicy and laden with wood. It has an extracted character that produces chocolate and bitter coffee flavors. The fruit is hard to find at this stage.
title: Château Haut Mouleyre 2014  Bordeaux

description: This is an obviously wood-aged wine with plenty of toast flavors. This wood aging has flattened the fruit giving a wine that is soft with few tannins. It is ready to drink.
title: Château Laffitte Laujac 2012  Médoc

description: Initially a little rustic, the wine does open out. It is smoky, fruity with the acidity of the vintage.
title: Château Briot 2014  Bordeaux

description: Strawberry fruit flavors dominate this soft wine. It is unfocussed and misses out on clarity and shape.
title: Château la Mothe du Barry 2014 Cuvée Design  (Bordeaux Supérieur)

description: The wine is dry, firm and with too many tannins for its own good. It does have hints of fruit along with spice and acidity. Shame about the over extraction that gives it a bitter aftertaste.
title: Château le Sèpe 2014  Bordeaux

description: This is a lean wine, all tannins and missing fruit. It is dry and showing considerable hard extraction. It will soften, but not much.
title: Château les Berthets 2014  Blaye Côtes de Bordeaux

description: Firmly tannic yet with the potential of good black currant fruit, this is a fine reflection of the vintage, rich and fruity, layered with considerably fresh acidity. Drink now, or give it a year.
title: Grands Terroirs de France 2010  Haut-Médoc

description: Rounded wine, showing ripe tropical flavors as well as a more citrus character. The wine is full, attractively textured with a buttery edge. Spice and green herbs come through to finish. Screwcap.
title: Château Larroque 2012  Bordeaux Blanc

description: The second wine of Château Ramage la Batisse, L'Enclos is ripe and fruity. It has a sense of structure although this is played down by the rich black currant fruits. Acidity cuts through the general richness of this medium-aging wine.
title: Château Ramage la Batisse 2010 L'Enclose de Ramage  (Haut-Médoc)

description: Spicy, rich and full of ripe fruit, this wine has great potential. It is structured and dense while bringing out a stylish elegance. Blackberry fruit dominates the tannins to create a wine that has both concentration and fine fruit. Drink from 2022.
title: Château Branaire-Ducru 2014  Saint-Julien

description: This property continues its upward trend. It is a solid wine, packed with great ripe fruit. Old vines give extra concentration and depth of flavor. The wine has great potential, with both its tannins and rich fruit playing strongly. Drink from 2023.
title: Château Clerc Milon 2014  Pauillac

description: This 100% Sauvignon Blanc with six months in French oak is fresh with attractive fruitiness and light acidity. It has spice, a touch of toast and full yellow fruits. The aftertaste brings in a more citrus character that lets the wine finish with freshness. Drink now. Laurent Dubois is the family's ninth generation at this northern Gironde property.
title: Château Les Bertrands 2014 Cuvée Prestige  (Blaye Côtes de Bordeaux)

description: This is a tight, mineral-driven wine with fresh acidity and a crisp character. Sémillon dominated, it conveys green fruits, bright acidity and a lively, tangy aftertaste. The wine is refreshing, fruity and ready to drink. Nicolas Thienpont and his brothers bought this 16-acre property in 1988.
title: Château les Charmes Godard 2014  Francs Côtes de Bordeaux

description: This is the second wine of Clos Haut-Peyraguey. It comes from a fine Sauternes vintage with a great balance between acidity and rich sweetness. With botrytis, plenty of sweetness, bitter marmalade and apricot fruit and delicious acidity, the wine is almost ready to drink. Just wait until the end of 2017.
title: Château Clos Haut-Peyraguey 2013 Symphonie de Haut-Peyraguey  (Sauternes)

description: The rich fruit and structure of this impressive wine are already well integrated. With power and concentration as well as layers of dark fruits, it is showing fine aging potential. The wine, dominated by 80% Merlot, comes from vines in the east of Saint-Emilion. Drink from 2020.
title: Château la Chapelle aux Moines 2014  Saint-Émilion

description: The second wine of La Dominique on the Saint-Emilion plateau shows the fruity side of this estate. It is packed with red fruits and with soft tannins. The acidity and the smooth texture promise early drinking for a generous wine. Drink from 2018.
title: Château la Dominique 2014 Relais de la Dominique  (Saint-Émilion)

description: This wine from the Gonfrier family property is full of berry fruits. It's also a ripe wine that is already drinkable. It has generous tannins and balanced acidity that gives the wine its crisp edge as a contrast to the blackberry flavors. Drink now, or even better, wait until 2018.
title: Château le Gardera 2015  Bordeaux Supérieur

description: Smooth, ripe and immediate, this is a wine that is developing deliciously, but fast. There is a great fresh, juicy character that balances with the ripe, full tannins. Don't age, just enjoy.
title: Château Couhins-Lurton 2006  Pessac-Léognan

description: Delicate and elegant wine, with smoky fruit, ripe but freshened with a tight layer of acidity. It has delicious black currant juice flavors, but the texture remains light and the tannins soft.
title: Château Margaux 2006 Pavillon Rouge de Château Margaux  (Margaux)

description: The second wine of Château Montrose is at a high level. With its ripe chocolate and sweet black currant flavors, the structure comes from dark tannins, which, as so often in Saint-Estèphe, are dry, but not hard, and have delicious fresh berry fruits to envelope them. A wine that is great for aging over 4–5 years.
title: Château Montrose 2006 La Dame de Montrose  (Saint-Estèphe)

description: This is an impressively complete wine, the fruit right in context with the dark, dry tannins. All the elements are in place, from the initial juicy fruit to the soft, fresh close.This is an impressively complete wine, the fruit right in context with the dark, dry tannins. All the elements are in place, from the initial juicy fruit to the soft, fresh close.
title: Château Potensac 2006  Médoc

description: With its well-handled new wood treatment, this wine instead has gone for full-bodied richness. The wood is definitely an important element, but its ripe, smooth black plum juice and blueberry flavors share the honors of this delicious wine equally. In 2–3 years, this will be a wine for luxuriating.
title: Château Branas Grand Poujeaux 2006  Moulis-en-Médoc

description: This is a serious wine, tight and closed up at this stage. Around the dry core, the fruit is structured, not offering richness, but with a good, solid base of black currants. It needs time to soften.
title: Château Durfort-Vivens 2006  Margaux

description: Very much in the food style of Bordeaux, this wine shows the freshness of the 2006 vintage, while also offering some ripe weight. Flavors of fresh black currants edged with black plum skin are supported by a firm line of tannins, finished with a sweet, juicy, fleshy aftertaste.
title: Château Preuillac 2006  Médoc

description: With its prominent new wood, here is a wine that goes for spice, caramel and high toast flavors. It has great power, a wine that is currently all structure, leaving the fruit to gain in richness at a later stage.
title: Château Smith Haut Lafitte 2006  Pessac-Léognan

description: One of the largest estates in Margaux, Lascombes is now performing well. With this vintage the heavy over-oaking of past years has gone to be replaced with a wine that is full of black fruits as much as rich tannins. There is concentration and a good potential for aging. Drink from 2025.
title: Château Lascombes 2014  Margaux

description: This is a concentrated wine, packed with tannins and black plum fruits. It has some of the fruity crispness of the vintage although with its dark structure and concentration it is obviously a wine that needs to soften over time. Rich and juicy at the end, it will be ready to drink from 2024.
title: Château Prieuré-Lichine 2014  Margaux

description: 88-90 Solid, chunky wine, firmly tannic and tough. The weight of fruit is there to give promise for the future.
title: Château Cissac 2010 Barrel sample  (Haut-Médoc)

description: 88-90 Smoky ripe fruit, big and bold fruit with some firm tannins. The wine is packed with ripe berry fruits.
title: Château Laforge 2010 Barrel sample  (Saint-Émilion)

description: 88-90 Soft, ripe, smooth, with delicious acidity and berry fruits. Some good density.
title: Château de Lamarque 2010 Barrel sample  (Haut-Médoc)

description: 87-89 Rich, though a wine that seems to lack an inner core. It is all beautiful fruit, super-ripe, laced with acidity, missing the structure.
title: Château Beauregard 2010 Barrel sample  (Pomerol)

description: 87-89 With intense acidity, this is a structured, firm wine. The extract is considerable, leaving an edge of bitterness. At the same time, the freshness gives point to the wood tannins.
title: Château Greysac 2010 Barrel sample  (Médoc)

description: 87-89 Solid, chunky wine, full of dense tannins, concentrated fruit. There is a powerful feel to it.
title: Château Plince 2010 Barrel sample  (Pomerol)

description: 87-89 Lacking richness, the wine has acidity, some sweetness, but misses definition and density.
title: Château Lamothe 2010 Barrel sample  (Sauternes)

description: 87-89 The wine seems hollow, all tannins, missing the weight of fruit. It's dark, certainly and concentrated, but one-dimensional.
title: Château la Couspaude 2010 Barrel sample  (Saint-Émilion)

description: 87-89 Ripe new wood and spice with blackberry juice flavors, very rich and concentrated. It has soft tannins, very juicy.
title: Château Reysson 2010 Barrel sample  (Haut-Médoc)

description: 87-89 Ripe and juicy, a forward fruity wine, with acidity and freshness. A wine for early drinking.
title: Château Siaurac 2010 Barrel sample Plaisir de Siaurac  (Lalande de Pomerol)

description: 87-89 Very cassis in character, with fruit, some weight and totally juicy acidity.
title: Château Simard 2010 Barrel sample  (Saint-Émilion)

description: 87-89 A delicious spicy wine, keeping the freshness and acidity in a red fruit style. The spice from the wood is too defined.
title: Château Bourgneuf 2010 Barrel sample  (Pomerol)

description: 87-89 Soft wine, its acidity light. Pineapple and green apple flavors, with hints of wood.
title: Château Ferrande 2010 Barrel sample  (Graves)

description: 87-89 The wine tastes light, with a hard edged mineral character, the richness still a distance away.
title: Château Filhot 2010 Barrel sample  (Sauternes)

description: 87-89 Lovely weight and fruit with freshness and acidity. A very attractive wine with blackberry fruits, dusty tannins. Almost opulent.
title: Château La Serre 2010 Barrel sample  (Saint-Émilion)

description: 87-89 Smooth, poiished new wood along with sweet, soft tannins. A velvet textured, smoky wine.
title: Château la Tour de By 2010 Barrel sample  (Médoc)

description: 87-89 The wine is out of focus, with fruit lost in a structure that hasn't come together. It has weight and acidity, plum fruits showing slowly.
title: Château Picque Caillou 2010 Barrel sample  (Pessac-Léognan)

description: 87-89 Firmly structured, dense tannins and wood, leaving the fruit behind. Extraction is a problem here.
title: Chateau Desmirail 2010 Barrel sample  (Margaux)

description: 87-89 A wine that is all structure, with very little fruit. It has a hard, metallic edge.
title: Château Suau 2010 Barrel sample  (Barsac)

description: 86-88 A lean wine, with the over-ripe fruit battling with the tannins. It is hard and over extracted.
title: Château Durfort-Vivens 2010 Barrel sample  (Margaux)

description: 86-88 Firmly tannic, stalky with black currant and an edge of extracted bitterness.
title: Château La Grande Clotte 2010 Barrel sample  (Lussac Saint-Émilion)

description: 86-88 Intense wood aromas that are translated through to the palate. This is all smoky plank and structure.
title: Château Fonréaud 2010 Barrel sample  (Listrac-Médoc)

description: 86-88 Sweet, soft fruit, ripe and attractive, with some spice and fresh tannins. The wine is open, already developing.
title: Château Balestard la Tonnelle 2010 Barrel sample  (Saint-Émilion)

description: 86-88 Fine fruit, lovely black currant character, with fine acidity and great freshness. A delicious wine. There is some Carmenère in the blend.
title: Château de Fonbel 2010 Barrel sample  (Saint-Émilion)

description: 85-87 Pushing dryness, and tannins, the wine feels extracted, hard. The fruit doesn't catch up with the structure.
title: Château Caronne Ste Gemme 2010 Barrel sample  (Haut-Médoc)

description: 85-87 The wine seems too ripe, the fruit very rich, opulent. It has weight, a jammy character, the tannins out of balance
title: Château Clauzet 2010 Barrel sample  (Saint-Estèphe)

description: 85-87 A dark wine, the fruit tasting a little over-ripe. It does have structure and acidity, but feels soft and flabby.
title: Château Barreyres 2010 Barrel sample  (Haut-Médoc)

description: 84-86 Tough, only with tannins. Very hard wine, firm.
title: Château Liversan 2010 Barrel sample  (Haut-Médoc)

description: While the wine is light, it has a good balance between its dry tannins and attractive black currant fruitiness. With good structure, it will age over the medium term, so drink from 2016.
title: Château du Perier 2011  Médoc

description: Fruity while still solidly tannic, this is a ripe Merlot-dominated wine. It has a touch of bitterness, but the main flavors are of black currant, fresh berries and a strong line in acidity. Drink from 2017.
title: Château la Fleur Poitou 2011  Lussac Saint-Émilion

description: A rich, ripe concentrated wine, packed with red plum and cherry fruits, lightly layered with tannins. The wine is immediately attractive, juicy, ready to drink.
title: Pezat 2009  Bordeaux Supérieur

description: A fresh wine, with some of the richness of the vintage showing in up-front red berry fruits. The tannins are already well integrated, allowing the wine to show a softer side. It is for medium-term aging.
title: Château Grand Tayac 2009  Margaux

description: Rich and fruity, this wine is finely balanced, with juicy black-plum fruit and acidity. The Merlot gives it a smoky character and a ripe, fleshy texture. Age this for 3–4 years.
title: Château Haut Barrail 2010  Médoc

description: Mint and herb aromas are followed by a structured and tannic palate. It has balancing acidity, with a juicy black-currant flavor and a dark, dry edge. Like nearly all of the 2010s, it needs to age.
title: Château Lousteauneuf 2010  Médoc

description: This wine is soft and fruity with ripe berry fruits and gentle tannins. For a major second wine, it's surprisingly easy and soft, developing fast with its berry fruits, chocolate and wood flavors at the end. Drink from 2017.
title: Château Mouton Rothschild 2012 Le Petit Mouton  (Pauillac)

description: For the vintage, this is a ripe, bold wine. Layers of delicious black fruits are supported by firm tannins and the right amount of wood aging. Balanced and dense, it will age well. Drink from 2017.
title: Château Pierre de Montignac 2012  Médoc

description: Big and dry, this wine shows the tannic, firm character of the vintage. It has a dark, dense core of wood tannins while the juicy black currant fruit is still developing. The wine needs to age, so drink from 2018.
title: Château Teyssier 2011  Montagne-Saint-Émilion

description: This shows both the fruit of the vintage and a more structured tannic side. Black currant flavors are up front, offering a generous feeling. They are balanced by the backdrop of tannins and tight acidity. Together they make a wine that is concentrated and likely to be ready to drink soon. Drink from 2016.
title: Château Teyssier 2012  Saint-Émilion

description: While this wine is lean initially, it also shows weight and the potential of ripe fruits. Concentrated tannins still allow room for a little juicy fruit. The overall effect is of structure triumphing over fruitiness. Made by the team at Domaine de Chevalier, the wine will take time to develop. Drink from 2019.
title: Domaine de la Solitude 2012  Pessac-Léognan

description: Dry and light, an unfocused wine. It has tannins, only light fruit, very dry and ultimately tough.
title: Château Moulin de Canhaut 2007  Médoc

description: Dry, dark-hued tannins cut through the wine, giving it a bitter feel. It is tough, firm, missing the balancing fruit.
title: Château de Virecourt 2009  Bordeaux

description: Firm and hard-edged this wine is currently tough. The fruit—black currant and berry—will bring out the potential richness. It's structured for the moment, but wait until 2017.
title: Kirkland Signature 2012 Château de Marsan  (Bordeaux Supérieur)

description: The blend of Sauvignon Blanc and Sémillon has produced an attractive, fruity wine that's young and fresh. Light and bright, with delicious final acidity, its structure suggests it could age; drink from the end of 2015.
title: Barton & Guestier 2013 Passeport  (Bordeaux Blanc)

description: Ripe berry fruits shine through this wine. Supported by the tannins, they give a solid and rich character that is beginning to develop. With a dark aftertaste, this wine has potential and will be best from 2017.
title: Château Bois de Rolland 2012 Cuvée Prestige  (Bordeaux Supérieur)

description: Juicy black fruits give a great start, supported by the tannins that kick in. Ripe, full of flavor and generous, this is a broad, full-bodied wine. Drink from 2016.
title: Château Brande-Bergère 2012 Cuvée O'Byrne  (Bordeaux Supérieur)

description: Ripe and juicy, this is perfumed, full of red berry flavor and attractively soft tannins. The wine feels broad and rich, ready to drink from 2015.
title: Château de Bel 2012 La Capitane  (Bordeaux Supérieur)

description: Dense and richly smooth, this displays all the fruit and generous texture of a 2009. It's now maturing well with its blackberry fruitiness, sweet tannins and light acidity. Drink now and until 2020.
title: Château du Tasta 2009 Grande Réserve  (Cadillac Côtes de Bordeaux)

description: Across the river Dordogne from Castillon, the vineyard of Lajarre is on the first slope. This soft and ripe wine has black currant fruitiness, fresh acidity and a judicious use of wood aging. It still shows the structure of 2010, so will be better from 2015.
title: Château Lajarre 2010 Cuvée Eléonore  (Bordeaux Supérieur)

description: The wine is rich, full of berry fruits that are also touched by damsons. It has spice, some toast and a smooth texture. Plenty of jammy fruit indicate good potential. Drink from 2016.
title: Château Penin 2012 Natur  (Bordeaux)

description: The second wine of Clos Cantenac is already accessible. With spice, black currant fruits and ripe tannins, it's both juicy and firmly structured. The wine is balanced, with great acidity at the end contrasting with the tannins. Drink now.
title: Clos Cantenac 2011 Petit Cantenac  (Saint-Émilion)

description: This refreshing wine from the Seze family of Fronsac is light, crisp and packed with fruit. Crisp with citrus flavors it is ready to drink now.
title: Château Buisson-Redon 2016  Bordeaux Blanc

description: Balanced acidity and fruit give this Lobre wine its immediate attraction. It has a bright character, the fruit and the acidity in harmony. Drink this ripe wine now.
title: Château de l'Aubrade 2016 Rosé (Bordeaux Rosé)

description: A crisp blend of Sémillon, Sauvignon Blanc and Muscadelle, this is a ripe wine, showing the warmth of this vintage. It is lightly perfumed with apricot and red-apple flavors. The aftertaste is all about tangy fruit. Drink now.
title: Château du Moulin 2015  Entre-Deux-Mers

description: This concentrated, herbal wine has a good balance between the great fruit and the tangy, zesty texture. With its fruity character and spicy aftertaste, it's already a pleasure to drink.
title: Château le Grand Verdus 2016  Bordeaux Blanc

description: Crisp and fruity, this wine is full of apple and citrus flavors. It also features a touch of wood and spice, with a creamy aftertaste from the light wood aging. Drink now.
title: Château Mont-Pérat 2016  Bordeaux Blanc

description: This is a tight, mineral-textured wine. Crisp fruit keeps it bright, but the texture adds a more serious, structured note. Wait until late 2017 for it to come completely together.
title: Château Petit Moulin 2016 Rosé (Bordeaux Rosé)

description: Despite the huge weight of fruit and accompanying structure, this is a stylish wine. It's impressively dense, concentrated and solid. At the same time, the juicy black fruits give a generous, full-in-the-mouth character. Drink this very fine wine from 2022.
title: Château Ducru Beaucaillou 2011  Saint-Julien

description: Firm and very structured, it has depth plus some spice from wood aging, along with a dry core that still dominates the fragrant red berry fruits. Don't drink before 2018.
title: Château Calon 2011  Saint-Émilion

description: Powerful, very rich and very concentrated, this epitomizes the opulent style of Cos d'Estournel. A sense of extraction is overwhelmed by the huge, ripe fruit. It shows velvet texture at first, but then the tannins come on strongly, leaving a wine that will age over many years. Drink from 2022.
title: Château Cos d'Estournel 2011  Saint-Estèphe

description: This is powerful and concentrated, with the high proportion of Cabernet Sauvignon in the blend standing out firmly. It is dark, rich, packed with ripe black fruits and sweet tannins. Drink from 2018.
title: Château Figeac 2011  Saint-Émilion

description: Rich and smooth, this is a ripe wine packed with blackberry fruits and sweet tannins that give a soft, while firm, structure. From the owner of Léoville Poyferré in Saint-Julien, it is sophisticated and elegant. Drink from 2017.
title: Château Le Crock 2011  Saint-Estèphe

description: As so often with Montrose, this is a powerful, concentrated and very structured wine. Dense tannins are paired with rich black fruits, although at this stage the wine also has a sense of austerity. Power, severity and complexity all make for a wine for long aging. Wait until 2019.
title: Château Montrose 2011  Saint-Estèphe

description: Continuing its impressive development, Clerc Milon 2011 is a serious wine. It is elegant, stylish, its fruits well integrated with red berry and plum skin flavors. Powerful while round and fruity with a fine sense of weight, this wine will develop relatively quickly but will then stay at its peak for many years. Drink from 2017.
title: Château Clerc Milon 2011  Pauillac

description: This is a well structured, rich wine. It has solid, ripe red-berry and black-currant fruits that dominate the firmer tannins, giving a juicy, generous feel. Well worth aging for 3–5 years.
title: Château Bellegrave du Poujeau 2009  Haut-Médoc

description: This small Pauillac property, close to Château Pontet-Canet, has produced an impressive 2006, structured with firm tannins under the black currant fruit.
title: Château Béhèré Courtin 2006  Pauillac

description: Densely tannic and rich, this is full of ripe chocolate and blackberry fruit. It is dark, brooding and dense—a great success for the second wine of Château du Glana.
title: Château du Glana 2009 Terre du Lion  (Saint-Julien)

description: This is a firm yet ripe wine that boasts ripe black-plum flavors layered with dense and dusty tannins. The wine is concentrated, with wood aging filling out the structure. It is big and bold, finishing with great ripe fruit.
title: Château Lanbersac 2009  Puisseguin Saint-Émilion

description: 93–95. Barrel sample. A complex and very successful wine, this shows rich tannins, dark fruits, a powerful texture of ripe blackberry fruits and spiced acidity. It will shine with some serious aging.
title: Château La Tour Figeac 2012 Barrel Sample  (Saint-Émilion)

description: 93–95. Barrel sample. The second wine of Château Ausone shows its 60% Cabernet Franc to great effect. It's perfumed and mineral, but with a dark intensity and acidity. A fine wine with a good future.
title: Château Ausone 2012 La Chapelle d'Ausone Barrel Sample  (Saint-Émilion)

description: 93–95. Barrel sample. This is a finely balanced wine that's ripe and structured at the same time. It has richness and spice, with a powerful context of wood, juicy blackberry fruits and delicious acidity. With such concentration, this is a wine with excellent ageing potential.
title: Château Beau-Séjour Bécot 2012 Barrel Sample  (Saint-Émilion)

description: 93–95. Barrel sample. This is a powerful wine with solid fruits and structure. The palate is full of beautifully ripe fruit—packed with rich and juicy blackberries. It shows how the potential of this property is being realized.
title: Château Beausejour-Duffau-Lagarrosse 2012 Barrel Sample  (Saint-Émilion)

description: 93–95. Barrel sample. This is a very firm and concentrated wine with dark and smoky character. The palate is elegant and fine, but densely structured with dark tannins that give extra complexity.
title: Château Certan de May de Certan 2012 Barrel Sample  (Pomerol)
winery: Château Certan de May de Certan

description: 93–95. Barrel sample. Full bodied and ripe, this wine is marked by smoky character, spiciness and full-throttle tannins. Blackberry fruits on the palate complement this serious structure. Obviously a long-term wine.
title: Château Pavie Macquin 2012 Barrel Sample  (Saint-Émilion)

description: 93–95. Barrel sample. Lavish with chocolate, coffee aromas, this is a finely perfumed wine. The palate is packed with ripe fruits and generous tannins that yield a deliciously rich mouth feel. Spicy, wood laden and opulent.
title: Le Dôme 2012 Barrel Sample  (Saint-Émilion)

description: 93–95. Barrel sample. Powerful and concentrated, this is a firmly textured wine with a dark, solid, dense character. The palate balances fine acidity and fruit with a dark, brooding structure.
title: Clos Fourtet 2012 Barrel Sample  (Saint-Émilion)

description: 93–95. Barrel sample. An exemplary wine, this is powerful, rich and full of ripe red fruits. The palate is dark, but brightened by acidity, red fruits and a beautiful line of freshness.
title: Château le Gay 2012 Barrel Sample  (Pomerol)

description: 92–94. Barrel sample. Very dense and rich with fine, tarry tannins that float amidst the ripe blackberry flavors. The wine is structured but full in body with a rich, opulent feel.
title: Château Fombrauge 2012 Barrel Sample  (Saint-Émilion)

description: 92–94. Barrel sample. The diminutive neighbor of Château Pavie, Pavie Decesse's wine has its own, more mineral, tight character. It is complex but fruity, with blackberries supported by wood, acidity and dense texture.
title: Château Pavie Decesse 2012 Barrel Sample  (Saint-Émilion)

description: 92–94. Barrel sample. Solid, firm and tannic, this is a powerful success. It has equal weight of fruit and tannins and a palate that's intensely structured and complex. For long-term aging.
title: Château Beauregard 2012 Barrel Sample  (Pomerol)

description: 92–94. Barrel sample. Black currant flavors resound on this juicy, deliciously fresh wine. It's a structured wine with a core of dry tannins and a palate that's firm and concentrated to the finish.
title: Château Villemaurine 2012 Barrel Sample  (Saint-Émilion)

description: 92–94. Barrel sample. This wine has weight and tannins that offer good structure, but it's the ripe, rich fruit that dominates. It's powerful and complex, and likely to age well.
title: Château Figeac 2012 Barrel Sample  (Saint-Émilion)

description: 92–94. Barrel sample. This concentrated wine is packed with new wood as well as dark chocolate flavors. The palate is dense with bitter, extracted coffee flavors, but balanced by lively, lingering acidity.
title: Château Grand Corbin-Despagne 2012 Barrel Sample  (Saint-Émilion)

description: 92–94. Barrel sample. Tight, firm and mineral in style, this wine is dark with expressive tannins cast over black fruits. As always, the wine is a complex expression of its fine terroir.
title: Les Astéries 2012 Barrel Sample  (Saint-Émilion)

description: 92–94. Barrel sample. This dense, extracted wine has dark coffee and bitter chocolate flavors that are followed by wood and tannins. The fruit is still obscured, and may need many years for its dark character to emerge.
title: Château Canon 2012 Barrel Sample  (Saint-Émilion)

description: 92–94. Barrel sample. This is a fruity wine, dominated by delicious black currant flavors. It has a firm background of fine, complex tannins and a fragrant, lingering aftertaste.
title: Château Faugères 2012 Barrel Sample  (Saint-Émilion)

description: 92–94. Barrel sample. Newly promoted to Premier Grand Cru Classé in 2012, this is a fine, concentrated wine, showing great style. It has weight and a delicious juiciness that is sustained by firm, dry tannins. Already a beautiful wine.
title: Château Larcis Ducasse 2012 Barrel Sample  (Saint-Émilion)

description: 92–94. Barrel sample. The only Grand Cru Classé on the sandy plain of Saint-Emilion, Monbousquet is producing great wines thanks to huge investments by owner Gerard Perse. This Merlot-dominated blend is ripe, spicy, rich and open.
title: Château Monbousquet 2012 Barrel Sample  (Saint-Émilion)

description: 92–94. Barrel sample. This is a ripe and smoky wine with lively acidity. It also has dense black fruits and a firmly tannic character that demands aging. Solid in texture, it's touched by notes of licorice with a bitter edge.
title: Château Providence 2012 Barrel Sample  (Pomerol)

description: 91–93. Barrel sample. The second wine of Château Valandraud is richly powered by spice from new wood and delicate acidity. It's smooth—showing opulent tannins—and attractive freshness.
title: Château Valandraud 2012 Virginie de Valandraud Barrel Sample  (Saint-Émilion)

description: 91–93. Barrel sample. This solid wine is dark with tannins and a dense, extracted texture. The palate is weighty with an intensely dry core and a serious, mineral character. For long-term aging.
title: Château Dassault 2012 Barrel Sample  (Saint-Émilion)

description: 91–93. Barrel sample. Owner Alain Moueix is a standard bearer for biodynamics in Bordeaux. This is a rich and opulent wine, boasting ripe black currants and fragrant fruits. A very pure and forward wine.
title: Château Fonroque 2012 Barrel Sample  (Saint-Émilion)

description: 91–93. Barrel sample. Firm tannins guard the ripe blackberry flavors on this rich wine. Spice and sweet tannins add to the intensity.
title: Château la Pointe 2012 Barrel Sample  (Pomerol)

description: 91–93. Barrel sample. This is a solid wine showing chunky richness that chimes with the black fruit of the vintage. It's full and ripe, but still shines with fresh fruit character.
title: Château Nenin 2012 Barrel Sample  (Pomerol)

description: 91–93. Barrel sample. A ripe and fruity wine, this exhibits an well-structured balance of acidity and sweet tannins. It has weight, richness, and a fine fruitiness.
title: Château Petit-Village 2012 Barrel Sample  (Pomerol)

description: 91–93. Barrel sample. Surrounded by the city of Libourne, Quinault l'Enclos has produced a Merlot-dominated wine that's ripe and soft on the palate. There's a good sense of structure, balancing fresh black-currant flavors with delicious acidity.
title: Château Quinault L'Enclos 2012 Barrel Sample  (Saint-Émilion)

description: 91–93. Barrel sample. A fine, dense, opulent wine with a great sense of structure. It's dark and solid with tannins that are dense, dusty and brooding. It's likely to age well.
title: Le Carré 2012 Barrel Sample  (Saint-Émilion)

description: 91–93. Barrel sample. The second wine of Cheval Blanc is surprisingly soft and ripe—full of blackberry fruits—with delicious acidity and a lingering black-currant aftertaste.
title: Le Petit Cheval 2012 Barrel Sample  (Saint-Émilion)

description: Big tannins and impressive fruits are the hallmarks of this impressive wine. It is also subtle, not showing all its flavors at once, hiding beneath tannins and structure. For this fruity vintage, it shows a strong sense of direct, solid structure, only allowing the strong black plum and berry flavors to come through slowly. It is for the long haul, so don't drink before 2022, even better later.
title: Château Latour 2011  Pauillac

description: Great swathes of fruit cross the tannic core in this impressive wine. Hints of wood aging peek out from beneath the sumptuous richness and spice. It is ripe, dense and obviously set for long aging. Drink from 2018.
title: Château Léoville Barton 2011  Saint-Julien

description: Dense and opulent, this is a fine, ripe wine. There is great weight here, along with flavors of nutmeg and white peach. Acidity and a firm, youthful texture all promise aging. Drink this wine from 2017.
title: Château Lafaurie-Peyraguey 2010  Sauternes

description: This is a luxurious wine that's opulently rich. Ripe black fruits dominate, lending fullness to the firm structure in the backdrop. It's a wine with great potential, density and weight. Touches of chocolate and licorice combine with flavors of dark plum, toast and spice. Drink from 2018.
title: Château Lynch-Bages 2011  Pauillac

description: This is a very spicy wine with weight, great depth of flavor and concentration. Fine acidity cuts through the core, balancing sweetness and adding freshness to flavors of wild thyme-honey and orange marmalade. Drink the wine from 2017.
title: Château Coutet 2010  Barsac

description: Initially dry and tannic, the wine shows dark fruits with blueberry flavors, smoke and spice. It is rich and dense, already with the fruit right up front. Drink now or better age.
title: Château Lacombe Noaillac 2009  Médoc

description: The high proportion of Sémillon in the blend gives the wine an extra richness. That rounds out the more herbaceous character and brings in ripe peach and kiwi flavors. It's already a lively, drinkable wine, but should only improve over another few months.
title: Château l'Avocat 2010  Graves

description: Rounded and sweet wine, its tannins buried in the rich blackberry fruits. It is dominated by its fruity character, although there is a chunky texture that gives a firm mouthfeel. Ready to drink in a year.
title: Château le Pape 2008 L'Excellence  (Pessac-Léognan)

description: On the lean side, with a layered concentrated wood structure. The wine has weight along with dryness, although the fruit is harder to discern.
title: Château Siran 2009  Margaux

description: Big, structured tannins lie over the ripe fruit. The wine has a dense character, the young tannins dominant. Given a year, the fine fruit will come through to give a sweeter blackberry character.
title: Château Bertinerie 2010  Blaye Côtes de Bordeaux

description: While the wine does have considerable tannins, it also has the ripe Merlot fruit to support it. Good acidity, black currant fruits, smoky wood, all the elements are there. It will always be firm, but should mature well.
title: Château Rocher-Bonregard 2008  Pomerol

description: This is an open fruity wine with attractive red berries and concentrated tannins. It is developing well into a ripe perfumed wine that will be ready to drink from 2017.
title: Château Pey La Tour 2014  Bordeaux

description: This is a fresh and juicy organic wine with attractive acidity and just the right balance of tannins. Drink this wine soon, certainly from 2018.
title: Château Roland-La-Garde 2014 Tradition  (Blaye Côtes de Bordeaux)

description: While the wine is dry at this young stage, it has fine potential. Generous fruits and firm tannins give it richness and a juicy character. Drink the wine from 2018.
title: Château Séguin 2014  Blaye Côtes de Bordeaux

description: Fresh and fragrant, this is a lively, bright and tangy wine. With crisp acidity and raspberry fruit that is twisted with orange peel it is ready to drink.
title: Château de Blaignac 2015 Rosé (Bordeaux Rosé)

description: High spice and toast flavors dominate this wine. The wood use is masking the fruit, probably too enthusiastically. It should soften, although not enough.
title: Château La Bourrée 2014  Castillon Côtes de Bordeaux

description: The wine has red fruits and tannins along with acidity. The 25-year old vines have produced a rich wine that is all about fruit and acidity. Drink from 2018.
title: Château Motte Maucourt 2015  Bordeaux Supérieur

description: This is a crisp, fresh wine with red-currant fruits and light tannins from the Alliance Bourg co-op. It is juicy and fruity, likely to develop quickly to give a light, bright wine.
title: Closerie du Bailli 2014 Tradition  (Blaye Côtes de Bordeaux)

description: Impressive dusty tannins offer a structured counterpoint to the deliciously ripe fruits and sweet berry flavors that stand out in this wine. It has great concentration as well, a powerhouse of firm structure and gorgeous fruit.
title: Château Bouscaut 2009  Pessac-Léognan

description: An obviously wood aged wine, with burnt toast and spice dominant at this young stage. Happily, there is enough black currant fruit and fruity acidity underneath to support this overdose of wood. Give it time to fully integrate, and drink from 2016.
title: Château Bois Cardon 2011  Médoc

description: A rich and rounded wine whose tannins are well buried in the ripe blackberry fruits. It's a dark wine, solidly dry at the core with great swathes of juicy fruit around. It's almost ready to drink so try it out in 2014.
title: Château de Paillet-Quancard 2010  Cadillac Côtes de Bordeaux

description: A dry style of wine that only slowly reveals its juicy character to bring out a warmer, richer side. It also does show considerable toast and spiciness along with firm tannins all of which still need to fully integrate. So don't drink until 2016.
title: Château d'Uza 2010  Graves

description: A fresh, fruity and sophisticated wine, this offers acidity balanced by dry tannins. It has juicy black currant fruits, hints of mint and a bright, smoky feel. The wine will obviously age, so drink from 2016.
title: Château Arnaud 2011  Saint-Estèphe

description: A well-balanced wine that both shows an herbaceous character and a ripe, full flavor that brings in yellow fruits and green plums. It has a well-judged hint of spice from wood aging to give extra richness. Drink from 2013.
title: Château Magnol 2012 Les Charmes de Magnol  (Bordeaux Blanc)

description: Despite coming from a universally hailed vintage, this generic Bordeaux is still weedy, herbal and lean. But it also has decent cassis and cherry fruit, some tasty vanilla and cinnamon notes from oak aging, and a tart, dry finish. It's light, but it hasn't been dumbed down for the mass market.
title: Malesan 2000 Rouge  (Bordeaux)

description: Certified French organic with this vintage, this 100% Merlot is ripe, full-bodied and already showing its potential richness. Terroir-driven black fruits and generous tannins give a warm character to the wine that is then backed by black fruits and final acidity. This is a generous wine from the Verdier family, ready to age. Drink from 2018.
title: Château Brethous 2012  Cadillac Côtes de Bordeaux

description: Still firm, this has dark chocolate and polished wood flavors, as well as dark plums and berries. With the tight acidity, it's a wine for aging, dark and concentrated for the future. Drink from 2018.
title: Château Bel-Air Ortet 2011  Saint-Estèphe

description: With wood aging, the Sauvignon Blanc has developed vanilla flavors that are currently smothering the fruit. Ginger dominates, along with black pepper, giving a wine that has a tangy texture just hinting at juicy white fruits. Age until 2016.
title: Château la Baronnerie 2012 Grand Vin  (Blaye Côtes de Bordeaux)

description: Simple and fruity, it has attractive red fruits, soft tannins and just the right amount of acidity. It will develop relatively quickly, so drink from 2015.
title: Château Lamothe-Vincent 2012  Bordeaux

description: Obviously wood aged, with spice and toast flavors, this is a soft, black currant and berry flavored wine. It has light tannins that are already integrating with the fruit. Drink now and until 2018.
title: Château Loyasson 2012  Bordeaux

description: Dry and tannic, this totally structured wine has weight. However the fruit element has vanished leaving a dense wine, very firm and just given brightness by acidity. Drink now.
title: Château Thuron 2005 Tradition  (Bordeaux Supérieur)

description: A bold and ripe wine, it's full of black currant fruits accompanied by wood and acidity. It's obviously young and will soften and calm into a smooth and rich wine. The finish brings out a dry character. Drink from 2017.
title: Château Cayla 2012  Cadillac Côtes de Bordeaux

description: With black currant fruits dominant, this is an inherently fruity wine. The juicy feel makes the wine seem light, not yet quite connecting between fruit and a very dry tannic texture. Give it until 2016.
title: Château des Lattes 2011  Médoc

description: A soft, lightly tropical wine with attractive acidity and grapefruit as well as pineapple flavors. It is crisp, very fruity and ready to drink.
title: Château Lamothe-Vincent 2012  Bordeaux Blanc

description: There is a tantalizing hint of perfume in this 85% Sauvignon Blanc and 15% Muscadelle blend that makes the wine both ripe and textured. With a touch of pepper as well as crisp apple, the wine is rich and ready to drink.
title: Château les Bertrands 2015 Cuvée Tradition  (Blaye Côtes de Bordeaux)

description: The wine has fine potential. While the wood flavors are dominant, as it develops the ripe red-berry flavors that are there will fill out and bring their fruity acidity along. It is going to be ready to drink from 2017.
title: Château Mission Saint Vincent 2014  Bordeaux

description: Bridgitte and her husband Eric took over her family property in 2009, in 2014 producing a spicy and fruity wine. It has fine tannins and sweet red-berry fruit. The acidity and the balance are just right. Drink this attractive wine from 2018. They donate one percent of their turnover to an environmental charity and are (they say) one of only two wineries in the world who are members of “1% for the planet.”
title: Château Guibeau 2014  Castillon Côtes de Bordeaux

description: A ripe wine that has red-berry fruits, slices of black plum and a full deck of tannins. It is concentrated and ripe, full of fruit and equally full of structure. Let the two soften and drink from 2018.
title: Château Tayet 2014 Cuvée Prestige  (Bordeaux Supérieur)

description: A crisp, red-fruit flavored wine that has sufficient structure to give it shape and density. It is fruity with spice from the wood aging. Acidity at the end keeps it fresh and bright. Drink from 2017.
title: Château Timberlay 2014  Bordeaux Supérieur

description: This is an attractive, ripe and fruity wine made from Merlot and Cabernet Franc vines. With soft tannins, it is juicy and crisp. There is a tight edge that will soften to produce a generous wine. Yorick and Sophie Lavaud's 13 acres are Agrocert-certified organic. Drink from 2019.
title: Domaine Les Carmels 2014 Les Vendanges  (Cadillac Côtes de Bordeaux)

description: Named after the Swedish royal family, this estate produces accessible wines. In 2013, the style continues with a wine that is fruity and softly tannic, emphasizing ripe blackberry flavors rather than too much structure. It will be ready to drink from 2018.
title: Château Bernadotte 2013  Haut-Médoc

description: Located just south of Margaux, this estate has produced an attractive wine that plays on the fruit of the vintage. The fresh black-currant character is enhanced by light flavors of wood aging. It will age for a few years, so drink from 2018.
title: Château Cambon la Pelousse 2013  Haut-Médoc

description: Situated at the western end of the Pauillac plateau, this estate has produced a fresh and fruity wine that takes advantage of the year's black-currant flavors and doesn't have too much of a tannic structure. It will develop more and will be best from 2018.
title: Château Devise d'Ardilley 2013  Haut-Médoc

description: In this wine, the initial extracted flavors have softened quickly to give an open, drinkable, fruity character. Blackberry fruits and acidity go with light tannins. It will be ready soon. Drink from 2018.
title: Château Grand-Puy Ducasse 2013  Pauillac

description: In this Merlot-dominated wine, powerful wood flavors still show strongly against the fresh, juicy black-currant and berry fruits. As this combination ages, it will produce a ripe, full and always fruity wine with strong final acidity. Drink from 2018.
title: Château la Croix Romane 2012  Lalande de Pomerol

description: With structure and fruit working well together, this ripe wine has good potential. It is still developing, with firm wood flavors as well as attractive acidity. Give it time and drink from 2019. The Philippe Starck-designed winery went into production in 2015; it's owned by developer Groupe Pichet.
title: Château Les Carmes Haut-Brion 2013  Pessac-Léognan

description: This wine is ripe, with dusty tannins and blackberry fruits. It is balanced, fresh with acidity while keeping a good layer of fruitiness. The tannins and structure will allow it to age although it should develop quickly. Drink from 2017.
title: Château Maurac 2013  Haut-Médoc

description: This is a young and structured wine. Juicy black-currant flavors are still firmly backed up by tannins. Produced from old vines, it is dense although also with a fresh acidity that is already attractive. Drink from 2017.
title: Château Nardou 2012  Francs Côtes de Bordeaux

description: The top wine from this estate is this release from the powerful 2010 vintage. It has a dense structure, dark tannins and rich texture. Ripe black plum and dark fig flavors along with the dry core means the wine is still developing. Drink from 2017.
title: Château Rousset-Caillau 2010 Cuvée Jean  (Bordeaux Supérieur)

description: This is already a delicious wine in the balanced Saint-Julien style. Smooth and ripe, it is fruity with a structure that promises medium-term aging. The rich aftertaste shows both the promise and the pleasure of the wine. Drink from 2020.
title: Château Beychevelle 2014  Saint-Julien

description: This Peyronie family cru bourgeois estate is one of the rare properties in Pauillac that is not a classified growth. That alone makes it a good value. The wine comes from vines close to Pichon Baron in the south of the appellation. This juicy black-currant flavored wine is still very young, full of its tannins and dark character. With its structure and acidity, the wine will age well. Drink from 2022.
title: Château Fonbadet 2014  Pauillac

description: Tight and crisply fruity, this wine comes from a property in the Vignobles Signé family since 1649. With a strong herbal character, it is refreshing and already delicious, bright and lively. Plenty of acidity keeps this wine packed with forward fruit. Drink now.
title: Château Petit Moulin 2016  Bordeaux Blanc

description: Unusually set in a Burgundy-shape bottle rather than the normal Bordeaux bottle, this low-sulfur wine comes from a biodynamic vineyard. It is ripe with yellow fruits and rich acidity. It has a rounded character, with an edge of minerality and light spice. This delicious wine is ready to drink.
title: Chateau Peybonhomme-les-Tours 2015 Le Blanc Bonhomme  (Blaye Côtes de Bordeaux)

description: Well-balanced, ripe and toasty, it has all the elements in the right place. It's rich, packed with spice, apricot and red apple fruits given a creamy texture by the wood aging. The wine could benefit by waiting until 2015, although it's delicious now.
title: Château Bois de Rolland 2013  Bordeaux Blanc

description: Steely and tight, it has intense acidity, a dense texture and powerful green apple and grapefruit flavors. The wine is still finding its way, suggesting considerable potential for long-term aging. Drink from 2018.
title: Château Latour-Martillac 2012  Pessac-Léognan

description: This tastes lean, the fruit buried deep beneath hard, dry fruit tannins. There is an old style austerity here that demands food. The final juicy acidity does leave a welcome relief.
title: Château d'Arcins 2006  Haut-Médoc

description: Grands Terroirs is a brand created by Cahors-based Château le Cèdre. This bow to its Bordeaux neighbor has produced a Pauillac that is classic, rich, structured and packed with blackberry fruit. It is still on the young side, although drinkable, a wine that will open and round in the next two years.
title: Grands Terroirs de France 2010  Pauillac

description: Made with the involvement of Hubert de Bouärd of Château Angélus as consultant, this wine is superrich and packed with dark fruit. Despite its high alcohol for a Bordeaux, it is balanced and fruity with tannins the are comfortably cushioned by the fruit and freshened by acidity. Drink from 2021.
title: Château de Francs 2014 Les Cerisiers  (Francs Côtes de Bordeaux)

description: A ripe rich style of wine, with swathes of black-currant fruits and cushioned tannins, this second wine of Duhart-Milon is full bodied and deliciously rich. The fruit carries the wine with its smooth tannins. Drink from 2022.
title: Château Duhart-Milon 2014 Moulin de Duhart  (Pauillac)

description: Produced by the team from classed growth Château Giscours, this is a successfully ripe wine with smoothly integrated tannins. Cushioned by the ripe fruit, the structure is concentrated and impressive. Drink this wine from 2022.
title: Château Duthil 2014  Haut-Médoc

description: With 135 acres under vine, this is a large estate. The high percentage of Merlot in the blend gives this rich wine its ripe blackberry smoky fruits. It is juicy and really fruity with just enough tannin to give the wine shape. Drink this wine from 2020.
title: Château Greysac 2014  Médoc

description: This is a small property under the same ownership as Château du Cartillon in the Haut-Médoc. The wine is ripe, juicy and with delicious blackberry fruits. It has a dark core of tannins ready to push the wine forward as it ages. It will certainly need time, so wait until 2021.
title: Château la Fortune 2014  Margaux

description: This 55% Cabernet Sauvignon and 45% Merlot blend comes from an estate just north of Saint-Estèphe. It reflects the structure and density of that appellation. Bold, ripe and fruity, it will age well. Drink from 2020.
title: Château Maurac 2014  Haut-Médoc

description: Located in Soussans to the north of the village of Margaux, the estate is owned by the Luze family. This is a fine wine, full of black fruits and firm tannins. It also has a softer perfumed side that is typical of Margaux. With this combination and the ripe berry fruits, the wine is sure to age well. Drink from 2021.
title: Château Paveil de Luze 2014  Margaux

description: This is a structured wine that has both firm tannins and ripe black plum fruits. It is concentrated and serious, the wood aging and the fruit tannins giving a lift and richness to the spicy fruit. The estate, dating to the 17th century, has 96 acres. Drink from 2021.
title: Château Sénéjac 2014  Haut-Médoc

description: From a small parcel of land that is not designated as classed growth (rare in Pauillac), this is a richly satisfying wine. It is full of complex tannins as well as juicy red-berry fruits. There is also structure to give it the chance to age. Drink this wine with its delicious potential from 2022.
title: Domaine de Saint-Guirons 2014  Pauillac

description: This serious wine is beginning to mature. Its spicy wood and mint flavors are now integrating with the rich structure. The finish is bright in a final burst of fruit. Drink from 2018.
title: Barton & Guestier 2012 Thomas Barton Réserve Privée  (Médoc)

description: While this wine has obviously seen plenty of wood aging, it's also full of dark blackberry fruit. Together, those qualities give density and structure, with acidity and fruitiness to match. Drink from 2021.
title: Château de Marsan 2015  Cadillac Côtes de Bordeaux

description: This is a fruity, juicy wine with swathes of black currant and berry flavors. The tannins give a smoky, spicy character and add to the sense of richness. Drink from 2020.
title: Château Fredignac 2015 La Favorite  (Blaye Côtes de Bordeaux)

description: This soft wine is still waiting for its intensity to come through. The acidity is there, as is ripe, honeyed fruit. Wait until 2022 to open it.
title: Château la Tour Blanche 2014 Charmilles  (Sauternes)

description: This wine is juicy and fruity, with generous tannins that support its ripe black fruit and balanced acidity. It has a smoky edge and will be ready to drink from 2020.
title: Château Le Cap 2015 Excellence  (Blaye Côtes de Bordeaux)

description: Mint aromas from new oak aging and spice and toast notes on the palate are part of this young, firm-structured wine. It 's powerful and dense, with great black fruit and acidity. A dry core of tannins indicates it will age. Drink from 2020.
title: Château le Grand Moulin 2015 Prélude No. 15  (Blaye Côtes de Bordeaux)
