description: A big and powerful wine, with tannins that are compact and dense. The dryness of the tannins go right to the core, surrounded by chocolate, sweet fruit and dark berry flavors. The wine is well structured, big and bold, with plenty of firmness promising aging.
title: Château Latour 2007  Pauillac

description: The wood element is important here, but it is based on a firm Cabernet Sauvignon structure, dry but rich tannins. The wine is a great success for the vintage, giving sweetness, ripe fruit that only shows light extraction, and dark plum and berry flavors. The feeling is of polished fruit and wood, rounded but always dense.
title: Château Mouton Rothschild 2007  Pauillac

description: For the year, this is a big wine, a success. New wood flavors and tannins blend well with the weight of fruit, depth of flavor and concentration. The wine has freshness to give with the structure, solid and intense. Certainly for aging—five years and more.
title: Château Léoville Las Cases 2007  Pauillac

description: This is a great success for the year, a wine that is dense, characterized by balance between sweet fruit and solid tannins. Spice from the finely judged wood aging adds extra complexity, as do the plum and berry fruits. For aging.
title: Château Léoville Barton 2007  Saint-Julien

description: Very herbaceous, Sauvignon Blanc-dominated wine. It has gooseberry flavors that are rounded out with pea and green bean tastes. A wine that can be drunk young and with seafood. Screwcap.
title: Château Briot 2010  Bordeaux Blanc

description: This wood-laden wine, spicy and toasty, also offers plenty of fruit weight, giving richness to the palate. Fresh black currants carry through to finish the wine with a lift.
title: Château Baracan 2010  Cadillac Côtes de Bordeaux

description: Powerful, ripe fruit, now beginning to open up, is the dominant character of this wine. It's full in the mouth, packed with black plums and ripe damsons and finished with soft tannins and a slight warmth.
title: Château Carignan 2009  Cadillac Côtes de Bordeaux

description: Dark tannins are sustained by juicy blackberry fruit flavors. While the wine is very dry and firm at this stage, it has a good, if long-term, future.
title: Château Côte Montpezat 2010 Cuvée Compostelle  (Castillon Côtes de Bordeaux)

description: A tough proposition at this young stage, but one which will definitely mature well, if slowly. There's power from tannins and fruit, both promising aging. Dark and dense, this hints at the juicy black fruits to come.
title: Château de Belcier 2010  Castillon Côtes de Bordeaux

description: While it has sufficient tannin, the wine also has a feeling of generous black currant and berry fruits. It's dry with considerable concentration, but it's future looks good, so keep for 5–6 years.
title: Château la Croix Saint-Pierre 2010 Grande Réserve  (Blaye Côtes de Bordeaux)

description: A firmly structured wine, dry to the core. The tannins feel extracted, giving some bitterness, yet the fruit shows potential juiciness. While it's always going to be a severe wine, it should be a great food partner.
title: Château Suau 2010  Cadillac Côtes de Bordeaux

description: From his Saint-Émilion base, Bertrand Ravache has created two brands: Leo (for Comte Léo de Malet Roquefort) and Les Hauts. This wine is all fruit, ripe and with a mineral edge. It has lots of acidity, lively fruitiness and hints of spice. Drink this fruity wine now.
title: Maison Bertrand Ravache 2016 Les Hauts de la Gaffelière  (Bordeaux Blanc)

description: This comes from a part of the Château de Cérons vineyard in Bordeaux's Graves region. It is a fruity crisp wine, light in texture and with attractive black-currant fruits. The wood aging has smoothed the wine, opening up the stalky texture. Drink from 2019.
title: Château Calvimont 2015  Graves

description: Stéphane Defraine's wine is rich with dark black fruits. The tannins with spice and a firm core give this wine density. It is already powerful and concentrated. It will be ready from 2018.
title: Château de Fontenille 2015  Bordeaux

description: This is a selection of the best parcels of the estate on the east Gironde bank across from Margaux. The wood aging (50% new wood) is apparent and gives a dusty texture to the wine without dominating it. It is a structured and ripe wine, showing the fruit of the vintage while also keeping solid tannins. Drink from 2019.
title: Château Grand-Maison 2012  Côtes de Bourg

description: Vines situated close to the fortified citadel of Blaye have produced this bright and shiny 2014. With its clear red-berry fruits, black currants and acidity, it is immediately attractive. The tannins, a great support to the fruit, promise some aging. Drink now, or, better yet, wait until 2018.
title: Château Haut Colombier 2014  Blaye Côtes de Bordeaux

description: This is finely balanced wine. It has poise and bright red fruits. Underneath that are both tannins and crisp acidity. The wine is never heavy—it's well structured, finishing with swathes of fruits. Drink from late 2017.
title: Château la Croix Blanche 2015  Bordeaux

description: This is balanced and ripe with some firm tannins and spice. The blackberry fruit has a stalky character with plenty of acidity as well as a dry core of tannin. The wine will develop well over the next few years to create a ripe and gently structured wine. Drink from 2019.
title: Château Léon 2014  Cadillac Côtes de Bordeaux

description: Balanced and fruity, this is a lightly structured wine. It has spice and ripe red-berry fruits in a warm strawberry character. Drink now.
title: Château Penin 2016  Bordeaux Clairet

description: Marked by its five months in wood, this warm, ripe and spicy wine is packed with rich black fruits and light generous tannins. It is a chunky wine, solid with its dry core while full and warm with its fruits. Drink now.
title: Cheval Quancard 2015 Réserve Merlot-Cabernet Sauvignon  (Bordeaux)

description: This wine is textured and fruity. Crisp citrus and red-currant fruits are layered with bright acidity and a refreshing aftertaste. The wine could do with a few more months before drinking, so wait until late 2016.
title: Château Cazeau 2015 Rosé (Bordeaux Rosé)

description: From the home estate of wine academic and guru Denis Dubourdieu, this tight, nervy wine has a mineral character rounded by wild-strawberry flavors. An attractive citrus tang gives it good bite at the end. Drink now.
title: Clos Floridène 2015 Le Rosé de Floridène Rosé (Bordeaux Rosé)

description: Austere and severe, this single-vineyard wine is very much a product of its limestone terroir. It has a mineral intensity that pushes through the tannins and black currant fruit, giving a powerful, dark character. Firm and structured, this is a wine for the long term.
title: Les Astéries 2010  Saint-Émilion

description: This second wine of Château Ausone is powerful, dominated by firmly tannic wood-aged Merlot. The wine also has an intense, juicy fruitiness and hints of spiced wood cake.
title: Château Ausone 2010 La Chapelle d'Ausone  (Saint-Émilion)

description: Both rich and dense, this wine shows the ripeness of the Merlot in 2010. It has firm fruit, touches of dark chocolate and licorice. With its concentration, this small vineyard is now in good form, producing ageworthy wines.
title: Château Providence 2010  Pomerol

description: This chunky, fruity wine is full bodied and rich. It shows all the structure and weight of the vintage allied to ripe black fruits and a dense texture edged with minerality. Still very firm and youthful, it will need many years to mature.
title: Clos Fourtet 2010  Saint-Émilion

description: Powerful, yet beautiful and smoothly structured. It has ripe, rich fruits, spice and sweet acidity. As a contrast, there is a dense core of tannins where the wine shows some severity and youth.
title: Château Latour 2010 Les Forts de Latour  (Pauillac)

description: Opulent and ripe, this is a powerful, wood-aged wine. It has a fine mix of tropical fruits, spice and vanilla. The richness is cut through with pink grapefruit to give a fine sense of poise and balance. Age for at least four years.
title: Château Pape Clément 2010  Pessac-Léognan

description: This is a ripe, red-fruit dominated wine with rich strawberry and cream flavors that are immediately attractive, With its balanced acidity, the wine is ready to drink now.
title: Château de Lardiley 2015 Rosé (Bordeaux Rosé)

description: A good tannic edge to this Gonfrier family wine gives it structure and places it in the food category. With plenty of acidity, it is also refreshing, textured at the end with a lift of zesty lemon.
title: Château de Marsan 2015 Rosé (Bordeaux Rosé)

description: Firm tannins and great freshness, with a touch of bitter chocolate as well as spice and tight tannins. This second wine of Lafite is attractively fruity, easily lifting the weight of tannins.
title: Château Lafite Rothschild 2008 Carruades de Lafite  (Pauillac)

description: This 100% Merlot wine from 30-year-old vines is one of the producer's limited productions. The wine is superrich in the plump, generous style. Its black-plum fruits give it the weight and ripeness as well as the smooth texture. There is a bite of pepper from the alcohol that spoils the opulent full aftertaste. Drink from 2018.
title: Bernard Magrez 2012 Egregore Cuvée d'Exception  (Côtes de Bourg)

description: With its high percentage of Merlot (65%), this wine is ripe and full-bodied. It has red-berry fruits that are rich and are already smoothing out. Concentrated and juicy, the wine is going to be ready to drink in the medium term. Drink from 2018.
title: Château du Cartillon 2014  Haut-Médoc

description: A parcel of limestone soil on this estate allows it to produce a small quantity of white wine. Vinified and aged in barrels, this is a soft ripe wine with light toast and lemon flavors. Textured and still young, this will age over the next few years. Drink from 2019.
title: Château Fourcas Dupré 2015 Grand Vin Blanc Sec  (Bordeaux Blanc)

description: This small estate is outside the main classified growth areas of Sauternes, close to the river Garonne. That makes it a wine that is accessible earlier, with plenty of honey and botrytis. It is already balancing out into a fine orange-marmalade-flavored wine with just the right acidity. Drink now.
title: Château Laribotte 2011  Sauternes

description: The second wine of classed growth Rauzan-Gassies in Margaux is ripe, soft with touches of licorice, wood aging and spice. It has attractive, forward red-berry flavors and the tannins of the 65% Cabernet Sauvignon in the blend. It is ready to drink.
title: Château Rauzan-Gassies 2011 Gassies  (Margaux)

description: Produced from young vines at Château Siaurac, the wine, dominated by 90% Merlot, is generous, approachable and ripe. It was matured in tank rather than wood, allowing the black fruits to come through strongly. The aftertaste brings out fruitiness as much as the gentle tannins.
title: Château Siaurac 2014 Plaisir de Siaurac  (Lalande de Pomerol)

description: Now mature, this is a softly fruity wine, its cherry and black currant fruits attractive rounded out by the gentle tannins. There is a dry core that comes with touches of wood and acidity. Not for aging.
title: Château de Belcier 2007  Côtes de Castillon

description: Although the wood aging shows strongly at the moment, there is enough weight of ripe black currant fruits to integrate as the wine matures. Then, it will be a firm-though-fruity wine, solid and chunky.
title: Château Roc Meynard 2011  Bordeaux Supérieur

description: The vast 300-acre estate of Château Bonnet in the heart of the Entre-deux-Mers produces a deliciously reliable, good value wine every year. This brand-new 2008 shows some lively yellow fruits as well as a strong citrus element. It has vibrantly fresh, pure fruit and is ready to drink now, but can age for a year. Screwcap.
title: Château Bonnet 2008  Entre-Deux-Mers

description: Dominating aromas of smoky new wood follow through to the toasty flavor that covers the fruit at this stage. But, like all 2009s, this is a rich wine that will balance out and show all of its opulence. That said, it will likely always be a firm, ageworthy wine, with the dark tannins always in evidence.
title: Domaine de Chevalier 2009  Pessac-Léognan

description: This vintage of Lascombes shows more restraint on oak than previous vintages. The result is a ripe wine, still showing some wood flavors although it is already beginning to balance these with the black fruits. It has an opulent style that is warm and generous. Drink from 2019.
title: Château Lascombes 2012  Margaux

description: A simple, youthful white, perfumed and spicy as well as crisply fruity. From the Entre-deux-Mers region, it is cool, clean, laden with green plums and white currant flavors. For aging over the next few months.
title: Château du Pin Franc 2012  Bordeaux Blanc

description: Going more for stalky tannins, this is a youthful, but also austere wine. It has perfumed wood along with hints of black currant tightly encased in a severe outer shell.
title: Château Terre Blanque 2011  Bordeaux

description: A bright, herbaceous wine that is full of citrus and grapefruit flavors. These go with a tangy character, crisp and hinting at black currants and more tropical fruit.
title: Château Laubès 2011  Bordeaux Blanc

description: A solid wine with firm tannins, this has structure as well as black-currant acidity. It still has a dry core although this will certainly soften over the next few months. It has the potential to be a ripe fruity wine from early 2018.
title: Maison Bouey 2015 Bordeaux By Boyd-Cantenac  (Bordeaux)

description: The rich fruit of this wine is supported by the ripe tannins. So blackberry flavors and acidity are given spice and a smoky character. The balance is already there. Drink from 2018.
title: Maison Hebrard 2015 Château Saint Seurin  (Bordeaux)

description: The wine made good use of wood, giving mint flavors while not overtaking the black-currant fruitiness. Structured behind the fruit, it is balanced with an attractive burst of acidity at the end. Drink from 2018.
title: Médeville Collection 2015 8 Generation  (Bordeaux)

description: The wine is ripe, rounded and with fine rich fruit. Its structure is balanced with the blackberry fruits, giving density as well as fine acidity. Drink this well-made wine from 2018.
title: Groupe Clinet 2015 Ronan by Clinet 100%  (Bordeaux)

description: This is a smoky wine, with ripe berry fruits and balanced wood flavors. The solid tannins lend structure and backbone to the palate, while the finish is rich. Drink from 2018.
title: Château Brande-Bergère 2015 Cuvée O'Byrne  (Bordeaux Supérieur)

description: The wine has a fine smoky character lying over the blackberry fruits. It has the potential to be rich with generous fruits and balanced tannins. The aftertaste is juicy and crisp.
title: Château de Macard 2015  Bordeaux Supérieur

description: Almost pure Merlot (95%), this wine is richly endowed with generous fruitiness as well as firm tannins. It's a young wine—all fruit and structure at the moment—and it needs to fill out. When it does, it is going to be a ripe generous wine. Drink from 2019.
title: Château Lanbersac 2014  Puisseguin Saint-Émilion

description: Some wood aging gives this wine its rich character. The tannins, black-currant fruits and good proportion (36%) of Cabernet Sauvignon in the blend all contribute to the wine's structure and ripeness. Drink from 2018.
title: Château le Calvaire 2014  Bordeaux Supérieur

description: Wood aromas and flavors are happily balanced by the ripe berry fruits. So the firm structure is lifted by juicy acidity and fruit to give a wine that will be spicy, fruity and succulent. Drink from 2018.
title: Château Merlet 2015  Bordeaux

description: The vineyard is in the heart of the Haut-Médoc, midway between Margaux and Saint-Julien. The wine is solid, dark and with plenty of firm tannins. At the same time, it has concentrated black fruits and a fine blend between black-currant acidity and ripe jammy fruitiness. Drink from 2020.
title: Château Beaumont 2014  Haut-Médoc

description: Almost equal proportions of Merlot and Cabernet Franc have given a beautifully perfumed wine. It has quite a structure for a second wine, although this is balanced with the intense black fruits. The touches of wood have given this wine its light spice flavor. Drink from 2023.
title: Château Cheval Blanc 2014 Le Petit Cheval  (Saint-Émilion)

description: Tangy and zesty, this is a crisp wine. It has tight acidity and a strongly citrus character. There are bright gooseberry and herbal flavors that show strongly. The downside is it is one-dimensional: all herbal fruit and crisp acidity. Drink from 2020.
title: Château Couhins-Lurton 2014  Pessac-Léognan

description: This is a finely perfumed wine with its dark tannins and juicy black-currant fruit. It has structure and a dense texture although this is filled with the bright acidity that gives the wine a lift. This will age well, so drink from 2021.
designation: La Chapelle de la Mission Haut-Brion
title: Château La Mission Haut-Brion 2014 La Chapelle de la Mission Haut-Brion  (Pessac-Léognan)

description: This is a ripe and tropical wine, complex with wood aging. It is warm, intensely rich and piled with mango and pineapple flavors. The acidity and crispness are well behind this smooth, creamy wine. Drink from 2022.
title: Château Pape Clément 2014  Pessac-Léognan

description: Named after the Pontac family which in the 18th century owned large swathes of Bordeaux and its vineyards, this estate is based around a former hunting lodge. The wine is ripe and full, finely structured and with tight still-young acidity. Drink from 2022.
title: Château Pontac Monplaisir 2014  Pessac-Léognan

description: With great acidity, this wine that comes from vines close to Château Pavie, is ripe with fine tannins and a generous structure. It is fruity with red-berry fruits and a crisp texture. The wine, with its tannins, will take time to develop. Drink from 2022.
title: Clos Badon-Thunevin 2014  Saint-Émilion

description: From vines situated on the plain below the Saint-Émilion slopes, this wine has firm tannins against a soft, fruity backdrop. Dominated by 80% Merlot, it's jammy and ripe, with plenty of red berry fruit and acidity on the finish. Drink from 2018.
title: Château Billeron Bouquey 2012 Calice  (Saint-Émilion)

description: This ripe and spicy wine shows blackberry fruit and balanced wood aging. From selected parcels, it's still young and will need time. Drink from 2019.
title: Château Grand Bourgeau 2016  Côtes de Bourg

description: The ripe fruit of the vintage is really apparent in this firm wine. Its tannins and spicy character are contrasted with balanced black currant fruit and acidity. It will need some time, so drink from 2019.
title: Château Haut-Gelineau 2015  Côtes de Bourg

description: With 24% Cabernet Franc, this is a perfumed wine packed with juicy fruit and a fine smoky character. It offers black currant flavors and youthful spiciness. Drink from 2019.
title: Château Haut la Pointe 2014  Côtes de Bourg

description: Spice and red berry aromas are followed by red currant fruit flavors, layers of tannins and juicy acidity. It has made the most of the ripe fruitiness of the vintage and will be ready to drink from 2019.
title: Château Haut la Pointe 2015  Blaye Côtes de Bordeaux

description: This Merlot-dominated blend is full of dense fruit, with a soft black currant flavor. A bite of tannin at the back gives structure and aging potential. Drink from 2019.
title: Château Haut Peyrefaure 2015  Blaye Côtes de Bordeaux

description: This is dark and firm, with sufficient fruit to promise a rich future. The wine has ample weight, a solid, dense core and a juicy outer layer. Good for 3–5 years.
title: Château Landat 2011  Haut-Médoc

description: This rich but tannic wine shows ripe fruitiness as well as dense structure. There is a good balance between juiciness and dryness in this wine, which is already developing well.
title: Château Moncabrier 2011  Bordeaux Supérieur

description: Using fruit that was sourced from a 12-acre property planted to Merlot, this wine is laden with wood. A burnt edge covers what will inevitably be attractive, ripe plum fruit. It has acidity on the finish, and its juicy element promises good things in 2–3 years.
title: Château Lamour 2010 Réserve  (Castillon Côtes de Bordeaux)

description: Soft, round and balanced, this ripe wine is ready to drink. It's led by the cherry and black currant flavors, with dryness that comes from the soft tannins.
title: Château Moulin de Beauséjour 2011  Bordeaux Supérieur

description: The aromas and flavors of new wood are dominant in this soft, ripe wine. It has opulent black-plum fruit that shows through the wood influence. A touch of smokiness adds spice.
title: Château Moulin de Canhaut 2009  Médoc

description: Smooth and modern in character, with toast and sweet-tasting fruit notes, this is a wine that characterizes the New World school of Bordeaux winemaking. It has extracted tannins and concentration, with a dark chocolate flavor. Aging will soften the extremes, so give it 3–4 years.
title: Château Moulin de Canhaut 2010  Médoc

description: Firm and dry, it shows red berry fruit that miss out on richness. That makes for a wine that is too tannic, as well as showing oakiness and a tight acidity. It will soften, so give it until 2017.
title: Château Carcanieux 2011  Médoc

description: While it is light for the structured 2010s, this wine has attractive red fruit flavors and soft tannins. With its gentle structure and good fruity acidity, it's ready soon. Drink from 2015.
title: Château de Cérons 2010  Graves

description: A firm and tannic wine, it is still developing. The dry structure and the smoky wood aging are dominant, giving a hard feel. It does have a juicy hint underneath, so the fruit will develop although tannins are going to remain prominent.
title: Château de Tourteyron 2011  Médoc

description: A juicy, fruity, soft wine, it has a gentle tannic character. Red berry flavors, soft acidity and fresh texture combine to give a light wine that will be ready to drink soon. Drink from 2015.
title: Château du Taillan 2011  Haut-Médoc

description: A stalky wine, it displays some juicy fruits alongside the dry wood flavors. It is balanced, with black currant juiciness along with a lightweight texture. Not for long aging, the wine should be drunk from 2016.
title: Château La Grange de Bessan 2011  Médoc

description: This wine falls firmly on the fruity side. It has red berry fruits, soft tannins and a bright acidity that gives lightness. Not for aging.
title: Château Plantier Rose 2011  Saint-Estèphe

description: This Château tends to release rich wines. The tannins and fruits are there, but they have been exaggerated with a hint of bitterness. In a year or two it will soften, but the harshness will remain.
title: Château Roullet 2009  Canon-Fronsac

description: Hard around the edges, this wine does have some fruit, but this is masked by the bitter chocolate and burnt tannins. Juiciness surfaces in the aftertaste, but almost as an afterthought.
title: Château Baston-Brillette 2011  Moulis-en-Médoc

description: A hard-edged wine, it's very firm and very dry. It is all structure, showing little in the way of fruit potential.
title: Château d'Arche 2011  Haut-Médoc

description: Layers of new wood dominate the aromas and flavor of this wine. They smother the fruit leaving a question mark over its future.
title: Château Lavillotte 2011  Saint-Estèphe

description: Wood flavors smother the fruit. It has spice, a burnt smokiness and a bitter-chocolate character. The wine does show some juiciness and fresh acidity at the end.
title: Château du Moulin Rouge 2011  Haut-Médoc

description: A jammy wine it has ripe red berry fruits, soft tannins and a red plum jelly flavor. It will age quickly, so drink from 2016.
title: Château la Fleur 2011  Montagne-Saint-Émilion

description: This estate wine of Belcier is rich and complex. It has great tannins as well as dark black fruits that give a ripe character. Juicy, fruity and still young, it has great potential. Drink from 2018.
title: Château de Belcier 2012  Castillon Côtes de Bordeaux

description: Owned by the Hessel family since the 15th century, this estate has produced a dense and solid Merlot-dominated wine. It is big and bold with ripe berry fruits and dark tannins. The black plum skin and berry flavors are concentrated and firm. It needs to age, so drink from 2018.
title: Château des Annereaux 2012  Lalande de Pomerol

description: This is a smooth, balanced wine that shows notes of ripe blackberry and new wood. There is a crisp edge from the currant flavor, and the acidity gives it freshness. Attractive and fruity, this is for aging over the next 3–4 years.
title: Château La Clare 2010  Médoc

description: Dominated by ripe Merlot, this rich wine has a juicy blackberry flavor and reveals the judicious use of wood. It's a wine that should be aged. The chateau is owned by the Delon family of Château Léoville las Cases.
title: Château Saint-Michel 2011  Bordeaux Supérieur

description: This is a lush wine that oozes with the superripe flavor of sweet blackberry. The firm tannins and dense structure act as a counterbalance and push the wine into a more structured sphere. The fruit quality and overall balance promise 4–5 years of aging.
title: Château de Roquebrune 2009 Cuvée Reine  (Lalande de Pomerol)

description: A rich and smooth wine, this is packed with black fruits that are touched with smoky tannins from the wood aging. It's full, fruity and structured on the palate. It will age over at least 5–6 years, but, with its rich texture, it will be drinkable soon.
title: Château Tour Saint-Vincent 2010  Médoc

description: A great mix of solid tannins and juicy fruit, this is a rich and structured wine, with the firm character of the year and deep blackberry flavor. It has weight and an edge of spice, finishing with acidity.
title: Château Vieux Robin 2010  Médoc

description: Ripe and smooth, this is rich with red berries. A touch of pepper accompanies a zesty texture that backs up the fruitiness. Drink now.
title: Château de Cornemps 2016 Rosé (Bordeaux Rosé)

description: This crisp wine has plenty of acidity as well as lively fruits. The structure and texture are light and lifted, with a clean aftertaste. Drink now.
title: Château Lary 2016  Bordeaux Blanc

description: This is a tight wine with acidity and a good future of crispness. Give this attractive wine a few months and its citrus fruit will show well. Drink from late 2017.
title: Château Laubes 2016  Bordeaux Blanc

description: This wine is smooth, soft and gently fruity, with a rounded texture that only hints at crispness. It's in an easy apéritif style.
title: Château Suau 2016 Rosé (Bordeaux Rosé)

description: Spicy and fruity, this light, balanced wine has easy, crisp fruit and bright acidity showing citrus and spiciness. It is a refreshing wine, ready to drink now.
title: Maison Bouey 2016 Château Baruaud  (Bordeaux Blanc)

description: This wine has a ripe texture, rich fruit and touches of spice. Full bodied and tangy, it's smooth, with a hint of caramel. Drink now.
title: Château de Belcier 2016 Fleurs de Belcier Rosé (Bordeaux Rosé)

description: This wine has a caramel edge that gives richness but also detracts from the fruit. It offers a smooth texture along with a spicy edge. Drink now.
title: Château de Lisennes 2016 7 Hectares Vin Bio Rosé (Bordeaux Rosé)

description: This vivid pink-colored wine, 50-50 Merlot and Cabernet Sauvignon, is soft, with gentle fruitiness and crisp edge. Acidity and a herbal edge add a more textured character. Drink now.
title: Château des Arnauds 2016 Les Caprices d'Anaïs Rosé (Bordeaux Rosé)

description: Soft and ripe, this caramel-flavored wine has hints of strawberries. Drink now.
title: Château Mémoires 2016 Rosé (Bordeaux Rosé)

description: Warm, soft-fruited wine, with fine ripe red berry fruits as well as a gentle tannic structure. There is an earthy Merlot edge to the blend, along with the more dry texture of Cabernet. For drinking next year.
title: Château Suau 2009  Cadillac

description: Almost black in color, this is an equally dense wine in the mouth. At this stage, the wood aging and dry tannins are very present, so it does need time to bring out the juicy potential of the black currant flavors and acidity. Drink from 2018.
title: Château de Belcier 2014 Château de Monrecueil  (Bordeaux Supérieur)

description: As with other wines produced by the Dulon family, this suffers from too much oak. Here it shows in the wood acidity, the burnt character and the bitter coffee flavors. It's a shame because somewhere under there is fruit. A year or two more will help, so wait until 2018.
title: Château du Vallier 2014  Côtes de Bordeaux

description: Attractively herbaceous, this is a crisp, light and bright wine. Tight green fruits and plenty of acidity give it a juicy character that makes it refreshing. Drink now. This is one of 15 Bordeaux chateaus by Crus and Domaines de France.
title: Château Mezain 2015  Bordeaux Blanc

description: 91-93 Barrel sample. Very ripe fruit aromas. The palate is almost velvet in texture, smooth and rich, fruits packed with black berries and sweet plums. A charming, delicious wine.
designation: Alter Ego de Château Palmer Barrel sample
title: Château Palmer 2009 Alter Ego de Château Palmer Barrel sample  (Margaux)

description: 90-92 Barrel sample. This is almost a third wine of Château Valandraud, rich, sweetly fruity, very ripe and spice. Delicious fruit.
title: Château Valandraud 2009 B de Valandraud Barrel sample  (Saint-Émilion)

description: 90-92 Barrel sample. Good ripe fruit, very dense with concentrated black chocolate and ripe fruits, but showing some alcohol burn.
title: Château Faugères 2009 Péby Faugères barrel sample  (Saint-Émilion)

description: 89-91 Barrel sample. Considerable freshness here, a wine that has ripe blackcurrant fruit, but very soft tannins.
designation: La Chapelle de Potensac Barrel sample
title: Château Potensac 2009 La Chapelle de Potensac Barrel sample  (Médoc)

description: 89-91 Barrel sample. All fresh blackberry juice with sweetness and power. The wine has richness, along with considerable charming freshness.
title: Château Tronquoy-Lalande 2009 Tronquoy Sainte-Anne Barrel sample  (Saint-Estèphe)

description: 89-91 Barrel sample. A rich wine, with soft, juicy tannins, some spice, the tannins dry at the center. Good structure, touch of wood.
designation: Le Clarence de Haut-Brion Barrel sample
title: Château Haut-Brion 2009 Le Clarence de Haut-Brion Barrel sample  (Pessac-Léognan)

description: 88-90 Barrel sample. Finely structured, a wine that boasts great fresh fruits, firm tannins and berry fruits. The wine is structured with considerable acidity.
designation: La Chapelle de la Mission Haut-Brion Barrel sample
title: Château La Mission Haut-Brion 2009 La Chapelle de la Mission Haut-Brion Barrel sample  (Pessac-Léognan)

description: 88-90 Barrel sample. The first release of a wine from young vines. It is charming, juicy and fresh, the fruit bright and lively.
title: Château Léoville Las Cases 2009 Le Petit Lion Barrel sample  (Saint-Julien)

description: 88-90 Barrel sample. Density with an important structure, this wine is concentrated, with fresh plum flavors. There is a slight edge of greenness, bringing out acidity.
title: Château Cheval Blanc 2009 Le Petit Cheval Barrel sample  (Saint-Émilion)

description: 88-90 Barrel sample. The smoothest of ripe fruit with an exuberance of wood spice. The wine has generous tannins, but the finish feels a little rustic.
title: Château Reysson 2009 Barrel sample  (Haut-Médoc)

description: A firm but sweet-hearted wine, packed with juicy black fruits that balance the acidity and tannins. It has weight, good depth of flavor and a chance to age well.
title: Château Rollan de By 2008  Médoc

description: Dominated by wood, this toasty wine is just beginning to hint at blackberry and cherry flavors. It will develop well over the next five years, as the wood softens into the juicy fruit.
title: Château Haut Condissas 2008 Prestige  (Médoc)

description: An unusual blend, with a high proportion of Petit Verdot, this wine relies on its dense tannins as much as its berry fruits to provide punch. It has concentration, as well as some dry bitterness, the acidity continuing right to the end.
title: Château Tour Seran 2008  Médoc

description: A lean wine, well-made to be sure, but lacking in concentration. The surface has attractive, fresh red-currant flavors, laced with acidity. Drink over the next 2-3 years.
title: Château La Clare 2008  Médoc

description: The wine feels very dense, juicy, dark and concentrated. It has a huge feel to it, a powerful wine that will need several years to fully soften and round it. And, At 15.5% alcohol, this is way too heavy for a Bordeaux.
title: Château Cantin 2010  Saint-Émilion

description: The second wine of Château Chauvin is a structured, perfumed wine with its high proportion of Cabernet Franc giving much of its potential richness and spice. The tannins are solid and will always show well as an integral part of this complex wine.
title: Château Chauvin 2011 Vieux Château Chauvin  (Saint-Émilion)

description: Ripe and solid, this has dense tannins and a superstructure of opulent red-berry and black currant fruits. The wine is layered with coffee, wood-aging influence and a firm finish. It's big and has great potential.
title: Château Carbonnieux 2009  Pessac-Léognan

description: So opulent and open, this is a seductively ripe wine, beautifully layering its sweet red-berry fruits, complex ripe tannins and rounded structure. It is still Bordeaux in its texture, but it is certainly very New World in its rich density.
title: Château de Fieuzal 2009  Pessac-Léognan

description: Potentially an aromatic wine that will develop a rich, velvety character. At this young stage, the fruit is dominated by firm tannins that sit at the heart of the wine. It has all the density for a good development, aging over 5–10 years.
title: Château la Bessane 2008  Margaux

description: A gold-colored wine. The palate has intense freshness as well as ripe apricot and orange zest flavors. The acidity cuts through the intense richness, leaving a wine that needs time to fully integrate, and then many more years to mature.
title: Château Guiraud 2007  Sauternes

description: Packed with botrytis, this is a wine whose sweetness is suppressed by richness. Flavors of bitter oranges and white figs go with the intense core of botrytis, followed by a touch of bright acidity. This is a wine whose journey is just beginning.
title: Château Lafaurie-Peyraguey 2007  Sauternes

description: A beautifully ripe wine, layering all the dense botrytis of the vintage with freshest acidity. It has weight, the texture of grainy honey, ripe yellow fruits, mango and orange zest. Impressive and certainly for aging.
title: Château Sigalas Rabaud 2007  Sauternes

description: There is a farmyard quality to the aromas, but the wine itself shows a finely structured character that offers a linear, herbaceous view. The wine has considerable aging potential, bringing out an enticing citrus character.
title: Château Couhins-Lurton 2009  Pessac-Léognan

description: Mint and dark black fruit aromas lead to an elegant wine. It has solid tannins balanced by an open fruity character. The acids, tannins and touches of spice promise aging for at least another 4–5 years.
title: Château de France 2006  Pessac-Léognan

description: Already the structure is beginning to make way for ripe plum and damson fruits. With its firm structure, this is a complex and concentrated wine that will need to age over at least four years.
title: Château Haut Bellevue 2010  Moulis-en-Médoc

description: This is a limited production wine—a rich and firmly tannic. It has weight and density, backed plum skin and blackberry notes. It's all wrapped in a concentrated, structured package. Age for at least 4 years.
title: Château Haut-Goujon 2010 La Fleur du Barril  (Montagne-Saint-Émilion)

description: This is a concentrated wine that is structured and packed with red fruits and solid tannins. It feels weighty and rich; the juicy character is balanced by a firm, dry texture. For aging over several years.
title: Château Haut Mazerolles 2010 Cuvée Prestige  (Blaye Côtes de Bordeaux)

description: Wood aging has given this a spicy feel. It's rich, full bodied and textured with a citrus tang. The texture is creamy, with pear and grapefruit notes. Age for another two years.
title: Château Thieuley 2010 Cuvée Francis Courselle  (Bordeaux Blanc)

description: This Margaux is full of firm tannins that parallel the fragrant blackberry and black plum touches. It has a dense structure, very much in line with the year, while the finish is juicy and fruity.
title: Barton & Guestier 2010  Margaux

description: This is an attractive, relatively light Sauternes. It has a fine botrytis character that's already well integrated with the orange peel and honey flavors. Not for aging; ready to drink.
title: Château Gravas 2010  Sauternes

description: Deliciously crisp, this wine expresses herbaceous fruit, with weight and richness. Full of lime, gooseberry and grapefruit flavors, this is a taut wine that's likely to soften.
title: Château la Grande Métaire 2011 Cuvée la Chapelle  (Entre-Deux-Mers)

description: Ripe and juicy, this shows red fruits and soft, broad tannins. The fruity concentration gives it a generous feel. Keep for 2–3 years, or drink sooner.
title: Château Lamothe-Vincent 2010  Bordeaux

description: Solid, concentrated and chunky, the dense black fruits surround a foursquare core of extracted dryness. Age for at least three years.
title: Château le Noble 2010  Bordeaux

description: Juicy fruit is present in this wine, with firm, extracted tannins. It needs time to show its potential black-currant and berry notes. Give it 3–4 years.
title: Château Turcaud 2010 Cuvée Majeure  (Bordeaux Supérieur)

description: Aromatic and herbaceous, this is a fresh red-currant- and citrus-flavored wine. With textured acidity and a bright, crisp character, it is developing well and it should be ready to drink in a few months.
title: Dourthe 2011 La Grande Cuvée  (Bordeaux Blanc)

description: This is a mineral, textured wine that has fine tannins and balanced ripe black fruits. It's dry, although with an undertow of richness, acidity and weight. It could age, so wait until 2017.
title: Château Doms 2011  Graves

description: Dominated by Merlot at 90%, this is a smooth, rich and generous wine. It does have a tannic core, but that is surrounded by these velvet, ripe berry fruits and opulent texture. The wine is developing well and should be drunk from 2016.
title: Château Jeandeman 2009 La Chêneraie  (Fronsac)

description: A firmly structured wine with sufficient fruit to sustain the structure. It is solid and chunky, with hints of mint to go with the black currant flavors. It's serious while also reflecting the fragrant fruits of 2010.
title: Château Mondésir 2010  Blaye Côtes de Bordeaux

description: This is soft, round and beautifully ripe with just a touch of perfume. A rich wine that is only lightly structured, juicy and forward.
title: Château Nenin 2010 Fugue de Nenin  (Pomerol)

description: This Jean-Pierre and Philippe Rivière label benefits from the ripeness of the vintage to bring out red plum and a rich structure. The acidity and tannins perfectly emphasize the generous fruitiness. Drink from 2018.
title: Château de Garros 2015  Bordeaux Supérieur

description: With a fine spicy character, the wine from this estate is richly endowed with blackberry fruits as well as a firmly tannic core. There is no wood aging but the fruit gives the wine an approachable character. Drink from 2018.
title: Château Haut Gaudin 2015  Bordeaux Supérieur

description: This is a perfumed juicy wine with attractive acidity and plenty of ripe berry fruits. It has light tannins, just enough to give the wine its shape and tannic edge. Drink from 2018.
title: Château Haut-La-Péreyre 2015  Bordeaux Supérieur

description: This is a fine fruity wine with young tannins that will soon integrate. Ripe with berry flavors and with attractive acidity, it will develop quickly and should be ready by 2018.
title: Château Jean Faux 2015 Sainte Radegonde  (Bordeaux Supérieur)

description: This is a concentrated wine with fine tannins and juicy black-plum fruits. It is densely textured, packed with great fruit and developing well. Drink from 2018.
title: Château La Jalgue 2015  Bordeaux

description: The wine is packed with fruit: blackberry and damson flavors that are given a great lift by the acidity. It has a spicy side to it, adding complexity and filling out the tannins. Drink this wine from 2018.
title: Château Laubes 2015  Bordeaux

description: The wine is structured while also juicy. Its red-berry fruits are in the process of coming together with the tannins to give a rich wine. It has plenty of acidity at the end to give a crisp aftertaste.
title: Château Panchille 2015 Cuvée Alix  (Bordeaux Supérieur)

description: This estate wine, originating from the vineyards that has been in the Queyrens family for more than 50 years, offers plenty of fruit here. The taste laces acidity and attractive black-currant flavors. There are tannins and a structure that will allow the wine to develop. Drink from 2018.
title: Château Pilet 2015  Bordeaux

description: This is a wine on the cusp of being mature. The red-berry flavors are dissipating into a secondary aromatic character. The tannins, though, are still there—very firm and showing no sign of budging. Wait and see, or decant before drinking. This is part of a single-parcel (lieu-dit)single-varietal range.
title: Les Vignerons de Tutiac 2012 Lieu-Dit Coudrat  (Blaye Côtes de Bordeaux)

description: A wine that is lean and angular, austere, the fruit dominated by very dry tannins. It misses weight with the licorice, meaty flavors and a hard-edged structure.
title: Château Ramafort 2007  Médoc

description: A proper second wine, it's developing well with black fruits, acidity and good texture. It has plenty of flavor depth while the tannins are firmly in the background. Drink from 2017.
title: Château Calon Ségur 2011 Marquis de Calon  (Saint-Estèphe)

description: Attractive, ripe and juicy, it has the tannic structure to support the full berry fruits, along with fine acidity. This is for medium-term aging, so drink from 2016.
title: Château Franc Mayne 2011  Saint-Émilion

description: This 20-acre vineyard produces a wine dominated by Merlot, lending the wine a smooth texture. The wine is rich with ripe plum flavors and only gentle tannins. It will age well over the medium-term, so drink from 2016.
title: Château Guitignan 2011  Moulis-en-Médoc

description: This wine, with its equal proportions of Merlot and Cabernet Sauvignon, is full of potential. With dark tannins and concentrated fruits, it's a big wine that needs years to show its underlying freshness. Drink from 2018.
title: Château Saint-Paul 2011  Haut-Médoc

description: This wine offers delicious acidity, crisp fruit and plenty of red berry flavors. It has a lively, perfumed aftertaste.
title: Château Roc de Minvielle 2014 Rosé (Bordeaux Rosé)

description: As its name, boisé, suggests this is a wood-aged white. That gives the wine richness and definite tastiness while keeping plenty of room for the freshest green and citrus fruits and crisp sliced apple. It should be kept a few months, so drink from 2016.
title: Maison Bouey 2014 Maison Blanche Boisé  (Bordeaux Blanc)

description: A large (for Saint-Émilion) estate of 93 acres has produced a dark wine that is layered with tight, dry tannins. The fruit is still buried under this tough exterior, although there are strong hints of the juicy black currant future. Drink from 2018.
title: Château Cantin 2012  Saint-Émilion

description: Firmly tannic, this tough wine shows signs of over-enthusiastic extraction. That gives a bitter character that will always leave the wine with a dry core. The black fruits skins give acidity and some final freshness. Drink from 2018.
title: Château de Belcier 2012 Les Armoiries de Belcier  (Castillon Côtes de Bordeaux)

description: Tight, bright and very crisp, this is a lively and fruity wine. Citrus fruit flavors compete happily with the red berries to give a bone-dry wine, light and fresh at the end.
title: Château Fonfroide 2014 Rosé (Bordeaux Rosé)

description: This smooth wine has a good balance between a dry core and black currant fruit. It has a fresh character, typical of the vintage, along with acidity and smokiness from the wood aging. It will not age long, drink from 2017.
title: Château Hourtin-Ducasse 2013  Haut-Médoc

description: There is an unusually high (40%) proportion of Sémillon in the blend, which offers the possibility of aging. Although this wine is fresh, lemony and tightly herbaceous now, it will become more rich and the flavors will deepen. Drink from the end of 2016.
title: Château les Pasquets 2014  Entre-Deux-Mers

description: This is a fruity wine, light and bright in character. It has acidity and black-currant crispness. The light tannins are just enough to give the wine shape. Drink now.
title: Château des Arras 2015  Bordeaux Supérieur

description: This wine, with its gentle wood aging and ripe fruits, is the more accessible early of the two wines made at the estate. It is full of ripe berry fruits, while having a background of firm tannins and a dusty texture. The wine should be ready from 2018.
title: Château Grand-Maison 2012 Cuvée Sélection  (Côtes de Bourg)

description: From vines in the heart of the Entre-deux-Mers, this 85% Merlot wine is rich with layers of young black fruit and spicy wood flavors. It is still a young, structured wine and needs time for the powerful tannins to soften. Drink from 2019.
title: Château Jean de Bel Air 2015  Bordeaux

description: The wine has some extraction that leaves a bitter edge. That needs to blow off to allow the underlying ripe blackberry fruit to come through. So wait until 2018.
title: Château Labatut 2015 Grande Réserve  (Bordeaux Supérieur)

description: With firm tannins as well as juicy black-currants, this is an attractive wine. It has plenty of acidity which is balanced by the ripe fruitiness. Drink from 2018.
title: Château Laronde Desormes 2015  Bordeaux Supérieur

description: The wine, with its juicy red fruits, has fine acidity as well as a core that has a dry tannin and mineral texture. It is structured and firm with the fruit still developing. Drink from 2020.
title: Château Magnan-Figeac 2014  Saint-Émilion

description: From its origins in the Middle Ages, this estate has always been a vineyard. This latest vintage released is fruity with wood aging still obvious in the toastiness and spice. But there is plenty of rich berry fruit to give this wine a good short-term potential. Drink from late 2018.
title: Château Maison Noble 2015 St Martin  (Bordeaux Supérieur)

description: This is a structured and balanced wine. It has spice along with tannins that are built on ripe red-fruits. This is a full-bodied wine that is made for food. Drink now.
title: Château Turcaud 2016  Bordeaux Clairet

description: This branded Bordeaux is packed both with fruit and with a firm structure. It has a dense texture and solid tannins although the generous fruit will allow it to age relatively quickly. Drink from 2018.
title: Fleur de Charme 2015  Bordeaux Supérieur

description: A smooth, beautifully rich wine with great swathes of ripe fruit. The wine is concentrated and dense, showing the best of the year with its fine, ripe fruits. Age for 3–4 years.
title: Château Nardou 2010  Francs Côtes de Bordeaux

description: The second wine of Ausone is powerful with plenty of firm tannins. At the same time, it is ripe, with softness from the fruit and light extraction. It is a very fine wine, delicious with its acidity and its black-currant fruitiness. Drink this wine from 2024.
title: Château Ausone 2014 La Chapelle d'Ausone  (Saint-Émilion)

description: This is a big wine in its breadth of flavors and structure. Powerful tannins give hints of the wood aging. The ripe black fruit is given a crisp edge by the acidity that is typical of the vintage. The wine will certainly age well. Drink from 2023.
title: Château Certan de May de Certan 2014  Pomerol
winery: Château Certan de May de Certan

description: From one of the major estates in Pessac-Léognan, this is a fine, stylish and tightly structured wine. It has spice and intense acidity to balance the dark tannins and black-currant fruit. It is going to need several years to really mature. The estate is owned by André Lurton who was influential in creating the Pessac-Léognan appellation. Drink from 2024.
title: Château la Louvière 2014  Pessac-Léognan

description: This rich wine has a good proportion (31%) of Cabernet Franc to give it a perfumed structured character. It is dense and with considerable tannins at this stage. By contrast, the fruit has enormous potential with rich blackberry and black-plum flavors. This chateau has made a considerable stride in this vintage. Drink from 2022.
title: Château Quintus 2014  Saint-Émilion

description: This is an exceptional vintage for La Croix. It has voluptuous fruits that emerge from the ripe dense tannins. They are balanced by intense acidity and a crisp edge. The wine, with its still stylish character, is one to age for a long time. Drink this very fine wine from 2025
title: La Croix de Beaucaillou 2014  Saint-Julien

description: Tight and concentrated, this is a very fine wine. Great acidity and great tannins go with the most intense fruit. Blackberry and black-cherry flavors power through this structured wine. There is also elegance and a fine sense of style. Drink from 2025.
title: Les Astéries 2014  Saint-Émilion

description: A ripe, smoky wine, full of sweet black currant fruits and stalky tannins. The wine is juicy, fruity, cut with acidity and with a dry core of tight tannins. It shows the beginnings of maturity.
title: Château de Fontenay 2005  Côtes de Castillon

description: A perfumed, finely structured wine, with firm, dusty tannins. The wood is well-balanced with acidity and some generous weight, finishing with black fruits and intense freshness.
title: Château la Gaffelière 2007  Saint-Émilion

description: Already the velvet texture is broadening out to give a wine that shows solid fruits, bright and sweet, never heavy, but with plenty of ripeness and polish. Inside this suave character, there is a core of tight tannins, promising medium-term aging.
title: Château Langoa Barton 2007  Saint-Julien

description: A wine that is dominated by wood at this stage in its development. But the structure and the fruit are all there, waiting to slot into place in the next 2–3 years. Spice and bright black berry flavors layer with final acidity.
title: Château Pape Clément 2007  Pessac-Léognan

description: Soft wine, the Merlot in the blend giving a round character to the texture. It is juicy, fruity, a gentle, mellow wine that seduces by its delicious ripe berry fruits. Its aging potential is there in the band of Cabernet tannins, but it's not a long-term wine.
title: Château Pichon Longueville Comtesse de Lalande 2007  Pauillac
winery: Château Pichon Longueville Comtesse de Lalande

description: Very modern and polished in style, this wine goes for the soft, juicy fruit characters. The tannins are sweet, equally soft, already delicious in character, finishing with smoky cranberry and black currant flavors.
title: Château Brane-Cantenac 2007  Margaux

description: This has really come on since the futures tastings in 2008. Today, the wine shows pedigree, the dusty tannins ripe, fitting well with the spice, acidity and soft, generous fruit. Concentration comes through from the solid final fruit flavors.
title: Château Labégorce Margaux 2007  Margaux

description: With its dusty tannins and bright fruits, this fully represents the vintage. It has a texture that is open, relatively gentle, powered by black currants and very accessible. The acidity gives a light lift at the end.
title: Château Lagrange 2007  Saint-Julien

description: Fresh berry fruits, light tannins and stalky black currants, sustained by tannins. It is juicy, the wood a mist in the bright fruit flavors. There is some aging potential, maybe 4–5 years.
title: Château Phélan-Ségur 2007  Saint-Estèphe

description: A packed wine, its ripe fruits are a warm pleasure. It has all the structure of the year but in fine measure, lending density and richness to the palate. It's a wine for aging; give it at least five years.
title: Château Gauthier 2010  Blaye Côtes de Bordeaux

description: There is tough concentration here that suggests a wine that needs aging; there's also fruit that hints at richness to come. A wine that has a good future.
title: Château Monbadon 2010  Castillon Côtes de Bordeaux

description: This is a soft wine, dense and ripe. Any tannins are covered by sweet blackberry fruit flavors. This has attractive spice, final juiciness and bright acidity. A wine for early drinking.
title: Château Mouton Rothschild 2010 Le Petit Mouton  (Pauillac)

description: This is a harmonious mix of firm, extracted tannins and dense fruit. It has a dark, hard edge at this youthful stage, suggesting this is always going to be a wine that is tough. At the same time, it has weight and richness to support the structure.
title: Château Puygueraud 2010  Francs Côtes de Bordeaux

description: A full, structured wine, showing attractive damson and blackberry flavors along with a strong element of wood aging. The wine is rich, its juicy Merlot character joined with final acidity.
title: Château Haut-Francarney 2010  Canon-Fronsac

description: This 19th-century chateau is situated on the plateau above the Garonne near Cadillac. A soft wine, it's lightly fruity and with a crisp edge. It offers attractive red-berry fruits and just the right acidity. Drink now.
title: Château Carignan 2016 Château Léon Rosé (Bordeaux Rosé)

description: This blend of 50-50 Merlot and Cabernet Sauvignon is lightly herbal, with a touch of attractive tannins. It's ripe but preserves a crisp edge to balance the caramel flavor. The wine is ready to drink.
title: Château Carignan 2016 L'Orangerie de Carignan Rosé (Bordeaux Rosé)

description: While this wine has high acidity, it also offers attractive fruitiness. It is light and bright, with a layer of spice and pepper. Drink the wine now.
title: Château d'Haurets 2016 Rosé (Bordeaux Rosé)

description: Pale in color, this crisp wine offers a touch of yeastiness that contrasts with the red-currant fruits. It has plenty of bright acidity as well as a tangy, zesty aftertaste.
title: Château Fonfroide 2016 Rosé (Bordeaux Rosé)

description: Lively and crisp, this wine offers a pure line of citrus fruit. Its acidity and herbal edge are right up front, refreshing and aromatic. The wine is ready to drink now.
title: Château Recougne 2016  Bordeaux Blanc

description: Brightly fruity, this blend with 85% Sauvignon Blanc goes for the tropical-fruit character of the grape. Attractive acidity and a zingy edge are balanced by ripe apricot and pineapple flavors. Drink from late 2017.
title: Château Roquefort 2016  Bordeaux Blanc

description: This is a crisp wine, almost tart. It needs to soften to allow the red-currant fruitiness to shine. It will be attractive after late summer 2017.
title: Maison Bouey 2016 Collection Baruaud Rosé (Bordeaux Rosé)

description: This fruity, crisp wine offers layers of acidity and bright fruit, with a refreshing burst of red currants. It's delicious and ready to drink now.
designation: Le Rosé Gourmand de la Maison Blanche
title: Maison Bouey 2016 Le Rosé Gourmand de la Maison Blanche Rosé (Bordeaux Rosé)

description: A ripe, smoky and still-tannic wine, this is solidly structured. A dense, dry core shows some sign of extraction although the blackberry fruits are developing well. As the wine ages, it will bring out the balance between acidity and structure. Drink from 2017. Owner Cyril Trias works with Alliance Bourg co-operative on his wines.
title: Château Chantemerle 2012  Blaye Côtes de Bordeaux

description: Full in the mouth, this ripe, spicy wine offers a fruit salad of flavors that are topped with some wood-aging flavors. Drink from 2016 for the wood to be fully integrated into the fruit. After the Jonck family's 350 years in South Africa's Western Cape, vineyard owner Johan Jonck and family decamped to Bordeaux in 2011. Consulting enologist is Eric Bardon.
title: Château Espérance 2014 Instinct  (Blaye Côtes de Bordeaux)

description: This second wine of Château Durfort-Vivens is ripe, firm and well structured. Beautiful ripe black currant and berry fruits are cut with intense acidity. From the great 2010 vintage, it is solid, dense and full of fruitiness as well as tannins. It still does need to age, so drink from 2017.
title: Château Durfort-Vivens 2010 Vivens  (Margaux)

description: At the eastern end of Saint-Emilion, this vineyard is close to Castillon. The wine has structure and density, with powerful tannins that are still filling out. Delicious, juicy black plum and damson flavors are going to be full and generous, while remaining fruity. Drink from 2018.
title: Château la Chapelle aux Moines 2012  Saint-Émilion

description: 91-93 There is a certain toughness her. The dense and firm character gives a solid, textured wine, packed with acidity. Foursquare and chunky.
title: Château Duhart-Milon 2010 Barrel sample  (Pauillac)

description: 91-93 Smoky acidity and juicy, very fresh fruit. The wine certainly has dry tannins, along with this delicious waft of black berry fruit juice.
designation: Barrel sample Le Clarence de Haut-Brion
title: Château Haut-Brion 2010 Barrel sample Le Clarence de Haut-Brion  (Pessac-Léognan)

description: 91-93 Ripe, soft fruit and tannins that come from fruit rather than wood. The acidity is a dominant factor, with great wafts of bright black currant fruits and final tannins.
title: Château Les Carmes Haut-Brion 2010 Barrel sample  (Pessac-Léognan)

description: 91-93 Delicious initial fruit is followed by dense swathes of tannin. Concentrated wine that has all the weight without any sign of bitterness. The aftertaste brings back the delicious opening.
title: Château Marquis de Terme 2010 Barrel sample  (Margaux)

description: 91-93 This is no longer a second wine, but a wine with its own portion of Ducru-Beaucaillou's vineyard. It is juicy, rich, without being overpowering. The acidity at the end is both very ripe and very fresh.
title: Croix de Beaucaillou 2010 Barrel sample  (Saint-Julien)

description: 91-93 Rich more than dry, the palate a very spicy character, the texture full, unctuous, but more than just sweet.
title: Château d'Arche 2010 Barrel sample  (Sauternes)

description: 91-93 Finely structured, richly juicy fruit, packed with ripe tannins and great swathes of rich blackberry. It is intense, as well as well integrated.
title: Château d'Armailhac 2010 Barrel sample  (Pauillac)

description: 91-93 Rich, the structure all a part of the ripe blackberry fruits, very dark in style. The wine is very ripe, still retaining elegance
title: Château Dutruch Grand Poujeaux 2010 Barrel sample  (Moulis-en-Médoc)

description: 91-93 Fresh, citrus and spicy pear flavors, a wine laced with acidity, a crisp texture and elegant bright aftertaste.
title: Château Haut-Bergey 2010 Barrel sample  (Pessac-Léognan)

description: 91-93 Firm while also rounded, very rich Merlot spice and blackberry character. There are hugely dense, extracted tannins, with a final dark fruit character.
title: Château le Bon Pasteur 2010 Barrel sample  (Pomerol)

description: 91-93 Very powerful spicy wine with rounded fruit despite the dense tannins. It has juicy acidity, finishing with a dark, dry aftertaste.
title: Château Quinault L'Enclos 2010 Barrel sample  (Saint-Émilion)

description: 91-93 The wine is tight, densely textured, very firm in character. It has considerable weight to go with the sweet fruit, very powerful.
title: Château Rauzan-Gassies 2010 Barrel sample  (Margaux)

description: 90-92 Firm, concentrated, dry wine. It seems to be all structure, until the sweet juicy plum fruits show through.
title: Château Fourcas Dupré 2010 Barrel sample  (Listrac-Médoc)

description: 90-92 Firm and tannic, while there are also sweet berry fruits and black currant flavors. The acidity is important.
designation: Barrel sample La Chapelle de la Mission Haut-Brion
title: Château La Mission Haut-Brion 2010 Barrel sample La Chapelle de la Mission Haut-Brion  (Pessac-Léognan)

description: 90-92 Beautifully perfumed wine, the tannins relatively gentle. It has packed weight, as well as ripe berry fruits.
title: Château Lafon-Rochet 2010 Barrel sample  (Saint-Estèphe)

description: 90-92 Delicious acidity, fresh in character, layering gentle tannins with black currant fruit and tight, nervy acidity. A juicy, fruity aftertaste. Well integrated.
title: Château Latour-Martillac 2010 Barrel sample  (Pessac-Léognan)

description: 90-92 Firm in character, with tannins that dominate. There is a good weight behind the tannins, with black fruits likely to come through well.
title: Château Rahoul 2010 Barrel sample  (Graves)

description: 90-92 The wine has rich citrus and pear flavors, with weight, an oily texture and balanced wood spice to finish. Well structured.
title: Château Rahoul 2010 Barrel sample  (Graves)

description: 90-92 Densely characterized wine, with its dark tannins, and powerful structure. Spice, juicy pepper, final acidity.
title: Château Vray Croix de Gay 2010 Barrel sample  (Pomerol)

description: 90-92 Attractive floral perfumes, a wine that is soft initially then shows a fine herbaceous edge. Crisp, textured with hints of wood.
title: Château Brown 2010 Barrel sample  (Pessac-Léognan)

description: 90-92 Great swathes of sweet tannins and ripe berry fruits, the wine is delicious, ripe, concentrated and intense without losing charm.
title: Château Clarke 2010 Barrel sample  (Listrac-Médoc)

description: 90-92 Packed with new wood that dominates the fruit. The style does have some elegance, while the new wood will need to calm down.
title: Château Cos Labory 2010 Barrel sample  (Saint-Estèphe)

description: 90-92 So stylish, with its ripe, jammy berry fruits already a pleasure to appreciate. It does have structure to go with the new wood character. Probably not for the long-term.
title: Château Dassault 2010 Barrel sample  (Saint-Émilion)

description: 90-92 Densely tannic wine, with beautiful perfumes. It is ripe, concentrated, while retaining great charm
title: Château le Prieuré 2010 Barrel sample  (Saint-Émilion)

description: 90-92 Structured, the second wine of Léoville las Cases, has solid tannins, chunky while melding into ripe black fruits. A fine second wine, ready to drink in 4-5 years.
title: Château Léoville Las Cases 2010 Barrel sample Le Petit Lion  (Saint-Julien)

description: 90-92 A wine that is smoky from the wood, while the tannins are firm and structured. It has a dark character, dominated by final new wood flavors.
title: Château Marquis d'Alesme 2010 Barrel sample  (Margaux)

description: 90-92 Severe in character, the acidity driving dry tannins. A wine for aging, although the juicy aftertaste is delicious now.
title: Château Moulin Saint-Georges 2010 Barrel sample  (Saint-Émilion)

description: 90-92 A ripe wine, keeping great swathes of freshness and offering the most delicioys acidity. Such a fresh wine, full of great blackberry fruist, very fresh as well as dense.
title: Château Potensac 2010 Barrel sample  (Médoc)

description: This is a blend of Sémillon and Cabernet Franc. With its creamy texture and bright citrus flavors, it is an attractively fruity wine. Its crisp fruitiness makes it dry, although there is a soft side to the wine that blunts the acidity. Drink now.
title: Jaillance NV Cuvée de l'Abbaye Brut  (Crémant de Bordeaux)

description: The wine has too much wood. Tannins and spice as well as toast are present, but not enough fruit.
title: Château Grand Pascaud 2015  Bordeaux Supérieur

description: A generous use of wood aging has given this wine a caramel flavor that lies awkwardly alongside the berry fruits. The aftertaste is dry.
title: Château Lamothe Castera 2015  Bordeaux Supérieur

description: The tannins and high toast flavors have taken over this wine. The fruit has been submerged. It is difficult to see this completely balancing out.
title: Château Malbat 2015 C'est la Vie!  (Bordeaux)

description: Situated in the heart of the heart of the Entre-deux-Mers, this estate has a long history dating back to the Middle Ages. With its stalky black currant fruit and acidity, this is fruity with a cool edge and a crisp edge. Drink from 2018.
title: Château Pey de Faure 2014  Bordeaux Supérieur

description: Firm with tannins, this is a dry wine. Its tough structure dominates the berry fruit, needing time to balance out. Drink from 2018.
title: Château Guitar 2015  Bordeaux

description: Layered tannins and wood flavors have tended to smother the fruit in this wine. That gives a dry, tough character not promising much for the future.
title: Château Laville 2015  Bordeaux Supérieur

description: This soft and creamy wine has a really bubbly rosé mousse. It has fruit and a crisp clean edge. The strawberry fruits give this wine a sweet character, certainly off dry. It is ready to drink.
title: Jaillance NV Cuvée de l'Abbaye Brut Rosé  (Crémant de Bordeaux)

description: The wine is rich and packed with superripe blackberry fruits. While there is acidity to keep the wine crisp, it does have a heavy feel to it from the high alcohol that also brings a pepper edge. Drink from 2018.
title: Chateau Malbat 2015  Bordeaux

description: This is still a young wine, firm with tannins. The enthusiastic wood aging shows strongly in the smoky toasty flavor. It's hard to find the fruit.
title: Château Roc de Minvielle 2015 Cuvée Les Tourelles  (Bordeaux Supérieur)

description: Firmly structured, the wine is dry and with dark tannins. Its fruit is currently masked. Give it until late 2017.
title: Maison Hebrard 2015 Château des Trois Tours  (Bordeaux)

description: With plenty of acidity and tannins, this wine is almost trying to be a young red. Drink it like that with food and it will be worth it. The aftertaste has pepper and attractive spice.
title: Château de Marsan 2016  Bordeaux Clairet

description: Benefiting from the ripe 2009 fruit, this shows the attractive character of many value Bordeaux wines in this year. It has red plum fruits, touched with raisins along with toast, acidity and a balance of tannins.
title: Château des Combes 2009  Bordeaux

description: Ripe and structured, this has black plum and ripe berry flavors that are lifted by the acidity typical of the vintage. Tannins are solid and dense, packed around the fruit, and show that the wine is still young. Drink this solid while fruity wine from 2020.
title: Château la Fleur-Pétrus 2013  Pomerol

description: True to the estate's signature style, this is a powerful, luscious wine. It's ripe with plum and berry fruits,layered with dark, firm tannins. There is a juicy element as well as black-coffee flavors from the enthusiastic use of wood. Give it time to integrate properly and drink from 2022.
title: Château Troplong Mondot 2013  Saint-Émilion

description: Ripe and tropical, this full-bodied wine conveys mango, quince and ripe white peach that accompany a rich texture. It's going to develop relatively quickly, so drink from 2018. Winemaker Stephan Carrier returned from Napa to take over winemaking after Irish businessman Lochlann Quinn bought the property in 2001. A new winery and barrel cellar opened in 2011. Hubert de Boüard of Château Angelus consults with Carrier. Fieuzal's newsletter is an accurate report on harvests.
title: Château de Fieuzal 2013  Pessac-Léognan

description: Powerful and dense, this wine has great potential. With full-bodied blackberry fruits and acidity that push through the dark tannins, it shows a rich character that is impressive for the year. Drink from 2020. The property has been owned since 1999 by Sophie Lurton of neighboring Château Bouscaut.
title: Château Lamothe Bouscaut 2013  Pessac-Léognan

description: Still tight and closed up, this wine has potential, offering ripe citrus and white fruits and nervy, tangy texture. Concentrated and dense, it's a wine for the long term; drink from 2020. Olivier is a large medieval hunting estate that, since the 19th century, has belonged to the Bethmann family. The 148 acres of vines and forests are managed environmentally.
title: Château Olivier 2013  Pessac-Léognan

description: This is a firm wine with ripe Merlot fruits that are still sheathed in tannins. Densely textured, it is rich with berries and a stalky character that needs to soften. Wait for this solid, concentrated and ageworthy wine until 2017.
title: Château de l'Annonciation 2011  Saint-Émilion

description: A well constructed, solid wine, this has a fine layer of firm tannins that melds well with the rich black plums and acidity. Even this young, the wine is showing a balanced character, warm and ripe. It will age, so drink from 2018.
title: Château Franc Pipeau 2012  Saint-Émilion

description: Rich, spicy and perfumed, this delicious wine is developing well and also has aging potential. It is packed with berry and plum fruits that parade with acidity and tannins that act as a support. It's still dense and the balanced fruit and tannins will allow it to age. Drink from 2018.
title: Château Ambe Tour Pourret 2011  Saint-Émilion

description: Hand-sorting and 18 months of aging is the key here. This 80% Merlot blend with 15% Cabernet Sauvignon and 5% Cabernet Franc offers a generously proportioned balance of tannins and black fruits. It has full-bodied character, packed with berry fruits and rich acidity. With all these elements, it will develop well. Drink from 2017.
title: Château Frédignac 2012 Cuvée Terroir  (Blaye Côtes de Bordeaux)

description: Ripe, soft and very drinkable, this has a generous structure that cushions the tannins with rounded black fruits. The acidity and the warm, generous character of the 80% Merlot and 20% Cabernet Franc blend net a fine representation of the fruity 2012s. This is Bordeaux consultant Stéphane Derenoncourt's home turf. Wooden fermenters and 16 months in barrel (40% new) necessitate time, so drink from 2016.
title: Domaine de l'A 2012  Castillon Côtes de Bordeaux

description: The aroma of this wine shows strong signs of the wood aging, although red fruits do show as well. There is a minty character from the new wood, berry fruit flavors and the juicy acidity of the vintage. The wine is going to age well over the medium term, so drink from 2015.
title: Château Croix de Mission 2011  Montagne-Saint-Émilion

description: Wood flavors and bright fruits are combining well in this wine. It is a rich wine, bright and fruity at the same time. The structure is settling in to give a wine that has a good future. Producer Jacques-Henri Bravard identified 21 parcels (of different soils). All vines are certified organic. Drink from 2019.
title: Xavier Flouret 2014 Château Haut-Meneau Quai Lumière  (Blaye Côtes de Bordeaux)

description: The wine develops slowly in the glass, closed at first and then bringing on ripe fruits and firm tannins. There is a definite dryness here, solid, textured and darkly structured. It is meant for aging, so don't drink before 2016.
title: Château Tour Saint-Germain 2010 Cuvée Prestige  (Blaye Côtes de Bordeaux)

description: New wood aromas are still strongly evident in this young and fruity wine. It has ripe tannins, a juicy character and attractive, forward fruitiness. The aftertaste has delicious acidity and freshness.
title: Château Vieux Cardinal Lafaurie 2011  Lalande de Pomerol

description: The aromas are of new wood and toast as much as fruit, and this follows on the palate. It has strong burnt-toast flavors along with a full textured palate. Blackberry fruits are under this weight of wood, and need several years to emerge, although the wine will always have a strong wood component. Drink from 2017
title: Château Roquetaillade la Grange 2009  Graves

description: The second wine of this Premier Grand Cru Classé estate is very fine. With its rich tannins, generous acidity and black fruits, it is solid and dense while having such attractive fruitiness. The wine will age well, full of ripe fruit and with excellent concentration. Drink from 2021.
title: Château la Gaffelière 2015 Dame Gaffelière  (Saint-Émilion)

description: From one of the few estates in Saint-Julien that is not a classified growth, this wine represents a bargain. The wine is rich, perfumed and beautifully structured. It has a velvety consistency with its ripe black currants and generous tannins. The estate is named after the mill belonging to Abbot Bridane in the Middle Ages. Drink from 2022.
title: Château Moulin de la Bridane 2015  Saint-Julien

description: Although initially austere, this wine then opens out well, giving a firm and structured character. There are spice, solid dry tannins and a fine layer of berry fruits, finishing off with lively acidity.
title: Barton & Guestier 2006  Médoc
